Breakfast is the best I've ever had.. Made to order rather than mass produced. Spa treatment is a must to experience. The only negative to report is the music from the restaurant's on the beach. Perhaps they should face their speakers away from the hotel.. Some nights it was like the band was on your balcony!
title: Small and beautiful...

text: We stayed at the Double 6 Seminyak for 4 nights from 30 Dec to 4 Jan 2020. Amazing resort with fantastic staff and service, The rooms were amazing and very modern. Would definitely recommend them. The beach across the road was easily accessible as well and the Rooftop bar at the hotel a treat.

We stayed at the double six in Seminyak for 9 nights. The hotel was absolutely amazing, super luxurious, we arrived to amazing welcome drinks plus the service was a 10/10 the whole stay. Room comes with 24hrs free butler service! She was just great, very helpful at all times. Rooms was super big, with an amazing comfy bed! We booked through luxury escapes and had amazing inclusions, such as free cocktails at the amazing rooftop bar!! Great view, awesome sunsets! The hotel is definitely not a party hotel but it was fun to stay at! Not to many kids which was awesome! Veryyy relaxing. The hotel has a spot right in front of the beach which was so handy, They also had awesome cocktails at happy hour by the pool (buy 1 get 1 free) . The only downpoint was the pool menu. It was very; â€¦

We stayed at the Double Six Resort to turn off from work and de stress and we certainly managed to do that. For the four nights we stayed at the resort we only left the resort for one night as the resort offered everything we needed. From the rooftop bar to the beachside deck chairs the staff constantly looked after us and made our stay so very enjoyable. The Plantation Grill was absolutely top notch and The Sling Bar not only served fabulous cocktails but the staff were great to have a chat with. We also had a wonderful massage in the spa. Would recommend this resort for a complete experience,

date post: Mary Anne C wrote a review Jan 2015
text: We stayed at the Double-Six Luxury Hotel in Seminyak from the 29th December, 2014 until January 3rd, 2015. Our stay was excellent! We had an amazing room with a butler and our own private swimming pool. As an interior decorator I found the room to be very trendy with the latest tiles, linens and furniture. The staff were extremely efficient and made our stay very enjoyable. The absolute highlight would have to have been the a la carte breakfasts....they were amazing...the choices were incredible and the food very high class. We also enjoyed the views and the food from the rooftop bar and found the prices very reasonable and the views over the ocean second to none. I would thoroughly recommend a stay at this very high end Hotel and would like to thank the staff for the; â€¦
title: The best accommodation in Bali

text: We stayed at the new Double-Six from 21-28 October and were given a plunge pool suite when we asked for an upgrade located away from any noisy night club areas. The staff (without exception) were amazingly friendly and incredibly helpful, contributing to the overall enjoyment of our stay. Included breakfasts at the Seminyak Italian Food restaurant were tasty and innovative with outstanding views over the pool and beach areas. The Double Six Rooftop Bar had rooftop prices but was a great place to watch the sunset and it was very easy to achieve the 1,000,000 rupiah minimum spend for the special conversation pits. Our butler booked restaurant reservations for us at Salt Tapas, Bambu & Sarong and also arranged our taxis. Beware the corner crooks offering transport for; â€¦
title: Amazing Staff

text: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights `0th-14th August. From the moment we arrived we were treated as very special guests with in-room check in and 24 hour butler service. The suite was pure luxury and impeccable in every way. The individual breakfast menu was the best we have every had in a hotel and individual for all tastes overlooking the beautiful pool and beach. The staff in this hotel are incredible from the head butler Erikson and his wonderful team ready to help make our stay special in every way. The day spa was luxurious and definitely worth a visit! We found the hotel and service faultless and our only regret was for not booking longer! R. & T Morris Perth WA
title: Maryed

date post: Cheryl E wrote a review May 2014
text: We stayed for 2 nights at this lovely hotel. The check in was a breeze. Hotel Manager( Mr. Bagai) was waiting for us and met at the time of arrival. The room was very spacious and view was amazing( Ocean View) .The bed was very comfortable and the pillows. The bathroom was as big as a bedroom. The swimming pool is huge . The amenities in the room are of high standard. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The selection of minibar is pretty good. We had a surprise the very next day with a birthday cake for my friend. Cant be better than this.
title: Amazing Right on the beach!

text: We stayed for 7 nights (from 26th Feb) at the Double Six for third time We visit Bali twice a year & doing so for many years & have stayed in all the usual locations (Sanur, Jimbaran, Ubud, Legian etc) Traveled as a couple this time but often have the kids & partners which can determine where we stay Double Six is perfect for us a couple for the following reasons: It is a suite not a room with a great balcony Huge pool (120m), never feels crowded & great place to watch the action on the beach or sunset Breakfast is "a la carte" which works extremely well & you can order as much as you want Lagoon Bar is brilliant especially at "Happy Hour" with very attentive staff I would just like to address the comments on the noise from the beach bars. Yes, it can be noisy but people, you; â€¦
title: Loved my stay

text: We stayed for 7 nights at this new hotel which is in a perfect location opposite Seminyak Beach with lots of restaurants close by. This hotel's greatest asset is the staff with no exceptions. They are all proactive in all areas to ensure excellent service. The suites were spacious and very comfortable and the bathroom was huge with all amenities. As mentioned in previous reviews the room fridge was useless and we ordered ice every day too. Did not quite grasp the butler concept - just seemed a link between us and housekeeping. We went to the reception staff for all our other needs as their service was exceptional and they all spoke very good English so there were no misunderstandings. We did have issues with the pool loungers. There are insufficient for the number of; â€¦

date post: Carla B wrote a review Oct 2014
text: We stayed for 8 nights and overall would say the location is fantastic, across the road from the beach, easy walk to great restaurants. The Double Six Italian restaurant has a great menu but be prepared for small serving sizes. Breakfast has good and varied menu so you won't get bored eating the same old thing. Pool was beautiful with perfect temp and outlook across the ocean. General service around the pool needs some serious looking at as does pool food menu. Pool itself needs much better access to get in and out - no matter your age. OH&S issues (trip/slip/fall) everywhere! Atmosphere average - no Bali inspiration or vibe at all. Fridges in rooms are useless which is a total inconvenience when you want a cold drink and have to wait for room service to deliver ice buckets; â€¦
title: The trendiest and best modern hotel in Bali!

text: We stayed for a week comprising two days in a garden view room and 5 days in an Ocean View Suite. We found both rooms very good but the additional cost of the beachfront suite was definitely worthwhile. The Butler service proved more useful than we had anticipated. We found the rooftop bar, the Sling Bar and the various breakfast venues all very good. The a la carte breakfasts comprised a broad range of choices offered by extremely pleasant staff. The Rooftop buffet also provided an excellent array of fruits other breakfast options. The staff at the main desks and throughout the complex we all exceptionally professional and the hotel manager Selvarajoo went out of his way to interact with guests and ensure their stay was enjoyable. We stay at many 4.5 to 5 star hotels and I; â€¦
title: Perfect hotel

date post: Mars V wrote a review Sep 2014
text: We stayed for a week recently. The hotel is in an excellent location, with the pool overlooking the beach. The staff are very friendly and attentive. There were plenty of restaurants nearby, though the hotel restaurant was also very good. There was minimal disruption from the construction work, but obviously the top floor of he hotel was not completed, so the rooftop bar was not open.
title: Fantastic holiday at Double Six hotel in Seminyak

date post: T Ben wrote a review Feb 2020
text: We stayed for the last 2 nights of our holiday.... wish we had stayed here all trip . Perfect staff.... food is amazing lovely room. Thanks double six ... We will be back..... highly recommend this place x
title: Relaxing break

date post: Danielle A wrote a review Dec 2014
text: We stayed here for 12 nights and thoroughly enjoyed every minute. Nothing was too hard for any of the staff and any issues were quickly addressed. A group of us travelled (8) here and we paid for an upgraded 2bed master suite - we had an issue with our room on arrival and after speaking with staff (politely) we were moved the following day to what I would say would be one of the best rooms in the hotel, with an uninterrupted view of the spectacular sunsets and beach. If you are considering a 2bed suite then you should clarify with staff or your agent if you are getting a sitting area in the middle of the two rooms, or if the sitting area is in one of the rooms. For people travelling with kids the latter would be better, but for four adults the middle room was important and is; â€¦
title: Beyond Expectations!

date post: Robert G wrote a review Feb 2015
text: We stayed here for 2 weeks back in November 2014. All of the great comments that have been submitted about this fantastic hotel are all true so I don't need to repeat them. However I would like to share an experience with the hotel staff who went out of their way to assist us with a travel problem. We purchased a tour from a booking Stand in the street just down from the hotel. We waited on the booked day for our pickup which never arrived. The hotel staff rang many times on our behalf to see what was happening but couldn't get an answer. One of the hotel staff members then drove us down to the booking stand in their buggy where we confronted the agent who reluctantly admitted they didn't make a booking for us and refunded our money. We then returned back to the hotel and; â€¦
title: Simply superb!

text: We stayed here for 3 nights as a couple. The hotel is modern, clean and open air. We got a welcome drink (with alcohol) when we got there and a guided tour to our room. Overall was a good, comfortable stay. I would say the hotel is a 4* compared to service/amenities we got at our other hotels in Bali. PROS - Service is excellent here. The staff is friendly, accommodating and hard working. - The breakfast here was the best we had in any of our hotels in Bali. The Sunday buffet is unreal and the a la carte has delicious options with basically all you can eat.. - Rooftop bar is nice to watch the sunset (but drinks were over priced) - Rooms were spacious with turn down service and many amenities. - The hotel is on one of the best beaches in Seminyak (Double 6) - Location was; â€¦

We stayed here for 8 night in Nov/Dec. We arrived late in the evening after being delayed 6 hours by Jetstar. All the stress of the journey completely evaporated when we entered the hotel. The room was so beautiful and spacious, the staff so wonderful. We were checked-in in the room and shown all the amenities by our wonderful butler. We had definitely arrived in paradise. The pool is a vast infinity pool which runs the entire length of the hotel and is stunning both day and night. Our breakfast each morning was delightful plus we ate dinner several times in the Italian restaurant where the meals were also top notch. The service throughout the resort is amazing as all the staff have been extremely well trained. The spa is beautiful probably the best in Bali. The manager; â€¦
title: Seminyak's little Gem

text: We stayed here for 8 nights in December wanting a battery recharger prior to the rush of Christmas . This was our fifth time to Bali and this resort was one of the best we have been to. We stayed in an Ocean View Leisure Suite - the room was luxurious and extremely large. But the thing that set this hotel apart from the others was the staff. In Bali it is common for the staff to be pleasant and accommodating but the staff at Double Six went beyond what was expected of them any time we requested anything and were extremely professional. The breakfast is a-la-carte instead of buffet but you can order anything you wish and as much as you wish from the menu so everything was fresh and straight from the kitchen. The Owners Lounge was a definite plus - here you can camp after checkout; â€¦

We stayed here for our honeymoon and it was a great choice! The hotel is directly on the beach and so we experienced Bali's famous sunsets at our leisure. The staff are friendly and very helpful! It is very centrally located - you can walk to a lot of great places.
title: 3rd times a charm

text: We stayed here from 4-11 November 2014. First trip to Bali, have never wanted to travel there previously. After staying at Double Six we'll definitely be back. From the airport pick up at the start of our holiday we were treated like royalty. The bed was so comfy and the room was serviced twice daily. We were upgraded to an ocean view room which was lovely. There was some noise from the beach, you could hear the band playing, this stopped at around 11pm but as the music was nice we didn't mind. The free standing bath with tv was a real treat. All the staff were so kind and helpful, and we were always greeted with a smile. The Manager kept in touch with me via email and his service and the customer service we received from the rest of the staff was second to none. Cannot; â€¦
title: The best honeymoon!

text: We stayed here in a 2bedroom Leisure Suite from 24/6 - 28/6. From check in to check out they were world class the whole way!! The room was immaculate, beds a little hard but bearable, we had a wonderful corner deck that overlooked the water & it was so well set out & very pretty! The downfall would be that the rooms is right next to Cocoon Bar & across from bars on the beach & I have to say the noise every night was insane! They do give you ear plugs in your room which is an indicator of how noisy it can get. Apart from this the hotel really is fantastic, the food @ the Italian Tratorria was first class, the wait service were on point 24/7 & food absolutely delicious :) WE had room service, pool service, restaurant dining & attended the spa facilities (this in itseld is another; â€¦

date post: Rae L wrote a review Dec 2014
text: We thoroughly enjoyed a 2 week stay at the fabulous Double Six Resort in Seminyak late Nov to Mid Dec 2014. My wife & I had a wonderful stay, the room was amazing & large, the brekkies were sensational. the resort itself was opened this year & is a funky modern dream of a hotel with wonderful ocean views... if you've booked waterfront... (which i recommend by the way). we were in the northern side of the resort opposite side to the wonderful roof top bar, where we enjoyed the most beautiful sunset. & Cocoon bar next door. i had no worries with the sultry background music, which we loved actually, sitting on the balcony in the evening before going out to dinner enjoying a couple of duty free drinks...hic! we spent some time by the beautiful massive pool relaxing & reading. all; â€¦
title: Bali Too New

date post: David B wrote a review Nov 2014
text: We took advantage of a special offer which gave us 8 nights in a beautifully presented suite at the brand new Double Six Resort just over the road from Legian Beach. The resort is typical Bali, with a grand open entrance and the best staff we've ever encountered, and this includes 4 & 5 star hotels throughout Europe. When you consider the hotel has around 150 rooms - the personal touch from the management team was nothing short of fantastic. Australian establishments could learn a lot from this hotel!! At the moment there is only one restaurant - which overlooks the entrance on one side, and the pool / ocean on the other, and offers a variety of Italian fare, however there is lots of fine dining close by, and in particular - Seminyak which is a cheap taxi ride away. Suites are; â€¦
title: Absolutely Brilliant

text: We took up a Luxury Escapes package deal and were blown away. For a hotel still being finished and working out the small bugs it's excellent. Small bug bears are the constantly changing floor levels, necessitating constant warnings to watch your step , and a better way for older guests to get in and out of the pool. But overall excellent with professional and friendly staff.
title: Loud, late music by night, noisy children by day.

text: We totally enjoyed our stay once again Not surprised with the attention to detail involving the level of service from all the staff as we have experienced this every time we have stayed at DSLH On arrival we requested an ocean view room away from the restaurant this was accomplished without fuss and in a timely manner Before our departure we had a last day â€œshoppingâ€ and ended up with a large Moose head made of wire, one of the staff porters asked if we needed assistance when we saw that he had totally packaged the item far better than us very impressed The rooms are spacious with fantastic ocean and pool views
title: Luxury!

text: We travel to Bali several times a year and have stayed in many luxury hotels and private villas. This time we decided to stay at the new Double Six resort. We are thoroughly enjoying the experience. I would highly recommend to try this place.

date post: Wendy T wrote a review Sep 2014
text: We travelled to Bali with another couple. We stumbled on this great looking hotel before we went to Gill T and booked for our final few days before we returned to AU. On arrival we were greeted by the concierge and the General Manager who gave us his business card so if there was anything we needed we should contact him. Well we didn't need to. The staff was fantastic and anything we needed they were there. Room. On arrival, porter took our luggage to the room. When we arrived in our room, our mouths dropped. Room definitely had the WOW factor as soon as you enter. Check in occurred in our room with concierge and butler. We had a very refreshing complimentary cocktail and refresher face towel. We were explained every aspect of the room - with so many features it was amazing.; â€¦
title: 5 star at its best

text: We usually stay in Nusa Dua however our experience in Seminyak was great. The ocean view suite was very spacious and clean. We loved the butler service and the very friendly and attentive team working at the hotel. Close walking distance to shops and day spas. We have come away feeling relaxed and would most certainly stay at the hotel again next time we visit Bali. Thank you for looking after us.

date post: Eamonn O wrote a review Oct 2014
text: We visited this hotel on a package heavily discounted from the rack rate presumably as part of a promotion of it. What a bargain! The hotel is new and part of it is still being constructed but without interfering with the completed section. The staff are helpful with excellent service and the food is excellent. It's heavily air-conditioned. Rooms facing the neighbouring Cocoon Bar would be noisy including into the night so avoiding those would be a good idea. It's hard to think of any criticisms of the hotel. At full tariff it might be competing against the 'name' luxury resorts but at the present prices it's an absolute bargain!
title: If you like waiting your in the right place

text: we were fortunate to secure a 8 night package. Room quality was great. Huge king size bed with a great mattress and quality bedding. The staff were without doubt the best trained and most accommodating we have experienced. The Italian themed restaurant was true to its theme with many genuine dishes superbly presented. Amazing 120 metre pool which wraps around the beach side of the resort. On checking out the resort has a well equipped lounge to provide some snacks and refreshment free of charge pending transfer to the airport. Quality spa and treatment facilities. Staff are well trained and really know what they are doing. Our favourite morning drink was without doubt the Granita Expresso. Crushed ice with a double shot of Expresso and milk and cream to top it off.
title: Wonderful Stay

date post: Laura T wrote a review Jan 2015
text: We were lucky enough to be told about this brand new restaurant whilst on holiday in Bali! It had only been open 9 days when we dined for dinner. An opulent bar to feast your eyes on, so many amazing features to look at. A great Gatsby feel to it with a relaxed and inviting atmosphere. Food was delicious, I had the tiger prawns and they didn't disappoint. Wine list brilliant and excellent value for money. By far the best place I've eaten at for a long time, and not just in Bali. We were lucky enough to be there the night Robert Marchetti was also there (Syd icebergs) and he came over and welcomed us and took the time to chat. Make sure you book ahead as this place will be booked out in no time! It's a winner, can't wait to go back!
title: Luxurious Room with Excellent Service

text: We were lucky to stay here for 8 nights in June 2014. The thing we will always remember is the warmth of the amazing staff. Their smiles made every day special. The hotel is right on the beach, so that when you are in the pool, you feel can look over the edge to the beach and sea meters away. You are not cut off from the real Bali, but can wander down a few steps and be among cafes and surf schools in seconds. On a balcony above the pool is the restaurant which serves an amazing breakfast with some of the best coffee we have come across. The rooms are large and well designed, and the day spa a two level extravaganza of pampering. We dined in the restaurant at night and the tuna fillets were extraordinary. To have achieved all this in such a short time since opening is a; â€¦
title: Amazing 5 day stay!

text: We were one of two families staying at Double Six in January. On arrival we were greeted by the manager and warmly welcomed. Service throughout our stay was excellent, with a lot of attention to detail. Rooms were spacious and modern, and the food was superb. The rooftop bar is a must - we spent a great night there enjoying the views and the cocktails. When one daughter got sick, staff went out of their way to help and it was no problem to stay longer in the room on departure because of this, which we really appreciated. We will certainly be back and thanks again!

We were treated so amazingly well from the moment we arrived. Our room wasn't ready (we were a little early) so we were taken to the Owners Lounge and given free drinks and snacks. Our check in was smooth and we were then taken to our lovely room and given a fruit cocktail by our butler and immediately relaxed. This was our honeymoon and they had left a lovely chocolate dessert in the room congratulating us which was a lovely touch. The pool area is great and even though there were some families with small children we never felt like it was too noisy or affected our relaxation in any way. One day when all the sun lounges were taken the pool staff hustled to get us some soft mats to lie on. They were very attentive and always walked up and down the pool area offering service.; â€¦

date post: Melbourne Mick wrote a review Jul 2014
text: We weren't scheduled to stay this hotel, but we decided to take a look whilst having a stroll. So happy we did! As soon as we were shown the Ocean View Leisure Suites we were sold, cancelled our booking at another property and gratefully indulged in the luxury of the new Double-Six Hotel. Absolutely everything is first class, from the staff, to the accommodation, the food in The Italian Restaurant (where we experienced Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner), the Spa and the incredible views. The level of service and attention to detail is second to none. We had a late flight out and we were kindly offered the use of a rear facing room until 8pm, meaning we could have an evening shower and a relaxing meal at the Hotel prior to departing for the Airport - very much appreciated.; â€¦
title: Best service in lovely new Hotel.

date post: mary C wrote a review Jul 2014
text: Well I feel quite qualified to do so. Having dealt with the hotel reception staff via email and a few wires getting crossed over availibility, we were unable to complete a booking due in the next few weeks as the hotel was going to be full to the brim with celebrities and the like celebrating the opening of thier new jazzy rooftop bar smack bang in the middle of our suggested booking period. Most hotels would say hey sorry tough luck go elsewhere or maybe not even bother saying sorry. But, I recieved the nicest email from a senior member of staff stating honestly and openly what had gone wrong and apologising for giving us the run around. She offered us some gestures of dinner bookings and complimentary wine to compensate given the ordeal meant we were two weeks away from a trip; â€¦
title: A Little Bit of Heaven in Bali

text: Well our time at the double six resort is coming to an end all I can say is they have looked after us like we are family simply the best service we have experienced in our travels can not fault this resort and the food and wine was next level if you want to be pampered in a relaxed atmosphere this is the hotel for you thanks to all especially Menno the sommelier

Well where do I begin. The rooms were big but the smell of mould was overwhelming in fact our clothes smelled so bad on returning home I had to re-wash them. Our friends in the adjacent rooms toiletry bag was absolutely covered in mould by the end of our 2 week stay. The music from The neighbouring restaurant was quite loud every night but was usually finished by around 10pm. We just shut the door and turned the air on to drown it out. The staff were brilliant with a fantastic butler service. The breakfast food was delicious and the Plantation Grill was amazing not so with the Italian food restaurant. The pool area was lovely and the sky bar has an amazing view. This resort is only 6 years old but is looks a lot older due to the deterioration in the build. I marked it a three; â€¦
title: Bali best

text: Went to the roof top bar Agus served us drinks at sunset.ðŸŒžVery friendly and efficient. ðŸ‘Lots of fun highly recommend . Thanks Agus you are a star. ðŸ™ðŸ™ðŸ™ðŸ™ðŸ™ðŸ™..... The rest of the staff were extremely helpfu and made us feel very welcome.
title: Great hotel if you want to splash out

text: We've been home only 24 hours and have already booked a trip back to Bali in October because of our incredible experience at Double Six. Outstanding rooms, fantastic facilities and beautiful staff who always remembered our names and our meal choices and treated us like family. We received a private tour of the new penthouse (absolutely breathtaking) as well as the soon-to-open Rooftop Grill, the latter a massive selling point for our return. As two very healthy/fit people - we were absolutely blown away by the incredible amount of delicious and healthy choices (rice paper rolls and kale smoothies by the pool, egg white omelet and veggies for breakfast, etc etc), in fact we ate at the pool and Italian restaurant for lunches and dinners a total of 10 times in only 5 days. We; â€¦
title: Our deepest of thanks to the Double-Six staff

text: We've had the most wonderful stay in Double Six in May 2019. This is by far the best hotel we've stayed in. A delicious a la carte breakfast every morning, the room feels like a large apartment, a balcony with ocean views, great coffee machine and much more. Super friendly staff, we cannot thank you enough. We've booked again for 2020 and are now counting the days.
title: Bali trip

text: What a fantastic hotel, our suite was huge with great views of the beach from our massive balcony. The staff were welcoming and the service was faultless. The food was also very good, though we really only tried the breakfast and poolside menu. The hotel is situated right on the beach with so many dinner options within easy walking distance that we ventured out each night to try something new. I wish we had more time to try out more places, there are so many options! The only downside was the noise when trying to enjoy an evening on our balcony. From around 5:30 to 10:30pm each night there are 2 mildly talented artists battling it out on the beach to see who can sing the loudest. We had read reviews, so knew to expect this and I spent a good few hours out there chuckling to; â€¦

What a fantastic hotel. Only recently opened this hotel is conveniently located in Seminyak, not too far from the hustle and bustle of busy Kuta and opposite the beach. This western style hotel has well trained and polite Balinese staff that went out of their way to please us. Everyone, (from general staff and management) made the effort to introduce themselves. It was difficult to remember everyoneâ€™s names but it was particularly nice to meet the Hotel Manager, Dheeraj and the Head Butler, Erickson. Thanks guys. The hotel offers a variety of rooms all of which are re-stocked, cleaned and linen changed on a daily basis. In addition to the usual, the rooms have cable TV, a coffee espresso machine and free water provided every morning. Security is taken seriously and we felt very; â€¦

What a fantastic hotel. The staff, the location, the cleanliness, the courtesy - everything was amazing. From the welcome check in by Lena in our room with a cocktail brought by the fabulous butler, Santan, we could not have asked for more. We will definitely be back.

What a fantastic luxury escape.Free Limo pick up at airport on arrival ( and departure). The suite was beyond expectations with our own personal butler. Staff were extremely friendly , efficient and professional. The Italian restaurant is one of the best we have experienced. Such a large menu for breakfast accommodated everyone. The pool was large with ample sunshades and a terrific lunch menu whilst relaxing by the pool. Close to beach, restaurants and shopping. I could even buy Australian newspapers from a hawker outside Double Six. Rooftop bar is great for cocktails, fantastic views,music and watching the sunsets .

What a pleasure it was to spend our Christmas break with our two teenage girls. The staff were very very efficient and could not do enough to help us. We loved sitting at the Italian bar during happy hour and joking around with the bar staff. Thanks so much we loved it
title: service & caring a priority fulfilled

date post: Kathryn P wrote a review Aug 2014
text: What an amazing hotel. Hotel doesn't seem good enough for the Double-Six Luxury Hotel.We recently stayed here for eight days and cannot speak highly enough about our stay.The suites were awesome ,from the massive bath to the king size bed, from beautiful linen to extreme comfort all round. Top this off with your own butler service-Hello Mr Ericson-and you feel so very special The reception staff were always there to help in any way ,24 hours a day. Always with a smile. The menu was extensive ,from truffles, 64 degree eggs to pastries and fruit.If you love Italian food this is the place for you. The staff everywhere got to know us by name and welcomed us where ever we were.We really felt so special.You must try their tiramusu,it's heavenly.There are also loads of alternative; â€¦
title: The roar of the ocean awaits.

date post: Michael N wrote a review Jul 2014
text: What an amazing stay at the double six. The hotel itself is flawless. Has everything you'd would expect from a 5 star hotel. Biggest asset is the people. The staff are so welcoming and friendly. Will do anything to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. Rooms are HUGE!! I doubt you'll find a room bigger than this. Bathroom is great and you'll get a great sleep on the amazing bed. Location is amazing. Close to everything with a short walk (15mins) to the restaurants of Seminyak or taxi drive to Kuta (if that's your thing) Can't wait to return once it's finished!!
title: Our best ever holiday in Bali because of Double Six

text: What an experience, truly beyond our expectations.......... Having been able to experience the Double Six experience, we have now realized just how complacement we'd become at what we were willing to accept at other hotels. Double Six ticked ALL of the boxes and exceeded in so many ways. From check-in everything was seemless. The Lobby staff are extremely professional and courteous. The rooms are well appointed, immaculate, quiet and modern. The space was fantastic as we travelled with two children. The entry doors face the corridor ensuring no distrubance from other guests coming and going. From the quality of the bed, bedding and fittings we felt indulged and comfortable. There was a TV for each of us (if we had needed it) but TV's were only on of an evening for a movie.; â€¦

What can I say, wonderful hotel, wonderful staff, great food and drink and wonderful location.! Bought a deal from Luxury escapes for 8 nights, wish I had bought two. From the very first we were made to feel special. From the very personal welcome and introduction to the hotel, the breakfast in the Italian restaurant everyday, not a buffet, but you could eat your way through the whole delicious menu if you wanted. The Italian restaurant for dinner, the pool bar, the rooftop bar, the pool area, the exemplary cleaning of our room everyday, our personal butler service , there is nothing negative about this place. The staff are wonderful. They are dressed beautifully and the smiles and service are fantastic. The best. It's our last day today :( wishing it was our first. Thank you; â€¦

Where do I start? The on time airport pick-up service in a luxury car with A/C, cold towels and bottled water? Or maybe the check-in service you can experience either in your car or in your room? Or the Butler you're assigned upon check-in who shows you the featured of your room? This place has it all!! I stayed with a friend for 3 nights in August and we were both in awe as soon as we entered the gates. This brand new property really is unlike anything else. We particularly enjoyed the 125m swimming pool located opposite the beach, and the Spa in which we had a 60 minute massage - which I would highly recommend!! I was also blown away by the size of our room, (deluxe ocean view), which was bigger than my 1.5 bedroom apartment! The location is also amazing as it is close to; â€¦
title: Beware of Room Allocation

text: Where to start. Our initial 5-star experience with the Double Six Luxury Hotel was via e-mails with Putra the Reservation Supervisor. Always so helpful and professional - nothing was a problem and our accommodation was booked!!! We booked a 2 bedroom Leisure Suite with city views and to our sheer delight we were upgraded to an Oceanview Leisure Suite (416) upon arrival and we were blown away. We were sharing with our daughter and her boyfriend who were already at the Double Six in an Oceanview Leisure Suite and already totally in love with the place. We stay along this ocean strip every time we come to Bali and just love it, so being able to sit on our very own balcony and watch the beach and ocean activity was the best. Location wise this place rocks and if you do want to; â€¦

Wife and I celebrated 40 year of marriage at the wonderful Double 6 Hotel. Everything was brilliant, the room, the service, the food and the staff. What a fantastic location, across the small road to the beach. My wife and I can't wait to return.
title: Back again for our third time and still amazing...!!

text: With a gorgeous sunset view and really reasonable cocktail prices, youâ€™d 100% be missing out for not going. Also had the pleasure of being served by Agus, who was incredibly friendly and helpful in helping us choose drinks.

Without a doubt, Double Six is located in an amazing area of Seminyak. It's chic and contemporary design adds to the luxury feeling that the resorts seeks to offer, along with being extremely clean and comfortable. Although these are definitely perks, the last day of customer service I received was not so great. Upon checkout, I made a payment on my card which the eftpos machine rejected. The reception staff then brought me to the non-wireless eftpos machine that subsequently worked. However the card was charged twice. Upon realising this, I notified the reception staff who were prompt to have accounts check on this. I even showed them the two pending transactions on my banking website. The hotel advised me that only one payment was received and that I would need to contact; â€¦
title: Absolute bliss!!

text: Wonderful place to stay, with outstanding staff, so very well trained. The pool is enormous and just delightful with the beach across the road also with an area to relax in the shade and swim in the lovely warm ocean, which, while I was there was beautifully clean. Food is wonderful with much thought given to dietary requirements. I was pleasantly surprised to see many vegan options which were delicious. Rooftop sunset Bar is stunning. Happy Hour drinks there and the pool bar makes it a very reasonably priced place to stay. Rooms are well serviced with many extra amenities. Sadly I must mention the hideous Bar Coccoon located next door to Double Six Hotel which pumps out very loud doof doof music till all hours. Ear plugs were provided but they barely worked. It might be; â€¦

Would love to give this Hotel a 5 star review as the staff were fantastic and the actual room and facilities, especially the restaurants and bars were exceptional. However, for early risers like us, we tend to be in bed by 8.30-9.00 not matter where we are in the world. The music that echoed from below until 10-10.30pm every night spoilt our experience a little, hence the 4 rating. If the music was good it may have been less bothersome, but seriously this singer was murdering songs with some bad cover renditions. Look, if you are a night owl, 5 stars, forget above comments, itâ€™s irrelevant. Everything else was great, Plantation Grill, Sunset Bar and Sling Bar are fabulous, poolside area and service was great. We really enjoyed the stay, just would have like soundproof glass.

Would you like a swim in the pool, with a margerita or mojito to follow? And later dine fine Italian as the tropical sunset and evening rock music rolls in? Capo di capo. Or dine at the Plantation Grill, a stylish restaurant that deserves a Michelin star? Or maybe cocktails at the Rooftop bar and disco? You choose. Morning after, take a soft Javanese massage which begins and ends with bells, or a facial? Your suite has wow factor design. And the friendliness and helpfulness of all the staff at every corner is great. Oh there are surprises too. Relax. Go now. .
title: Stunning Hotel Best for Partying.

text: Wow ! Firstly, thank you to Double-Six for a truly amazing holiday. We arrived home yesterday after a fabulous 7 days. I have been in the travel industry for over 25 years and have stayed at some great hotels and resorts but I have to say Double-Six stands out for both quality and service as well as the amazing ultra modern design and look of the entire hotel. It seems everything has been thought of ! From the moment we arrived we felt so very special. The staff went above and beyond to ensure our stay was perfect. For a fairly large hotel like this the personal service was excellent. The Hotel Manager, Deerhaj and Head Butler Erikson popped by during breakfast every now and again to ask how our stay was and if we were happy which was lovely! The ever smiling staff were so; â€¦
title: Girls week trip in Bali

text: Wow Double Six! Our second visit here and we once again are already planning our return back again for 2020! You truly go above and beyond and we couldnâ€™t have asked for more from your staff or hotel. You give from your hearts and offer pure luxury. Thank you to you ALL! Best hotel in Bali... A MUST stay! Immy and Alex May

date post: Mike M wrote a review Dec 2014
text: Wow! I had many so reasons to keep saying this over and over during our stay last week. Thanks so much Double Six for a fantastic 5 nights over Christmas. ALL of the entire staff were absolutely brilliant, from Dheeraj the attentive hotel manager, the front desk, concierge, butlers, restaurants & bars staff, spa, pool guys, hotel car drivers, etc - absolutely everyone! Super efficient, a totally a can-do approach, nothing was too much trouble for any of them, happened in a nano-second and with a great attitude (plus their uniforms looked incredibly creative and uber cool). Our beautiful 2 bedroom sea view suite was absolutely extraordinary. The in-room check in process was also novel and really great - we were whisked straight to our room on arrival, presented a welcome; â€¦
title: All about the people

date post: Diana J wrote a review Dec 2019
text: Wow! We could not fault this place! From check in to check out; all staff were so welcoming, helpful and friendly. We didnâ€™t have to wait a second if we had a questions; someone was always at hand to ask. We arrived a little early so were shown to the lounge where we were offered complimentary drinks before being shown to our room for check in. We were given an amazing welcome drink and informed of all the hotel facilities. We were informed that to respect the culture; not to dry clothing on the balcony and they offered a complimentary drying service by calling the butler. This was also nice to look up at the hotel and not see various garments on each balcony. Our butler also offered to unpack for us! Our room was HUGE! Housekeeping was wonderful and offered cleaning twice a; â€¦
title: Dream stay

text: Wow! Wow! Wow! We stayed for 9 nights! From the moment we drove into this resort to the time we left we could not have wished for a better holiday experience. The Friendly, Professional, Accomodating and Nurturing, Staff were Five Star! Our room was 201, private and extremely luxurious. Only complaint that it was a bit noisy until 10.30pm due to the music from the Coocoon Bar next door, this only was an issue the night before we were to get up early for a tour as we were out most nights until then. On the two days we were up early to do tours, the Staff arranged early alacarte breakfast in our suite. The Butler service is amazing and very quick always with smiles. The breakfasts in the morning were so yummy, the range of food and drinks were 10/10. We loved the dragon fruit; â€¦

Wow!!! What a beautiful hotel full of friendly staff and relaxing surroundings. Myself and my fiancÃ© were lucky to have my sister who works in travel (Infinity) help organise our wonderful trip and stay at Double Six as we couldn't of imagined a more superb holiday and Double Six had such a big part in it. From the minute we walked in at 2am in the morning we were greeted with such politeness and even a complimentary cocktail which was delicious by the way :) Not once in the 5 days of our stay did we feel uncomfortable if anything we felt more comfortable then anywhere else we have stayed before overseas. Such friendly staff who make you feel like you are the only people there, King and Queen even. The breakfast, the snacks, the view, the spa, the room, the pool,; â€¦

WOW... What an AMAZING Hotel !!! From the moment we arrived (10am) at Double-Six we were so warmly greeted by Erikson the Butler, Anastasia the receptionist who had an amazing smile and then we were personally introduced to Dheeraj the GM of the Double-Six, who is so down to earth. Dheeraj explained that we have been upgraded to a Pool Access Suite but will not be ready to move into until 2pm. Meanwhile he had organised a Leisure Suite ( WOW ) for myself and my husband to still check into while we were waiting on our Pool Suite to be cleaned. Only being there for half an hour we already knew this is exactly the hotel we had been searching for! At 1pm we were personally checked into our Pool Access Suite where all information was taken. Then right behind was our; â€¦

date post: Carolyn G wrote a review Jan 2015
text: Written Lawrence Bellefontaine publisher of Bali news and views newsletter and blog with over 820,000 page views. Mr. Bellefontaine is also the general manager of Bali Luxury Villas and Bali Paradise Beach Estates. A 18 year resident of Bali After dining at the new Bali Plantation restaurant in the Double Six Hotel Saturday night I can confirm that Bali has spawned another first-class restaurant. I am almost hesitant to recommend this restaurant because with limited seating there is no question in my mind it will end up like other famous Bali restaurants such as Mamasan's and require reservations at least a week in advance. Upon first entering the restaurant it reminded me of some of the best restaurants in Vancouver, San Franciso and New York City. Rich textures,low; â€¦
title: A little slice of heaven

text: Yet another outstanding visit to the Double Six Hotel Seminyak. Luxury - Tick. Service - Tick. Location - Tick. This property is beach front, and provides top end luxury. Additionally, there is now breakfast served in the roof top bar location, which provides a spectacular backdrop to the excellent buffet breakfast on offer. We often make use of the beach front beach chairs that are dedicated solely for hotel guests, which provides direct access to the beach.
title: Will absolutely return!

text: You know the feeling when you first sit in a new car - the smell of the upholstery and the leather steering wheel and how the seats feel firm and the windows are sparkling clean. This was how it felt when we first stepped into our new, and upgraded accomodation at Double Six. Because the place had only been open for a matter of weeks, we were lucky enough to be given a better room than the one we had originally booked. We were up on the third floor overlooking the ocean and just high enough to get a good view of the neverending pool below and the antics of the novice surfers riding the waves out in front of us. Our bathroom was bigger than our double garage.. or so it felt and the rainforest shower was so good I thought I could hear a scarlet Macaw squawking at a double wattled; â€¦

You wouldn't normally think of a hotel on Double-Six as a wellness sanctuary, but for me, that's exactly what the new Double-Six Luxury Hotel was like. Every year, I book a few days in Ubud on my own to eat healthy, get back in the gym, detox, etcetera. This year, I decided to try something new and Double-Six provided just the right experience. Only two of the five restaurants are open, but each one offers incredibly healthy dish selections. The Vietnamese shrimp rolls at the pool bar were plump and fresh, while the super food white egg omelette at Seminyak Italian Food hit just the right spot with my dragonfruit smoothie. The gym is not huge, but it has everything you need with good house music playing in the background. Yoga classes hadn't officially started yet, but the; â€¦

Your rating of this hotel would be totally dependant on the position of your room, as all rooms are, I think, almost the same - excellent. We were on the second floor, immediately above the busiest section of the pool, beside the restaurant with diners looking into our room, and within sound range of all four of the music venues. We had paid for an Oceanview suite (which it was, sort-of), but in hindsight I would have preferred to be around the back looking at the construction site next door. I emailed Double Six weeks before we came to ask for a quiet room, and the reply was something like "don't worry, all doof-doof stop 10pm". Well, there were times I would happily have dragged that person out of their bed at 1.30am, put the ear plugs (thoughtfully provided) in their ears; â€¦

date post: Ahmed A wrote a review Sep 2015
text: (+): Spacious room.. Quiet room.. Great hotel breakfast.. Duty manager Mr. Bagus Adit is very cooperative & helpful.. Just across front of hotel, there're many jimbaran seafood restaurants.. All staff are friendly.. (-): Garden view is actually car parking view.. Aircon in garden view room is noisy & turns on&off itself in some periodic time (but not in pool view room).. Cheap LG central Aircon isn't cool enough.. a bit underpower of btu.. Outlet Aircon is near to bed, so its airflow blows the face while sleeping.. No hotel beach..
title: Best ever

date post: Arnaud D. wrote a review Jan 2017
text: 1/ Good welcoming 2/ Quick service request 3/ Very near to Menega :) 4/ Employees were friendy 5/ Cool pool :) I am so recommend Le Meridien Bali Jimbaran for staying with friends, couple even for family. Love it!
title: Great rooms, smokey location

text: 2 bed suite: 175sqm of space with a view to the pool area. The two bedrooms are quite far apart allowing good parents vs kids separation. Both have large bathrooms. There are a couple of balconies and a terrace to the back. The living room has a dining area and a sofa area that are reasonable. During our stay in December, there were minor building works on the adjacent plot. Occasional noise was a slight annoyance. Overall, the room served its purpose but this is more of a 4 star standard than 5 star. The resort: surprisingly small with everything wrapped around d the pool area. The kids pool and club are good for toddlers. The main pool snakes around the complex but it is not very large. The restaurant serves basics well. The breakfast buffet is satisfactory, but nothing; â€¦
title: Beware of breakfast rate

text: 20 years ago we enjoyed 2 lovely weeks at the Le Meridien in Bali. Last week we returned for lunch, unfortunately the "old" hotel is now a Trump resort and the Le Meridien Bali is housed in a ramshackled worn out 3 star property unworthy of being branded with such a famous name. Unlike us check before you book, even lunch let alone stay.

6 of us stayed for 8 nights on a Luxury Escapes special. The staff were so lovely it became like family. The morning of check out my husband had to be taken to hospital, the Night Manager Julius was professional and his experience was invaluable as he guided me with which hospital and his staff with how to transport my husband etc.He and the Security Manager went above and beyond the call of duty for us on the 24th August as well as beyond their normal hours of work which l hope will be recognised by Star Group shareholders. Thankyou Le Meridien for a memorable stay - very warm memories from our whole group.

date post: John G wrote a review May 2013
text: A beautiful hotel with beautiful people Perfect place to stay for couple who want to explore jimbaran and south Kuta.The lagoon view room is highly recommanded. Amazing restaurants to have romantic dinner on the beach with your love one! A dream that should never ends...
title: Great Introduction to Bali

text: A beautifully located hotel with exceptional staff, service and amenities. A huge lagoon pool winds its way through this architecturally splendid hotel. Not absolute beachfront, but the beach is only a few steps away.The views from the rooftop bar, especially at sunset, are beautiful.Just outside the hotel , the beach is lined with seafood cafes, where tables are set on the sand to view the magnificent sunsets. The seafood is freshly caught and cooked to order over coals...and incredibly cheap! The hotel's restaurant , by the pool, is excellent and not expensive.

A couple of days into a 5 night stay, and it seems something isn't quite right here. The place has very few guests - even fewer using the hotel facilities. Ok, it's not high season but it's quiet - too quiet. Could be because they are intentionally supporting the local community by keeping their "in hotel" prices so high, not sure, but value isn't great here. Don't get me wrong, our room is pleasant enough, spacious and clean - although we are situated adjacent to the road where the local dogs and roosters wake you early - not the hotels fault of course, but when the place is nearly empty, perhaps a room further away from the noise or even an upgrade opportunity would have made a difference. Great location close to the beach and restaurants. Staff are friendly enough. It's; â€¦
title: Amazing

date post: Kelda J wrote a review Jul 2017
text: A fabulous hotel !!! Staff were wonderful. Very accommodating and went out of their way to provide the best service. The General Manager seems to be very hands on which is unusual as most hotels I've stayed at the GM is never around. This hotel GM greets her guests as if she is welcoming them into her home. At breakfast she came to ask us if we needed anything extra and if we were enjoying our stay. She approached us again at the pool area on another day and again offered to take care of anything that we may need. A special personal touch. Great service!!! The rooms are lovely well decorated and very spacious. The pool is large with lots of sun and we liked having a room with direct pool access. This was a treat. The restaurant serves delicious food and all restaurant staff; â€¦
title: Highly Recommend

text: A few friends and I got to the Le Meridien on 12/27...just in time for the soft opening of the hotel. The rooms were spectacular. My room actually had pool access right from the balcony which was incredible. The design and style of the hotel is unique. On the back side of the hotel, are the famous Jimbaran seafood restaurants where you sit on the beach to eat freshly caught fish. The manager of the hotel Simon is really, really fantastic. He was very interested in making sure we had everything we needed and solicited our opinions on the staff (which were all fantastically nice and helpful). Apparently, next month they are going to open two-level suites with their own pool and barbecue area. Very excited to come back and see those. This hotel is incredible.
title: Astonishingly obscured for a $250 hotel rooms.

text: A first time visit to the Le Meridien. The rooms are generously large, with good lagoon view, spacious walk-in wardrobe, separate long bath and shower facilities. The bed and pillows are most comfortable for a good night sleep. The gym was well equipped and open 24 hours. The breakfast was a good spread. Overall, the service level was good and attentive. However, the room air-con controls could be more responsive and somehow the room to room telephone connection was not working. The location of the hotel is some distance from the beachfront.

A friend and I stayed here for 8 nights on a Luxury Escapes package that had many great inclusions such as meals, massage and driver guide included. We opted for the lagoon pool access upgrade which was great to be able to take a dip in the pool right from our back verandah/room. The room was spacious, clean, all staff were super friendly, great service, food was fantastic, huge buffet breakfast variety & good value (for an Aussie). Cant fault anything really, perfect if you want to just relax at the resort, also an ok distance to go by taxi to Kuta, Ubud, Seminyak- try to avoid travelling on the road between 4-5.30pm, traffic kaos! Spa treatments were amazing!!! This hotel-resort whether on the package or not is highly recommended! Service was fantastic, a wonderful stay!

A great place to enjoy luxurious & clean room, friendly staff and a good breakfast. Its a place for you to escape from your daily routine, near to jimbaran local food and Jimbaran beach. Thanks for the great experience Le Meridien Jimbaran, Bali, surely will be on our next trip plan.

A little bit perplexed on how to describe the feeling i have regarding my visit in this hotel. I think unsatisfied is the right term. The one thing i have to commend is on the effort exerted by the staff to make our stay satisfactory, but to be fair there is some things that need to be pointed out. Pros: 1. The hotel rooms are great and chic, definitely something to look forward to. For the first three days we had the lagoon access room followed by another three days in the lagoon view rooms. 2. Hotel grounds is covered with lush vegetation, which was very enjoyable. 3. Getting escorts on the buggies was fun, especially with the little ones. Cons: 1. There is NO beach access to this hotel, however you are promised beach access on beach club where le meridian has made; â€¦
title: Lovely staff! Pitty about bad finishing in rooms.

text: A lovely hotel at a lovely place in a lovely island. Le Meridien Jimbaran Hotel is truly a great place to stay while being in Bali. It is situated in the Jimbaran area , just by the beach and has a great view to the Jimbaran Bay and the ocean. The hotel facilities are clean, the food is delicious and variable. The swimming pool is so beautiful. The people working there are so so so much nice and helpful. The room was very spacious, the view from the balcony was so nice, internet connection throughout entire area is strong and worked just fine. We had a classic room reservation but the hotel staff upgraded the room with an Aqua Suit with a Lagoon view for free! That's right - the upgrade was for FREE. We had a transfer to the airport late in the evening and the hotel staff even; â€¦

A male friend and I were lucky enough to stay at the Le Meridien for a portion of our 10 day getaway. We originally had two rooms booked for a friend to join us but he had to cancel his trip. The hotel were so accommodating with the change in our plans and kindly cancelled one of the rooms - although assuming we were a couple and wanted a King bedded room - A bit of a laugh for us as it seemed to be the consensus in Bali - "honeymoon special!" The staff here are amazing. The japanese girl on reception (I can't remember her name) and Pande in the rooftop bar were exceptional and made us laugh. The rooms were incredibly spacious and so well designed. Extremely modern and luxurious! The hotel even organised a driver for us for the day who took us to Ubud and he was wonderful; â€¦

A very well managed hotel! All staff from the bellboys,checked in, restaurants and pool attendances were great, same level of high service. If you want a quiet pool, fast service in ordering food at the pool, this is the hotel. Great kids club,too,but little things could be better: hat or gimmick for the kids. Mami was great! Breakfast was great, sushi bar was awesome, Indian food were also fab. Definitely will come back to see if the service remain the same if not better.
title: Happy with our decision

text: Absolutely love this hotel! The rooms are so spacious and luxurious, and the lagoon (pool) access from our balcony was awesome. The staff are so friendly and helpful, Smiley kept us entertained our whole stay. We will be coming back for sure!

After a shaky start - be careful of the BRG .. It is a sham!! Only stay here if you get a good rate - not worth the rack rate. We ( 2 Adults and 4 Kids )only stayed One Night for the Jimbaran Lantern Festival and that was enough.. The Entrance with the drive up the Lobby had was exciting .. The Entrance had a "wow" not a "WOW" factor and that was about it.. Lacked atmosphere... Check In and Check Out was a breeze and the FO Manager / Guest Relations Manager on Check Out was extremely attentive. Classic Rooms : Had everything you needed .. Can not really fault the rooms... Clean and Comfortable.. No View ... Kids Klub - Kids loved it - and wanted to go back the next day.. Kiddies Pool at the Kids Club - but a parent /adult had to be there if they wanted to use it - which; â€¦
title: Relaxing stay. Perfect for airport

date post: Marine H wrote a review Sep 2018
text: After booking on the app I was double billed for 2 nights. 3 fone calls later told they are working on it. I requested to speak with a manager, nothing. Eventually fixed 3 days. On landing in Bali a phone called saying a car would pick me up. Which it did. But on arrival tried to charge me. Again after much stress resolved. Then asked as a life time member with almost 5,000 nights at SPG I was asked if I wanted points on checkin or breakfast, said as lifetime I get breakfast, never received the points. Food is minimal at breakfast, elevator button could not be pushed, Internet is slow, slow slow and all in all a most disappointing stay ever. If you are considering Nali please give this property a miss you will thank me.
title: A wonderful stay

date post: Sas M wrote a review Sep 2018
text: After reading a fair few negative reviews I was a little hesitant about our stay at the Le Meridien. First impressions were good. Lovely open reception area and extremely kind and friendly staff. We had 2 rooms but the hotel were unable to accommodate interconnecting rooms. We ended up being 6 rooms away from our teenage boys which was far from ideal. Given our first morning we experienced a 5.2 earthquake I needed to have a room closet to my boys. However the next day we were able to move rooms to the room next door which was perfect. We had been given an upgrade for our inconvenience which was gratefully received and the room on the surface wad great. It was big. It had direct access to the pool however the finer detail needed some attention. Thin and freyed towels really; â€¦
title: Fails on many counts

date post: Sab C wrote a review Oct 2014
text: After spending multiple nights in Bali at other hotels, the quality of this hotel was definitely inline with the price, but should not be in the same five star category as the St.Regis and Four Seasons. The pictures online look awesome....the photographer did a great job as this isn't a true representation of the facility. Fairly simple hotel, basic room and amenities and overall a little rough around the edges. Staff tried hard and were friendly; however, this was just not the experience we were looking for on our honeymoon. A rooster woke us up each day at 4am in the morning. There is construction going on particularly around the pool which didn't make it very inviting. Short distance from the beach where we had an amazing seafood dinner right in front of the waves.
title: Very good

text: After spending the first 2 nights in Novotel Bali Benoa, we moved to Le Meridien Bali Jimbaran and stayed there for 2 nights (Dec. 26~28, 2020). Check-in was easy and efficient. After I got the room key, one of staffs (Ms. Dewi) escorted me to our room (Room # 123; Aqua Studio Suite/Lagoon access) which was located in the ground floor. Our room was spacious : It was clean, nicely designed and well maintained. We loved our room's design and the kids love the space in the room. It has balcony in the back as well as lagoon access. They also decorated the bathtub with red rose all over as we celebrated our wedding anniversary during this trip (thanks to Ms. Tri and team for giving us such a nice surprise). Breakfast in the morning was excellent although the available selections; were fairly limited but they were of excellent quality. There is an access door located near the restaurant to go to the Jimbaran Beach passing by rows of beachfront seafood restaurants in the back of the hotel (walking distance +/- 5 minutes to the beach). Overall, despite the minor issue (breakfast selection), we had an excellent stay in Le Meridien Bali Jimbaran (a lot better than we originally expected). For this reason, I personally give them a solid 4 stars' hotel and I strongly recommend this hotel property to everyone who is looking for quality hotel accommodation during their next visits in Bali.; â€¦

After spending the first 2 nights in Novotel Bali Benoa, we moved to Le Meridien Bali Jimbaran and stayed there for 2 nights (Dec. 26~28, 2020). Check-in was easy and efficient. After I got the room key, one of staffs (Ms. Dewi) escorted me to our room (Room # 123; Aqua Studio Suite/Lagoon access) which was located in the ground floor. Our room was spacious : It was clean, nicely designed and well maintained. We loved our room's design and the kids love the space in the room. It has balcony in the back as well as lagoon access. They also decorated the bathtub with red rose all over as we celebrated our wedding anniversary during this trip (thanks to Ms. Tri and team for giving us such a nice surprise). Breakfast in the morning was excellent although the available selections; were fairly limited but they were of excellent quality. There is an access door located near the restaurant to go to the Jimbaran Beach passing by rows of beachfront seafood restaurants in the back of the hotel (walking distance +/- 5 minutes to the beach). Overall, despite the minor issue (breakfast selection), we had an excellent stay in Le Meridien Bali Jimbaran (a lot better than we originally expected). For this reason, I personally give them a solid 4 stars' hotel and I strongly recommend this hotel property to everyone who is looking for quality hotel accommodation during their next visits in Bali.; â€¦

After staying in a private villa for three days on the north side of Bali, decided to go for the full service option. I have stayed in LM's all over the world, this one fell a little short. Location was not that good. My morning beach walk left me feeling as I was going to get cancer from all the burning wood and trash. The water looked pretty bad, I was not going in. On the brighter side, my room was amazing, large walk-in shower, large tub. Service was up to, if not exceeding my LM expectation. You call for more water, towels, whatever, very prompt. All staff on property was there to meet your every need.

After waiting for a long-ish time to check in (although the waiting area was very comfortable) we were then called up to check in, to find out that our room was not ready yet (this was past 3pm). They apologized and offered us lunch in their restaurant! We went down and had some burgers and sushi while we waited for our room to be ready. The room was upscale, comfortable, and quiet. They have a great pool, swim up bar, and beautiful grounds. We would definitely stay here again!
title: What a mix of good and bad!

date post: Rahul P wrote a review Jan 2018
text: All the staff were very nice, helpful and welcoming. They couldn't do even for us, and we felt like family. Over our 2 weeks stay, we got to know the staff, and loved their friendliness and eagerness to make our stay as comfortable as possible. Breakfast is great, with plenty of choice, nice way to start each day. The only issue we had was a lack of hot water, but not a big issue in Bali in summer! Conveniently located to make the most of the Jimbaran village environment, with either an easy walk, or the guys driving us straight to the front doors of local facilities on the golf buggies. We even left a small bag behind, and they called us and organised a taxi to drive it to the airport, where the taxi drive came in met us, giving us our bag. Very much appreciated. Overall,; â€¦
title: Far from the madding crowd

date post: Pritam S wrote a review Jul 2014
text: Although im not a tourist, well i stay in bali, i spent my weekend here for 4 nights. Its very2 beautifull hotel.. my room is in Lagoon access pool and its amazing.and the staff is friendly to local (i've read the comment below that they feel the staff is more friendly to tourist instead of local) well it's not happening to me.. My dad stayed in this hotel few month earlier and he did reccomend me to stay in this hotel and i do not regret it at all. Im here with my kids 1 year old and they help me with the babycrib without being asked for.. very2 amazed with this service. Hotel is very family friendly.. my room on 1st floor so its very easy access to get to my car parking.. From the beginning the reception already offer us with late check out which is i dont see that; â€¦
title: Great stay

text: Although we only stayed for three nights, the standard was high enough to stay longer! The bed and room were very comfortable and breakfast was ample. Staff are very friendly and attentive when serving and one waiter even invited us to meet his family! The location was ideal for a quiet stay with easy access across the road to all the beach front BBQs, serving the best fish we have ever had! Taxis and general costs at the hotel are not cheap, what you expect from a 5* hotel but be warned on check out as things do add up.

amazing hotel! the services, the view, the beverage, the spacious room, everything!! although they just opened this year but there isn't a single detail missing. i was prepared for the lack of service from a hotel who just opened but it turned out i was wrong. the services here are so great. jimbaran itself is the heaven of seafood in bali where you could eat at the seashore. so when i get bored i just walked and try other restaurants around the hotel. it is a must go, especially if you are a couple on a honeymoon. heaven!! oh, and i just found out that they have videos, sharing all the interesting things that you could find in bali. so if you guys run out of idea on what to do in bali, maybe their videos can help you. XD

Amazing service. I went with my partner and upgraded to a suite and it was just brilliant. Extremely clean, impeccable service, they would drive us in the buggy up to the beach and back. Seafood at the beach is what this area is known for. It's in a nice and quiet area, not the party side of Bali. One thing that keeps sticking in my mind was the fact that I ordered a coffee at breakfast, and because they knew what room I was in, they went through the trouble of writing my last name on the coffee!! Just that personal touch is amazing. Excellent facilities as well. Would definitely come back. I was told this is a relatively new hotel. Only drawback was the weather was a bit cloudy because of the season but the hotel cant help that of course. They were amazing and I even signed up; â€¦

An 8 night stay with my sister and younger niece and nephew. I was a little surprised how isolated Jimbaran Bay is. Having stayed in Seminyak several times I was thinking that the area was similar. Other than the hotels and beach restaurants directly surrounding the hotel most places to eat/things to do were a cab drive away. Albeit cab fares are nominal in Bali but I just felt it was a little isolated from the 'main' areas. There was no 'walking' to anything outside the main hotel area. The beach although has had rave reviews I thought was no cleaner than the main areas of Kuta and Seminyak although much calmer and child friendly. Although still somewhat dirty and strewn with rubbish. The hotel has certainly seen better days. The rooms although I think modernised recently were; â€¦
title: Big rooms but not really a resort

text: Apart from a massive pane of glass falling out of Lobby into kids pool 1 story below, constant damp smell in room from mold in the air cons, gassing for mozzies at 6pm, daily thick smoke in the afternoon from the seafood bbqs on the beach, slippery floor by pool and in showers it was ok. I have a genuine concern that some one will get hurt or die here as this hotels construction is as unfinished and as bad as I have ever seen. The staff are amazing the pool is nice but my life is worth more that that upside. Unfortunately not worth it! Stay elsewhere and good luck to the hotel group spg as I hope this is not a reflection on your other hotels but I will not take the risk.
title: Beautiful pool area and good kid's club

text: Arrived at the Le Meridien after staying in other parts of Bali and it was just like pure heaven! We got our room upgrade to a suit because we thought we had extra guests arriving and it was more like a pent house! Absolutely huge! The service was incredible and don't get me started on the pool & gelato shop! We were welcomed by all staff on arriving and loved the fact that they were willing to drive you on a buggy even just to find an ATM! We were planning to spend a lot of time at the beach there, but loved the privacy of the hotel more! Will DEFIANTLY be back!!!
title: Serenity

date post: Elizabeth M wrote a review Apr 2015
text: Arrived to find out that we had been upgraded from a lagoon access room to a lagoon access suite. The room was spacious and modern with great private access to the pool. All the staff we encountered we lovely and friendly. The breakfast had a concise but well executed amount of choice - complete with egg station. Close proximity to the jimbaran beach front restaurants (2 min walk). The housekeeping was a little hit and miss - there were three of us but they only ever left 2 towels and never any face washers or hand towels but that's only a small thing. We were provided with 6 bottles of free water in the room each day and more if required. Enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel. Note: there's a nice little Vietnamese restaurant 5 mins walk away called Saigon
title: Beautiful hotel and staff

text: Arriving at Le Meridien Bali is like being at home. The staffs at the front office had provided excellent service, especially the manager, Mr. Franklyn K. Some of the team members are new to SPG and have limited knowledge about the program. The hotel does not have beach access. However it has great rooms and lagoons around the property.
title: Wonderful end of trip stay at new Meridien!

text: As a frequent travelling amassing 102 night in Marriott properties, 23 in SPG and 10 in Hilton last year I was pleased when SPG merged with Marriott to offer a wider range of properties. I thought this year I would try multiple SPG properties taking advantage of my platinum status. Unfortunately, the Le Meridian Jimbaran would be anything that I would expect out of a SPG property. At check in I was made aware that my credit card had already been charged for the 3 rooms I had booked even though they had been booked as flexible due to the nature of our business. Unfortunately, this makes it a nightmare for our company reconciliation. This is where everything went down hill. I was offered as my platinum arrival gift the choice of the bonus points or a continental breakfast.; â€¦
title: Boutique and Homely

text: As a Starwood Platinum member; I was happily surprised by the amazing welcome at the MÃ©ridien Jimbaran. During our trip in Bali, we stayed in various cities (Jimbaran, Seminyak, Kuta, Nusa Dua, Lambok, Amedâ€¦) We enjoyed and loved our stay at Le MÃ©ridien Jimbaran for various reasons : 1- Awesome Staff, dedicated, knowledgeable and very helpful 2- Modern and spacious suite room, we were upgraded both times we stayed at the hotel, to a suite Laguna Access and the Penthouse. 3- Delightful food, ice-cream shop, Illy CafÃ© and simply the best breakfast in the hotels we stayed at. 4- The director Manager Gregory was available through-out our stay with assistance, and advice, and made sure our honeymoon was perfect, he helped also make reservations and change our hotel for; â€¦

As a treat to myself for my birthday I checked my family of 5 into this hotel at the end of our stay. From the minute we arrived to the moment we left I felt like I was in a little paradise. The staff were all very helpful, the rooms were clean, spacious and comfortable. The pool was huge and plenty of seating. Nice quite location where you could just step out the backdoor and choose one of the many on the beach restaurant's for a sunset seafood dinner. Also indulged in a treatment at the Spa there and it was amazing. Would definitely stay here again.

As always, service staff in Bali are always genuinely warm and friendly. upon arriving the hotel, we are ferried by a golf cart buggy to the lobby area, with staff alerted prior our arrival. Nice salted pool, if you have young kids, do consider ground floor units which overlooks the pool and have direct access. Try the spa if you have time, was above average experience for my wife and I, who love trying out various spas when we travel. Jimbaran beach is located at the backdoor, so you can check out the seafood BBQ by the beach, try Menega, the most famous restaurant in the stretch. Seafood is cooked over wire using coconut husks. Only letdown was uncooked pancakes in the breakfast buffet, chef who was alerted quickly checked and remove the affected items, Small things like; â€¦

As frequent Bali visitors we found this smaller boutique style hotel easier to navigate than many of the larger resorts. Staff are well trained and very friendly, willing to accommodate all requests. Our room size and quality was very good although we had paid for a more spacious room. Beds and pillow were fantastic. The smaller sized property meant like many hotels there is a lot of competition for sunbeds. It did make accessing the excellent spa services easier and they are definitely a good standard. The hotel is just back from the beach, behind the seafood restaurants which is convenient if you love that style of eating, however it is not the place to stay if you enjoy walking out of your hotel for a choice of restaurant options and a good dose of Bali shopping. We had; â€¦
title: Beautiful retreat

text: As I am vegetarian and don't like the smell of seafood. So this place is not for vegetarians but the rooms and full hotel is very clean and spacious. The properties nearby hotel is worth visit for a drink like ayana etc.

date post: Kim W wrote a review Mar 2016
text: As part of the SPG group, I decided to try the "newish" Le Meridien Jimbaran and from the time we checked in to the time we checked out, everything was sub-par. The grounds especially the walkways and the building looks like it was done very cheaply. Twice, we called for room service and both times, the person that picked up the phone couldn't speak/understand English. After much repetition, the phone is passed to another person who took down our room service orders. Breakfast in the morning is a mad-cap affair, it feels and looks under-staffed, and the hotel is not even running at full capacity. No replenishment of all Indonesian dishes (they were all empty) - I'm not talking about 1 dish, I'm talking about the whole Indonesian selection (all 6 dishes were empty!), I told the; â€¦
title: Wonderful 4 star hotel

text: As regular SPG and Bali travelers we thought we should try this SPG hotel. On arrival our rooms (2 lagoon view) were not ready so after an hour of waiting they kindly sent us to the restaurant for a complimentary lunch. On ordering they had run out of certain foods which was surprising. Then by 4.00pm we were taken to our upgrade - a 2 bedroom apartment ! it was SUPERB and worth the wait. Beds and sleeps quality A+ The staff are wonderful. Front desk so professional and friendly and welcoming. Loved the buggy drive to Jimbaran Corner for basic supplies and money changers. Loved that the seafood restaurants are across the carpark. So many to chose from. Loved the buffet breakfasts - excellent food choices and a different curry / soup each morning. When the pool was; â€¦

date post: Susan G wrote a review Jun 2016
