I am DEFINITELY not a PETA person or am some crazy animal activist, but animals this large shouldn't be living in such a small space. I think they are trying their best given the resources and land; â€¦

All the people that work here said all the elephants are really happy, and I believed them because every time I saw them they what looked to be "dancing" all the time which I thought was strange, so I googled "dancing elephants" and I was very disappointed. These elephants are distressed, unhappy and need social interaction with their families. They say they are saving these elephants but they have already bred 5 babies that are chained up away from their mothers in the park. The only time they aren't locked up on a 1 metre chain around their foot is when they are in a elephant show or doing an elephant ride (which costs 800k rupiah for 30 mins) this place has nice food but everything is over priced. You have to pay 50k rupiah to feed the elephants also. Please do more research,; â€¦

Although I don't like to see any animal being exploited for human entertainment, I have to say these elephants appear to be very well looked after. Our guide was very informative and he explained to us that he had been with his elephant for 8 years and it is his job to build the relationship he has with her and to feed her and to make sure she is well. All the elephants looked well. The pens they were kept in whilst not being used were mostly in the shade, they have regular time in their lake to cool off and get fed all the time, during the ride and while having pictures with people. The food at this place was very very good. Well worth paying the money. Although for what we got we didn't think it was that expensive.
title: GREAT DAY ACTIVITY PLAYING WITH THE ELEPHANTS!

date post: Adriana H wrote a review Aug 2019
text: Although I made reservations for all elephant activities we wanted to do months prior to our arrival and received a very detailed schedule of events, once we arrived there are actually no reservations for events just long lines waiting with day visitors that are not hotel guests. While I originally booked the activities and my E-mail confirmation says it includes breakfast now that we arrived we are told breakfast is not included. Elephants are shackled in the leg. The public bathings are not clean and have a towel (not disposable and not for one time use) for all guests to use. I find this very disgusting. The reservation department confirms via E-mail, but the email is not honored. I am very disappointed.
title: Highlight of our trip

text: Although the elephant experience itself was indescribable, the animals themselves where so gentle and absolutely fantastic, but the price was appalling. After paying nearly $300 USD (after the exchange rate) on the $99 "breakfast with the elephants" for two, we met the elephants, had our buffet breakfasts, asked for a 2nd cup of coffee each which was brought to us, followed by a bill for $8.00 seconds after our first sips. Apparently, a second cup of coffee at a $150 buffet breakfast is not free. Unfortunately they had already handed out their questionnaire asking about the meal, in addition to questions such as "did any of the staff ask for a tip and who" and "if you did the rafting trip, did you buy a drink from the riverbank sellers". Not even disguising their desire to; â€¦

Always a great day out with the family. We enjoyed a fantastic day out in Taro, getting to feed the elephants and ride on them through the surrounding jungle. The staff were fabulous and clearly love the elephants that they spend their life with.
title: I love Elephants!

text: Amazing day spending it hands-on with the elephants! We arrived in the morning and fed and washed a cute Asian elephant. It was so sweet to be that close and interactive with them. Afterwards we went swimming with the elephants, where you sit on their backs with a trainer and they play in the water. We enjoyed a continental breakfast afterwards and then went for a half hour elephant ride thru the forest. It was an amazing and beautiful experience!! I asked our elephant handler if they are treated well, and he said they are fed LOADS of fruit a day, and are taken care of by onsite veterinarians. These elephants are rescued from Singapore apparently, but I did find it distressing to see elephants with a chain around their leg. I asked about that and was told they do that to ensure; â€¦
title: Awesome Experience!

text: Amazing day, we chose the breakfast and bathe session, we was staying elsewhere in Ubud and they came and picked us up, we then got to wash and swim with the elephants which was an amazing experience... feeding the elephants was also fun however by this time a lot more people had arrived so was a little crowded. Buffet breakfast provided was delicious with a large selection. Overall would massively recommend anyone to do this whether you stay at their lodge or not. It is quite pricey but it can be argued you get a lot for your money ...

Amazing experience washing the elephants, signs all over the park explained why they're looked after the way that they are. The keepers clearly love them & I wish I could have stayed at the lodge. There was an opportunity to buy the elephant art work & a great little restaurant. Highly recommended!
title: Not a happy place for elephants

text: Amazing place with such an Amazing experience! We were lucky enough to sit on top of the magnificent animals and go for a short ride on the night safari. We travelled through the park where there were lights in the gardens... Magical!! It did start to run whilst we were on our ride and we were given umbrellas straight away from our guide. After the ride we watched a night time performance from the elephants, got to feed the baby elephants, and the had dinner! A must see whilst in Bali!!
title: Great for kids

text: Amazing place, to see the elephants being treated so well and being looked after by there keepers was great. To be able to ride and hear about the elephant from there keeper was really good. Once the new area opens where the elephants can roam on the own will be even better for the park. Great restaurant and food etc too.
title: Amazing sanctuary for Elephants

text: Amazing place. None of the elephants are tied or tethered except the bull for safety reasons, even then only 1 tie on the leg. You can tell the trainers love their animals. Wonderful to see that all these rescued elephants are doing well. Able to buy food for them and feed them all day long. Great to know every penny is going back into the elephants care. Definitely recommend.
title: Happy Elephants, great park, lovely service

date post: Dan S wrote a review Jun 2017
text: Amazing to interact with the elephants in a beautiful setting, however the treatment of the animals is sub par. Although the resort is making a respectable effort by local standards, they have a long way to go before earning the sanctuary name they've assigned themselves.
title: Elephant safari bathe and breakfast

text: An absolutely wonderful experience! One of the very few places in Bali that the animals are actually put first, and you can see they are well taken care of. However it is expensive to stay in the lodge, but it is defiantly worth it to have more one on one experience with the elephants!
title: Elephant Safari Love

text: An amazing experience which will never be forgotten. These elephants are extremely well looked after and loved by their handlers, each of which adore what they do. The handlers have an amazing bond with these larger than life animals. If you love elephants, then this place is somewhere you must visit whilst in Bali. You experience a range of activities which include an elephant ride, feeding and a talent show. If you can afford it, stay the night as you will experience more than that of a day visit. Hotel is fabulous and all staff are amazing. PRO'S: You will not experience anything like this anywhere else. It's truly unique. Elephants are loved and there is a wide range of activities as well as a huge gift shop containing anything to do with elephants as well as a fantastic; â€¦
title: Fun Day Trip

text: An amazing experience, stayed for 1 night and had an elephant safari ride, rode an elephant whilst it was swimming and even gave a baby one a scrub down in the morning. Fascinating creatures, and although they are in captivity, they have all been rescued from various situations, they are well looked after and seem really happy. The staff are great and really friendly, would definitely recommend to anyone who is going to bail.
title: Absolutely amazing, experience of a lifetime!!

text: An expensive day out but good if you have never riden an elephant. I was a little disturbed by two elephants that were looking very unhappy rocking back and forth continually whilst chained to a spot in the park. When I asked the guide what they were doing he said 'dancing!'. Certainly didn't look like dancing but I guess some of the elephants here have been saved from much worse conditions.
title: Inspiring

text: Arriving at Denpasar mid morning, we were met at the airport by the driver who took us straight to the lodge. Despite being early, we were shown to our room straight away and given a suggested itinerary for our one day/one night stay. Our Park View room was large, clean, well equipped and overlooked the main park area where the elephants feed and sleep. It was amazing to hear the elephants trumpeting at night and to wake up to see them just feet away from our balcony. As guests at the lodge we were allowed to take part in activities not available to day visitors. We bathed the elephants in the morning and walked freely around the park before the safari park opened. We swam with the elephants and could request an elephant ride at any time. Watching the educational dvd; â€¦

As a lover of elephants I could not go past visiting the park on our recent holiday! We opted for the night safari & were extremely happy. Dinner was amazing and the staff were very friendly and knowledgeable. Was great to see the elephants happy and meet and feed the baby :) Well worth the experience. Next trip hope to stay a night or two at the lodge

As an attraction this place is lovely. You can interact with the elephants and take a nice ride around the park and through the 'jungle' (amongst peoples allotments of sugar cane etc really) But as a hotel, rated as 4.5 stars here, Id say it was closer to 3 stars which is fine but for the price of the rooms i dont recommend it. I am reviewing Elephant and Safari Lodge as a hotel and place to stay, not an attraction as we certainly paid for a decent place to stay. We booked through agoda.com which gave us a great deal and we took a deluxe room with paddy view for Â£145 per night. When we arrived we were shown to a garden view room with no view but the walkway outside the door with ensuite shower and toilet. Compare this to our previous hotel, Komaneka at Rasa Sayang, where for; â€¦
title: Experience of a lifetime!

text: As an elephant lover, this was one of the best experiences of my life! Bali Adventure Tours picked us up on time from our hotel, and were very pleasant to deal. Once at the park, it was so nice to see the elephants roaming around and very much enjoying their baths, food and swimming. The elephants are clearly happy and are very playful with their trainers. It was so nice to see that the elephants are treated so well after being rescued and it is clear that the trainers love their elephants. I did not feel hurried during the day at all, and felt that I was given ample amount of time to spend with the elephants one on one as well as in a group. The breakfast that is provided is also fantastic. I cannot recommend this experience enough and can't wait to come back and stay a few; â€¦
title: Magnificent Animals

text: As part of a two week Bali holiday, in which we stayed at Sanur and Nusa Dua, we also stayed at the Elephant Safari Lodge in Taro - about 12 km from Ubud. This was a great experience, especially if you love elephants. The hotel itself is first-class and the rooms are beautiful, with their elephant themes of course. The resort is set in beautifully landscaped tropical gardens, and is a cool, peaceful oasis away from the madness and humidity of Kuta and surrounds. It was a real novelty being picked up to go to dinner each night on an elephant, and the day and night safaris were enjoyable, meandering through what appeared to be the local farm areas with cows and chickens dotted throughout the jungle. The staff were friendly and helpful and the cuisine was a blend of western; â€¦

As soon as we booked our trip to Bali, we knew that we wanted to interact with elephants. I'm so glad we picked the elephant safari park. We got picked up from our hotel in Seminyak early in the morning and got transported to the park. When we arrived, we immediately were moved to the elephant bathing area. What an experience!! You are able to get so close to the elephants and wash them. Later you hop on the elephant and get in the pond for a swim. The keepers are very fun and make sure you get awesome pictures. Another thing I was very pleased with was they offer warm clean showers and towels. After the shower we ate breakfast, which was included in our package. The breakfast was delicious and we ate as we watched elephants swim. This is a must when in Bali.

AWESOMENESS GALORE! Was there for 1 night and to my surprise was upgraded to a Parkview Room for my Birthday. It was beyond amazing having to go to sleep and wake up with an elephant right outside your balcony. This Beautiful elephant sanctuary is located about 30 minutes outside of Ubud in Taro. The room was impeccable, clean. The staff amazing. I wish I had gotten the names of the staff at reception on Oct 2nd. The Mahout for Tia the elephant, who came to pick me up for the Safari Dinner...so passionate about his job & gave me a brief history of the elephants as well as the Sanctuary itself. The Safari dinner Buffet was impressive, the staff who sang HBD to me that was so unexpected, but with so many choices the food from the buffet was very tasty and so was Breakfast in the; â€¦
title: Do Not Visit Here!

date post: DAVID H wrote a review May 2018
text: Awful experience We were placed in a a very noisy room near by the kitchen and service It wasnâ€™t anything like we expected. Our complaint wasnâ€™t even considered. Luckily we stayed in much better hotels afterwards with a great quality and price I wouldnâ€™t recommend this hotel to stay in The elephant experience is a must do but not the hotel it self.
title: Superb setting

text: Beautiful elephant park - elephants have been rescued from Sumatra and seem happy and healthy. The rangers and mahouts (carers) are all well-presented and appear to truly enjoy their jobs. As a guest, you have unlimited access to the elephants - you can feed them at any time and help with their baths in the morning and evening. The room was a paddy-view room. We were extremely pleased with it - the bathroom is on a lower floor, which was a nice separation. The beds were EXTREMELY comfortable, although it was 2 singles (not exactly romantic). Location was disappointing - not 20 minutes from Ubud, closer to 45. We paid our driver more since he quoted us to Ubud but we had been to Ubud before so we knew the area he had been expecting. Also, their service is quite expensive:; â€¦
title: Nice Park but Poor Elephants

text: Beautiful park, kind environment, lots of elephants! We had our elephant ride on Romano, a 24 year old female - she was beautiful and her rider was fantastic too! We then watched a show and has photos taken with the elephants, followed by a buffet lunch. Just note, take cash as drinks are not included.
title: Excellent value. I recommend it to everyone

text: Beautiful place, the elephants are magnificent. We loved riding one, and the show is pretty good too. Beautiful grounds. Also the cafe is good and you have a nice view of the park. Highly recommended.
title: One night stay , fantastic

date post: Lisa B wrote a review Apr 2015
text: Been so close to the elephants all the time is outstanding! Best part - swimming with these giants. And feeding baby elephant ;-) Absolutely unique experience! When you stay overnight you get so much more than just visiting with the tour!
title: Mixed feelings

text: Been to Bali many times and this is one of the most wonderful things I have experienced. The entire place is so well planned, organised and all the staff do an amazing job. I took my daughter for her 15th birthday, and we have the memory of a lifetime. The rooms are superb, the coffee-table books provided are perfect and the spa sublime! You certainly get value for your money, definitely not overpriced. Our hands on interaction with the elephants was beyond anything I could have imagined. Being collected from our room for dinner by our elephant taxi was unique and the outdoor dining under the stars is beautiful. The staff appeared with a gourmet birthday cake singing happy birthday to my daughter and I just thought, things couldn't be any more perfect. AND the elephants are all; â€¦

date post: Megan D wrote a review Aug 2011
text: Been traveling back to Bali several times now, stayed at this wonderful hotel with my husband on our last trip for a night and came back and stayed here again with the kids as well this time for 3 nights. All I can say is staying here the second time was as equally enchanting as the first. The tranquility of the gardens and pachyderms, immaculately pristine facilities, friendly and professional staff, and excellent food (dinners were exceptional) all add up to an amazing experience. We were initially recommended staying here from several friends who also had nothing less to say in regards to it - which is why I find the below review "Not a good hotel" quite blatantly inaccurate and seemingly spiteful. The opening line stating "If you want to ride elephants, go to Chiang Mai,; â€¦
title: AWESOME, FANTASTIC!

text: Before I begin I want to say I wasnâ€™t sure what to expect after reading the reviews. What we got was breath taking and really magical. We paid for the 5 of us 2 adults 2 teens 1 10 year old to do washing, bathing, feeding and ride. We got to the lodge nice and early and was taken to the washing station where we got to hose down an elephant and washing them. The elephant we had was chained up and moved freely. She was cheeky and responded well to the handler that didnâ€™t even have to touch her to stop her from going somewhere she shouldnâ€™t. We next went to the bathing pool where we got into the water with the elephants on there neck area (handler told us where to sit so didnâ€™t hurt the elephants). We where then in the water where there the elephants when down into the water and; â€¦

Being an animal lover, something just didnâ€™t sit right with this place. I visited yesterday with my 13 year old and 11 year old children and we paid for admission only as all we really wanted to do was get up close to these gentle giants and hand feed them. Upon arrival we were ushered down to the elephant encounter area where we could have our photos taken with an elephant and with voice commands from the mahout guy the elephant would â€œcuddleâ€ you. I have to admit this was certainly the best part and lots of fun - the kids loved hand feeding the elephants fruit (which you had to buy) and coconut palm which was free to feed them. We loved being so close to the gentle elephants and being able to interact with them. After this we viewed the bathing area which was green and dirty; â€¦

Best day of my life! Paid for bathing, the whole family got involved, not rushed at any point. Got into water on elephants back and had lots of one to one time. Was just a beautiful experience. Then taken to hot shower which was very welcome followed by Buffet breakfast which was great quality. Was then taken on safari around the park. Got chatting to the handler and he was saying the elephant is like his wife, he spends all hours with it, training and caring for her. When he gets sick or is a day off, then she gets a day off too. Didn't see any mistreatment and most handlers didn't have a control hook, just sat chilled on them, following their commands. It was just a lovely lovely day and one I won't forget for a long time.
title: Fun, happy experience

text: between the elephant and hugging the honeybear, you will have an amazing time with your loved ones here! the area is very nice in between jungles and taking pictures is a must especially when the elephant dive into the water or when the bear poses for a selfie with you!

Booked thru Bali adventure tours. Upon arrival to the park we joined a short que for payment. We had payed by paypal the night before so was waved through once explained. We waited in the lobby area fro our group to form. In this lobby is some interesting bits and pieces to look at while you wait. Before i had time to even get a third of the way through the interesting decor we were told the drill and moved on to two asian elephants ready for there morning scrub! A huge male and a female, both very well behaved and seemed very happy with us scrubbing them like gods! After 15mins or so and a few snaps later we were moved on to a large pool area where the elephants enjoy their dip. We were shown to our elephant climbed abroad and was told to sit just behind his head. The; â€¦

date post: Sylvia P wrote a review Jan 2012
text: Booked to stay here for two nights and, despite the expense, have no regrets. I was concerned about the welfare of the elephants after reading some other reviews but found what I believe to be thirty very well cared for, well loved, extraordinary animals that changed my whole view on elephants - I'm in love! The steel hook people have mentioned is actually blunt and used by some handlers very lightly to direct the animal - some only use their voice or hand but I certainly saw nothing resembling pain or cruelty. I was a bit distressed by one female on a short chain but was told she could harm the other calf kept there if she had free reign. A few minutes later she bumped the calf out of the way and I had no doubt she could have hurt it. Maybe better to keep them separate raather; â€¦
title: What a wonderful experience!

text: Both my wife and I were looking forward to this tour all week, and to be honest we weren't disappointed. The shuttle van picked us up from Seminyak on time and the 2hr road trip gave us the opportunity to see more of Bali away from the resorts and busy area's. From the moment we arrived we had a quick introduction and within minutes we were Riding "Tia" around the landscaped gardens. You couldn't remove the smiles off our faces, and whilst talking to the mahout during the ride you could see how well these rescued elephants are looked after. 30mins later we watched the brief Elephant show and rather it being a circus act, it showed to us that these animals crave human interaction. After that for a small fee we fed the elephants a fruit basket and a quick photo session. Then a; â€¦

Breakfast and bathe the Elephants worth every cent! Was truly the highlight of my trip. Getting up close to cuddle wash and feed these truly gorgeous creatures it was just so special. Our tour guide was fantastic and getting to touch and see these gentle giants was a wonderful experience.

Buffet lunch was very good. We took the elephant tour around the park. Each elephant takes a journey through the jungle like park terrain. You have a guide that controls the elephant and takes photos for you while mounted on the elephant back. Felt very safe. tour was about 30 minutes plus another 15 minutes mini circus show.

Came for a day visit to explore and experience riding an elephant in Bali. It was worth every penny! We came with our son who is almost 2 years old, he had an awesome time, especially when we got to feed the animals! Our guide was very knowledgable and nice. We went on a half hour tour of the jungle and watched a couple shows. Also had the lunch included in our package, the food was outstanding!
title: Don't miss this experience!

date post: Richard V wrote a review Feb 2019
text: Came here on my honeymoon. The dinner and lunch was really good, breakfast was okay. The elephant experience was amazing. But the rooms were really bad... from ants taking over the free fruit platter, to the overall smell, it was a place we were glad that we were only staying one night for. Also, we did a ton of research before booking this to make sure the elephants weren't abused and, after reading comments, there's a lot of misinformation in these reviews. Yes, the elephants are chained -- but that is due to safety regulations. Plus, they are building out a free-range area for the elephants. Yes, the elephants perform for guests -- but they were never abused or harmed. The reality is that these elephants *are* rescued, and they *were* abused from where they originally are; â€¦
title: Great day out, and a great experience. A must do in Bali

text: Checked in for 3 days. Literally the best experience of my life. Such an amazing place to be up and close with the elephants! I was a bit concerned they may be unhappy but they are so well looked after and after reading the story, they were all rescued from poor conditions. Such a wonderful ending for such beautiful creatures! Would recommend for everyone to visit and stay. Highlight to my trip to Bali that I will never forget!

Checked in today and from the moment we arrived we felt welcome. The staff here are all so friendly. The food is omg amazing (had the buffet for dinner and so full) complimentary drinks and massage when you arrive & the elephants are so amazing

Clean! Incredible service/catering! Great breakfasts! Accommodations are beautiful. Transportation is included and available. Go for the elephants. They are cared for and treated well and an amazing experience. We went rafting, loved it! Lots of stairs, you have been warned, just don't let that stop you! Our only grumbles are tthe elephant trainers dont get paid enough for the work they contribute.

Coming from the tropical island Of Seychelles, was great and awesome to see and feed those mamouth animals really close. As we do not have any kind of wild animal back home it was an unregretable once a lifetime experience. Feeding the elephants at close range and being able to touch them was simply amazing!!
title: Special experiance

text: Costly compare to rest of Bali, but very nice. Very friendly staff and even the most simple rooms are very luxery. Had a great stay! Good food. Elephant swimming was great. Safari tour through jungle a bit boring. Nice museum and education-centre.
could not fault the place . Staff were friendly , the mahoots were exceptional. the food was lovely, the whole place could not fault it in any way, looking forward to going back later on i the year..
title: Fun and unique experience

text: Couldn't wish for a better experience.all the staff in the park are helpful,polite and couldn't do enough for you.beautiful energy in the whole of the park.the elephants are very well looked after,by the trainers(mahouts).felt very comfortable when riding and swimming with them.the room and hotel are very well kept.really clean and attention to detail is paid to the whole of the park.getting to ubud was no problem,as they run a free shuttle bus to and from.the drivers are very organised with the timing of picking you up,which is some task as it's very busy with quite a lot of traffic coming into the centre.the restaurant serves tasty food to accommodate most guests.didnt have the buffet on for the days we stayed as the park was quite with not as many guests,but had a good; â€¦

date post: Brian E wrote a review Jun 2017
text: Crazy Price (70â‚¬ with elephant ride) Tiny little park, you could do it in 20mins. They claim to try to protect the elephants, so your choice : - 20 of them attached with chains with a possible movement of less than 1 meter or - Rest of elephant waiting that you go for a ride. They are all equipped to have you on their back and are waiting all day long for that. Then the ride in the park itself for short time. - 3-4 elephants are there waiting for food that you buy for extra and take picture. Restaurant with crazy price Only good thing is the museum, tiny one bur nice pieces exposed. As some locals explained me, only revenue from the souvenir shop is given to help to save them into the wild. Entrance fee is pure business. If you like animals and care for them and most; â€¦
title: Mixed Feelings

text: Day trippers will get a false impression. We booked to stay two nights and instantly regretted it within the first few hours! The elephants donâ€™t have any choice in what they do. Starting with the fact elephants are herd animals, they have no interaction with one another unless theyâ€™re waiting to be ridden and are stuck together with their riders sitting on top of them or forced at the fence for pictures. During the day when they donâ€™t have their rider with them, they are then chained up meters away from one another in a concrete circle connected to a chain that is no more than a metre a long. At night time, they are then kept in the same place. Unless they are being used for a show or a ride, the elephants have no freedom. They have baby elephants which must be taken away from; â€¦
title: Beyond Awesome

date post: Carol B wrote a review Feb 2016
text: Decided to go here because it was apparently the most humane place to see elephants in bali, and with such exorbitant admission prices, I believed it would be But the entire place was a massive gimmick - I felt incredibly uneasy seeing the three year old elphant in a small open enclosure so everyone could come and pat it while its mother was chained up a short distance away and looking on, she was evidently very distressed and sucking her trunk while people were approaching her baby (elephants nurse with their mothers until they are 5) Yes the elephants are well fed and washed, but a large proportion were also chained up. I was not convinced about the humanity of this operation at all. The size of the gift shop and cafe area in relation to the space the elephants get was a; â€¦
title: Wonderful day out

date post: Tina W wrote a review Jul 2017
text: Definitely a place worth visiting with the family. The grounds are very beautiful and extremely clean and maintained. The elephant ride was very enjoyable as well as feeding and taking pictures. The elephants seem very happy and are well treated. However what struck me the most was the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff!! Such super nice people that really go out of their way to treat us so nice and ensure a very happy experience. The staff is the best!! Thank you!!
title: Wonderful

text: Depending on your starting point it can be a bit of a journey to get to, but worth the trip. 41 elephants many brought from Sumatra, numerous born in the park and several very young elephants. Very interactive, with rides through the forest and feeding times. Nice lunch in cute restaurant and a gift shop of course. Staff was super friendly and our kids want to go back and stay on site in the lodges. It was a memorable experience.
title: The most amazing time

text: Despite being billed as a sanctuary this place is not that. Elephants are chained and in a stressed/bored state. They say it is for their own protection and for the surrounding village etc. The elephants look well cared for and the facilities are great from a tourist point of view and the staff were good. We observed three elephants chained to the spot, one male who was aggressive and "needed" chaining, a female chained near him and a juvenile who was quite distressed about being chained.

date post: Christie G wrote a review Jun 2017
text: Did not stay in the accommodation - just visited the elephant park - & it was great. We saw nothing but affection for these huge animals. My wife was really wanting to ride the elephants so we did the whole experience - lunch, ride & show. Must comment on the beauty of the park itself - all buildings are both well constructed in a sympathetic manner but are quite beautiful as a bonus. Our lunch was quite simple but there was sufficient variety to find a tasty meal to eat in the sumptious hall. A long ride for my wife & I & then some photo opps with my wife hand feeding our elephant, Mona, with assistance form his long term handler, Norman. The Government insists the elephants are chained which is a pity but they do not seem distressed at all.
title: Breakfast and swim with the Elephants package

date post: Popi D wrote a review Aug 2018
text: Did the â€œbreakfast and batheâ€. please, please do not come to this park. Please do not come here - it is not the elephant friendly â€˜sanctuaryâ€™ advertising claims to be - this is farcical. Was dismayed when we first arrived to see a small area with several sand circles, each with an elephant chained to the middle, most were rocking back and forth on the same spot. I have several videos of the elephants doing this - if you read up on this you can see rocking is a sign of abnormal mental behaviour of animals in captivity. Unsurprising when they are chained up. To start the morning you are herded into a line with a group of circa 50 to â€œwashâ€ an elephant - washing includes being handed a scrubber and hose and standing next to an elephant for 30 secs holding these props & posing; â€¦
title: I give this 3 stars because I do not believe Elephants are for our entertainment!

text: didn't stay at the hotel, just did the visit during the day and found it clean and well run! Definitely buy the lunch inclusion when booking from your hotel, although the food was pretty average. But, you're not there for the food are you?!

Disappointed itâ€™s basically exploitation with a velvet glove on...the elephants are paying their way by entertaining the tourists. I feel like I was duped to believing this is a sanctuary and it may weâ€™ll be compared to where the elephants have come from but thereâ€™s no need for the rides, the tourists will still come and pay to visit and feed the elephants and have dinner. Making them paint for entertainment nearly left me in tears and I walked away. Despite being a resident I said no thank you to the Day safari rides and the rides to dinner. I thought it was more of a free roaming sanctuary, the chains they say are to avoid fighting for food...surely a larger area would allow the elephants to form their own herds and provide them with enough food there would be no need for; â€¦
title: Please donâ€™t support this â€˜sanctuaryâ€™

text: Do not be misled, this place is not a sanctuary and elephants are treated like circus animals. How they have any good reviews are beyond me the way the elephants are treated. Absolutely no freedom when they arenâ€™t being used for their â€˜tricksâ€™ as the are tied up with chains. Very depressing

date post: Debra Curtis wrote a review May 2018
text: Do not book the park view room! I recommend their most basic room and take some free photos with the elephants in the morning with your own phone. Just wanted to throw that out there first as I wish someone else did while I was looking up reviews. I specifically looked for non-zoo like experience with Elephants and was recommended this place. Since I had only a few days to visit Bali, I wanted the best experience so I booked the park view room where you can view the elephants right from your balcony. Sounds amazing right? Wrong. Although these elephants were â€œrescued from Sumatra and saved from extinctionâ€, they are still â€œcaptiveâ€. I understand they are chained up for ours and their own safety but that doesnâ€™t mean they are free animals. So all night and morning, you can; â€¦
title: A smile never left my face!

text: DO NOT STAY HERE. The elephants are chained up for hours not being able to move more than a few metres. They are hit by trainers during games.. forced to participate in things they don't want to. They are ridden for human entertainment. SO SO SAD.
title: Unique Experience

date post: abi g wrote a review Apr 2018
text: Do not support forced animal tourism. These elephants are chained up, put on concrete circles and baking in the sun 9 hours a day until they're forced to take you on a ride. Look at the conditions the live in and the how short their chains are. You're a horrible human being if you support this for the sake of a photo.
title: Elephant park cruelty

text: DO NOT VISIT --- the elephants are basically being used as fair ground rides for fat ignorant tourists. The elephants were kept in small confined spaces and lined up and made to wait until they were next needed for a tourist photo. It is advertised as a sanctuary but it's not at all- the elephants had marks all over their bodies and were clearly really unhappy. It was a really sad day and I wish I never paid anything towards funding such a depressing place. All of the staff had clearly been trained on what to say when asked about controversial issues- such as why the elephants were lined up and made to stand still, etc. The manager of the place was called over to us to answer our questions as we were all obviously so concerned and just fed us dribble to all of our questions.; â€¦
title: Mason Elephant Park Taro, Bali

text: Do not visit this elephant park if you're expecting to see happy elephants. The park says it is not a zoo but a learning centre and a 'sanctuary for elephants' when in reality they would be treated better in a zoo. The elephants are chained up by their feet on a 2 foot long chain, and are left there all day until they are needed to give rides. They also make the elephants do circus tricks and are trained to make funny pictures with customers. I was very disappointed and saddened by the way the elephants were treated, it is very easy to allow the elephants to roam around in their own pen rather than chaining them up. When I asked a keeper why they were chained up the answer he gave me was "that's how it is, so they stay in the same place" Disgusting.

date post: Troy D wrote a review Aug 2018
text: Do not visit this place the elephants are in chains or stood in rows like in a cattle market. When they are allowed to move they are either giving rides to tourists or being fed by doing tricks such as football or painting!! please watch videos online about the dark side to elephant tourism before going here.
title: Excellent

text: Donâ€™t get me wrong this park is beautifully kept and well maintained but I just canâ€™t help but feel sorry for the elephants. Here they are either kept tied up by a short chain on a circular dirt pad for the day or have to ride tourists around the track 6 times a day, 6 days a week! The elephants suffer skin rubbing from where the rope is attached around their leg and many are displaying large abscesses from the concrete block that they lay on at night. Like I've stated above - this park is beautiful and itâ€™s not that the elephants are being tortured, itâ€™s just that they are living nothing like they would in the wild and I donâ€™t agree with animals being chained up.

date post: Daan Stoeten wrote a review Jul 2019
text: Donâ€™t Go!!! It looks amazing on the website and so many good reviews on Trip Advisor, donâ€™t be fooled by it. Elephants are constantly chained up for the majority of the day with chairs strapped to their backs all day. They are not able to roam around themselves even though they are in a secured area, where they canâ€™t get to visitors. They do rides that pick you up from your lodge and take you to dinner not an experience at all just sad!!! As I have already visited a proper sanctuary before in Thailand, where the elephants could roam free with no chairs attached to them this was far from this â€˜sanctuaryâ€™. The place is also in the middle of the Jungle so that closest place to get to is Ubud which is 30 mins drive away and not much to do in the resort or is to expensive to do; â€¦
title: Cruel elephant treatment, AVOID!!

text: Donâ€™t listen to the vegans spouting nonsense about animal cruelty in their reviews. My wife and I stayed here and thoroughly enjoyed it. The elephants are well looked after and were very happy (no evidence of any mistreatment whatsoever). Facilities are great and staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Great place for both couples and families.

During our visit to Ubud, my friend and I decided to visit the Elephant Sanctuary. It is a wonderful place. You get to take an elephant ride through tropical gardens for about half an hour and the elephants do tricks to entertain their guests. The guides are very knowledgeable and the gentleman we had spoke beautiful English. They seem to really enjoy what they do and care a lot about the elephants. Our guide told us that all the elephants had been rescued and they were very well cared for in the sanctuary. You also got to hand feed a group of elephants and be able to stand right next to them and pet them. I would go visit again. Great experience.

Elephant riding is definatly a must-do thing when you are in Bali. This is easylie done in just 1/3 part of the day so easy to combine. It's not crazy expensive and best of all the elephants are not being tortured. What I thought would look more like a zoo with elephants in cages turned out to be completely the opposite. Even though that the elephants are not allowed to walk freely (due that they can destroy the park) they're chained. Highly recommend visiting this place!

Elephant Safari park has beautiful and gentle elephants. Good activities such as Elephant rides, Elephant bathing and swimming with Elephants. Loved Elephant shows they had. We stayed 1 night at the Elephant lodge. Our room had a paddy view. We don't think we will do that next time, as the bed and pillows were uncomfortable, bathroom drain got clogged everytime shower was used. Dinner was okay. Breakfast next morning was less than appetising. We will surely visit the park next time for a day tour.

date post: Rachel A wrote a review Mar 2016
text: Elephants look like they are well cared for, great staff, nice meals, plenty of interactions with the elephants. The museum has lots of historical artifacts to look at, gardens are nice too. Very happy we stayed here.
title: Once in a lifetime opportunity

text: Elephants looks well taken care of and was quite tame. Those that we interacted with had great synergy with their trainers. They responded to trainers instructions to pose with us for photos. We had the chance to ride them, although some people may not want to do so, but the elephants seems more than capable carrying us around. In a way, visiting the park helps to sustain the elephants and maintaining a safe enviroment for them. I think owner is doing a great job. Thanks!
title: So good

text: Elephants were chained in steel chains that were probably not even 1 meter long, they are obligated to walk with people on their backs all day and the mahouts beat them in the head with spicky metal hammers when tourists are riding so that they go in the right way and do everyhting well. PLEASE DON'T COME HERE, DON'T CONTRIBUTE TO THE SUFFERING OF THESE POOR ELEPHANTS, THEY ARE EXPLOITED FOR MONEY, OBLIGATED TO DO ZOO TRICKS AND YES THEY ARE BEATEN IN THEIR SENSITIVE AREAS (HEAD, EARS..) WITH SPICKY METAL HAMMERS.
title: Elephants are on a money making merry-go-round

text: Enjoy an up close and personal experience with these amazing animals. Whether it be a ride through the jungle and a dip in the lake, or feeding and patting these magnificent animals, it is a great experience.One elephant was dancing when we were there and my duet was hilarious
title: Faultless.. amazing

text: Entering the park we were greeted, given a welcoming drink and shown to our room with a view directly in front of the elephant feed area. It was unreal just looking at all the elephants. After been taken to the restaraunt by the elephant, we were entertained by them and sat down to excellent meal. Have to make the comment that all these Elephants have been rescued from mainly Sumatra, and given a second lease on life. They are all extremely well looked after and fed and loved. Slept comfortably in the air conditioned room, we woke and went down to wash and then swim with the elephants. This is an unforgettable resort destination, and would recommend to any and all travellers.

Even though I feel it was overprized this was a brilliant experience for the whole family. We stayed in the Elephant Lodge for two nights: my husband and I and three teenage boys. The rooms were spacious though without a view and the walls were very thin and the family next door with two very young children was very noisy (all four of them). So after one hour of listening to them shouting at each other we asked to change rooms which wasn't possible because it was fully booked. The reception team promised to talk to them and the noise subsided one hour later. It was a very special experience to be picked up from your elephant from your room, taken on a safari into the jungle next door, to be able to help wash the elephants in the morning and then to ride on their neck into a; â€¦
title: Helpful staff really make the difference

text: Every thing is so great that We hope we can bring our grandchildren to this wonderland in the near future! The water rafting is well organized and we have a great time ever! Better to stay one night, the elephant ride to dinner is a good memory to us!

Everything about this place was amazing. Even the bonds between each elephant and their personal keeper was lovely. Had a three night stay and everything was perfect, down to the elephant chauffeurs and the delicious menu!

date post: Mark S wrote a review Apr 2015
text: Everything is good. The staff, the rooms, the food and services. I am appreciated everything provided. One night stay is not enough for me to stay fine and relax. They have set all the activities itinerary which filling whole of the day. Thus, i have not much time to stay in the room to enjoy the stunning view. The hotel a little bit far from the Ubud center, however, they did provide free shuttle to Ubud. It was my first experience to play with elephant, i never realize that the huge giant can be so cute and playful. You can walk into the elephant park and get the feel of surrounded by the elephants. Good experience and comfort stay.
title: Jumbo resort

text: Everything was perfect except the quality of the food and the value for money in the restaurant... Very clean room, excellent service and all the elephants are really well cared... All the family enjoyed these 2 days...

Excellent facilities all around - experience to be taken by elephant to dinner and then a ride the following day was great. Restaurant food and service was exceptional, as was all contact with staff. To have 18 elephants in their 'pods' overnight - right outside ones window - was magical and probably unique. Everywhere was very clean, with plenty of staff on ground to ensure safety and access.
title: Beautiful setting, cold damp rooms and questionable elephant conditions

text: Fantastic place. Well worth the money. Beautiful animals and friendly staff. These animals have been saved from terrible conditions and still love and let people enjoy their company. Food in restaurant great too. Give it a go, you won't be disappointed.
title: Just incredible

text: First impressions weee that the elephants were happy and very well cared for. They do one one leg chained but I understand that's for safety issues. We got to bathe 2 elephants for around 20 minutes before heading the lake to have the chance to go in the lake with them with a trainer. We then got a continental breakfast which was lovely. We then got to feed the elephants bamboo and pieces of fruit before having the chance to ride them around the safari park which took about 40 minutes. The l elephants then do a show which lasts about 15 minutes and they seemed happy. Only reason I did not give this 5 stars was because there was a lot of waiting around between the activities as there was a high level of people there doing the same tour. Unfortunately we had nothing but rain; â€¦

First of all I can't stress enough how much fun the elephants are, was a thoroughly enjoyable experience throughout our stay!! They are beautiful gentle creatures that truly made our stay! The rooms were luxurious and spotless and were turned down twice daily, again very impressive. The food and especially the drinks were very pricey ($30 per person for a buffet) and as you are confined to the park you dontreally have any option. This didn't really bother us too much, but as my girlfriend is vegetarian her options were very limited ( pizza or pasta) another issue was how early everything closed, I am aware that it is primarily aimed at families but however after 8.30 pm it turns into a ghost town. There is a bar but it never seemed to open, kind of forcing you back to your room; â€¦
title: Nice place, One Night Will do

text: First, let me say that this place is a BEAUTIFUL place to stay. The hotel itself is spotless, the rooms were lovely and the staff was great. There are some things,however, that you need to be aware of ... The elephants ARE working elephants. They are required to bring guests to and from the restaurant, they do elephant shows 3 times per day and they have to bring guests on 2 jungle walks per day... They ARE tethered at night or when they aren't working. They say it is to avoid bullying or food stealing. (Understandable, but hard to see nonetheless) There is a place in Chang Mai, Thailand that is an actual elephant sanctuary - and we were under the impression that this place was the same. The hotel is also quite far from Ubud so they have really jacked up the prices for; â€¦
title: Definately One For The Bucket List

text: Firstly if you think it's "sad" then DON'T GO and then complain after it!! I was unsure about places like this but before coming to Bali I researched trips and read loads and loads of information about this place before making the decision that actually....this place is a good place and this is even supported by the World Wildlife Federation! Upon arrival at 7:30am, I will admit, I was concerned as the first thing I noticed was the chain around their leg, however after speaking to the park ranger he said that they put these on at night as the trainers are not around to be close to the elephants so it stops them wondering off as the place is quite open and close to roads. By 8am....all the elephants were roaming around the park either having a bath, riding tourists round, being; â€¦
title: "Dancing" elephants

text: For a unique, close up and personal experience with Elephants, this is a must for animal lovers. The villas are amazing, staff genuinely friendly and time spent with elephants well worth the price.

date post: Jennifer F wrote a review Jan 2015
text: For Bali this is an expensive family event but is worth it, very well done and you get a lot packed in. You get picked up from your hotel, taken to Taro (2 hrs from Nusa Dua) and the ride itself is picturesque. The Safari Park has an amazing museum with all things elephant related including a full Mammoth skeleton. The museum has ancient artifacts and bones that are 10,000+ years old! Food is provided for lunch and was better than the buffets served at our 4 star hotel. The elephant ride takes about 30 mins and your name is called out in order. There's a lot of junk on this site about the Mahut's being cruel to their elephants. This is rubbish. Each Mahut rides only one elephant whom they are bonded to like a favoured pet. After lunch there is a show and then your ride home.; â€¦
title: Excellent place - but elephants ARE working

text: For everyone who has always waited for a chance to get REAL close to the gentle giants! Recommendable for all ages. Very friendly staff, especially the elephant trainers. Stay at the lodge, because a simple park visit will not give you the privilege to bathe and scrub the elephants! Not cheap though and a bit tucked away (another 35 minutes from Ubud), but definetly worth it.

For my first few trips to bali i dismissed staying here due to how expensive it was per night. however after staying here we sat s=down and calculated how much it would actually cost for all the inclusions we received.on arrival we recieved welcome drinks we ashumed we would have to wait as we arrived earlier than check in however we did not someone took our bags up to our room as our escort took us for a tour and orientation to the park. so of we went cocktail in hand to checkout the spa, resteraunt elephant gardens and the baby animals we couldnt beleive we we got to our room that our travel agent had managed to get us an upgrade to the elephant view rooms. we were about 10mtrs from the hugest elephant we had even seen. once we had settled down from all the excitment our; â€¦
title: Fantastic Experience - Well worth staying overnight

text: For our wedding anniversary we booked for the Elephant Night Safari, before we arrived in Bali. So we had no idea what we would expect. The driver that collected us was very nice. When we arrived we were greeted by the park guide Budiash. He was so nice. He gave us a full tour of the beautiful park we met the huge Arapaima fish Shrek, fed the Koi by hand which was so good. We then fed an elephant, walked around the park met the 2 elephants in the hospital, and dodged some large poos lol. All with Budiash telling us amazing stories of the park. Also Budiash took us to meet Mr Wong and his new lady friend. Mr Wong is the bull Elephant in the park. We met out Mahout Budiana for our ride on Ardila. Trecking through the forest Budiana also keept us informed of his and; â€¦
title: MISTREATMENT OF ELEPHANTS

date post: Vincent R wrote a review Jun 2018
text: For someone who is a little hesitant with animal adventure, I was pleasantly surprised by this experience and would definitely recommend it. The park is tastefully laid out and kept in excellent condition. The staff were very skilled and friendly and the ride on the elephant, as well as opportunities for photos and feeding, were expertly carried out.
title: Beautiful factory surroundings

date post: dominic c wrote a review May 2019
text: FOUND ELEPHANT ROCKING BACK AND FORTH TIED TO CHAIN SURROUNDED BY FECES IN THE MORNING. I am absolutely disgusted and outraged that this place can even call itself a sanctury- And the fact that people have called this the best place for elephants ever on here is a joke in itself and sums up everything wrong with humans today. The elephants are tied down with short chains on their front foot, not even the back foot, in round depressing concrete circles, surrounded by perfectly sculpted landscape with bushes carved into elephants, which they seem to take care of more than the elephants themselves. If you tied child or even dog to a short chain all day then it would be abuse and you would go to prison, however somehow they beleive it to be okay for these intelligent creatures.; â€¦
title: Mr

text: Friends were concerned but this was truly a sanctuary for these Sumatran Elephants and incredible opportunity to bond with them. Caregivers obviously loved their animals and you could see the elephants were happy and treated royally. The ride arou.around the park,hugging, feeding and petting them were the highlights. Show was short and that's the only time I felt the animals were trained to pander to us. Lunch was a fun buffet - we paid $75 through our tour World Spree with ride so you can find a better.deal than the $95 list and your own transportation.

from arrival to departure we had a magical experience . we recieved a warm welcome and immediately upgraded , the room was of extremely high quality, the food was fantastic and reasonably priced.the whole elephant experience was truly magical . to be so close and hands on with these magnificent animals was an honour . the park is run on a very ethical and sustainable footing .everything is immaculate . all of the elephants (except the four young eles that have been bred there) are rescued from a dubious future in Sumatra. 10/10 thankyou.

date post: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Aug 2009
text: From everything from the first step into the Safari to the last, the experience was as good if not better than we imagined. Our 5 yr old son was blown away with the interaction with the Elephants, and mum and dad the same with the hospitality and accomodating. Upgraded from the Garden room to the Park View room once we saw what we were missing. The Staff were wonderful , friendly and accomodation. An ever lasting experince we will never forget...
title: bali holiday

text: From finishing out Honeymoon we wished we stayed here. They treat the elephants with respect. We had a nice and peaceful ride and show. We later found all the things they offer and wish we had stayed here. They have duty of care to their customers as if a elephant was having a bad day it had the day off to relax and get over it's upset and would not stress customers. Really nice day out
title: Paddy View Room and Elephant Experience

date post: Aileen D wrote a review Jun 2015
text: From human aspect the park is clean and organized however I found the elephants living conditions to be terrible. NOT an elephant sanctuary; this place is making money by treating elephants in a manner I found appalling: 1) bull hooks (sharp metal sticks) are used to steer the elephants HOWEVER we saw visible blood on several elephants from the bull hook, although a bull hook is common practice to use it should not be drawing blood! Elephants also had ankle wounds which appears to be from the chains. 2) Elephants are not allowed to wonder and have no room to do so; they spend the day chained to a small circle and sleep this way also. 3) We were informed and observed there are 31 elephants for 3 acres of land (keep in mind some land is part of the lodge and restaurant). This; â€¦
title: Elephant Safari Park Lodge Taro

text: from the minute you step into this amazing place - you are transformed into another universe. Smiling friendly staff, cold towels, refreshing drink, and that;s all before you check in! Being escorted to your room thru what can only be likened to botanical gardens - you are shown where the gym and day spa are - both well worth a visit to. The rooms are spacious and clean, steps down to the bathroom, but there is a handrail. Lovely touches throughout, towels folded into elephant shapes, elephant slippers, elepahant feet carved timber bed legs. All things elephant here!! The elephant taxi service from your room with the mahout (handler/trainer) is special. The talent show very clever. The buffet food and the al la carte menu excellent. Food fresh and tasty. shuttle service to Ubud; â€¦
title: Fantastic and unique

text: From the minute you walk in till you leave it is a amazing experience. First you wash the elephants and they love that. You wash them down with a hose and water and you can pose for pictures with them. The staff are only too happy to take pictures for you. You then move on to swim with the elephants. This is cool as you get on top of a elephant with a trainer and he brings you out into a pool and the elephants swims and goes into the water . Quiet cool. You then take a shower and have some breakfast . The breakfast is a buffet breakfast and is quiet nice . Then onto your elephant trek which is about a 30 minutes long and you go through the park and into a forest . Our guide was fantastic telling us all about his elephant which he called " Lady Gaga" and how he looks after; â€¦

From the moment we entered the Resort, we were treated like gold. We were escorted to our room by one of the front desk people. As we walked she explained where everything was and how our schedule was set up for our stay. Even gave us a tour of our room. Being able to be up close and personal with the elephants were amazing. Feeding, bathing, riding and especially getting picked up for dinner was incredible. We ran into Nigel, the owner while we were taking a walk. He stopped to talk with us. Later at dinner he went table to table to talk with each guest. Very personable and open to all our questions. This was one of the highlights of our trip to Bali!
title: Tourist Trap

text: From the time we got picked up by a park representative in Nusa Dua and then dropped back at Nusa Dua we received excellent & friendly service. Our stay and the activities were an experience that I can only describe as the best we have had. The accommodation was beautiful and is equal if not better than any 5 star hotel in the world that we have stayed in previously during our travels. Where else could you get an Elephant taxi service from your room to the show or dinner. The food was superb across all meals. The facilities and care for the elephants is fantastic. The elephants are clean ( do not smell like some other places ), do not appear stressed out and actually seem to enjoy the interaction with humans. Even the recently born baby elephants who were only 3 & 4 weeks; â€¦

Get ready to be marveled. It is truly an amazing place that you must visit if you're in Bali. The experience with the elephants is spectacular. I know some of the review states that the animals were chained during the evenings but each animal has to be secured in someway rather than roam freely in the middle of the night right? During the day they were well cared for, well fed, and pampered esp with the guests washing them.The pick up at the hotel was amazing. The Gardenview has that option to get picked up from your room. There is no view of the garden but rather an alley where the elephant picks you up. It's more expensive because the elephant picks you up at your hotel room. If you would like that experience which I would recommend, then go for it. If you are on a budget then; â€¦

date post: XL Surf wrote a review Mar 2018
text: Getting a hug from elephant Ayu is a deeply rewarding experience. The gentleness, warmth and pace struck my heart. The feeling remains now, a few days later, in a way that makes me expect it will for life. Thanks to the wonderful team. You all deserve a raise.
title: Beautiful park but on the expensive side

text: Getting to hang with the elephants and watch them from your porch is an amazing experience, The rooms and facilities are great here and teh staff was fantastic, giving us every opportunity to spend time with , get close to and get photos with the elephants. Washing the elephants was the most fun. It truly is a blast. Only downside to the restaurant is the buffet. It is a whopping $0 for two for lunch. Order off the menu, the food is not that good either way, so you may as well get what you want and pay half that cost for lunch. That being said, no matter how expensive or average the food, you get to eat it yards away from the elephants and all of the other facilities are outstanding and up to western standards (in fact the bathroom is the size of my kid's room at; â€¦
title: A Magical Night at the Elephant Safari Park

text: Getting up close n personal with these gorgeous creatures was a delight. Glad for a hot shower as it was raining, followed by yummy buffet breakfast. Loved our guided ride through the park forest. Happy to return!! Love these gentle creatures!
title: Amazing experience!

text: good point:kid enjoy playing with elephant,elephant show is good , the lanscape is beautyful, dining area is very spacious, staff are friendly, room are clean. bad point:food for dinner and lunch no good,lack of children playground , swimming pool to small.lanscape surrounding pool is pretty ordinary , hotel lobby too congested.
title: Absolutly Amazing , once in a life time oportunity

text: Great day feeding the elephants was an amazing experience, we also had a ride on the elephant , they seem well cared for . Lunch was included which was ok nice day out . Was also little garden walk way to have a look around with fish in the ponds

date post: Julia-Alessa M wrote a review Sep 2015
text: Great experience getting up close with the elephants. Guides were helpful, elephants well looked after like family. Great family day out. Staff helpful with photos of you and elephants. Worth the trip to beautiful Ubud, scenery and location fantastic.
title: Nice park!

text: Great experience, great adventure. All services and employees are generous, helpfull, friendly and very kind.
title: Awesome Experience from the moment we walked in

text: Great Hotel and Service! We booked the honeymoon 2 nights package and had a wonderful stay. The price is quite expensive but it is definitely worth it and you can see that the money is reaching the elephants. All of the 31 elephants looked really healthy!
title: Night safari was worth it!

text: Great place to experience time with the Elephants. Better to book a package deal thou, if you want to ride, bath or swim with the elephants, if just book a room you only get the room, nothing else except patting and feeding of the elephants and of course many photo opts. Beautiful Lodge and the food at the restaurant was amazing but pricey! Enjoyed my stay here very much!

Great service, comfortable rooms, swim-up bar with welcoming staff, & incredible atmosphere. The food is incredible, and you eat whilst watching lions & lionesses sunbathe on the other side of the glass. The view from our room was of rhinos running through fields. This place is well worth experiencing at least once. There's nowhere else in Bali like it. I definitely recommend experiencing a sunset safari tour throughout the entire sanctuary. One of the highlights for me was feeding carrots to the zebras. Fun fact: their stripes are actually brown not black.
title: A bit expensive for what it is

text: Great tour of the Elephant Safari park and show. It was amazing experience to fed the elephants and have some interaction with them. This is abit pricey and more if you want to ride the elephants. Regardless still worth going to see.

Had a day out at this place courtesy of our kids (xmas pressie) and loved every minute. the elephants are beautiful creatures and seem well taken care of, lots of space for them to roam around, our rider who took us us out on Rhonda called his elephant his second wife! lush surroundings very beautiful, ate a gorgeous buffet lunch and the staff were very nice. I understand that this an attraction and a money making venture but it was tasteful and I recommend an afternoon here for pure fun and relaxation.
title: Unique Exeperience

date post: Scott M wrote a review Apr 2018
text: Had a fabulous time at this elephant safari. Washing, feeding and swimming with the elephants and so much more! Lovely staff and beautiful surroundings. A must do for animal lovers. Highly recommended!
title: Incredible experience

text: Had a great day at the park. Wonderful to experience the elephants at play. The ride was the highlight but the park was so busy that by the tine our turn came to ride the elephants we missed the show. Our transport came early so were had to leave. The drive up to Taro was lovely taking us through villages. We were there during Gallengan which is a Hindu celebration. The villages were decorated and there was activity everywhere. The Elephant Safari was a great experience and highly recommended but give yourself time to really appreciate it.
title: Love the elephants!!

text: Had a great day with the family. Recommend going early and taking the bath the elephant option (wear bathers and take a change of clothes), feed the elephants, have breakfast at the lodge and then go on an elephant ride. Just the most amazing experience and we were there for at least until just after lunch. Took 4 boys aged 14, 13, 12 and 11 and they thought it was the best day ever!
title: Not what I thought it would be...

date post: Robert B wrote a review Sep 2016
text: Had a wonderful 3 days stay at this wonderful resort. Chauffeured to dinner by elephant with their trainer/ mahout who clearly loves their elephant & cares for them. We fed,washed & bathed with them truly memorable experience we will never forget. The owner truly cares about the elephants and his guests we even saw him having breakfast in the same place as ourselves & open to chatting with guests. Lovely dining facilities and wide choice at breakfast on top of the wonderful lodges within superb surroundings and able to enjoy a free shuttle to Ubud & back ðŸ˜Š
title: Memorable stay with the elephants

text: Had an amazing experience at Masons, was a bit skeptic after reading some of the views but was pleasantly surprised. Staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming we received a free upgrade and the room was stunning and very clean. The elephant park itself was very well maintained and the elephants looked very well cared for and loved. Would highly recommend this place to anyone visiting Bali thanks Masons â˜ºï¸
title: Unique Exotic Lodging

text: Had an amazing time at the Elephant Safari Park and Lodge. Stayed one night, got picked up by an elephant for dinner, lovely experience. Food was great, eating under the stars with the elephants in the distance. The whole park was beautifully done, and the elephants seemed really happy and their trainers seemed to really care for them. You could have unlimited amount of time just feeding them and hanging out with them. We did the bathing in the morning, shame the elephant pool was being emptied and cleaned as it would have been fun to swim with them, but we understood it has to be cleaned. The afternoon we arrived we watched the younger elephants playing in the pool, it was great to see them enjoying themselves. The babies were great fun. We were a little put off by the; â€¦
title: Hotel is normal, but it's the elephant interaction time that's the seller

date post: Annie S wrote a review Nov 2018
text: Had the best experiences ever at this place the animals are so beautiful, loved it all including their breakfast. Got to meet the owners and an Australian worker there who filled us in on the background of the place and animals. Itâ€™s a must see place in Bali. ðŸ˜Š
title: Didnâ€™t stay but had a great time on elephant ride!

text: Had the most incredible experience that will remain with me for the rest of my days with the gentle Sumatran giants at Mason Elephant Park in Ubud. We were thoroughly impressed with the affable owner and founder of the park, Nigel Mason. He has established a first class sanctuary for the last few remaining Sumatran elephants in Indonesia. They are exceptionally well cared for, loved and treated as family by their Mahouts (elephant carer). The park is pristine, their diet is controlled as is their exercise regime and they have a successfully and naturally bred five baby elephants thus far. We were lucky enough to meet a the latest addition to the family - Arjun - who was only one day old. I would highly recommend this place for all animal lovers. Wow, wow, wow.

Had the most wonderful time getting to know the elephants at this safari park. We went late in the day, got almost the whole place to ourselves and had lovely one:one time with the elephants, the highlight was cuddling the baby elephants who were inquisitive and gentle at the same time. We didn't stay there but the accommodation looked pretty amazing. A wonderful afternoon destination for families and 'big kids' alike!

Have just returned from the Elephant Safari Park. We had a deal to stay for 3 nights including breakfast, evening meal and spending time with the elephants. I think when we booked we were user the impression that the park was in Ubud. It's not. It's at least 30 minutes away and there is nothing near the park. Once there it's pretty isolated. The staff were friendly and helpful. Food wasn't bad and prices reasonable considering we were stuck. Pool not very inviting. Spa offered limited services. I feel that 1 night would have been enough. And yes the elephants are chained up but they appear to be well looked after and the park is clean and tidy
title: Thank you for our experience with the elephants

text: Having a daily elephant safari ride plus a ride to dinner was very cool. You can get up close to the babies and play with the adults as well as washing the adults in the morning. There are so many photo-ops within the park on a daily basis! The bathroom, especially the shower, will be the model if we ever have a house built. The bed was very comfortable and the air-conditioner was perfectly refreshing. The food in the restaurant was great and moderately priced. There are set dinner special menus nightly as well as a regular menu. I think we got the specials every night. Breakfast was fantastic. Along with the regular menu selections, you get a big plate of fruit, some juice, and the best coffee I've ever had. There is also a very nice turn down service with an accompanying; â€¦

Highly recommended, the day we went it was raining very heavily but the elephants seemed to love it and were playing in the water. We just paid for entry which was only US$19 adult, elephant ride and lunch were extras. The museum was great with wooly mammoth skeleton and other very interesting artefacts.
title: Expensive and treated like second class.

text: Honestly, I had no big expectations about this place but fortunately I found very special. It is expensive but unique. We were riding with Jajang (trainer) and Efa (elephant), during the ride we were told about the special relationship between the trainer and the elephant because they are like family. The elephants are very nice with the people and off course, all the place is really beautiful. Jajang was very polite and attentive with us. In addition, there is a small and interesting museum at the entrance related to elephants. I with my family enjoyed but as a recommendation, check your pocket before deciding to go since it is not cheap.
title: Horrific....we left after 2 hours as I was so distraught at what we witnessed - DO NOT FUND PLACES LIKE THIS

date post: John P wrote a review May 2019
text: Hotel is a little out of the way, which is great. Wonderful layout. We had a park view room. Spacious, clean with great amenities. Was perfect to wake up to elephants staring back at us from the balcony. I read the reviews about the elephants and how this wasn't a sanctuary. And I'm not an elephant whisperer. That being said, I did talk to the elephant guy there. The elephants are chained when on their resting pads. These pads were made for them and they each have their own. It provides a safe space to be able to eat and rest without fear of being attacked or have their food taken from them. These elephants are from Sumatra and are not from the same herd (so they will attack each other and the boys will go after the girls). They've had 3 baby elephants born there; â€¦
title: Hotel and restaurant was very poor

text: Hotel was very normal with walls so thin you could hear and make out what other people were saying and watching on TV. Breakfast was decent and the pool almost non existant considering the amazing pools in most Balinese hotels. However, staying at the hotel gets you amazing benefits. You get one elephant ride per day, access to the park, which means the show, feeding and interacton with the elephants. Early in the morning you can help wash the elephants. Scrubbing them before they swim. And then you can ride bareback on them as they swim in the water and dunk you a couple times. Very fun. You also get picked up at dinner time by an elephant chaffuer to take you to dinner. So, the hotels not great, but your not going for that anyway....right?

How magic to be able to spend time in a top quality lodge with such beautiful creatures. We had limited time in the lodge and the staff went out of their way to ensure we had the best experience possible.
title: Magic experience

text: hughe clean rooms. Book a package (find the early bird) and the stay includes the riding, cuddling, diner, breakfast, washing and swimming with the elephants. Very well organized, good care for guest and elephant. Come early and check out late, we stayed 1 night and the 24 hours we were in the park were way to short.
title: Best time in Bali

text: I am a massive animal lover who is very sceptical about the ethical treatment of animals so after researching this place thoroughly, both myself and my husband decided to go, keeping the thought in the back of our mind that of we noticed any animal cruelty or animals in distress we would immediately leave and get our money back (they off 100% money back guarantee thatâ€™s how confident they are in the treatment of their elephants). Yes while the elephants eat they have a lose chain on their ankle, this is and what was evidential was for their safety as they get a little a bit possessive and charge at each other, after they have finished their lunch they are free to take a swim in a massive pool to wash and cool off, free to approach guest to get more fruit via hand feeding; â€¦

I am a travel agent and the experience of staying there completely out-weighs doing a day trip. By staying there, there are more inclusions on the property like washing the elephants and swimming with them. I would stay there a million more times (and I am planning on going there again next year). The people who day tripped it out to the lodge got a ride and saw the elephants but it is nothing compared to staying there. Stay in a Park View room as well. Well worth the extra money you spend!

I am so glad a friend at home recommended we book a night at the elephant park lodge rather than just do the day trip! It was so much more of an experience ! We left our villa in canggu to spend the night - arrived at 3 and were shown to our park suite . Having come from our villa we were expecting more of the same - but no, this room is world class standard not just good Bali standard . Feather pillows , king size comfy bed , immaculate marble and glass bathroom with grohe tap ware . But best of all our balcony opened onto the park where the elephants were munching on their dinner just feet away ! It was amazing. An elephant collected us from our villa for dinner and elePhant talent show. The dinner , we opted for the buffet, was ok better than most but nothing amazing. Next; â€¦

I am, hands down, one of the biggest elephant adorers out there! So getting to see these beautiful creatures was absolutely wonderful :-) Biggest down side was that our Mahout used his "training stick" way too often and way too hard - I don't believe animals need to be physically punished in order for them to obey. We also hated how the elephants were chained with little food and no shade during the day when they weren't being used for rides etc. they didn't even have mud or dirt for a dirt bath Loved getting to hand feed these greedy guts, the staff helped get the elephants into great positions for photos and they had a few tricks up their sleeves! We also loved getting to see the elephants frolic and play in the water with one another while we ate lunch - their happy; â€¦
