For months my daughter and I had been looking at photos and videos of the elephants so I was worried we would be let down. I neednâ€™t have worried it was everything we hoped for. We had two garden view rooms next door to each other. Our children had a twin room and we had a king they were gorgeous, big fluffy towels, bathrobes and slippers. Very clean and smart. They really had no view to speak of and no verandah to sit on. The windows just looked out onto the backs of the Park View rooms. Having said that the path between is very well maintained with a lovely garden so for our one night it wasnâ€™t an issue.; â€¦
title: Amazing experience - we'll be back

text: I've been to elephant parks in Sri Lanka,India and Thailand before but haven't seen elephants as well treated as here.We went here from Kuta which took 1 and a half hours on terrible roads and dreaded return trip but the park was worth the trip.A guide told us how the morning would pan out starting with a walk around the lodge where they have ponds with many fish especially one that hosts a massive fish I believe was rescued.Some lodges are still being erected and I hope it attracts more visitors,it must be great to wake up to the sound of these gentle animals.tour starts with you hand feeding a couple of elephants with coconut husks (bring bananas,they love them).You are then put on to your elephant for a lovely slow stroll through the lovely grounds of the lodge culminating in; â€¦

Just back after a wonderful morning at the elephant safari park which was an amazing experience. We arrived at the park around 9.15 which was perfect as it was quite quiet. We walked around the park, had an elephant ride, hand fed the elephants, watched a show and had lunch. The rest of the time we just lounged around and took in the surroundings. Lunch was lovely with plenty of choice. Unlike other reviews we didn't feel like the elephants were badly treated. They seemed very well looked after. All in all an enjoyable experience which I will remember for years to come!
title: Ignore the hysterical reviews, this is a good place

text: Just came back from our animal adventure. We stay one night at the resort & enjoyed our stay very much. I'm not kind of nature lover but my kids do. However, the temperature was cool & made our stay perfect. We had elephant ride in the jungle in early morning& they were marvelous. We also had elephant fetch us to our dinner from our room & had outdoor dinner under stars. The breakfast & dinner tasted very excellent & fresh. I have been traveled many countries & this resort really has 5 star standard. We do think about to take our in laws together for our next visit. Do spend at least one night there & you won't retreat. By the way, my 2nd & 3 night were with Mara river safari lodge.. however, the weather was so hot there & made our stay not so comfortable. Will write some; â€¦

Just checked out after 2 wonderful days at the Mason Lodge. We didn't quite know what to expect after reading at lot of comments, both good and bad about the Elephants daily treatment. We've learned that all bad comments simply is made by ignorant people who don't understand why the Elephants is for an example, chained to their resting pads. They are so much being cared for, even if you want to ride an elephant - they make sure that the elephants dont feel any harm what so ever . We tried to swim with the elephants and afterwards giving them a bath and scrup, wich was so much fun. Dinner at night with a view over the park and the elephants resting. We hope to come back in the future ðŸ™ðŸ˜Š

date post: Laura Anne C wrote a review Aug 2012
text: Just did the Elephant Safari Ride and it was an amazing experience. The elephants here are so well taken care of. The place is really clean and hardly any foul smell unlike most zoos. The staff were all knowledgeable about things going on and all had smiles on their faces. Cons: Everything here is very expensive. I think majority, if not all of the things they sell in the gift shop are all overpriced. Also, they must device a way for the waiting time to be shorter. I was not happy at all that I had to wait 2.5 hours to ride an elephant - and majority of the people there shared my sentiments. I was hoping to get a massage at the spa while waiting for my turn to ride the elephant, but they said there were no staff available. I was a bit disappointed given that this place is; â€¦
title: the best experience ever

text: Just loved spending the day with these beautiful animals . Next time we visit we will be going for breakfast and bathing of these beautiful elephants . A must if you are in Bali. What a great time and Manggo Bali our tour guide looked after us very well..Can recommend his services while in Bali.

Just when i thought this trip couldn't get any better, it did !! I got to ride an elephant in its habitat and speak to the elephant boy at great length. A picture is worth a thousand words. So here is my essay. Thank you god for the opportunity !!!
title: Wow Wow Wow !!! The best experience with Elephants EVER ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ Better than Thailand ðŸ˜ðŸ˜

date post: Megan P wrote a review Sep 2015
text: Just wonderful .......... everything about this place was just fantastic. From the greeting at reception right through to the "cuddle" from an elephant. ALL the staff were friendly and helpful - and nothing was ever too much trouble. The accommodation was 1st class - clean, bright and fresh. One of the highlights for me was the chauffeur service .... collected by elephant for the safari's and for dinner. I looked forward to this and something that I will remember for ever. For that little "something special" you could not go past a stay in this wonderful park.
title: Best holiday ever!!!

text: Kids loved the park, and the ride on the elephants. It's a lovely park the grounds are nice. Having already been on an elephant ride in Thailand I knew this would be a little different so the experience for me wasn't as great. Obviously it's a park where the elephants are kept and the ride is around the lodge. Not quite the same experience as in the open rain forest. In saying that we had a great day out the kids had fun feeding the elephants also- it's great you are able to get up close and personal. The food at the restaurant was really lovely as well. I thought entry was a tad expensive from memory it cost a family of 3 $200 au so not a cheap day out.
title: Amaizing place !

text: Large and beautifully apointed rooms with a welcome Fruit Basket. Very Clean. the pool overlooks the Elephant park so you can swim while you enjoy the view of the Elephants and have an afternoon drink or snack at the pool side cafe which also overlooks the Elephants. There are no shops near by so make sure you purchase anything you may need prior to arrival. However food and beveridges are available from the restaurant and cafe. We had an amazing experience with the park virtually to ourselves early in the morning and Evening which allowed one on one contact with all of the elephants including play time with the baby 4 1/2 month and 5 month old Elephants. A new Baby due in Oct 09. Staff were very knowledgable in regards to the Elephants , the parks history and the surrounding; â€¦

Learn so much about elephant from this place. Staffs were nice, helpful, and very friendly. Our guide explained alot about elephant. We were taking save now and stay later program. Got elephant bathe + washing jumbo + elephant ride. Really amazed by this place. They take care the elephants really well. The elephants were trained with gentle and care.
title: Birthday and Christmas

text: Learn so much about elephant from this place. Staffs were nice, helpful, and very friendly. Our guide explained alot about elephant. We were taking save now and stay later program. Got elephant bathe + washing jumbo + elephant ride. Really amazed by this place. They take care the elephants really well. The elephants were trained with gentle and care.
title: Birthday and Christmas

text: Learning about the sanctuary made it special and staying on the grounds did too! We really enjoyed the room and service as well as the dinner elephant pickup! Washing them and meeting them was nice too. The "Safari", while a nice selling point was a trot around the grounds. The dinner buffet could have been better and a la carte menu lamb chops were the tiniest ever.
title: Great but WAY over priced

text: Looking for peace and quiet? Some time with nature? And if you want to see elephants, feed them and see them play, this is a great place to visit. They offer other activities like riding the elephants as well. They also have a museum where you can learn more about Sumatran elephants, and a good selection of items in their gift shop for those interested in mementos of their visit to the park.
title: Safari ark & bike ride

text: Lost for words with this one nearly. Riding an elephant was not something that featured on my bucket list. Knowing what I know now, if it's not on yours, I suggest making the edit. Keeping my children entertained while away from the comforts of home is by no means an easy feat. This gem of an attraction had both the kids and the parents more than happy. From feeding elephants to cuddling, to washing and then a beautiful walk through the forest, this place truly has it all and will have you singing out for more! A nice restaurant allows a good meal and time for you to sit down and pinch yourself to make sure you're not in a dream! Amazingly informative and a beautifully maintained humane sanctuary for these wonderful creatures. A must do for all trips to Bali on my opinion.; â€¦

date post: Lisa F wrote a review Dec 2014
text: Loved bathing the elephants. The park is very clean and big. If you love elephants its a must visit since the interaction it's very close and personal. The staff is knowledgable and friendly. Would be doing this again when in Ubud
title: Appearances are deceptive

text: Loved everything about this park the passion love and care that the owners and handlers have for the elephants is beautiful. Was definitely one of the best experiences we have had. From the pick up to drop off we had such an amazing day the handler for the elephant we were lucky enough to wash was so informative We lived every second we got to spend with Roxy
title: Disgraceful place using bullhooks

text: Loved it!! Booked a honeymoon package and spent 2 wonderful days with the elephants. Did day safari, night safari, cycle trip from Kintamani, candlelight dinner, cleaned the elephants swam with the elephants. Trip of a lifetime! Recommended Ps John and Sandra Snelgrove The Vine Hong Kong

Loved staying at the Elephant Safari Park lodge. Didn't regret selecting the park view room. We were able to watch the elephants eay and sleep. Food was good and all the elephant activites were great.

date post: Chloe S wrote a review Jul 2017
text: Loved that the person taking us on the elephant had been with the same elephant for twenty years, moving together from Sumatra. Felt the "show" was a bit demeaning to the elephants. Also some of the elephants were chained up - our guide said that was to stop them eating everything in sight
title: Great visit

text: Loved the greenery and the solace of the area. The elephants were well looked after. They were taken care of by experienced Caretakers. The ambience of the lodge was amazing and the elephants seems like they felt home there.
title: Sad Experience

text: Loved this place! So much interaction with the elephants, was amazing. Really got to learn and get to know these amazing animals. No complaints.
title: Lovely get away

text: Lovely park, only taking 40mins from ubud roughly 400,000rp taxi return.. We wanted to just enter the park not ride the elephants costing 295,000irp or 950,000irp to ride.. Entering the park you can automatically see that they live in a fantastic clean big sanctuary, my girlfrend gets very funny about coming to places like this for sometimes seeing very poor conditions.. you can buy fruit for 50,000irp to feed and ingage with these incredible animals. We didn't want to see the show as i dont believe thats a correct way to entertain the people or the elephants, but you can go have a cool beer or buffet lunch in the restaurant,

Lovely place to stay...we stayed one night because it worked out that it wasn't that much more than a day pass. Service was great, it was 5* just like the rooms and little extras like gown and slippers. They do care about the elephants, you get the odd trainer who uses his stick which isn't very nice to see. I don't think they realise that elephant lovers don't mind the elephants acting naturally. Food was amazing but gosh it was expensive. Have to do it once though, would recommend! The elephants pick you up at your room and take you to dinner!!!
title: Great stay for a night if you want to ride an elephant!

text: Make sure you come in early as there is a lot to do and see within the park. The room was one of the best we ever experienced. The "park view" room is a must.

Mary was an awesome pachedyrm!loved her food so payed xtra to feed her!really enjoyed it and the elephants were well looked after which was satisfying!buffet included and was nice!bali royalty turned up also with there cavalcade!book and enjoy ðŸ˜‰

date post: Marcel B wrote a review Jul 2018
text: Mason Elephant Park - the positives. To get up close and feed these amazing elephants was a highlight. These animals are rescued from Sumatran work camps and their conditions are certainly a vast improvement on their previous environment. The Mason family pay the local farmers to grow food for the elephants so they certainly do their part in sustaining the local economy. However, there were also many negatives with this place. The negatives - We repeatedly saw handlers using sharp steel implements to stab their elephants around their sensitive neck and ear areas. These implements were carefully kept out of view or palmed by the handler. I asked staff to explain and they replied these were only used in cases of emergency - but as shown in these photos these were used to hold; â€¦
title: Amazing stay

text: Me and my husband researched a few different places in search of somewhere the elephants are treated right, we came across a review on this place which stated the elephants were well looked after and the staff didnâ€™t use any sharp objects to get them to cooperate. This wasnâ€™t the case unfortunately. We booked to wash and swim with the elephants. Washing was great at first, then when the elephant wasnâ€™t doing as she was told by the staff, I witnessed him punch her just under her ear. Then we went to go â€˜swimâ€™ with them. You donâ€™t swim with them at all, youâ€™re told to get on their necks and they walk around in the water with you on them (as well as a staff member behind you) As I watched the staff I noticed they all had something in their hand, as I looked closer I noticed it was; â€¦

Me and my wife read about this place online and decided to go because of what we read and because we wanted the experience. This place rescues elephants from Sumatra and bring them here to treat and take care. They have certificates from various animals protectors organizations from the world. We really loved to read that and decided that we wanted to go, know this elephants and support the work that they do. We also read that the ride with the elephant took a little long, and we didn't really wanted to try that. What we wanted to do was bathing the elephants and swimming with them. And that's what we did. First, let me tell you, in order to do that, you have to arrive early in the morning at 7am. They stop giving elephants a bath at around 8am. Also, they have packages that; â€¦

Memorable experience. I had mixed thoughts before decided to visit this place, but it seems very safe and well kept, with no visible signs of animal cruelty. The animals seem friendly and happy. I've asked several times while there about the training process, and was told that it's a "repetition and reward" technique. The whole park was very clean and well maintained.
title: Great day out for the kids

date post: Jennifer F wrote a review Aug 2019
text: Most awful sad treatment of animals. Just simply horrifying. These giant beauties are not let free to roam ever and forced to perform all day long . They live their entire lives on a 3 ft chain . Nightmare. Avoid at all costs and do not support this operation. They are not saving elephants like they claim, but exploiting an already bad situation
title: Do not come

text: Most importantly the elephants seemed to be well cared for and relatively happy. Swimming with and riding the elephants was a great experience and surrounding is beautiful, but far away from everything, so for catering you rely on the hotel, which is quite expensive, but excellent. Also, we had buffet lunch and didn't want our desert. Our waitress was very nice and said I give you a box just get some for later. For this we got in trouble with another waiter, which we found a little embarrassing. The internet is also tricky, as it doesn't require a password, but they want personal information either by signing into fb, twitter or filling out a form with personal information. I found that cheap. Despite these negative points, I would recommend staying for a night if you like; â€¦
title: Very fun, but maybe have your own driver.

date post: Ben S wrote a review Jul 2015
text: My 13 year old son and I have just left this gorgeous place. We spent 4 nights here and had the best time. Firstly I will mention that it is a 2.5 hour trip fro the airport and the lodge is very isolated so do buy some big bottles of water at the airport before you leave to last you the first day or so. We arrived quite late at night and we thought we were being dumped at a zoo at first. But this is a very small place, only 27 rooms. The rooms are large and very clean. You do get a couple of bottles of water each day but you will need extra. They deliver you fresh fruit each day also. WIFI was free and worked well. Now about the park. Well you get to live amoungst the Elephants, ride the elephants, bathe them, pat them, play with them, swim with them...it is SOOOOO COOOL. The; â€¦
title: Such a cool experience.

text: My best friend and I went to Bali for New Years, and this hotel made the trip. The ability to play with and feed elephants every day (free to hotel guests!) was wonderful. The location is set in a gorgeous jungle, the restaurant is delicious, and the staff could not be more helpful or friendly. I will absolutely stay here again when I return to Bali.
title: Great time for the family with the elephants

text: My bf and I stayed here in January for one night for our anniversary. My bf had emailed the hotel before our arrival and said we were there celebrating our anniversary. Upon our arrival when we entered our room, we found beautiful rose petals on the bed and in the bathroom which was a nice surprise. In the evening after dinner we got back to our room to find an anniversay cake had been left for us. What a delightful surprise! Room was large, bathroom was big, although our toilet leaked. The elephants were the highlight and the handlers were very friendly and helped us take pictures. Food was very good in the restaurant and breakfast was even better than expected. We bathed one of the elephants in the morning before the park was opened to visitors. If you stay there you should; â€¦
title: Stay at the Elephant Safari Park

text: My daughter and I spent a night at the Elephant Safari Park at Taro last month and it was fabulous from start to finish. We'd been there before as day trippers, but staying there was something really special. The staff were excellent, welcoming us with a delicious drink and a prepared itinerary. The twin room was very comfortable, with a huge bathroom. We had lunch and a wander around (the gift shop is great) then towards evening, we went out onto our balcony and staff opened a gate in the railings and there was an elephant waiting to take us to the restaurant! They perform a little show, which they seem to enjoy, and then you can go off on a moonlight elephant ride through the jungle. After dinner when we returned to our room a bulb popped when I turned on the lights and; â€¦

My daughter and I stayed for 4 days, lovely well appointed rooms, gardens beautiful and the entire elephant experience, Wonderful... Taro is a little out of the way, so nothing to do close if you leave the resort, we did a couple of 1/2 day trips which were easily arranged by the obliging reception staff. Drivers love to tell you how little they are paid and that can become tiresome, as they are always wanting to take you somewhere else. My daughter had a nasty fall in the bathroom, large steps down and is still being the bruises two weeks later!!! The floors in the bathrooms are tiles with some rough tiles. Our only problem, was the restaurant, the food was not a great standard and they did not cater for vegetarians, which we both are. The staff made you feel uncomfortable; â€¦
title: Happy memories of bonding with elephants

text: My daughter Holly and I stayed overnight at the lovely Elephant Safari Lodge in March 2010. The extra special attention to my 5 year old daughter was beyond any of my expectations and I am now passing on our delightful experiences to all our family and friends. Our room and its location to the restaurants and pool area - service of all staff and clean/pretty park surroundings in particular made for an extremely comfortable stay. But it was the magnificent elephants, the lovely four course dinner and being picked up by an elephant and then taken on a night safari that leaves us with fond memories of our great time in Bali. I have to say, meeting the founder Nigel who was wandering around just before we checked out a delightful experience. :) We would like to make special; â€¦
title: Brilliant!

text: My family and I had an amazing day. We were picked up from our resort and taken to the park where we were quickly introduced to the elephants and hand feeding them. Great photo opportunities and one on one interaction with many elephants. They are all very friendly and well treated. Park is well looked after and elephants are all relaxed and chilled. The ride was great. You were taken around the whole park which allowed you to see the hard workers keeping the park clean. The lunch was all you can eat buffet and there was a great selection of food. A highlight for our Bali holiday!
title: Are they really taken care of?

text: My family and I visited in December 2014. We had a ball. The place exceeded our expectations at several levels. To begin, the drive was little long - since we were staying south of the airport. But once we got to the park, the fun began. We reached in the afternoon, so headed straight to have lunch. The spread was very wide. Salads, soups, fruits, several main course dishes and then dessert. Since lunch was included in our ticket price, the a la carte menu was also part of the package. So while the adults ate from the buffet, my kids ate pizzas - which also exceeded our expectations. Then we saw the show and spent time petting the elephants. Finally, the day ended with a 30 minute ride through the park on an elephant. This was very enjoyable. I would definitely recommend; â€¦

My friend and i had a awful experience when we first got to Bali and after a sleepless night in a awful hotel, getting burnt by a spa and a crazy driver for our journey to the lodge, all we could think of was home... until we arrived. We was welcomed by such wonderful happy staff and a wee drink that straight away we started to calm down. Once we got to our lodge we both stopped feeling home sick.... it was amazing!! comfy bed, great shower, really clean and the ceiling and deco really was lush!! after we showered we got on our elephant ride to the most tasteful dinner and yummy wine! Next day i had a great time in the spa and the rest of our stay was a dream! It will be something i will never forget.... place is amazing, staff are friendly and it is soooo cheap for what you; â€¦
title: Wonderful experience

date post: grumpy f wrote a review Nov 2015
text: My friends and I were debating between the night vs. day safari bc time was cutting short. We decided on the night safari which was slightly more expensive. I believe it was 1,500,000IDR (equivalent to $115USD). It was great! We got there maybe 10 minutes late, but they were wonderfully accommodating. It wasn't vey busy at night so we weren't bombarded w other tourists. We met an elephant and got to feed her and took pictures. Followed by a short 15 minute show of the elephants. We then took a 20 minute elephant ride, the elephants can take up to two people and we had a funny guide that entertained us the whole time. We were concerned it would be hard to see at night, but there's plenty of lights and it had a great ambiance. We also got the dinner. The food was sub par, but we; â€¦
title: best run elephant camp I have seen in 3 countries

text: My girlfriend and I stayed there last month for one night. We anticipated it being the best night of our trip to Bali but it turned out to be the worst. We had read the mixed views before going but decided to give it a chance and we regret that decision now. The elephants are chained to a spot with a radius of around 8 feet. The only time they are unchained is for the various activities including elephant riding and elephant safari. There are signs around the park giving nonsense reasons for it but it was in no way nice to see these big beautiful creatures stuck to the same spot with very minimal interaction with the other elephants. Each elephant had a mahout who is assigned to that particular elephant and is supposed to have a â€˜connectionâ€™ to their elephant. They carry; â€¦

My husband and I bathed with the elephants, what an experience, absolutely fantastic, worth every cent. Lovely park and very clean, the breakfast was lovely and the elephants are very well loved and cared for, thank you we will be back.

date post: Jez R wrote a review Jul 2016
text: My husband and I chose to do the "bathe and breakfast with elephants" tour, and loved having the opportunity to get up close to the elephants. We enjoyed speaking with the elephant trainers, and learning more about the age of each elephant, where they came from, and how the trainers work with them. The elephants seem well cared for and happy.
title: Bathe and breaky with the jumbos, fantastic

text: My husband and I did the morning tour. We bathe the elephant, with a scrub brush and hose. Then we rode the elephants in the pond, where we both got wet! This tour is incredible, the tour starts the moment you walk into the park, you see elephants eating in the lush green park. The elephants are tethered while they eat, but for the most part they were free to roam with their Manout. It was interesting to see the elephants in their daily routines. They are so smart. I could tell how much they were cared for and loved! We spent a lot of time with the elephants bathing them, swimming with them, going for a ride and feeding. There was many photo opportunities. I would definitely recommend, I feel it was one of the most incredible experiences I have ever spent with elephants!
title: Loved this!!

text: My husband and I had such a wonderful experience was had here, bathing them getting up close and personal was really cool. Loved petting and feeding them and the facilities are beautiful and well kept.
title: More negatives than positives

text: My husband and I recently spent one night at the lodge and booked ourselves a room with park view that includes almost everything such as an elephant safari ride, elephant bathing & swimming in addition to being able to watch the elephants 24/7 from the balcony of our room. We had so much fun with the elephants we were sad to leave. Our initial impressions were also of disappointment because we didn't like seeing people including ourselves riding the elephants and seeing them chained up. We actually felt bad throughout the elephant safari ride that the poor elephant had to shuttle us around in the rain. We noticed that the trainer held a rather sharp hook which we later learned is an elephant training tool. The trainer used the tool every time the elephant misbehaved but it; â€¦

My husband and I recently stayed at the ESPL for 6 nights in August with our 14-year old sons. The rooms and the park were lovely (and pristine as well) and service was excellent. We also took advantage of the good spa services at ESPL. Readers should understand that this is not an elephant sanctuary like those in Thailand where guests are expected to take a very active role in caring for elephants and live in basic accommodations. It is a five-star hotel experience where guests have access to elephants in a controlled environment, especially in the mornings and evenings when tourists visiting the park are not present. During the day, the elephants work by giving rides to the many tourists that come to the lodge as day-trippers, and give a few short shows. There is a small; â€¦
title: Unique Experience!

date post: Timothy A wrote a review Jun 2016
text: My husband and I stayed at the Elephant safari park for the first night of our honeymoon in Bali. This hotel exceeds all expectation the staff are absolutely incredible. After a disastrous start to our trip to Bali due to our own passport problems we contacted the hotel to revise all of our plans multiple times and the staff never once made it feel like an inconvenience. We had the most wonderful driver who collected us from the airport and drive us to Taro, he made us feel so at ease and spent so much time talking to us about Balinese culture and each of the towns we were driving through, it made the journey such a nice one. After arriving at almost 9.30pm the chef still accommodated our "romantic 8 course dinner" even though the restaurant was closed. We could not have; â€¦
title: Amazing experience

date post: Zoe E wrote a review Jan 2019
text: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights during our honeymoon. We are a very well travelled couple with high standards and expectations, yet a desire for local flair and culture. We found our stay very nice but it had a lot of room for improvement. THE ROOM - We stayed in a Park View room and honestly if you do not stay in one of these rooms, itâ€™s just not worth it to stay overnight at the hotel (just come for the day). But the room itself was very nice, comfortable bed, well designed, very nice and spacious bathroom, and our porch had about 15-25 elephants outside of it at any given time. The only complaints about the room are that the walls and doors are very thin and next door to us was a family that we could hear fairly well from ours, and also the trees were a bit tall in; â€¦
title: Not what I hoped...

date post: Shar M wrote a review Oct 2015
text: My husband and I stopped here for a half day after going white water rafting and it was absolutely amazing. I had my hesitations about going somewhere like this--you always hear about how cruel they are to the animals. I have to say I was very pleasantly surprised. Our guide was talking to us a lot when we went on our elephant ride and told us how he and the elephant (Rama) ended up there. They rescued Rama from Sumatra where he was being hunted for his tusks. We noticed that Rama only had one tusk and that was the reason why. Our guide has been with Rama for almost 20 years and moved his whole family to Bali when Rama came to the Elephant Park. This place is great and you really get to spend a lot of time with the elephants.
title: Birthday elephant safari

text: My husband and I visited the Elephant Safari in Ubud. I was sceptical because I wasn't sure how the elephants would be treated, but I wanted to see for myself. We got there for an early morning visit and were taken down towards the elephants who were chained up by their ankles in their own individual little pods. They were munching on their breakfast. OK, I wasn't too keen on this, but they assured me it's only when they eat and overnight to stop any fighting. We then washed the elephants and took a dunk in the bathing pool with them, which was good fun. We also had an elephant ride and fed them, which was a fantastic experience. Getting up close to them was a once in a lifetime experience. Now, DON'T go to the elephant show if you feel this is cruel. I gave it the benefit; â€¦
title: Highlight of our Bali Holiday

text: My husband and I visited today to see the elephants being cared for in the â€œsanctuaryâ€. It is not a sanctuary, it is an elephant zoo. We walked through the park to an area where about 3 or 4 elephants of varying size were standing with their keeper for the express purpose of allowing tourists to get a photo with them. People were literally queuing at each elephant for this. Other elephants were taking tourists for a ride and you could also see the elephants take part in a â€œshowâ€ where no doubt they were bullied into doing unnatural tricks for the amusement of humans. Does this sound like a â€œsanctuaryâ€? Needless to say we left immediately. I have no interest in seeing these beautiful animals being used as a sideshow. By the way this cost us $30 each.

My husband and I went to the Elephant Safari Park in 2007 for a day trip, we were so impressed with the treatment of the elephants, the friendliness of the staff and the cleanliness of the facility. We also noticed that there was some construction going on and we were told that this was accommodation being built. When we decided to return to Bali for our 40th wedding anniversary this was the place we wanted to stay. We bought a 2 night package. The Park was still incredibly well run, spotlessly clean and great care taken with all of the guests whether staying in the lodge or just visiting for the day. The elephants are well loved and cared for with devotion. Our room in the lodge was perfect, from the balcony we looked onto the Elephant Park and at night the elephants slept; â€¦
title: Not a good hotel

text: My husband and I went to the park this morning with our 5 year old son. We did the elephant ride, saw the show, and walked around a bit. 2 hours was plenty. We hired a driver from Ubud for 250,000 rupiah for 4 hours (to wait and drive us to the store afterwards). The elephant ride was a unique and special experience. Our elephant was 31 and her handler had been with her for 8 years and referred to her as his "Second wife". The animals seem well cared for--and anything that may seem alarming by Western standards is explained both in person and via flyers posted throughout the park. Yes, the animals are chained by legal requirement and the little mallet the handlers carry are only used in an emergency. Our trainer gave our elephant a lot of discretion when she wanted to; â€¦
title: Don't stay here - they will request more money

text: My husband found this place online& booked 4 nights/days. What a fabulous experience. Food fresh and delicious. rooms/suites are faultless, tasteful and beautifully kept. The elephants are just superb and appear very well looked after and housed. We rode every day, petted, washed and fed them, had a T-shirt painted by Romana whilst wearing it.well worth doing!!!
title: Thoroughly enjoyable

date post: B L wrote a review Jul 2018
text: My husband, two teenage children and I had such a wonderful morning here (we didn't stay at the hotel we just did an elephant experience). We got to bath Eva the elephant, getting up close and personal was really super. There was time to also meet other elephants, pet and fee them and we also each got a kiss from an elephant! We all shared a really special morning together which lots of laughter and smiles, this is something we will never forget. The Mason Lodge is beautifully well kept and the facilities were excellent.
title: Great place. Elephants well cared for.

text: My kids loved it! Waking up to elephants and being up close to these gentle beings was a spectacular experience for the children. The looks of fascination and astonishment on their faces first thing in the morning was priceless. Elephant rides mean elephants coming up to your room to pick you up. Feeding and bathing these gentle beings mean exactly that. Baby elephants were cute and being close enough to touch them is a wonderful experience for the kids. Theyâ€™ll come away with a whole new dimension of what it means to be a part of creation. Cost is very expensive but youâ€™ve got to think of it as being party to conservation effort of Sumatran elephants.

My partner and I celebrated our 1 year anniversary at the lodge and it was the most magical experience. Elephant chauffeur to dinner from our room was incredible and the set menu at the restaurant was delicious. We even got a surprise cake!! Cannot recommend enough

My partner and I didnâ€™t stay at the lodge but we came for a day trip to Ubud from Seminyak and enjoyed a elephant ride here! I had been here before but my partner hadnâ€™t been on an elephant before or seen one up so close so we were super excited, we got here at 10am on a Monday and it was very busy we were told a one hour wait for the ride but we were welcome to get photos with the elephants or to watch any shows they had scheduled in the mean time. The only disappointing thing was the fact we had to wait closer to two hours in the really hot sun which not much shelter but apart from that the ride was worth it. When we got on the ride it was just two elephants going along as the others were resting so our guides were really interactive and even took photos of each others; â€¦

My partner and I felt so lucky to be able to have this experience and get up close with these amazing creatures - we started off with washing them (this took a little while due to one over-zealous woman who wouldn't move along after her turn!) then moved on to swimming with them. The water was pretty gross, but that's to be expected when you're with elephants and they did have someone there acting as a pooper scooper to keep the water free of 'elephant coconuts' as one of the carers called it! I was very much looking forward to a shower after that but the water in the shower (of which there were only 2 female ones I believe) was less than a trickle you might wash your hands with so it was pretty woeful. After an attempted shower it was breakfast, which was a nice enough -; â€¦

My partner and I had the most amazing experience here. The staff were fantastic, helpful and efficient and we got first class treatment all the time. Obviously riding the elephants to dinner every night is a highlight, made even more special when my partner proposed to me one night whilst we were walking through the pretty gardens! I had a few reservations when booking about it feeling commercial and whether the Elephants would be treated well. All the Elephants seemed really happy, healthy and very well cared for. Both the elephants and their individual handlers (some of which have been working specifically with their one elephant for 20 years) were extremely good natured and even the elephant show didn't look like the elephants were being forced to do anything they didn't want; â€¦
title: Probably one of the most beautiful places on earth

text: my partner and i spent 3 days/2 nights at the park and were extremely fortunate as we were the only guests in the hotel over those days. The magic is being in the park after it has closed to visitors and having 27 elephants to ourselves. The staff were fantastic and couldn't do enough for us. The room was great and the view of the elephants couldn't be better. Sharing breakfast with the elephants, washing them and getting them ready for the day, riding them around the park and then down to dinner under the palms in the park - the most unique Bali experience for any elephant lover.

date post: Hannah P wrote a review Nov 2014
text: My partner and I spent six nights at Elephant Safari Park last week and loved every single moment. If you have a chance to stay overnight, I would highly recommend it. You get much more of an experience and insight into how the Park is run than if you just come for an elephant ride during the day. Apologies for the long review but I have lots of good things to say! Elephants: Of course, the main reason why people stay here is for the elephants. The elephants are amazing. They are so gentle and happy at the Elephant Safari Park. They are only chained overnight in their own open air circles and some bits of the day when they are not with their mahouts, and I can understand why. If left to roam around when they are not with their mahouts, they would step on the beautiful; â€¦
title: Mixed feelings

text: My partner and I stayed at the Elephant Safari Park Lodge for a few days in February 2015 and got up close and personal with these gentle giants! One thing I must say is that staying in this place gives you a completely different perspecitve than just visiting for a "talent show" and a ride. I can see how some people may think that this is just another money making animal cruelty business because some animals do appear to have some scarring and the elephants are chained up when they are not with their mohouts. However, given that the majority of the elephants were rescued from the logging industry and were mistreated in their previous life, they are bound to have some old scars. I have met all the elephants in the park and can assure you that elephants born on site were; â€¦
title: Amazing - once in a lifetime

text: My partner and I stayed here for 1 night in March 2011. We got an internet deal for a Garden Room however it was still much more expensive than what we are used to paying on our holidays. However it was worth every dolalr spent. Our room was great with a jungle/elephant theme. We got a chauffered pick up from our room to a romantic dinner in the park amongst the elephants. The food at dinner was AMAZING! The park opens to daily visitors between 9am-5pm but as we were staying there we got to do lots of things once the visitors left which was alot more special and less crowded. We got to feed the babies and give the elephants a bath. We even got to go swimming with the elephants in the main lake which was truly memorable. In our room fee we got breakfast included. Breakfast; â€¦

My partner and I stayed here for two nights and absolutely loved it. The activities offered were fantastic, both inside the park and with the Bali Adventure Activities program. The personal time with the elephants that you receive as a guest is priceless and dining under the stars is not to be missed. Would definitely recommend this as a stay for couples or families.
title: Magic, Can't wait to return with family and friends.

text: My partner and I stayed here for two nights and three days and loved every minute of it - the elephants are so amazing and if you only went for a day trip you could be misled into thinking that its not as 'free' as it actually is!!! The baby elephants were gorgeous and they get to swim at least twice daily in a lovely big pool - a great deal of thought and dedication has gone into the setup of this place and it really is a safe haven for all of the rescued elephants that now live there (approx 40) It is definitely an elephant experience - there is not much to do other than relax - which is the whole point of being there!! two days was brilliant, the pool was fantastic, spa treatments are available and the surrounding park is landscaped beautifully. There are many options; â€¦

My partner and I thought this would be a nice trip when we went to Ubud. We thought WRONG. I went to see a place of conservation, not a museum of Ivory products and thirty elephants chained up to the spot on four acres of land. There elephants are not free to roam. The baby elephants are chained and clearly distressed and upset. The elephants are made to perform tricks like painting. I left in tears. Disgusting. Those who partake in the Elephant rides didn't seem to notice the animals distress. DO NOT GO HERE.
title: AMAZING

text: My partner and myself spent 3 nights at the elephant safari park lodge in Taro before staying in Kuta for a week and I have to say, it was the best experience of my life. The staff were amazingly friendly and helpful. They offered to take pictures on our camera for us at every opportunity which resulted in some fantastic photos. We felt very looked after and it was incredible. It was so lovely to see how well cared for the elephants are and it was good to know they each have their own mahout (trainer) that takes care of them so they can form a bond. We were lucky enough to experience everything there was to offer from swimming with the elephants (my favourite!) to white water rafting (my second favourite). I have recommended this hotel to all of my friends and family and; â€¦

my party stayed in 2 different rooms and both were excellent. one room allowed for elephant taxi service to a white linen dinner. the other room had a shaded area below with lounge chairs where the kids could hang out and play games and read. bathrooms were luxurious. plates of desserts and fruit were complimentary in each room. restaurant food on property was excellent and fairly priced. nice gift shop. pool is small. loved walking through the gardens and seeing the koi fish ponds. the museum was very informative. one of the top 2 highlights of our trip.
title: Simply Amazing

text: My teenage daughter and I recently visited the Elephant Safari Park and really enjoyed our day. We were picked up promptly in Kuta and travelled the long journey to Taro, some 2.5 hours by minivan. We purchased our tickets online through the Bali Adventure Store for AU$145 approx. for 2 people, which included pickup in Kuta, entry to the park, a long elephant ride, elephant show and a very enjoyable lunch in the park restaurant. We were home by late afternoon. My daughter's choice, and a good one it was. We enjoyed learning all about elephants up close and personal, their Mahouts (rider/keeper), habitat. etc. It is good to know that they are being well cared for in Bali. Next time I would like to stay at the Lodge, it looks like it would be fun.

My two teenage children and I did the morning washing and swimming with elephants package which included breakfast. The elephants were beautiful and I enjoyed washing them,(kids didn't last long at this bit) Then we rode the elephants bare back into their pond and they swam around, splashing and ducking under. It was pretty crazy and the pond, which is full of fish and dark brown dirty water, might not be for everyone. You then have a shower and breakfast, before going on a trek through their forests. Breakfast was soooo slow, even though there were only six people in the restaurant,and not fabulous. The elephant trek was fun especially when the elephant I was riding decided to leave the path and rip up some palms and trees to eat. I realised that the carers have very little; â€¦
title: Best animal attraction in Bali

text: My visit to the lodge was so overwhelming i waited all my life to ride an elephant and enjoyed it so much. My elephants name was raj and him and his rider came from Sumatra..raj was approximately in his 30s and he was so gentle and very compliant to his main rider with just a touch of his ears he turned and did it all with gentle persuasion. I loved every moment that I was there. Next time i plan on staying there . The baby elephant was adorable and all the elephants look so happy. Everything and everyone was so beautiful. Loved it.

My wife and I had an amazing time. We stayed here 1 night, got picked up at our room by an elephant for dinner, bathed a baby elephant, and also got picked up by an elephant at our room for a safari ride. We both loved the entire experience and it seemed like the elephants were treated extremely well here.

date post: Cheryl R wrote a review Mar 2018
text: my wife and I had the most enjoyable time here, great ride through the forest, and then interacting with them was fantastic. I really enjoyed the younger elephants doing a variety of things they had been taught..Eva, our elephant was awesome and her keeper was great to chat to as we went around and then fed her. All the keepers were great. Our lunch was also really nice. A great day out
title: Fantastic experience with the elephants

text: My wife and I had trouble booking through the Mason Safari park website, so I booked the cheapest room available through hotels.com then I called the Hotel, to upgrade to a park view suite, and to add all the elephant activities. We only Stayed for 1 night, but it was perfect, they gave us a nice drink upon arrival, and showed us to our wonderful room. It overlooked the whole park, and there was an elephant 30ft outside our room off the balcony for most of our stay. The first night, an elephant picked us up off our balcony and took us to a candlelit dinner with was one of the best dinners we had in Bali, and each entree was only about $7 us. Our first morning, we got to bath with the elephants and it was a great experience, my parents even watched on the live stream they; â€¦

My wife and I just got back we spent 3 nights at this amazing park.We stayed in the "Taro Suite" which is beyond words, The park itself is landscaped to perfection and the staff are so helpful and friendly without being obtrusive. The stars of the park of course are the elephants, this is an absolute must do experience. Altogether , The Park, People, and Ambience will stay with us forever . You must go to this place to see what the owners of this park have done to create a magical place they have to be truly admired for there determination and resolve to save what elephants they can from an uncertain future and bring them to this wonderfull haven. David and Moira S

My wife and I stayed at the lodge at the Elephant Safari Park with our disabled son and had a once in a lifetime experience. The park is amazing and as a guest at the lodge you get access to opportunities not available to the regular day visitors - such as being collected from your room by elephant taxi to go to dinner and helping to wash the elephants in the morning. All the staff were excellent ensuring our son had the best time.

My wife and I wanted to ride the elephants on our trip to Bali. Based on reviews this was the best place to do it. The shuttle picked us up on time and the staff was very nice. The elephant ride was a nice experience and we even got to feed them. There was also a little show with the elephants and then a delicious buffet lunch. It was an overall good day. Luckily we were the first ones there and got a more personal experience. Later in the morning big groups were showing up and would have spoiled our ride.

My wife and I went here on our honeymoon for an elephant ride, we dis not stay at the lodge on site. The facility was well kept and very clean, and also had ice cream shop, restaurant available, and daily shows available. The ride itself was amazing, the host gives you two umbrellas just in case, the seat is a two seater and accommodated both my wife and I (with a seatbelt). The 'driver' was very knowledgeable on elephants and the facility and had an amazing sense of humor. The 'drivers' and the elephants are brought up through training and remain with each other, ours was with his elephant for 15 years. The trainers and staff are also very loving and accommodating to the elephants and their needs. The elephants are rescues from Samaria from hard physical labor work.; â€¦
title: awesome Elephant engagement

text: My wife, son (17 years old) and I had a great time. We learned about the animals and got to interact with their handlers and the rest of the staff. Do not miss this activity. It is a MUST DO when in Bali. The price is well worth it. We ate and had transportation. My 17 year old was incredibly moved by this experience.

Myself & my boyfriend booked a night here. As I am a huge elephant lover I expected this to be the most amazing night but we definitely could have just done a day trip. I did a lot of research into the lodge before going as the last thing I wanted to see was mistreated elephants. Although they were chained up & people were riding them I dont believe that any were in distress. We learned that due to the elephants not exercising as much as they would in the wild, having people ride them is good exercise. In regards to the hotel, it was absolutely gorgeous! The downfall was the over priced dinner/breakfast & the not so tasty buffet. There was no entertainment at night, which I did not entirely expect but assumed there would be some background music playing in the bar. We opted; â€¦
title: Nothing close to a sanctuary!

date post: Graham M wrote a review Jul 2019
text: Myself and my husband arrived for the start of our 3 day trip and what we thought was an elephant sanctuary... We were horrified to learn this is far from the truth! These poor elephants are chained up all the time only being let of during the day to perform rides for tourists and pose for photos! The booking photos would have you believe a very different story!!! This park is nothing more than an ego trip for Nigel mason who after watching his documentaryâ€™s (which are repeated over and over again on the tv in the room) is nothing more than an egotistical vile bully! We left after the first night for fitting the other 2 days we had paid for as couldnâ€™t bare to stay there a minute longer!! Please donâ€™t be fooled by this money making scheme...these elephants are used as; â€¦
title: A must to visit / stay

text: Myself and my husband spent one wonderful night at Elephant Safari Park Lodge for our honeymoon. The experience was magical and more than amazing, and one we will never forget. The accomodation, personal service and assistance, food and atmosphere was absolutely wonderful. And the one on one interaction with the elephants was better than expected. We cannot wait to go back, and will need to stay longer than just one night! Most romantic honeymoon place. Will happily tell all our family and friends and anyone else who listens that they have to see the Lodge during their stay at Bali. A bit hard to find if you dont know your way around, stay on the main road through Ubud and look out for the signs. Thanks, appreciation, respect and admiration to owner and founder Nigel Mason; â€¦

Nice hotel and great dinner under the stars. Interaction with elephants close up includes washing them, bading with them bareback and generally pet them. Also included are elephant show, elephant-riding from your room to dinner venue and a little elephant safari in the close surroundings.
title: absolutely amazing

text: nice park me and my wife enjoyed too much but the ticket is too expensive 75 dollars per person only 3 activities you do in show el elephant show and feeding elephants and riding elephant for half hour
title: Absolutely Brilliant

text: Nigel, Yanie, sons and to ALL the wonderful staff .... Sitting here in the restaurant now, thinking just how awe inspiring this park is !!! Truly amazing how far these elephants have come, although a natural habitat is ideal , it's no good when your home is completely destroyed and you're tied to a tree. Words escape me for just how well these elephants have recovered and how they are thriving here. An absolutely tremendous effort, they are marvelous, intelligent and majestic animals. And from a tourist point of view , if 5 star is a top rating this sanctuary scores an easy 10 ! The service and accommodation here is out of this world. The grounds are stunning, the room is impeccable and the atmospheric veiws and serenity, truly breathtaking. Thank you so much for; â€¦
title: "Amazing"

date post: Mia T wrote a review Jan 2020
text: Not all of the rooms have a view.The photos on the website don't show that those elephants are chained there. They are only there at the end of the day when they aren't working. The chains are quite short. There is a baby and mom in a pen but 2 men are with them and they don't let them go away from the corner of the fence where tourists can take close photos. There is a pond and shower in their enclosure but every time they move in that direction the men chase them back to the corner. Each activity costs around $100 USD. Rooms are clean and comfortable. $30 USD return cab ride from Ubud.
title: Elephants are chained and it broke my heart

text: Not such a pleasant experience, from the over priced entry fee, to the apparent manner that they are treated to be trained and the elephants being chained all equaled to a total of 10mins being spent in the location. Im not an animal lover but felt sorry for the way these animals where being restricted and rode for human pleasure.

Not sure how they claim to be an accredited sanctuary when they give out elephant rides. To force elephants to obey human commands takes a torturous process that kills many baby elephants. Their use of bullhooks is cruel. I would not recommend this scam.
title: A day with majestic animals

text: Nothing negative to say about the Lodge and Park.The staff are fantastic,and the inter-action with the elephants wonderful. We had a park room which looks over the main area,so you are close to the elephants at all times.The 1.5 hour trip was interesting all the way.(we asked our driver not to take us on the main highway,but through the towns) Highly recomend this park and hotel.
title: Overall, a wonderful experience.

text: Now if you want to do something different I would recommend the bathing of the elephants (Bali tours), it is approx. 90 mins drive to the preserve of elephants, these elephants have been rescued from other parts of the country. Now it is an early morning as pick up at the Trans hotel ( 0600 hrs) and then the circus drive begins, you do see a lot of the country which is a plus. The reason that I would take the early tour is there were only 9 people including my wife and I at the reserve for several hours. This gives you lots of time to be with the elephants without a large crowd. At the location you get to wash the animals and ride them into the pool area. You are sitting just behind the ears of the elephants and they will try and dunk you into the water. (PS don't ask what's in; â€¦

date post: Adam C wrote a review Oct 2017
text: OK I realise elephants are expensive to feed and look after but this place really does charge too much for admission. I was on a tight budget so I decided I couldn't afford to go in once I got there and found out the prices . And I was in low season! Basic admission is 300k and if you want to include an elephant ride just under 1million.
title: The next sea world. Very sad

text: OMG Amazing - we were staying in Sanur (also amazing) and decided to spend my birthday at the Elephant Safari Park & Lodge. The whole team are amazing. We were upgraded from a Paddy room which meant an elephant collected us from our room and took us to dinner! Following morning we washed and swam with the elephants. Everything is exquisite - the evening meal was amazing/Breakfast was wonderful. The staff made a fuss of my birthday and delivered a birthday cake. The grounds are immaculate and the animals treated so well. I am an animal lover and I was really impressed. I can not recommend this highly enough. It was incredible and thank you to everyone for making us feel very welcome and special.

On our 8 days vacation to Bali in the middle of february, we decided to stay one night at this hotel. And my, are we glad we did. This turned out to be one of the most memorable experiences during our stay at Bali. We just fell in love with these elephants. We washed them, fed them and had elephant taxi to dinner and safari in the park. So much fun, and I have no doubt these elephants are so well taken care of. The lodge is beautiful, nice rooms (we had connecting rooms which was great) and wonderful bathrooms. Food very good, even though the breakfast had quite little to choose from. Thanks for an amazing experience, would truly recommend:)

On our recent trip to Bali the concierge at our resort recommended that we spend a day going to see the Elephant Park. Our hotel was located in Nusa Dua in the south and the Safari Park is in Ubud in the centre of Bali. The bus ride took around 2-1/2 hours, I was very glad I remembered to bring water as the bus was very warm. The park was designed and is run by an Australian conservationist in an effort to save the Sumatran Elephants which are being killed to make room for the rising human population in that area of Indonesia. I only include this information to set this tour in a higher category than some of the other â€œparksâ€ in similar destinations that treat the animals poorly. The Elephants all look healthy and seem to enjoy the human interaction. My wife and I rode around; â€¦

One of the best days of my life! For a reasonable price per night you stay in a beautiful lux room. Included is an elephant ride to dinner outside surrounded by elephants feeding. In the morning feed/bath then ride the elephants on a safari around the park. After we were able to ride them in the water with nothing but a rope to hold on. Tons of smiling once in a lifetime pictures! Each elephant has a human companion so they are very well taken care of. Only negative was that the elephants are chained around their ankles while feeding and sharing a paddock. I'm sure it's for their own protection but still wasn't expecting to see that.
title: Amazing Experience

text: One of the most amazing things I have done in my life. The park was well maintained and beautiful. The guides were very knowledgable and helpful. Even took out pictures for us. A bucket list in life kind of place.

One of the most beautiful animal experiences I've had. The elephants are super adorable and calm! My friends and I were here and we started off with a shower with the elephants. We bathe them for a good 15-20 minutes. Post the shower, it's time for a swim with the elephants. Basically you sit on the elephant and they take you in the pool for a dip. The elephants also get all cute in between and begin posing in the most candid ways possible. We had a photo session with the elephants and they also had a short interaction with us. Pay a bit more and get ready to indulge in some delicious breakfast. It's worth the money spent! Catch these cheeky elephants in a show that's held post breakfast hours. The elephants do some coconut breaking, painting (which goes for sale in their; â€¦

One of the worst places Iâ€™ve ever been to. Setting was nice to the eye but realistically no place to nurture a herd of elephants. Absolutely gutted to have given the cretins that run this place Â£150 to shun everything they offered bar the breakfast buffet (average at best). Given the uproar about places like sea world and how itâ€™s inhumane to keep majestic animals like orcas and dolphins in captivity - then it will only be a matter of time before the curtain is pulled down on this farcical show. Elephants chained to the spot, handlers standing on the backs of elephants in the â€˜swimâ€™ part of the show to make them drop under water for a photo moment & a complete disregard for the lies they were telling, what I can only describe as an ignorant crowd (myself included given we were; â€¦

Originally, my nephew was skeptical of the 'ride an elephant' industry. However, after meeting Nigel (founder) at dinner on the first night his views changed. The project explanation and the subsequent tour of the lodge gave us a better understanding of goal/process of ESP. Ideally - all animals would stay in their natural habitat (everyone agrees), but knowing that is not possible with current population growth and corresponding deforestation...a new option is needed. I feel Nigel and ESP have created a sustainable solution for 27 Sumatran elephants (as Nigel confirms the solution does not change the world, but it does save 27 elephants + educate the dire straights (if left in Sumatra) of these elephants for all park attendees). Additional to the moral evolution, being; â€¦

Our family of 3 (including a 4 year old) had a fine time at the park though, at about US$240, we felt it is a bit too expensive for what it is. The price included transport to/from Seminyak, access to the park, an elephant ride, buffet lunch, and a short elephant "talent show". The highlight was being able to ride an elephant for ~30 minutes on a path around the park, though the whole experience comes across as very choreographed (they make the elephants strike different poses and spray water at defined places for the camera). The animals appear adequately cared for and happy, though I don't have anything to compare against. Lunch was fine, with a decent selection of options. Drinks were not included. The elephant "talent show" was a bit corny, but entertained our 4 year; â€¦
title: A very different holiday

text: Our family of 4 stayed in a Garden View room for one night. The reception staff were really helpful with early check in and late check out. We had about 1.5 days in the park and felt this was a good amount of time to see and do everything that we wanted to do. The reception also prepared an itinerary for our stay, which was very helpful. The garden view room was spacious, clean and comfortable and the marble bathroom was very nice. We couldn't justify paying more to stay in a Park View Room as we didn't really spend much time in the room. We spent most of the day watching the elephant talent shows (we must have seen at least 3 of them!), feeding the elephants, bathing the elephants, watching the elephants playing, browsing in the shop and checking out the museum. The; â€¦

Our family of five had the pleasure of bathing, feeding, then riding the elephants. From what we observed, the elephants were well taken care of and each has an assigned mahout who have been with each for many years. The park was well maintained, bathroom facilities were very clean. The breakfast buffet was held in their dining area which overlooks the elephant bathing area. As we had our delicious breakfast, we watched the younger elephants play in the water. It was a great experience.
title: Fantastic place.

text: Our four children loved this place. There is no cruelty visible and the elephants are well kept. We have visited elephants in captivity all over Asia and this is a great place in comparison. Yes, gimmicky and a money maker but at least the elephants are healthy. We had drinks and ate in the lovely open air restaurant and had excellent service throughout. Also particularly liked the antiques on display in the lobby. Thankfully ivory is an industry that has declined sharply over the years. Nigel Mason has done a great job here!

Our guide told us that he and his elephant work 6 days giving 15-20 + rides a day, even though the information video said the elephants work 2 days on 2 days off. Very sad. I would not recommend riding you can go and feed and take pictures if you like that's lots of fun.

Our Reservation - We had a 2 day reservation to stay at the Elephant Lodge at the beginning of our trip in Bali. I am HUGE on elephants and just love being in their presence! After our initial 2 days, we decided it wasnâ€™t long enough. So we bumped our next reservation another 2 days and extended at the Elephant Lodge. We then left and traveled onto an Ubud city center hotel. While it was nice, it wasnâ€™t the same vibe as the Elephant lodge. After that stay was over, we ended up basically canceling the rest of our trip (Canguu, Singapore, Thailand) and stayed the rest of our trip at Mason Elephant Lodge. Its that good!!! The lodge and staff - I like to think of myself as an Elephant buff. I too was skeptical of this lodge just from an experience I had in Thailand several years; â€¦

Our room was beyond heaven and the balcony view of the elephants was way beyond expectations. We were greeted and pampered from the moment we were picked up from our hotel in Legian. We started with the most amazing bike ride through the countryside and everything was exceptional. I have read a number of reviews and disappointed to think that some people feel the park is over rated, when in actual fact it is the most beautiful experience I have had to date. Mind you, I know the history of the elephants and what people perceive as inhumane, being chained - this I understand is a necessity to protect them and the surrounds from their destructive habits. The elephants are treated well and the joy they give to all is wonderful. Our meals were wonderful and plentiful. A very; â€¦

date post: Megan F wrote a review Jun 2019
text: Our rooms were beautiful, more than we expected. We were upgraded to rooms where we could be picked up to go to dinner on the back of an elephant. What an experience. The park is beautiful, and the elephants a very well cared for. They even have a nursery so that the breeding program goes ahead, and the best for the elephants is of the utmost importance. Our upgrade included dinner pickup, bathing the elephants, swimming with the elephants and an elephant safari. What a great eperience, one I would fully recomend to everyone. Our accomodation included breakfast which was delicious. The only bad thing I could say is that the pillows on the beds were very soft, so I had a bit of a sore neck the next morning. It was raining on our 2nd day, but this could not stop us bathing and; â€¦
title: Mason Magical Moments

text: Our second stay at Elephant Safari Park & Lodge. Check in was smooth and quick, welcome drink delicious. The rooms are 5 star quality, the shampoo, handwash, soap and moisturizer supplied in the bathroom are also quality (my hair never felt so good). There are books to peruse during your stay and the parks own dvd's are programmed on the tv. There is plenty of information regarding elephants and an elephant 'museum". 4 elephant talent shows daily. Included in the price is an elephant ride plus an elephant picks you up at your room and chauffers you to dinner. We paid for the buffet as we had it last year and it was good. This year it was even better, great range of food, soup, salads, lamb, beef, seafood plus indonesian dishes and sweets. The food was delicious and the staff; â€¦
title: One tick for the Bucket List

text: Our second visit to the safari park staying for one night park view room full board for my daughter's 8th birthday. Is still exciting. Was so nice this time round to have a girls getaway. My daughter loved it especially the wonderful surprise by staff who sang and presented her with a birthday cake at the buffett dinner. Thank you so much. The staff are soooo wonderful. Best nights sleep I had in Bali, exceptional quality (huge king plus bed) mattress and pillows, am hunting down the pillows to buy. Really worth staying the night to take full advantage of all the activities. Riding on an elephant is truly one of the most relaxing, calming meditative experiences I have ever had. Once you settle into the ride it is so peaceful. Will be back again. Note: do not miss an opportunity; â€¦
title: Very relaxing and beautiful

date post: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Jun 2009
text: our stay at the elephant safari park was one of the best ever spent in Bali, we have been doing day trips for the past 5 years and after one nights stay it is on our to do list every year. i would recommend any one going to bali stay a night and experience the luxury of their rooms, the great friendly staff and of course the elephants
title: Elevating with Elephants

text: Our tour desk at out hotel reccomended we do a tour here. With a 7:30 pickup, the bus ride took just over 3 hours from our hotel in nusa dua. Traffic was exceptionally bad that day, apparently its normally a 2 - 2 1/2 hour trip. We chose a deal that was white water rafting and an elephant ride which cost $130 each. The white water rafting was so much fun! And we definately think this is the best company to do it with as its about a 9km trip down the river and a lot of other companies where starting 5 or 6km into our journey. All the good bits are at the start :) Bring some money along because the tour guide expects a tip at the end and they do ask. Theres also spots to stop along the way where you can buy softdrinks and bintangs. The elephant ride, which i was really looking; â€¦
title: Wow this was awesome

date post: Claire Annand wrote a review Aug 2017
text: Our visit to Elephant Safari Park in December 2016 was our big Christmas surprise. Driving through the mountains into this oasis felt epic and every aspect of the day was a peak moment for us. Very special; brushing & washing the elephants, some in our group bathed with them, a sumptuous breakfast, a languid & informative jungle ride. The park is so beautiful just to walk through. Children were giddy with happiness, and made gentle by these giant peaceful animals. We met people who were staying at the lodge and they raved about it. A day to remember! Made us want to stay next time!
title: Lovely elephant park :)

text: Parking area:ample and secure.Check-in was excellent,friendly,informative and polite.Welcome drink:Good. Room was 5 star.Cleanlines:Number 1 in Bali.Bathroom:Huge,clean,Excellent. Fresh fruits provided were excellent. Elephant picked us up to Dining area.Night safari included in our room package.It was raining for the night safari but they manages to provide umbrellas and raining coats. Food in the resto was excellent,good portion and great taste,but quite expensive.Beware:you must dine there coz hotel surroundings are jungles.Impossible for you to find other resto nearby. Museum,Parks,Gift shops are 5 star International standard.Thanks to Nigel Mason &team hard works to keep up with the high standard. Swimming pool was 2 star but very clean. Breakfast was a la carte, not; â€¦
title: Magic Experience, Magic place to stay

text: Place with the wow factor, especially for kids. Park is very beautiful and staff extremely friendly. Our room was spacious, modern and clean. Bathroom was also very large and well equipped. From a big balcony we had a really nice view over the park and the elephants. Just beyond the park we could see the rice terraces, beautiful. One of highlights was being picked up at our room and brought to dinner by an elephant. Dinner was excellent. Breakfast was delicious and plenty. Our kids loved the elephant washing and bathing in the morning, the following elephant ride was a bit short but then compensated by feeding baby elephants. The drivers were very kind and we had a fantastic time.

Please do not support any organization that has elephant riding or animal abuse , there are alternative organization that are proper elephant sanctuary where you can support and help rescue elephants.

Please donâ€™t visit. Itâ€™s advertised as a sanctuary but the truth is, itâ€™s a tourist trap. They keep the elephants here to pull in tourists and pay ridiculously prices to even feed them! We paid Â£70pp to enter which included transfer to and from your hotel, bathing the elephants and breakfast. Also included in the price is to ride them and watch a show but we refused to do that as itâ€™s cruel. The elephant are chained up for 90% of your visit unless theyâ€™re being ridden in or out of the water (completely unfair on the elephant) I watched a few elephants sway from side to side showing signs of distress so I knew I had to leave this place immediately. I was pleased however that whilst we bathed the elephant it was not chained. Iâ€™m not happy with the way some of the staff; â€¦
title: Over priced - not convinced itâ€™s a â€˜sanctuaryâ€™

text: Please please ignore the very small amount of negative comments that you read. Elephants are treated so well! No whips, rods, sticks or anything of the sort were even witnessed! Me and my partner love animals and we were both trying so hard to find faults within the park to see if the elephants are being mistreated - we were delighted that it was completely the opposite. These amazing creatures are spoken with love, calmness and the trainers have so much patience with them. Especially with the younger elephants. We booked the earliest slot to have breakfast and bathe with the elephants. We saw the elephants chained up by the ankle. Straight away I asked why this was and we were explained that the elephants were being fed their breakfast. If they werenâ€™t chained then the bigger; â€¦

Please think before you go!! This are saved animals but now they are still prisoners. They breed with the elephants so they get babyâ€™s, when they are older they must ride at least 17 rounds in the heat with people on them. The trainers have metalstick that they hide, but when an elephants wants to go an other way the sting it behind the ears. The elephants look down and not happy, and when they are done riding they are chainend without water to walk about two meters around. I only washed the elephants but they didnt look happy. Which animal does like to be washed 10 times a day... these animals are seperated and lice in an small place. In the wild elephants are together, its sad but true I saw the elephants cry and YES elephants do cry!!! You can try and see for yourself or; â€¦

date post: nancy m wrote a review Dec 2015
text: Price is not cheap but it's worth every dime. Location is pretty far from the city, so be prepare to just stay at the hotel because they have lots of activities as well so it's not boring at all. When I arrived, they gave me the daily itinerary. From daily day elephant safari ride, elephant chaffeur, elephant show etc. We get free access to the museum and the park too. Choose the park view room, you can see the elephants from the room. Amazing! The room itself is not that trendy, a bit old style but very clean and well maintained. Food was ok. Service was great. Would love to come there again!
title: love it

text: Really annoyed we didnâ€™t do our research on this place, as well as they try to market this place as a sanctuary, itâ€™s not. The elephants we saw were there to be exploited, nothing more. Ride, swim then back on the short chain. See picture of one stretched on her chain to get a drink.
title: Cruel!

date post: Sarah P wrote a review Jul 2016
text: Really enjoyed! A must do!!! We did the bathe and breakfast and it was just fantastic. Staff were very accommodating and the elephants were gentle giants! I was a bit nervous to start with but the animals and staff easily made me feel at ease!!
title: Great afternoon out

text: recently stayed here for 2 nights and it was amazing, having read some of the negative reviews we were slightly concerned but having been here we couldn't fault anything, really don't know why people were writing such negative reviews, the elephants were well looked after and ONLY chained up at night and to feed for their and guests safety, there is nothing negative about this lovely park.
title: Great attraction

text: Recommend anyone everyone to stay here fantastic hope to stay again one day
title: amazing experience

text: Recommend staying here even just for one night ! The rooms are just amazing , we had one over looking the elephants park The highlight of our stay was being collected for dinner by the elephant , the lake ride on the elephant and washing them. Dinner was delicious and beutiful setting .
