Plenty to choose from and good for a buffet The grounds are beutiful and the elephants apper to be well looked after It was quite pricey, I think we paid about $ 600 but that was for 2 adults and 1 child, included dinner and breakfast, elephant pick up for dinner, elephant ride round the grounds and the lake ride on the lake and washing the elephant I loved every minute of our stay and recommend a stay here

Recommending this to everyone travelling to Indonesia, the experience you get for the price you pay it truly remarkable. The elephants put on an a beautiful performance for you and ride is amazing as well. You learn so much about them. If you take a evening package, dinner is included and it is top class!

Resort was top class. Staff were very good and friendly. The food in the restaurant was excellent. The rooms outstanding and the interaction with the elephants so much fun. Swimming with them unreal. The elephants are very looked after and happy

Riding an elephant has been on my bucket list my entire life! The staff were so nice and I loved being able to not only ride an elephant but be able to feed and just watch them! Our trainer spoke great English and was so informative! He has been with his elephant, Ola, for 16 years! It was one of the most incredible places I have ever been!

date post: Jeff travels wrote a review Sep 2012
text: Roons not that good for a 5star resort, but we had an excellent time and we paid for a park view room which was lovely in the morning , I woke before 6am excited to see the elephants and it wasn't disappointing there was about 12 elephants all in there pods outiside your room which was a fantastic experience,we got picked up outside your room by elephant to take you for your evening meal also or the safari ride the next day , you got to wash the elephants and go swimming with them if ou wanted to , fantastic experience.
title: Add to your bucket list

text: Short day trip just to see and feed the elephants. Did not ride them, no interest there. The park also has a large arapaima in a pond there. There's a scenic walk that's also beautiful and the gift shop has many items for all tastes and interests from statues to tapestries.

date post: Lyndsey B wrote a review Sep 2018
text: So disappointed with this place. I love elephants and felt so let down with this place as I expected more of a sanctuary than the elephant theme park it is. The elephant equivalent of Sea World. Elephants chained all day, no freedom. Only released to give rides and Bull hooks being brandished by Mahouts ready to use them. So disappointed and angry that people fall for this as being a nice place for elephants. How would you like to be tethered on a 2ft chain all day?
title: Cruel, not a sanctuary for elephants

text: So forever now Iâ€™ve been absolutely dying to do an elephant experience, I was recommended Mason elephant lodge by our hotel and was under the impression we where going to an elephant â€œsanctuaryâ€. Itâ€™s not a sanctuary itâ€™s an elephant park. To my understanding a sanctuary letâ€™s the elephants roam free, not tied to the one area with a chain around their foot. The animals did look very well but it did make me sad not seeing them to be able to roamfree. Their was also riding, another thing I didnâ€™t agree with. I paid for the â€œwash and batheâ€ not understanding that a bathe is where you get into the water on the elephants back to â€œswimâ€ with them.. needless to say I passed on this activity. We also had breakfast while waiting for our transfer to come and get us, and it was nice.; â€¦

So good to see elephants happy in a safe environment this happy - to people who are writing cruel reviews clearly haven't spoke to the staff or done any research as these elephants have been saved from a Island where hunting and poaching occur. These elephants are fed, sheltered and provided a safe environment for reproduction and conservation. Yes they are chained it is illegal in bali for elephants to roam free. I think they'd rather be fed and be chained, than hunted. But that's my opinion. We stayed only a night as it is very expensive. They only part I did not agree on was the talent show - although it was cool elephants probably don't need to know these skills. And I could tell by the end of the day some of them were getting tired and they should be able to go back to bed; â€¦

So I just left this amazing hotel. It was a perfect kick off to my Bali vacation. We arrived late and had amazing pizza in the room. We were unnerved about the elephant chains but they answered all our questions and in The light of day there was no denying the bond between animal and handler. The food was awesome, and the staff was kind and willing to stop with their pachyderm companion to say hello and answer a question along the way. The girls,and fellas,were great in the breakfast area by the rooms and over all it was an amazing experience! Ps have your camera ready.... the road in is worth it

So much fun. We fed the elephants and the staff. Had them give us trunk hugs. There is a short show with the elephants doing tricks. The ride was 30 - 40 minutes through the jungle. All the elephants were healthy and well care for and loved. Our driver referred to his elephant as as close to him as a brother.

So the elephants are great and the hands-on experience you get with them allows the hotel to charge a premium price for the stay. You will pay orders of magnitude more for this hotel than anything else in the area. That's fine if the service is up to par, but I had the misfortune to arrive on a day when they were experiencing a lot of technical problems: the machine that makes the room keys wasn't working, so someone had to let me into my room every time I left, and the perimeter alarm was malfunctioning. It emitted an ear piercing squeal for the first six hours of my visit, leaving me with a massive headache. They fixed it temporarily but it started up again at 5:30 in the morning. I travel with ear plugs and a white noise app on my phone and I still couldn't drown out the; â€¦

Some of the reviews below are, quite frankly, hysterical. The elephants are very well treated, with humour and kindness- a 3 yr old elephant decided he was going for a swim and the handler laughed and let him, whilst supervising him! I could see no evidence of sores or lesions. I was a little uncertain of them being chained but the handlers explained fully the reasons and they are not on a short leash and are not straining. Not ideal but these elephants are well treated. They're breeding, 3 babies in 2 years and more on the way. Stressed animals don't breed. This is a good place and a genuinely absorbing, calm and tranquil day out. The park did not get busy and is truly lovely.

Spacious room and very comfortable and clean.,Great staff and food in wonderful surroundingsThe elephant experience was excellent being able to bathe with them was exceptional..The elephants are healthy and happy and a credit to the owner and his staff.

Spent the night at the park and had a lovely time bathing and swimming with the elephants. Would highly recommend! The elephant show was fun. Had a lovely dinner with the elephant picking us up from our room and being near by as we ate our food. The accommodation was modern and clean with king size beds.
title: Day trip

text: Spent two nights & two days with my daughter who is an elephant lover - to say the least ! Chose the rooms overlooking the park with the elephants right at your balcony. Hearing them & seeing their silhouette under the moon was so special! Paid for full board which covered everything, accm, food & safaris etc (chauffeur ride from your room to dinner by an elephant is a must!) which made it easy for me to fulfil everything my daughter wanted which was lots of individual time with the elephants Beautiful park, lovely big clean rooms, lovely kind hospitable staff to both us and the elephants ! We stayed here in the off season (so called rainy season - but it never rained) late January, which was great, as it wasn't crowded. Only negative was the lunch buffet was the same both days; â€¦

Stayed 1 night in a garden view with our 7yo and 3.5yo. With an extra bed and breakfast, price came down to about Rp 3.5million. Was not expecting much since our trip last year to the Safari and Marine Park in Gianyar was a complete disappointment. But I was pleasantly surprised. The Elephant Park Lodge surpassed my expectations for a themed hotel. Much much much classier than the Gianyar one. It's not a big park and there's not a tons of things to do. You went there to watch, feed, pat, shower the elephants. You could do as much or as little as you'd like. For us, 1 night was perfect. 2 nights would be boring. We arrived around 3pm. Checked in, relaxed, watched an elephant show, fed some elephants. Whisked by the elephant to dinner outdoor under the stars, then; â€¦

Stayed at the Elephant Safari Park & Lodge for one night. Had originally booked a "park-view" room, but this was fully booked. Fortunately I was upgraded to the executive suite, which was an impressive room with all the amenities that one can expect from such a standard. The staff was very service minded and friendly. The elephant shows was entertaining, and the elephant safari rides was good. We did the night safari, not sure if I would do that again. Would have preferred the day time ride, but do to timing for our own side this was not possible. Can strongly recommed the showering/bathing of the elephants, this was a great way to get a closer encounter with the elephants. Do not expect to see large herds of elephants roaming around freely. They are located in fixed positions,; â€¦

Stayed for 2 nights at the Elephant Safari Park with 2 young children. Amazing!! Loved every minute, total relaxation. The spa/massage rooms were great and very reasonably priced. The rooms were very clean, with little extras included. An elephant ride to dinner both nights, a great experience with the kids. Washing the elephants in the mornings was an amazing experience not only for the children but for us too. We had a lot of interaction with the elephants and are very grateful for this experience. I would highly recommend this to anybody of all ages. Will return to this resort every trip to Bali from now on, it was the highlight of our trip.

Stayed for 2 nights. The room was very spacious, with a great bathroom. Highlight was getting picked up outside your room for elephant rides. The breakfast was huge, the food and drink was a little on the expensive side. Be prepared for the cool mountain air in the mornings.
title: Wonderful experience

text: Stayed for two nights over Christmas. We arrived in the afternoon and had an amazing Christmas Eve dinner, staff were very accommodating as we are vegetarians. Enjoyed our stay and spending time with the elephants. Only negative was when we checked out staff were not very helpful as they were when we arrived, otherwise a perfect Christmas with the elephants.

date post: Joey H wrote a review Sep 2015
text: Stayed here for 3 nights in March. I can't praise it enough from the moment we arrived everybody is so friendly the lodges have everything you could wish for fruit bowl on arrival and cakes left every evening. Beds turned down every night while we were at dinner. The elephants are just amazing and really well looked after. I would go back in a heartbeat.
title: A lot of fun

text: Stayed here for one night with my partner to start off our bali trip... They have a documentary showing on the TV about how Nigel (the owner) rescues the elephants from Samantra and brings them to Bali which is great however I feel like he has lost his way a little bit... for example in the documentary you see Nigel say "no chains anymore" to the elephants once they come into the bali safari lodge however the elephants are chained in one small spot and they sleep with chains on... they do this so the elephants dont wreck the landscape however visitors are there to see the elephants and the resort is on 9 acres I dont see why they cant have a massive section to themselves. Also its in the middle of no where so we would of been bored if we stayed for any longer then one night. I; â€¦
title: Amazing Park - think twice about the rice paddy view rooms

text: stayed here in april with my daughter, didnt know what to expect, but was wowed from the moment we arrived, the service the staff the food and the elephants and the things we got to do with the elephants every day, the spa was great too, ni wayan sutariani took great care of us at the spar.. the elephant handlers were all very kind to the elephants our mahout/ handler was kadek and our elephant was rama, made our trip outstanding, would like to thank everybody there for a memory we will never ever forget.... you all rock it was so worth it..

Stayed here last week for 3 nights and I have to say this is the most amazing place I have ever stayed at. I have been in hospitality for over 30 years staying and working in beautiful establishments all around the like Atlantis in Dubai, Raffles in Singapore and the Hanser in Bangkok. This hotel is more outstanding than the others. The staff are amazing, food is beautiful cooked from breakfast thru to dinner. Other reviews say it is expensive, they should go out more. The prices are very reasonable and they don't push any extras on you. The accommodation is beautiful set in middle of an Elephant Safari Park with your neighbours being these beautiful elephants. The highlights were getting picked up for dinner by elephant and having the freedom of the park before and after the; â€¦
title: Fun day!

text: Stayed here on a group deal 3 nights. Was fantastic. We got to wash and bathe the elephants every morning. We even hoped on back of the elephant whilst it was having a bath.. These are rescued elephants and they are well looked after. Was lovely to have breakfast overlooking park where elephants were feeding. Accommodation was lovely and elephants came to our room to pick us up for dinner. Food was top class. They have daily shows which you are able to attend all included. We took so many gorgeous photos.. they also arrange the whitewater rafting which is great fun. Definitely worth a visit.
title: Elephant visit

date post: Reshma D wrote a review Nov 2016
text: Stayed here on the two night honeymoon package when we first arrived in Bali. The drive is a couple of hours from the airport but we had someone from the park pick us up and transport us. We bathed, rode and fed the elephants everyday and it was a great experience. The elephant handlers were very friendly and work with just one elephant, some even referred to them as their second wife. Every other member of staff we encountered was also friendly and helpful. The food was good but would have expected a bit better given that everything else is to a high standard. We also had a treatment in the spa which was nice and relaxing rather than do the mountain biking or white water rafting that came with the package. Do note that if you book a 'Paddy View' room that you will not be; â€¦
title: Beautiful Elephants.

text: Stayed here one night for a treat Sooooooo glad I did The room (paddy view) was amazing We booked directly with the park for an all inclusive package for $250 aus each and it was so worth it Perfect way to start an awesome trip to Bali Highly recommend anyone to indulge in this valued package Dinner, breakfast and lunch 45 min safari ride on the majestic elephants Pick up from wherever from an elephant to dinner Swim with an elephant and bathing them Plus a show that will make u smile of these happy and content animals This is a must do ðŸ’ž

date post: Igino F wrote a review Oct 2012
text: Stayed in a park view room and never wanted to waste a second of the view, both night and day. Spent 2 1/2 days there and still didn't want to leave. Staff amazing and made us feel like we were the most important people in the world. Washing, bathing, feeding, riding and just sitting and watching the elephants was an unforgettable experience. Thank you to EVERY person involved in the running of the park. Hope to return again one day.
title: Think twice before trying it!

text: Stayed in garden view room - park view ones are better. This place offers a unique experience for guests the elephant "chauffeur" picks you up from your balcony, on a twilight ride through the park to the restaurant by the lake where the food is outstanding. The elephants are adorable and really well looked after - you can bath them, swim with them and feed them. Even the spa is in the park so you can watch the elephants from your jacuzzi The rooms are elephant themed even the bed has elephant feet and the towels are folded into elephants. Breakfast is very good too. The hotel also runs white water rafting trips via Bali adventure tours - I can definitely recommend the white water rafting and cycle tours
title: A little underwhelmed

text: Stayed two nights which I felt was enough, in a garden view room (for the elephant taxi) which just overlooked a few plants, but hey you are not there to look at that. Reception staff friendly and one in particular always remembered my name. Taken to room as soon as we arrived and given all the information on timetable of events. Room was lovely with two twin beds, quite firm, great a/c, high beamed ceiling with a massive ceiling fan. Everything is elephant, ie towels, little paper shapes, etc. Plate of fruit on table both days and cake left first night. Bathroom was down a couple of steps, big walk in shower and good toiletries. Phone in bathroom. We had our first elephant ride that afternoon which was an experience. The keepers are great and quite funny but they give; â€¦

Staying at the Elephant Safari Lodge was a unique and endearing experience. The grounds are superbly kept and well thought out in regards to caring for the Elephants that live there. I had a wonderful time riding the elephants, especially being picked up from my room and dropped off to the outdoor restaurant for dinner. Bathing with the elephants in the morning was more than a treat. A beautiful place to stay, heart warming.

Staying at the Mason Elephant Lodge was a dream come true. The room was very comfortable and the staff was great. The best part of this hotel is of course the Elephants! Waking up each morning to an elephant greeting you at your balcony is the stuff dreams are made of! We loved every second here!

Staying here was absoulety amazing, once in a life time experiance . Me and my girlfriend had a great time enjoying every moment with these amazing animals. I would recommend to anybody!! It is a must do! Rooms - were fresh and clean. Food - was tasty and reasonable priced Breakfast - was small for choice but what was on offer was tasty. Location - is about 20 minutes from Ubud but the hotel offers free shuttle. Spa - the massages were great, even let you shower afterwards. Staff - all friendly and polite. WIFI- was ok for messaging, however sometimes on facetime it wouldnt connect. We are going to be returning next year!!
title: Very expensive

text: Such an amazing experience of meeting the Elephants. All the staff are very friendly and are happy for you to interact with the Elephants and share knowledge on them. The Elephants seem very well looked after and happy whilst we visited. Loved every second of our time spent there!
title: Like a religious experience.

text: Takes a long time to get there from Kuta. The elephants all seem to be very well looked after, each one with its own carer and little area to relax. The elephants are NOT hit over the head unless they misbehave or try to get to some food on the surrounding farmers farms. We asked our rider all about this, he steered the elephants by telling her where to go. The claw on the end of the hammer is a last resort for when they try to get onto the farms. Elephants skulls are so thick that it doesn't hurt them anyway.
title: Elephant night safari

date post: Adam C wrote a review Jul 2018
text: Terrible terrible terrible. You should all be ashamed of yourselves mason lodge. Iâ€™m so angry I spent over Â£160 for the two of us on this â€œexperienceâ€ it was like a cattle market. The poor elephants chained up (and there is no explanation you could give for this) they donâ€™t do this in a proper sanctuary (Thailand) you are carted from one shoddy thing to another. Iâ€™m sure the elephants donâ€™t even want to be scrubbed down. Riding the elephants in the water is poor. I refused to do this when I saw the handlers pick axing the poor animals on their heads when they wanted it to do certain things. In closer inspection you can see the scarring on their poor heads. Breakfast. Terrible unless you like flies all over your food. The ride also terrible. Wanted to get off half way through it.; â€¦
title: Amazing interaction with the elephants

text: Thank you for providing such an awesome place to visit. Cleanliness staff facilities are world class. Expensive yes, but entertaining to the hilt. From the elephant show to the excellent elephant walk, to feeding the animals everything was organised perfectly. Safe for everyone.
title: Good but unbelievably expensive

text: Thank you for the most amaxing experiance. We travelled with 11 of us for one night aged from 5 to 60. Staff are amazing nothing is to much. Washing the elephants is a mist for all. The elephant pick up from the room to dinner is also brilliant and we all enjoyed it so much. 3 of the adults swam with the elephants again just amazing. Rooms are clean and have everything you need. Evening meal we sat around the elephants we a lot on the menu but some ordered from the lunch menu as had burgers and after 2 weeks in bali we was craving english food. Breakfast was the only let down but we was happy with fruit and to get back to spend the last couple of hours with the elephants. Just amazing. Elephants are so looked after and each one has his own keeper. A must if you are in; â€¦
title: Close to Elephants

text: Thank you to everyone who made our day so special! The love you all have for the elephants is evident. My husband and I are huge animal activists and I'll be the first to admit that we were reluctant to come to the park as we had read some reviews that were less than favourable. After doing our own research, and asking 1 million questions, we realise they couldn't be more wrong! It's such a shame that other people haven't educated themselves about what the parks about. It's about preserving these beautiful animals, and creating a safe, amazing space for everyone to enjoy. I feel fiercely loyal to the team at the safari, and will be shouting your praise. We are very excited to come back and stay at the lodge next time. A special thank you to Yanie and Nigel, and of course Nyoman; â€¦

The accomodation is excellent and clean. Service is also excellent. The elephants are treated well - although this is a definite compromise - in that they have to work for their keep. It would be great to see more education about palm oil and the choices we can make. Perhaps label your chocolate as palm oil free? Recommend the painting with elephant. I didn't ride them but I enjoyed the daybed that was at the far end of the grounds where I could read/nap and watch them in action. The pool at the chocolate factory is actually better than the pool at the hotel for IDR100 (which you spend easily on a drink, food and chocolate) pool use is allowed and looks over the rice paddies. Enjoyed the chocolate also!

The beautiful elephants were amazing to see up close. We got to feed them and even got hugs from these gentle giants. Was an awesome experience and recommend at least a couple of hours to see, hear and smell everything.
title: Cruel - please boycott.

text: The best experience was actually to stay at the park and the kids really enjoyed the ongoing access and view to/of the elephants. We were very impressed that we were able to accommodate the whole family in 2 rooms with no problems about age of children which is a common hindrance in other hotels. This makes it a very good value for money. The level of service is a major highlight for the hotel. All staff were extremely helpful and friendly. We really wanted to have an animal experience traveling with the whole family but are always concerned at animal exploitation. Unfortunately whilst we would prefer to go and assist and learn at a sanctuary or rehabilitation center most of the sanctuaries are pretty expensive to get to and as such out of budget for families. The; â€¦
title: Nice stay

text: The Best hotel ! We spent 1 night with 2 children the family room was perfect everything was neat, food was delicious, staff were very nice and friendly when we went for the night Safari they prepared our beds and slipper for the night and late night snack we were treated like Royalty ;)
title: Great fun for everyone!!

text: The better deal is to stay a night and get access to the park and the activities. Room was great, staff was very attentive, good food and over all a very nice park/lodge area. Highly recommend to come here and stay for a night.
title: 9 Years Later..

text: The downside of this place is that the elephants can be seen chained by the foot to certain areas within the park. But I guess it can't be helped as they are potentially dangerous animals, mainly because of their size and it makes sense to keep them spread out around the park for the purpose of visitor satisfaction. Also the show, whereby the elephants are trained to do tricks, it's fun to watch but is it cruel? I don't know but I guess these things are almost required, to ensure enough funds come in to preserve the animals. Perhaps a vicious circle. The animals did seem well looked after and our rather hypocritical elephant ride did have me believing that our 'driver' did really care about the elephant he looked after, and told us they'd been together 15 years. It's fun,; â€¦
title: Enjoyable for kids, teens and adults

text: The elephant are so well looked after, they are not stressed out, eating healthy, bathed, washed etc... Mason Lodge has a couple of pregnant elephants - this goes to show they are really looked after and taken care of!! If you do your research it is extremely had to breed elephants unless they are in their natural environment/stress free. Upon checkin the gentleman (who hardly spoke English, my driver spoke better) tried to upgrade our package including park entertainment, elephant ride to dinner however this was all included in our accommodation. Thank god my partner said no at the time otherwise we would have been scammed, I see a lot of reviews the same as this. If you can try stay in room 222 (garden view) as you can see straight out into the breeding yard, I think itâ€™s a; â€¦
title: I was persuaded to give it a try because of the greaf reviews

date post: Utami W wrote a review Jul 2017
text: The elephant lodge was a lovely retreat in ubud. The staff were friendly and helpful and our room was clean and tidy. The elephants were treated very well and seemed happy and loved by the staff working there. Furthermore, the grounds for the park were looked after well. We had the buffet dinner in the evening and thoroughly enjoyed our 4 plates of food! A little bit of luxury for our travels!
title: Wonderful Elephant Park

date post: RESHMA P wrote a review Jul 2016
text: The elephant park is a very nice way to spend a couple of hours. You can feed and hug the elephants, watch them mess around in the pool, perform a few impressive tricks and go on a 35 mins ride. The park is beautifully manicured and the restaurant area is a nice retreat from the afternoon heat. The elephants and their mahouts are from Sumatra. The elephants were originally rescued from being abused but many of the younger elephants were born at the reserve. However, for day trippers it is extraordinarily expensive even for those from Europe. At $195 (Â£145) for a family of 4, we couldn't help feeling this place is a cash cow for the Australian owners.
title: Elephants

text: The Elephant Park is actually a sanctuary for the Asian elephants, and it's a must! You can feed these gentle animals, go for a ride (something they do for exercise). You can even book ahead and learn how to bathe and take care of them. Definitely a highlight of my trip!
title: Not an elephant sanctuary

text: The elephant ride itself was ok - a wobbly side-to-side roll but manageable. What was more interesting was the conversation with our mahout, who shared with us how the elephants came to the park, how each elephant had only 1 trainer throughout its stay at the park, the elephants themselves, how he came to work at the park and his friendship with the elephant he worked with. Interaction with the elephants was encouraged with free elephant feeding and photography opportunities which park staff willingly oblige and even offer to do for the family.

The Elephant Safari Park & Lodge is a unique experience, up close and personal with the resident elephants. What we liked the most is that the park managers train the elephants with a reward system as opposed to some of the cruel methods used in other locations. The elephants don't do anything they really don't want to. Aside from the humane and kind treatment of the elephants the park is focused on conservation and sustainability. The rooms are beautiful and the museum is a great place to learn more about the role of elephants through the ages. We took our 10 year old who absolutely enjoyed every second of her time with the elephants. This was my second visit and I will return again.
title: BEST ELEPHANT PARK

text: The Elephant Safari Park & Lodge was absolutely the most amazing experience we had in Bali! We stayed in a Park View Room and absolutely loved it-- the elephants are literally RIGHT in front of the balcony attached to the room and you have a view of them day and night. Incredible! The rest of the safari/park was amazing, too. We got to feed the elephants, pet them, ride on them, bathe them, etc. We never felt rushed and were able to spend as much time with the elephants as we wanted. The staff, grounds, and amenities at the park were awesome, although expensive, and you could tell that the elephants were incredibly well treated and happy. I HIGHLY recommend the Elephant Safari Park and really encourage anyone traveling to Bali to build in a visit and an overnight stay at the; â€¦

The Elephant Safari Park has been the highlight of our family trip to Bali!! We stayed in Ubud and this was only a short ride from our hotel. We got to feed the elephants, take pictures with them and ride them! Our 5-year-old is obsessed with elephants and he brought his elephant "lovie" to the park. He was beyond happy to see the animals up close. Overall, this was an exhilarating experience and a dream come true for all of us! Highly recommend!!

The Elephant Safari Park was one of my favorite activities of our Honeymoon! Being so close to these animals, with as much time spent feeding and loving on them as you want was so amazing. We opted out of the elephant ride, sparing your the lecture, after all the research we did we just didn't agree with riding them ourselves. BUT you can have a great day without the ride too! We loved feeding the elephants, meeting the babies, getting hugs and hanging with them for several hours. I have never been so close to one, let alone 5-6 at a time! The show is cute too. Our tour we booked online through Bali Adventure Tours included transpo, entry and a buffet lunch. The food was good! It was worth every dollar to spend time with these animals. From what we are told, most if not; â€¦

The elephants are all rescues from the illegal palm oil forest clearing in Indonesia and not only are they providing education and entertainment for tourists they are given a safe haven , well looked after, but provide the dollars to rescue more from poisoning and other horrible deaths for those still out there. It is sad they probably cannot never be returned to the wild , but a safe loving haven , being well fed and looked after is a far better option than what they were facing. I would go back tomorrow if I could this place is great.

The elephants are chained up to 2 foot long chains alone all day until they are needed for rides. During the â€˜Elephant Introductionâ€™ they started by explaining that the elephants werenâ€™t treated like circus animals here but then went on to make them paint, crush coconuts and other little unessesary â€˜tricksâ€™. The worst part about this place is the lies they feed us to convince us that these elephants are happy. They are absolutely not and it was heartbreaking. Each little cabin had a chained elephant outside as if it was a statue. A beautiful setting but the money should be put into ensuring the elephants have the most natural habitat instead of ridiculously expensive fish and other pretty decor. I hope the money I spent on my ticket and lunch helps those big fellas some how; â€¦
title: Amazing experience!

date post: Becky B wrote a review Feb 2020
text: The elephants are kept much better than I thought and the grounds are kept very nice. However, for dinner my chicken came back more raw than eddy murphy. So although i possibly obtained some salmonella poisoning, I decided to brave the smaller restaurant for an Ala Kart breakfast with my wife. But alas we both couldn't dodge the bullet as we both went down with food poisoning. We had the garden view room. I guess thats what they call a view of tye next buildings wall with some plants growing along that wall. Also for all of you hoping to rely on speaking english to get by, please note, the staff here are very limited in their english speaking skills. You may want to use google translate or learn some basic words. Finally, Mason Elephant lodge is 30 min from the Ubud CBD.; â€¦
title: Expensive but not luxary

date post: Laura W wrote a review Oct 2015
text: The elephants have been rescued and are well looked after. The waiting time approx 1.5 hours is well organised allowing you time to see the short show, eat/drink and meet and feed the elephants, your name is called over the loudspeaker so there's no queueing a great idea. Our elephant, Rama was 33 years old and the handler had been with him for 22 years!
title: Amazing!! Bucket List Experience!

text: The elephants were wonderful. We had 10 days of relaxation and interaction with them and we will definitely be back. All staff were so friendly, helpful and appreciative of your presence. We met Nigel and his wife and had a 45 minute discussion with the Park Manager. All were willing to take the time to tell you more about your surroundings We explored the local countryside and villages with the locals welcoming you into their homes. What a great experience. Certainly worth a visit

The experiences at Elephant Safari Park & Lodge were more than I expected. One of the highlights was swimming/bathing with an elephant! Throughtout the days, my husband and I have never get bored. When we had a trouble with the shower, the staff reacted immediately and fixed it within a couple hours. I would love to go back to this lodge with my family next time.
title: Must experience

text: The facilities at Mason Elephant Lodge in Taro are second to none. Staff are warm, friendly and very welcoming, they spoke very good english and were very knowledgeable about the elephants. Would definitely recommend staying to get the most of your experience. The property is exceptionally clean and the elephants are very well looked after. My grand daughter learnt so much about the beautiful, gentle Sumartrin Elephants, it was a joy to see her interacting with them. This was the experience of a lifetime with her, we enjoyed every minute and would love to return again. It really is worth putting a cuple of extra dollars towards a room to stay rather than just a day visit as you get access to the park grounds after hours. We ate off the A la carte menu for diiner and it was; â€¦

date post: Ray Dsilva wrote a review Oct 2018
text: The food was the worst we had on our whole Bali trip. The pool was really really dirty and uninviting. The room smelt of poop constantly, and there was mouse litter on the bed. The staff was impolite. The activities were poorly planned and we were sent from one place to another various times. Over all, we wish we had spent this money (because itâ€™s expensive) somewhere else. Big disapointment! :(
title: Elephant love

text: The girlfriend and I had a lovely morning doing the breakfast and bathe with the elephants. Fantastic experience! The elephants seem as well cared for as possible considering where they are but I understand peopleâ€™s concerns. Even met the owner whilst we were there who seemed like a good bloke.

The handlers of the elephants were very informative. To be so close to these amazing creatures was a fantastic experience. Most of the elephants are rescued and they have a handler each. The park is owned by a Melbournian. We visited for the night safari and dinner under the stars and didn't stay at the accommodation.

date post: Karoline M wrote a review Mar 2019
text: The highlight of my trip! What an amazing experience, we did the wash and bathe with the elephants. I was hesitant to go, being an animal lover- but felt they are well cared for and have a great bond with the handlers. Definitely worth visiting this amazing place and get up close with these gentle giants!
title: SOOOOOO glad we stayed here!

text: The hotel and grounds were beautiful. Bathing and swimming with the elephants was spectacular and the staff was wonderful. Spa was too rate! Wonderful wonderful experience!! Everything was top notch and very special!!
title: Well treated rescue elephants enchant

text: The hotel is very beautiful and spacious. The room we stayed at had the elephant symbols everywhere from paintings to the towels. Also it was a unique experience to go swimming with this game incredible creatures. Also giving them a morning bath was special and cute. However the restaurant was just ok. The food looked good but tasted just average. So they have lots of room for improvement there.

The hotel itself and the grounds are beautiful. Our initial thoughts were that it was SS to see the elephants chained to the spot in the gardens though. The elephant bathing experience was overpriced and rushed to be honest. The â€˜bathingâ€™ consisted of us scrubbing one with a brush for about 3 minutes before the next couple were pushed in front of us and we were moved on. The swimming consisted of us sitting on top for 5 minutes in a large pool - wonderful experience. The low point for us came when we noticed a trainer hitting one on the head hard with a little silver metal hammer as he wasnâ€™t lowering his head so a lady could jump off. Not sure that should be happening?!
title: Just left!!!

text: The Hotel/Lodge ist very nice. Itâ€™s clean and nicely kept. The gardens are beautiful. Our room had a view looking at the elephants. We spent 3 nights here (Christmas and a Birthday). The Team did a fantastic job helping me decorate for my husbands birthday. It was great! The only negative I have to add to our stay would be the food. I hope itâ€™s due to the pandemic. Bali is full of great vegan and fresh food. Unfortunately the food here is ok. Nothing great and the breakfast choice was the worse we had in Bali. Outside of this, great place.

The Hotel/Lodge ist very nice. Itâ€™s clean and nicely kept. The gardens are beautiful. Our room had a view looking at the elephants. We spent 3 nights here (Christmas and a Birthday). The Team did a fantastic job helping me decorate for my husbands birthday. It was great! The only negative I have to add to our stay would be the food. I hope itâ€™s due to the pandemic. Bali is full of great vegan and fresh food. Unfortunately the food here is ok. Nothing great and the breakfast choice was the worse we had in Bali. Outside of this, great place.

The jungle itself is really pretty and the staff were really friendly but that it probably the best I can say about this place. The hotel room smelled of damp. But the most distressing thing was that the elephants did not seem to be kept in the condition advertised on the website. They are chained up and then the rides are in boxes - which we already knew is bad for their backs! So we turned our rides down and decided instead to walk everywhere. There is also a cringey bath with the elephants which is basically Instagram mad couples having photos taken on elephants in the water in their bikinis. The whole thing was really upsetting and I would not recommend if you care about elephant welfare.

The kids enjoyed this experience but it was a bit underwhelming. The elephants are amazing creatures...and the guides are good. But it reminded me of a pony ride at the fair as a child.... only on a really big elephant! It is just a simple ride on a large track of space and then a quick dip into the â€œpoolâ€. I will add... the included lunch was actually great!
title: Amazing ðŸ˜€ðŸ˜€ðŸ˜€ðŸ˜€

date post: Adilson V wrote a review Mar 2018
text: The kids had a great time feeding the elephants and the grounds were beautiful. We didnâ€™t take an elephant ride as the admission prices alone are quite expensive even by Australian standards. Still worth the visit though.
title: Over priced

text: The location is without a doubt, beautiful and peaceful. The rooms were comfortable and clean with great bathroom and shower. The elephants are lovely but there was little to no information available on them; where they came from, why they were there etc. We had to constantly ask the mahouts for details and they didn't seem that interested in discussing it. The hotel staff were dismissive with what seemed like forced politeness, the food was terrible and incredibly expensive and we were put in a room next to the kitchen area where the chefs literally screamed, shouted and banged doors at 6am (not something you want to hear when on holiday). We ended up leaving one night early and going somewhere else. The elephants seem well looked after and, assuming they are in captivity for; â€¦

The location of this conservation is located about 2 hours car driving from denpasar. The location is great..located inside the forest however the location is so clean only smells from elephant sometimes disturb hehehe..only elephant that available in here at the locket you will be charge for the entry ticket..and if you want to take an elephant ride..additional charge shall be impose. You will be free to touch the elephant or take a picture with the elephant..some employee will always available to assist you whenever you want to take picture or touch the elephant.

The Lodge and amenities exceeded our expectations. The rooms were beautifully appointed and very comfortable. Food was excellent and the staff incredibly friendly and helpful. The interactions with the elephants was amazing and I am completely in awe of this magnificent animal. Being able to learn about the elephants with mahouts that have spent up to 25 years with the same animal was extraordinary. Watching the attention that each elephant receives from passionate handlers on a daily basis was fantastic and incredibly reassuring. If every I am able to return to Bali, I would definitely revisit.
title: Awesome park!!!!

text: The lodge and safari park are outstanding in terms of the experience they offer. 5 star accomodation, great staff, and the experience you get with the animals is fantastic. Don't think this is a zoo because its not - its interactive and the kids will love getting up close and peronal witrh these incredible creatures.
title: Put this one on your bucket list

text: The lodge is located within the Elephant Safari Park itself. Our garden view room was upgraded to the Park view which allowed us have an awesome view of these gentle and intelligent mammals the whole time. The park where these mammals live, is a well manicured botanical garden itself. This place is definitely a "Must See" if you were to visit Bali. The service there was very personalized and tip-top.
title: Quite possibly the best holiday we ever had.

text: The name of this place is utterly misleading. It's not a Safari experience so much as a place for a group tour; it's not a Safari Park out in the wilderness so much as a Theme Park and it's not a Lodge so much as a Hotel complete with tacky gift shop and 'jumbo the elephant' type displays. They make much of the fact that this a sanctuary where the elephants are protected from the rigors of life in Sumatra but that's akin to saying that Orca should be happy for being kept alive at SeaWorld.

The night safari was great and the show was very entertaining. Johnny's british accent was very funny considering the fact that he's never been abroad. Would definitely recommend this place to everyone in Bali.

The park is a cool place to visit but I didn't care much for the Lodge, especially not for the price. Nothing too wrong with the Lodge, it has pretty nice rooms and very friendly staff. The Lodge only has 13 TV channels, which normally isn't a big deal because who cares about watching TV while on vacation, right? EXCEPT, they advertise that they have HBO, which they DON'T... and then 2 of the 13 channels are solely dedicated to Nigel Mason's businesses. So if you want to watch a 12 year old, 60 minute looped video of Nigel Mason talking about elephant births and prized fish at his Elephant Park, then you'll love it. He also has another channel that's just a loop of his chocolate factory and adventure tour business. It all comes off as very monopolistic and scummy, to be honest.; â€¦

the park is beautiful with 33 elephants!! you can feed them and take pictures with them! they are super smart and kind creatures!!! we loved them!!! however, the ride was not that good...bit too long and quite bumpy (uncomfortable)

The park is great. You can ride the elephants (as couples) through the park's jungle and into the lake, you can also feed them and take photos with them. Not to mention the elephant shows every couple of hours. Aside from the elephants, the park has a restaurant (lunch included with our package), fish lakes, an art gallery, and a souvenir shop. Highly recommended for couples and families.
title: Such an amazing experience!

date post: Lauren E wrote a review Sep 2016
text: The park is not huge but enough to keep busy for a couple hours! The elephants are very well trained and playful! You can feed and touch them! They give you bamboo to feed for free or you can pay a few bucks for fruits which they seem to like more. Elephant ride was amazing and the guide that we got for the ride was loads of fun! The talent show was great but not very long. They will cool you down at the end of the show... I'm sure the water is clean lol!
title: Loved it!

date post: Mohammed Z wrote a review Aug 2016
text: The park went over and above our expectations, the romantic dinner for two was a big WOW. Five stars for everything. To the Manager & Staff of the park a Big Thank You, you made our holiday get way a time to remember. ðŸ’›
title: An amazing experience!

text: The place is a real piece of jungles. We've stayed there for two nights. The elephants were very very kind & friendly. Bathing the elephants in the morning was really exited. If you want to go for dinner, you will get an elephant pick up. The only bad thing is the prices of the activities. It's expensive!

date post: Travel LifeðŸ’• wrote a review Oct 2018
text: The place is kept well , but its in the middle of nowhere and if you dont have transport it means you are stuck there. Elephants are great but the word "sanctuary" in my opinion isnt right as the elephants are used as attractions and are tied up at night - they are used to transport guests from the rooms to dinner at night as well under the guise of "exercise for the elephants". The shop is more of a sales point for memorabilia so as a guest you are limted to the menu and not having a few mopeds that they can rent out to guests means once you go there you are pretty much stuck there unless you book a day trip or excursion.
title: Ride the elephants

text: The reception area is a little small but was very welcomed by the friendly staff. The rooms facing the elephant field was really spacious and clean. Bathroom are huge too with full amenities provided. Breakfast is simple but tasty. Activities are fun! Staff are smiling and friendly!

The restaurant food was awful and over priced. We ordered two pizzas and a portion of chips and when it arrived it was cold. The bed was rock solid definitely not value for money. Would highly recommend just coming for the day!
title: A Great way to spend the morning

text: The sad truth is that the Sumatran elephant has been almost killed in the wild. And due to over logging, over population and corruption will be gone in a decade or so. Therefore the choice is either a place like this or extinction. It would be so much better to see elephants in the wild living their natural lives but that just ainâ€™t gonna happen for much longer. So whatâ€™s the point of this place. Firstly about 27 elephants are preserved - most of the elephants are rescued and you can see the chain marks where their 2.5cm think skin was scorched. Secondly those coming particularly the young see the magnificent beasts up close and decide perhaps to do something about the â€˜genocideâ€™. We didnâ€™t see any mistreatment. No hands raised. No objects to encourage behaviour (go to any horse; â€¦

The service was excellent & our group loved the food. Although the best part was waking up to the elephants off our balcony in the mornings. The elaphant guides were so caring & happy to be there. Very happy to see that this place exists.
title: Experience of a life time..

date post: Chris W wrote a review Feb 2015
text: The staff and park were excellent with the exception of the Front Desk. We purchased a room with a view (Pattie) and were placed behind the restaurant/bar. We questioned the Front Desk three times and they said it was an "upgrade" when in fact it was a "downgrade." The only explanation we could come up with for our treatment is we purchased our room from another website (not their website). Buyer beware.
title: Amen to an earlier comment: "Looks Good, Feels Fake"

text: The staff is really well-trained here, especially when compared to other hotel and safari park in Bali. You will be so surprised to find how attentive they are and how good English they can speak. Overall it was a very good experience. We stayed one night only and I think one night is just right. Washing the elephant and seeing the baby elephants were the highlights of our stay. For family traveling with kids, this is definitely the perfect place! The reason why i couldn't give this property 5 points was because the food in the restaurant is not very good. (Do not order the spaghetti Bolognese !!) I think the lodge really need to improve the taste of food.

The staff managed our stay to perfection. The park view room had amazing views and was very clean and comfortable. The food at the park is second to none. Engagement with the elephants when the park was closed was brilliant we particularly enjoyed playing with the baby elephants. Despite the hefty cost of staying i would thoroughly recommend a stay at the park lodge.

The Taro Safari Park by Bali Adventure tours is one of three companies offering an elephant experience in Bali. The park prides itself in being the oldest, best organized and well kept operations of the three operating in Bali - up to a point that the other parks lure their guests to their own venues *pretending* they are the 'actual' elephant ride in Bali. We experienced this too - a taxi driver and two tour two operators even denied the existence of an elephant park near Ubud and try to take us to Bakas and Levi instead. We opted for the 'real' thing and went to Taro instead. Pick up was okay, though we had to wait for a long time for other people at another hotel who did not show up in time - this and the busy traffic had us arrive very late at the park. We lost a lot of; â€¦
title: just loved the baby elephants........

text: THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER. Let me preface this by saying that we were expecting so much more from this hotel, being on tripadvisors highest recommendations. We were let down tremendously. I came here to celebrate my fiance and I's engagement and my parents who live in indonesia also came to visit because it was their wedding anniversary. Upon check in we were never greeted, we had to find our way to the desk. The gentlemen at the desk had no interest in how we were doing but upon seeing my parents, his only concern was that my parents were not alllowed to stay in my room due to maximum occupancy!???? Whattt??! Staff was very rude and I was never onced given information regarding the hotel nor any of the elephant activities. When I called to book a shuttle to go out; â€¦

These elephants live better than some people their mahouts are their slaves and they love all the attention and love poured on them. We got to know Nafor and Daisy and they recognised us after a couple of days too. The myth that these beautiful pets could possibly be mistreated here is a load of bull and we are soo disappointed kiwi travel agents dont promote this sanctuary more .. visit yourself and see how they were rescued from certain death in Sumatra Nigel and Yanni Mason are demi gods for the outstanding care and love in providing this for generations to come .. without this ... they would be history. The people who have written bad reviews obviously didn't take the time to learn about the different personalities each elephant has or their daily routines ... they; â€¦
title: Do not visit if you are in any way an animal loverðŸ˜¢

text: These Elephants once lived in Sumatra where they worked everyday pulling the logs that had been chopped down. That was their job. One day the logs and the food ran out. The Elephants were dying. Mason Elephant Park and Lodge saved these elephants and gave them a new life. Yes, people go on their backs but this gives the elephants exercise. The trainers assured us the elephants were very happy. After 2 night staying at the Mason Elephant Park and Lodge I could see the elephants were happy. All they did was eat, eat and eat more. They ate 240 kilos of vegetation per day, which was wheels to them with wheelbarrows so the noise wouldnâ€™t scare them. I loved the African safari styled rooms, the fine dining in the dimly lit gardens and the daily breakfast. It was a beautiful; â€¦
title: This may take 5mins. But its worth it!!

text: These elephants were taken out of the wild in Sumatra for awful reasons (logging, Ivory ect) The Masons have rescued them from this fate where their lift expectancy was short and have then taken them into their care here in Bali and have given them a much better quality of life. The handlers (in blue uniforms ) that have trained the elephants and look after them seem really great . They were friendly and answered any questions we had. On our first night here we bumped into Brad who is Australian and here doing the marketing for the park. He has so much passion and care for this place and the elephants. He gave us so much information on the elephants past and their care it was great. He showed us around explaining how they are kept and what activities they do throughout the; â€¦
title: A must do!!!!

date post: Katrina D wrote a review Apr 2018
text: These types of places are always conflicting for my spirit. I had no issues washing and feeding the elephants but couldnâ€™t help but notice that during the swimming portions sharp objects were used to force the elephants to comply. Some also had scabs and wounds from being prodded by their trainers. There were several families allowed to take photos sitting on the elephants â€œbended kneeâ€. I also saw a few elephants swaying which is a sign of them being tired and overworked. While it was nice to get up close and personal elephants should not be ridden or forced to paint. There are other ways to truly show conservation. Please help to improve!
title: Very disappointing

text: They treat the elephants really well. I was a little nervous coming here but my trepidation was put to rest specially when my elephant didn't want to move forward they were really patient with her she finally moved forward after gentle coaxing
title: Best Birthday gift ever!

text: This by no means is a sanctuary. I witnessed the elephants being grabbed behind the ear and treated not so nice. In addition, their customer service was horrible. 30 minutes of my trip was spent trying to explain to them why I was NOT getting in that filthy water to bathe the elephants. Yes, I originally paid for the elephant bath. However, once I got to the water and watched them remove enormous piles of poop out of the brown water I immediately changed my mind. The pictures make the water look clean (false advertisement). You would definitely get sick swimming and playing in that water. I wanted to do the elephant wash with the water hose instead (which was a lesser price than I originally paid). I wasnâ€™t asking for a refund, only a different activity. Seemed simple right?; â€¦

This facility is NOT a sanctuary. Legitimate sanctuaries do not allow elephant rides or force the elephants to perform ridiculous tricks. Elephants are wild animals whose spirits must be broken in order for them to submit to human instruction. This is generally achieved by separating baby elephants from their families, isolating, restraining, starving and repeatedly beating the elephant until they finally submit and can be trained. It is irrelevant where these elephants at this facility have come from. Continuing to exploit them for rides, tricks and baited physical interaction is not in their best interest and keeps them in a perpetual state of fear of being beaten if they do not follow instructions. Also, elephants are not anatomically designed to carry weight on their backs; â€¦

date post: Ashton Mattingly wrote a review Feb 2019
text: This has to be one of the most memorable and amazing experiences ever! We were unsure if we wanted to ride elephants in Bali so we researched and found Mason Elephant Park Sanctuary. These amazing animals have either been rescued or naturally breed in this stunning facility. Every single elephant is loved and cared for immensely. All commands are done with voice control and gentle pressure, no different to riding a horse, and taught through repetition and reward too! Not a â€˜bull hookâ€™ in sight!! They are having just as much fun interacting and playing. Not once did I feel like they were unhappy or mistreated. The Mason Family are doing amazing work for the elephants and the people of Bali. Next time I would love to stay at their lodge and support their amazing cause! Itâ€™s safe; â€¦
title: Luxury Resort with Elephants! An absolute MUST in Bali!

date post: Ronan D wrote a review Aug 2015
text: This hotel is worth the money if you are staying near Ubud. It is a unique experience offering up close and personal encounters with these amazing animals. The safari park is located outside of Ubud and if you stay there has three shuttles a day going to and from the hotel and a taxi will only cost 150-,000-200,000 IDR if you miss it so not the end of the world! The staff are courteous and you get a welcome drink on arrival. We were "upgraded" to a room looking over the male elephant area from a paddy view room so not sure if it was an upgrade or not. The rooms are fantastic with a lovely bathroom, all the freebies you need (shower gel, shaving foam, toothbrush etc) and a huge shower. The beds are hard mattresses but comfortable and the air con and fan keep the room nice. There; â€¦
title: Amazing experience

text: This is a great experience for the young and old.I have been here twice now and highly recommend it,Id suggest you get your own driver so you can leave when you want.You can just get entry into the park without riding an elephant or you can get the entry and ride.There is a show on after your ride and you can get beautiful food at the restaurant too

This is a great place, my only regret is that we were not traveling with our kids, they would have loved it! Booking from afar and only going by reviews on TripAdvisor I will admit I have reservations. Didn't know if this place would be too kitchy or even too touristy so the park completely surprised me. The elephants were all so happy and healthy, we actually witnessed a vet taking poop samples of the beastie outside our room one morning just to make sure she was healthy, very cool. The place is pretty pricey but worth getting the room with the park view and my husband and I found the very best time to see and hang with the elephants was early morning right before the sun came up and you had the place to ourselves. Food was petty good although lunch is the same as dinner and; â€¦

This is a great way to see the Elephant Safari Park! The rooms are incredible and the staff ius SO nice. If you can find a good offer on the Internet, it is really value for money. After the park has closed you and the other guests are the only ones in the park and you can still interact with the elephants. The room was incredible - the only thing that could prevent you from sleeping the the rain forest - it is really loud at night - but an incredible experience! I can only recommend this hotel!!
title: A marvellous place to stay for nature and elephant lovers

text: This is a MUST place to visit...Next trip I'll definitely be staying overnight. Our group did the night safari Highly recommended it. Right from the start the staff are great, very friendly and informative. The grounds and gardens are absolutely beautiful, has a very relaxing vibe. WOW what an experience interacting with these amazing Elephants and their keepers. Truely wonderful learning all about them and the handlers are so friendly and will gladly sit and talk for hours about their Friends the Elephants. The buffet dinner was so so yummy, coconut curry lamb and thai beef salad would have to be the stand out dishes for me and a nice selection for deserts. Can't wait to go back.
title: Once in a lifetime experience!

date post: Joseph G wrote a review Jan 2017
text: This is a special place for kids and grown ups alike. The service is extremely attentive, food is good and rooms lovely. And of course the stars of the show are the elephants. The ability to interact with these majestic creatures is something you'll never forgot.
title: Intimate with elephants

date post: Laura S wrote a review Apr 2015
text: This is a truly magical place, we stayed here for 1 night only and I wish we could have stayed a bit longer. The accommodation is absolutely first class, the staff are wonderful, the gardens are a truly special experience the food is as good as any we had in Bali.. Elephant Safari Park and Lodge is about more than just being a very good hotel, it is about Elephants, truly happy Elephants, Elephants that wonder about following their Mahout because they want to. Step out on to your Balcony at 3:00 AM and listen to the sounds of the Park and you will pick out the ghostly shapes of majestic Elephants occasionally flapping their ears or swishing their tails and probably eating. We were fortunate to meet with Nigel Mason, as my daughter has been fundraising for a charity that Nigel; â€¦
title: Perfect Birthday Weekend

text: This is an amazing experience....believe all the previous reviews! It's a must do! Being collected at your room by a beautiful elephant and her mahout and walked off to an alfresco dinner under the palms - romance in the extreeme. Feeding the babies, scrubbing the mums at their morning bath, laughing at their antics and marvelling at their gentle plodding natures. Wonderful! The room was gorgeous, with turn down service and a sweet snack treat each night. Staff were unbelievably friendly and proud of 'their' Park - an absolute credit to them and management. Just fabulous. Just go!
title: Elephant Paradise in Bali

text: This is an amazing park with an amazing story. I cannot speak highly enough of this beautiful place. Swimming with the elephants is an experience I will never forget. Words cannot describe the joy you feel when watching these magnificent animals interacting with their trainers, visitors and each other. Everything from the staff to the accommodation and grounds all excellent. Well done. ðŸ‘ðŸ¼
title: Should be on everyone's wish list, I can't recommend this highly enough.

text: This is an experience not to be missed , especially if your an Lephant or animal lover â¤ï¸ðŸ’œðŸ˜ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ðŸ˜we absolutely loved it ! He rooms are great Lephanrs everywhere, even though bed has Lephant legs ! The bathroom is huge and the Lephant comes and picks you up from your room to take you to dinner ðŸ˜ðŸ˜€ðŸ˜ðŸ˜€ðŸ˜ðŸ˜€ðŸ˜ðŸ˜€ðŸ˜ðŸ˜€ Wow Ow and Wow !!! â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸ðŸ’ƒðŸ’ƒðŸ’ƒðŸ’ƒðŸ’ƒ The breakfast at Mammoths Head Lounge Bar is just to die for and h restaurant serves fabulous buffets with fresh food, I bought souvenirs for my family from the gift shop which are just adorable xoxox His is a not to be missed opportunity when not Bali ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ðŸ˜â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸

This is an experience you have to have. Firstly because this is an elephant sanctuary that houses over 30 elephants that have been rescued from poachers. The money you spend goes for a good cause. Secondly it's an incredible experience. I Felt so humbled by the strength this beast has. We opted for the full package including lunch.... Good is excellent as is the service. This is a Bali attraction you do. Riding elephants was also very fun. The park is very well organised and everything is very clean too.
title: Disappointing

date post: Billy M wrote a review Jan 2017
text: This is essentially a money making tourist attraction and is in no way a 'sanctuary' for the elephants. Unfortunately we found this out too late after buying our tickets at a travel agent. After speaking with one of the handlers, the elephants are made to do a minimum of 17 rides a day round the same small track and are chained up to their concrete circles after the tourists leave. You can see the puncture scars on the elephants heads from where they have been brutally trained by the keepers with pick-axes (which they carry round with them in their belts). Please do not go here. It is a money making industry and has no interest in the elephants' well-being at all. We also saw the owner who was filming one of his many dvd's in the park (which are sold in the gift shop along; â€¦
title: THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER

text: This is my 1st experience here in Elephant Safari Park and was quite disappointed by the experience and information given. -For the Elephant Ride Tour I paid total of Rp.2,6million/2pax just to stay for 1h55m bcs the park's driver asked us to leave (fyi We took this tour as a personal tour and not as a group tour) When we spoke to them,they response that its our fault that we dont use private car and took their shuttle (which they said its provided with the package) If I knew this was the case, i think i would never even consider on paying for the tour package and the fact that i felt rushed out of the building without a choice. My suggestion just save your money or go Safari Marine Park Instead !!

This is not a sanctuary! Elephants are chained and forced to perform silly tricks in front of tourists. The area is small and everything is about creating an experience for the tourists - not about the animals welfare! Baby elephants are stressed and swaying back and forth

This is not what we expected at all. We got a driver and made our way out from Ubud to see these elephants. This is very much like a zoo. Elephants are chained up and giving rides all day. They are not free to roam around and some just walk with their saddle until new tourists arrive for a ride. Our driver as lived here his whole life and never been. He said its just a tourist trap and he has heard many people who leave dissatisfied. The cafe serves american style food and is called the Ivory Cafe. Its also very expensive to just get it. Not yo mention if you wanted a ride. There are some really breath taking things to do and see in Bali, this is not one of them.

This is relatively a small elephant park. We started from our hotel in Nusa Dua which took us about 1 hr and 45 minutes. Once you pay and receive your entrance ticket and lunch voucher, you walk to the main area. Once there, they call your name and hotel name for the rides. Surprisingly well organized. The elephant rides were approximately 30 minutes. You may also purchase baskets of fruit for 50,000 IDR and feed the elephants which was a fun experience! Then you can watch a show in the small arena. (There was one at 11:00 then again at 12:00, I'm sure if there were more) Lunch was nothing special with simple foods like beef and chicken satay, rice, curry and minestrone soup and French bread. There were also desserts of pastry and fruit. Other reviewers really seemed to; â€¦
title: Well organized half day tourï¼ŒGreat fun for my kid

text: This is the best Elephant Safari and ride place on Bali. There are many other options but no other have the cleanness, organization and nice environment. Even though it is almost 2h from Nusa Dua beach this is the best option on Bali and you will spend the whole day there. As a recommendation buy the full package (park + elephant ride) and this will include the transportation and the meal there.

This is the perfect place to get some peace and quiet and experience beautiful elephants first hand. The staff were so friendly, The elephants are well looked after and swimming with elephants was incredible. Highly recommend spending one or two nights here.

This Lodge is about 2 hours out of Denpasar and will cost $US50 if you take their service. THe location is beautiful though. We got that about 10am as we had to leave early the next morning for a flight. We completely screwed up their itinerary but they squeezed all the activities into one day for us. In total we probably only spent 3 hours doing everything the park offers. While the elephant tour was only about 20 minutes etc, the highlight for my fiancee was the swimming with the Elephant, Mr Wong. The elephant would dive in and out of the water and go on its hindlegs. It was a rare experience for her and she loved every second of it. As for the room, this is where things went down hill a little. The room was ok, the pictures were a little misleading in my opinion. There; â€¦

date post: Ozzy travel wrote a review Aug 2016
text: This lodge is situated at taro bali jungle... very good place to entertain my kids... lots of elephants... good thing is that the complete lodge area is clean and there is no bad smell... we also had experience a heavy rain at night... elephants are very friendly... we enjoyed stay there!
title: Amazing place!!

text: This park and hotel is definitely the most interesting part in my trip in Bali. Visitors can feed the elephants at any time. Even though we did not book through the hotel website, the hotel offered us the whole package (including elephant day safari and some other activities) as well. Nothing to complain. I will certainly visit this hotel again, but with my kid in the future.
title: Elephant experience

text: This park experience exceeded our expectations. The grounds were lovely and the elephant park was very enjoyable. We learned about elephants from our "driver" who is dedicated to his specific animal. Our 30-minute ride seemed longer and it was pleasant traveling through the jungle, spaced far apart from the elephant in front and behind so it seemed we were the only ones there. Our guide accommodated us with photos on his elephant. At the end of the ride, the elephants walk into a swimming hole and have fun with the water (with us on top!) People can purchase fruit to feed the elephants. There is a little show a couple of time a day, showing the elephants performing tricks. The buffet lunch was great and the gift shop had LOTS of souvenirs of all kinds! The lodges must be quite; â€¦
title: A real thrill

text: This park is seriously one of the best places you can be in Ubud. You practically live a few hours of your life with elephants. You can wash them, feed them and ride on them. I personally enjoyed the elephant safari the most as the trail takes you deep into the jungle and you can see all kinds of weird stuff you wouldnt find anywhere else. I saw a HUGE spider (though it wasnt poisenous) and all sorts of tropical fruit like coffee beans and cocoa. The guide was awesome and he was really helpfull

This park should really be an example for the park businesses per se. Amazingly well kept facilities and animals. Friendly and professional staff everywhere. The park is part of a series of businesses under the same umbrella, all of them striving for excellence. Great packages available

This place has so many good reviews and stars but for me it was a different experience. I love animals and when choosing to go on vacation to Bali elephants had to be included in my journey. I was not crazy about coming here but I wanted to be close to these magnificent animals so I decided to give it a shot because it has great reviews. I booked a bathe with elephants and breakfast package. We got picked up early at 5:45am our driver dropped us off, we had someone guide us into the park and explained what we needed to do. I see there are elephants everywhere but they are chained up unless they are with they're mahout (trainer). They have 2 elephants set up next to a pond, they give you a hose and brush so you can "bathe them" basically wait in line do it for a few minutes; â€¦

This place is a jewel. I traveled here with my wife and 10 year old. We are in love. To bath, swim, feed, ride and play with these giants is amazing. My kid loved the pizza and we loved the food, staff, and room. I have nothing remotely bad to say about the place. If you are traveling through Bali. A one or two night stay will make memories that will never be forgotten. Maybe this place will lead to others being made. The world could use a few more.

date post: Robyn S wrote a review Jan 2015
text: This place is a must. The accomadation here is just amazing and the views breath taking, if you like elephants..which I do. We had an itinerary on arrival of two full days, which we found so convenient, rather than asking for the times of shows, elephant rides, elephant pick up from room to dinner etc. The interaction with the elephants and staff is very close and personal. The staff are very knowledgable and friendly, and you can ask them anything, they are aways willing to oblige. Would I stay here again, oh yes in a heart beat.
title: A beautiful end to 2014

text: This place is absolutely fantastic. If you are an animal lover, the chance to touch and play with elephants is magical. 30 elephants and 3 babies. You can wash them, ride them feed them and just soak them up. The baby elephants wrap their trunks around you arm and play tug a war. The hotel is stunning, the food incredible, service so friendly. We did a great package with transfers, parkview room, breakfast and dinner. It also included a day and night safari. Imagine riding a gentle giant thru the misty mountain on a romantically lit track. Then having dinner in the palm grove, candlelit tables set with white linen , the noises of the elephants all around you WOW! The 5 course meal absolutely beautiful. I cannot recomend this place hghly enough
title: Absolutely amazing

text: This place is amazing! Went above my expectations. ALL the staff were super friendly and helpful. They were trying to help taking photos of us, playing with the elephants and person who was riding our elephant was really friendly telling us about the hotel and how they care of the animals! I'm really happy I went there!
title: Experience of a lifetime

date post: Phoebee A wrote a review Aug 2012
text: This place is amazing, it really is! It is difficult to review as there are two seperate entities, the elephant park itself, and the hotel/lodge area, so I will start with the lodge itself. As hotels go, this is right up there with the best. I think the lodge area deserves a review of it's own because it is absolutely worthy of special mention. The rooms are HUGE, even the basic paddy view ones, and are very pleasant; absolutely worthy of five star accomodation. Everything that should be included in top notch accomodation is there, super comfortable bed, safe, air con, sattellite TV, power shower, etc. I could not fault the room at all. Even the small touches, such as the bed having carved wooden elephant feet, the face towels in the bathroom being folded into the shape of; â€¦
title: Had lots of fun!

text: This place is so relaxing. We ended up buying tickets online for entry, which included the elephant ride. We arranged our own transport using a local driver (only paid 400k). We entered the safari park, fed the elephants and then we're treated to a 15min show. We then had a elephant ride through the safari and then had lunch in the lodge. Definitely worth while going but don't get ripped off by local tour guys, check online for offers!

This place is well and truly worth every cent you pay. I can not speak highly enough of the staff, accommodation,food, tours and of course the elephants. Our visit was so much more than we had expected. I can't wait to go again.

This place really is located in one of the most breath taking surroundings ever. I did really enjoy my time here. The bedrooms are chic, clean and very spacious the beds are comfy and the bathrooms are lovely. However I canâ€™t help but feel like these elephants should be free. I understand they are taken care of but Elephants belong in the wild. Not chained up at night. Granted these animals are pampered every morning and have regular baths, food and attention but it still doesnâ€™t feel right- money is being made off their captivity. I was under the impression that these animals were allowed to roam around care free at a distance of the hotel guests, but you have elephants in daily â€œtalentâ€ shows and they are constantly being told to pose for pictures and carry tourists around.; â€¦

date post: Samuel C wrote a review Aug 2018
text: This place sells itself as a "sanctuary for elephants", but this is completely false. It is yet another cruel animal attraction. Elephants here are forced to perform acts and carry tourists around on elephant rides. Elephant rides are NOT comfortable for the animal and cause long-term damage to the animal's spine. The elephants are also chained on metre long chains before their performances. They lie to guests about the "reasons" for chains and elephant rides. It was heartbreaking to see the elephants. I regret not researching this place properly.
title: Lovely visit.

text: This place was amazing. I definitely recommend staying there. Swimming with the elephants was the highlight but you can also feed them, go on a safari ride, and get picked up by an elephant for dinner. Get a park view room. It was so cool waking up and seeing elephants outside your room.
title: Great...Great..Great Experience = Worth the price

date post: Tamara M wrote a review Dec 2014
