text: This place was fantastic! There is plenty of learning to be done with the museum and the mammoth bones. We rode the elephants for maybe 30 minutes and even walked through the elephant pool. There was also an elephant show where the elephants did tricks like play basketball and carried the trainer on its trunk. The best part though was feeding the elephants and taking photos after the ride. The staff helped us stage several photos with the elephants and were happy to take the pictures with our cameras (so we didn't have to buy anything extra). Some of the best photos from our Bali trip came from the Elephant Safari Park. We paid about $200 USD for the four of us to ride elephants and tour the park, and it was well worth every penny. A very memorable day for us!
title: graeat!

text: This place was incredible!!!! Firstly, I need to address some of the reviews I have seen. Yes the elephants are chained up for parts of the day, but this is for yours and their safety! The elephants were rescued so they are still wild animals - I agree that we would rather see them in the wild but the world isnâ€™t a perfect place, they are happy and safe at masons! The whole morning was great, washing the elephants, riding them and then the breakfast was simply lovely! They are currently building a new roaming area for the elephants which will mean less chains and more freedom - win! The only was they can fund the new development is by having people visit, so go! You wonâ€™t regret it
title: Awful place.

text: This review is going to focus on the benefits of staying overnight at the Mason Lodge as we felt like there was a lot of ambiguity as to what you get. This won't focus on the treatment of the animals which you can decide for yourself based on other reviews. We stayed 1 night at the hotel and while it was great to see the elephants, we felt like the employees were intentionally ambiguous to us in what we received for staying at the lodge vs what we had to pay for out of pocket. To be clear, the only things you get for staying at the lodge, outside of the room, is: -Free entrance to the park and access at all hours -20% discount on any of the elephant activities (see picture for list and prices when we went in July 2019) -Elephant ride from your room to dinner at 6:30pm, about; â€¦
title: Amazing place

text: This sanctuary for Sumatran Elephants was an absolute joy to visit. Highly recommend getting up a bit earlier to wash and bathe with them. Yes they chain the over night and sometimes during the day. But this to stop them running amuck and stealing each other's food. Definitely happy elephants is what we saw and interacted with. A bucket list experience.
title: A fantastic day with gentle giants

text: This trip was actually totally unplanned. We just decided to spend our 2014 holiday at Elephant Safari Lodge a week before our departure :) Good choice ! We captured a priceless moment. 1. We came around 3hours earlier,without any notice. Lucky us!They gave us early check in. 2. The MAMMOTH museum !! I dont think I can find it in other place in Indonesia. If you have kids, this should be in your no.1 list ^^ 3. The Room and amenities were good. No complaint at all. 4. Breakfast, dinner, or doing SPA with direct view to the Elephants? We got it here !!! 5. Not to mention the romantic Elephant night ride, elephant show, and many more..love it !! This is my best : I FELL in LOVE to the ELEPHANTS !! I've never imagine it before. They are so loveable !! My favorite, is Jegek, the; â€¦
title: Was sceptical about doing an elephant ride but

text: This was a great experience to interact with elephants in their day to day routines. Getting picked up from my room by elephant , daily talent show and night and day safaris were all apart of the intinerary. my personal pick was the elephant bathing which allowed me to get up close and personal with the animals at what appears to be there favourite time of day.
title: the best hotel we had in 1 mond

text: This was a great place to spend a few hours; however, if you are short on time, skip the elephant ride and hang out with the baby elephants. The trainers are very friendly and were very happy to get the elephants to pose for pictures....it was a great excursion.

This was a really good day out organised by the Trans Resort for us. The driver that took us was very interested and extremely in hurry to get there. But once we survived the ride we watched the Elephant show, walked around the other enclosures and had a 35 minute Elephant ride which was very enjoyable. After all this we had a very enjoyable lunch that was included in our ticket price and had a very wide range of food
title: Love

text: This was an absolutely fantastic elephant ride activity! The venue is beautiful, and our tour guide was very friendly and chatted with us through the 45 minute or so elephant ride. The live elephant show is also great fun and a buffet lunch is also served. The staff also take fantastic pictures for you with the elephants, which come out amazingly! Highy recommend

This was an event like never before, and so calming, while yet an adventure beyond expectations. The owner discussed in detail about his interest in saving the dying-off Sumatra elephants from natural causes and tusk-Ravens. He took it upon himself, with much challenge from many, to open The Sanctuary. He made a point of us knowing that the elephants "only do what they want to", so if the elephant is feeling down one day it does not take riders. You can see it in the elephants' spirit that they are happy to be there. They actually smile! The handlers train them to do sweet things, such as hug you with their trunk, while you get a chance to see them up close and pet them prior to riding. Their original handlers, if they had one, were relocated with them to keep them; â€¦

This was an experience that my husband and I will remember for a long time. First we helped wash the elephants, then we got in the water with them. Followed by feeding them. Each elephant has their own carer who is dedicated to looking after them, they build a bond and connection with each other. The park is clean and well maintained. The elephants are very well looked after.

This was definitely the highlight of our very recent Bali trip. The park it self is so well maintained, the gardens are beautiful and the elephants are so well cared for. The staff are so helpful and nothing is a bother. The interaction with the elephants is amazing and the staff will happily click away with your own camera so you have lots of photos. We had transport from the hotel which was great. The owner of the park has done an amazing job with this park and the care of the elephants he should be very proud. We Didn't stay at the lodge it self but if we came back to Bali we would consider doing a couple of days.

This was my second time visiting Asia. My first visit was Thailand. While in Thailand, I was able to spend a day at a true elephant sanctuary where the elephants are free to roam, they are not put to work, they were not chained, and they werenâ€™t bombarded by flocks of tourists. When I decided to visit Bali, I was excited to visit with the elephants again. My friend came across the Mason Elephant Park. We checked out the reviews and decided to make a reservation to feed and wash the elephants. We made our reservation directly through their website which was very easy. We had quick replies and all questions answered.the park has its own drivers and they picked us up in a private car at our hotel in Sanur to transport us to the park. Our driver was very polite and friendly. The; â€¦

date post: Moataz S wrote a review Jan 2017
text: This was my second visit to the Lodge. Came in Oct 2016 with my sister and just had to bring husband and 11 year old son here too. Visited Jan 2017 with them. Everything about this place is top notch - great staff, great facilities and great environment. The elephants are lovingly cared for and certainly well treated. They respond to voice commands and appear to enjoy their work. We stated in a Park View room which overlooks the elephants, which is just amazing. In the morning we washed and swam with the elephants which was just amazing. I love how the staff are more than happy for you to take as long as you want interacting with them and feeding them and will take as many pics on your own device for you. It's not cheap but for the incredible experience, it is well; â€¦
title: Best hotel ever

text: This was not part of our original plan for visiting Ubad but turned out to be a very good call. The drive is not too far from Denpasar and it passes the Jungle Swing and the majority of tourist attractions in the area. The service is extremely sufficient, the food and drinks are amazing and the scenery is beautiful. The rooms are very spacious and fitted out for luxury. We liked watching the sun go down over the rice paddies and enjoying the hot nights at the open air restaurant and bar. The buffet dinner is a must as it includes many local dishes and is cooked to perfection. The bar has a few cocktails that are exclusive to the venue and are amazing. PLEASE listen to staff when they explain where the animals are from and remember it is a RESCUE center.This venue is not; government funded and they rescue elephants that would have been enslaved to work or would have died of starvation or worse. They are beautiful and majestic but they are still wild rescue animals. We think they do an amazing job (granted I don't work with animals) with limited space and limited funds. Please ask questions if you are concerned and don't jump to conclusions. We had an amazing once in a lifetime experience. We sat each night watching these giants sleep, swaying in the moonlight and serenading us with deep rumbling voices. Thank you to everyone there and we hope you continue with the good work.; â€¦

This was not part of our original plan for visiting Ubad but turned out to be a very good call. The drive is not too far from Denpasar and it passes the Jungle Swing and the majority of tourist attractions in the area. The service is extremely sufficient, the food and drinks are amazing and the scenery is beautiful. The rooms are very spacious and fitted out for luxury. We liked watching the sun go down over the rice paddies and enjoying the hot nights at the open air restaurant and bar. The buffet dinner is a must as it includes many local dishes and is cooked to perfection. The bar has a few cocktails that are exclusive to the venue and are amazing. PLEASE listen to staff when they explain where the animals are from and remember it is a RESCUE center.This venue is not; government funded and they rescue elephants that would have been enslaved to work or would have died of starvation or worse. They are beautiful and majestic but they are still wild rescue animals. We think they do an amazing job (granted I don't work with animals) with limited space and limited funds. Please ask questions if you are concerned and don't jump to conclusions. We had an amazing once in a lifetime experience. We sat each night watching these giants sleep, swaying in the moonlight and serenading us with deep rumbling voices. Thank you to everyone there and we hope you continue with the good work.; â€¦

This was not what I had expected at all . The elephants including the baby elephants were chained to concrete pads when they were either not giving rides or performing in a patronising show . In speaking with the handlers ( who obviously care deeply ) they confirmed that the elephants have no time EVER to roam freely or socialise with the other elephants . They also said this was the law that elephants must be restrained at all times. The animals were either depressed and vacant or swaying in boredom with their legs chained up .I came home feeling really sad for these amazing intelligent and sensitive creatures had been exploited so badly .
title: Bathe with gentle giants

text: This was one of the best days we had in Bali without a doubt. I was initially a bit worried about how humane the park would be but after my visit I have no worries at all. We had a 30 minute elephant ride through the park which a brilliant experience. The merhuit of the elephant we rode was completely in love with his elephant and referred to her as his sexy second wife. He was very talkative and informative. We then got to feed the elephants by hand and watch them perform Omar show of different tricks. The park was immaculate and the elephants were extremely looked after. A must do in Bali.

This was our first time riding an elephant, and we loved it! Our guide was super friendly and really interesting. Our Elephant was Roxy. We were fortunate not to be in a big group and went around the track by ourselves. The food was great too and very reasonably priced. A must day out!
title: Absolutely Amazing

text: This was our first trip to Bali and being animal lovers we decided that we would stay here for 3 nightâ€™s .This may well be one of the best decisions we have ever made. The accommodation is outstanding and the service from all the staff was second to none. We chose to stay in a Paddy view room and loved every minute of it. The room was excellent and the bathroom amazing. The restaurant is fantastic and the staff very helpful and all spoke good English. The gardens are spectacular with orchids growing everywhere. Now to the elephants. I have been involved with animals of all species most of my life and this place is one of the best I have ever seen the elephants are relaxed and there was no sign of any stress or mistreatment of any kind. To have the chance to wash one of these; â€¦
title: Worth Every Dollar! Highly Recommended

text: This was our second visit to Mason and we enjoyed it every bit as much as last year (if not more). Friendly staff, great food, absolutely beautiful and well-maintained grounds. What more can I say? Oh yes..... the ELEPHANTS! We fed the elephants by hand, petted and cuddled them, went on a ride through the grounds and also got to gently pat and cuddle the new baby elephant (who was very curious and affectionate of his own volition). What an experience..... Let me say that we are very discerning about which animal facilities / zoo's / parks we patronise (and yes, we did pass on a few animal-oriented experiences in Bali - based on some reviews we'd read beforehand). But let me say these elephants are very well loved and cared for. Most are rescue elephants and are experiencing; â€¦
title: Nice but not quite like the pictures

text: This was possibly one of the best experiences of my life and would defiantly go again. The elephants are just awesome and seem to be so well looked after and happy. The highlight for me was seeing the baby elephant having so much fun in the pool, although swimming with the elephants was totally awesome too. The staff are fantastic, the food is also pretty good and reasonably priced. I highly recommend the buffet in the evening with a few bintangs! The accommodation was superb. I would definitely stay overnight â€“ as well as the fab accommodation you get picked up for dinner by an elephant and get to eat breakfast looking out to the elephants.
title: Glad we stayed here!

text: This was probably the best experience I have had in my life. it was roughly $150AUD including transport to and from your hotel to ubud and back. Including touching washing feeding swimming with the elephants and an elephant ride. Also includes a breakfast which is delicious (not the bacon) Got to swim with the elephants,,,, in there pee and poo (yuck) but they have shower rooms for you then a breakfast afterwards. On the elephant ride it is bumpy and quite long i would say 20mins. The carer is very lovely and chatty. Honestly the best experience of my life and my fondest memory of bali :) I RECOMMEND IT !!!
title: Finally saw elephants

text: This was such a great experience. We got to wash, feed, pet and ride the elephants. The restaurant and gift shop were very nice and the grounds at this preserve were gorgeous. You can stay the night here as well.

date post: Victoria L wrote a review May 2017
text: This was the best day of our holiday - the elephants were amazing!! We booked the breakfast and bathe package even though we didn't plan to do the ride, however we needed the pick up as were staying in Seminyak, and didn't grudge paying extra when the money goes to the park. We were picked up at 5.45 in Seminyak and arrived at the park around 7.15 am. We arrived and were slightly sad to see them chained however when we thought about it it wouldn't be great to arrive to them charging and fighting with each other! We were first moved on to bath them which was fun and they seemed to really enjoy it - at this point they are slowly being unchained from their stations and are roaming free with their trainer over to the bathing and pool area (they have to be chained when not with a; â€¦
title: Mrs Vicki Leathard

text: This was the highlight of our Ubud trip. This wonderful, clean facility treats their elephants with respect and care. Plenty of food and water, and the visiting tourists can pet and fawn over these precious animals. Their eyes are soulful and they are clearly taken care of. They have free treats for the elephants and you can also buy (cheap) baskets of goodies to fed them and get their attention for photos. The staff goes out of their way to get you "the perfect" photo. Such a close and unique Experience, can't get any closer than we did. The lunch after the show was quality and good. Definitely would go again and again... can't get enough of the elephants !!!!
title: Amazing safari

date post: Kavita B wrote a review Sep 2019
text: This was the most amazing and inspiring place to stay, we just did 1 night as it isnâ€™t cheap but it was worth every penny, the elephants come and collect you from your room at dinner time and the food is yummy, the staff are amazing and the welcome drinks are a lovely touch upon arrival, the elephants are clearly well cared for each one having its own human that has clearly bonded well. Masons is the only rescue centre in Bali and I really feel grateful to have been fortunate enough to have had the experience.
title: Great Stay

date post: Fabio Corbellini wrote a review Aug 2012
text: This was the second time I've visited this park. Elephants are well looked after and I love being able to get up and close to them. The elephant ride is always a great experience. Lunch here was great we had a full buffet lunch included in our tour price. Definitely visit this park when in Bali!
title: Must see attraction on Bali

text: This would have to be one of the best highlighs of my life. absolutley loved every minute of the 2 days I spent there in May 2012. The elephants are amazing and apear to be very happy and very well looked after, the babies are so cute. There is nothing negative I can say about this place, staff are amazing, food was first class and the rooms are just brilliant. Planning to return if possible next year to see the new baby elephant, thank you Nigel and Yani for sharing your dreams with others, may you be truely blessed for this.
title: Highlight of my Bali Trip

text: Thoroughly enjoyed the elephant experience. The story of how the elephants came to arrive at the park is quite moving and to see they have had successful new arrivals is great to see. Take some shoes with grip as the park pathways can be a wee bit slippy!

Thoroughly enjoyed this park. The elephants are friendly and is evident that they are well cared for. The grounds are immaculate. The trek is great finishing in the water where they elephants can cool off and refresh. The buffett lunch has a good selection of dishes. It was a very good experience and i would recommend this place. A definite highlight. Oh forgot to mention the show. The elephants play soccer and basket ball. So cute!
title: 1 night staying at the elephant lodge

text: Three days like a dream. The pick-up service was perfect, the check-in warm and professional, all the staff from reception to mahout most helpful, friendly, competent, the food very fine specially the breakfast. to wake up and go to bed with elephants, to get close to them, to feed them was a wonderful experience. To learn about the background of these elephants, their rescue and their live now showed us that captivity is not ideal BUT what Nigel and his team did is fantastic! The animals are well taken care of. they seem to enjoy their live, Whiskey looked like smiling while doing the hula hoop. Thank you so much for a marvelous birthday present. And - I love my painting from Desi! Sincere thanks to all of the Elephant Safari Park team!!!
title: bucket list

date post: Sue K wrote a review Sep 2016
text: To be honest, we almost didn't go to this park because my husband was convinced that the elephants were unhappy and didn't want to support that. After going and seeing how the elephants are treated, we were both glad we did! We did the elephant bathing in the morning, which I highly recommend. All throughout the park, workers are more than happy to take pictures with your camera, and they also have a professional photographer taking pictures. It was about $20 USD for all the pictures on a USB stick. The pictures that were taken with our camera were excellent too though. And free. When we got there, we set to work scrubbing down the elephants. They seem to really enjoy it and it gives you the opportunity to get up close and personal right away. Then, you ride the elephant; â€¦
title: Awesome Experience

date post: Alp Korhan wrote a review Feb 2019
text: To see the elephants in such a beautiful well laid out place which is clean is fantastic. The staff truly care about what they do and you can see the elephants are well looked after. No pressure sales here or to ride them if you donâ€™t want to. Excellent to feed them and having photos was a highlight
title: Enjoyed our time

text: To The Owner & Manager of Elephant Safari Park, I wish to Thank you and your wonderful staff for the fantastic experience my family of 5 shared on Wednesday 15th June at your Elephant Safari Park. My Husband and I came to your Safari Park 13 years ago before children and wanted to come again with our children. This was my daughter Grace 5th Birthday and it was everything and more than we could have expected. I had sent a letter prior to our arrival that it was her Birthday and organised a birthday cake during the banquet, but the way your staff treated our family was so beautiful and Grace will never forget that day. Upon arrival the staff knew it was her birthday and she was included in the Elephant Show. The presenter was so lovely with her and kept reassuring her, so; â€¦

Today I visited this place and was so impressed. We got to wash these beautiful animals and learn so much about them and their past struggles and how each elephant ended up at the rescue centre. The park also has live video streaming for you to watch if you are wanting to see how the animals are treated - which is great. Personally, my boyfriend and I washed and fed a beautiful 30 year old elephant who had been rescued from a government holding in Sumatra. It was one of the most amazing experiences ever!
title: Had a fantastic stay, highly recommended

text: Together with my husband and two boys (3 and 5 years old) we travelled around Bali during christmas and new year in 2009. One stop was the Elephant Safari Park Lodge. This is a place that I'll always remember with a warmth around my heart. Arriving at the hotel the entrance and reception I got a bit disappointed. The staff was very friendly but the "interior" did not look that welcoming. But once entering the park and hotel area, and especially the room - that was something else. We'd chosen a room with park view. The room was very spacious, modern, clean, comfortable beds (and the extra bed for my son was already made and there where four towels - which has never happened before during all our trips) and best of all - a wonderful view over the park. We had the elephant resting; â€¦
title: Unforgettable encounters

text: Too expensive to stay at when you look for a budget rooms but still worth the visit at least as a safari guest ;) The animals are treated well and look happy, the owners seem to have a good cause (I suggest searching some documents on this place on youtube before going) saving elephants from Sumatra and I don't know where else. The place is very pretty and includes a pickup from your hotel and then a drop-off, buffet of european breakfast (epic) and several unique interactions with elephants that you cannot get in a normal zoo. You shower and scrub the elephant, you bathe with them, you ride them and you feed them, and during all that time staff are cheerful, nice and helpful with taking pictures of you. They take some proffesional ones too and you can then purchase them, have; â€¦

Took my Grand children and we all so enjoyed it. To be able to interact with these beautiful animals. We rode them, learned about there life, fed and interacted with them. The children loved every minute. Surroundings beautiful, lunch great value as smorgasbord which was part of our package. The gift shop had some reasonably priced mementos. I would recommend this place to anyone.
title: Once in a lifetime setting - not cruel from our experience

text: True elephants are not from Bali and would always be better in the wild.... That is is WE human beings were not taking all their space for our cities, our plantations... all the elephants in this park would probably be gone or in bad conditions if the Mason family would not have saved them, cared for them and given them such a large space to continue their life, with enough food, medical support and away from abuse. The lodge is a great experience to approach and understand the animal, interact with them with a dedicated professional team around. Congratulation for the work. It's a real dedication. Beautiful and original Secret Retreat!

Unique concept of combining an elephant park with resort within the lush greenery of Ubud, Bali. Highlight of the stay was being picked up by an elephant right at your suites balcony. Another great feature was sipping on Bintan (Indonesian Beer) while watching the elephants or going for an elephant safari before dinner. Overall a great experience, especially with my two kids. Ubud area itself is beautiful with lots of greenery and laid back markets for bargain shopping.
title: An amazing time

text: Uniquely different place to stay + relax + new experience The room very cozy, match with village atmosphere The food.. hmmm yummy.... two thumbs up for the restaurant manager (Mr. Bagus)
title: Fantastic, unique experience away from all the hustle bustle

text: Unlimited access to a one on one experience with the Elephants. Cleanliness and top facilities in rooms/bungalows,modern and serviced each day. Meals really good......as an Australian I LOVED the crumbed lamb cutlets at the restaurant. I was sooo impressed with the marhours care of their charge. The elephants having been rescued, it was so rewarding to see their devotion to these beautiful creatures.

Upon arrival, my husband and I were very disapointed and actually made a reservation to stay in Ubud as the accommodation was not pleasent. The room itself was dirty and dingy and the toilet did not flush properly and smelt of sewage and poo. However, this was not the reason for us wanting to leave. The Elephants appearance made me feel personally uncomfortable and depressed.. We went to bed following a mediocre dinner by the Elephants which was even more heart breaking watching them stretch out but confined by a chain. My husband wanted to expirence the elephant ride to dinner but would not do so alone so I accompanied. The mahout said that each elephant has a trainer to which they make a personal bond with and come to understand their characteristics which was reasuring. Our; â€¦

date post: Rasha Joseph wrote a review Apr 2018
text: Utterly delightful stay at this top quality venue - very comfortable, every detail thought through and the best bit of all of course, being collected by elephant taxi from our room to be transported to dinner!
title: Magic Experience, Magic place to stay

text: Very exciting seeing the Elephants as we woke up! Very spacious, clean well appointed room with large bathroom and excellent air conditioning which was most needed! Lots of fun to interact with the Elephants under the guidance of their handlers. Beautiful paradise resort if you love elephants!

date post: Steve O wrote a review Dec 2015
text: very nice staff was lovely enjoyed every min of it so relaxing stayed in paddy view room but will stay in park view next time the food was to die for so loved riding the elephants in the water first day of stay the elephant guides were lovely second day only got to ride for around 5 mins ?? but still enjoyed it loved talking to guides about how long they have been there and to find out they love the owners and he looks after them like family
title: Sanctuary for Elephants, Bonding for Us

date post: Ash J wrote a review Jan 2017
text: Very underestimate to the local tourist especially at the souvenir place..we asking the price of dress for our daughter and very takes time to answer it..and than with the bad intonation he answer the price in US Dollar..so what... we already know before..it would be charged in US dollar but there is no price at the dress that we would like to buy. He prefer to serve international tourist even though only buy 1 thing not more than 300thousand rupiah and pay with card and it very takes time. My husband was getting angry and pay more than 1.000.000 in cash...so very underestimate..and in the restaurants also dissapointed..that was the first and the last time to stay there...
title: Wonderful experience

text: Visited here as I believed an elephant â€˜sanctuaryâ€˜ meant the elephants would be well looked after and have a bit of freedom compared to some parks etc. The elephants are chained up all around the park unless they are being ridden by ignorant idiots. Majority of the elephants were swaying and looked extremely depressed/bored/angry. One elephant was so frustrated, probably out of boredom or depression that he was swinging into the concrete bars and throwing sticks at people and the trainers. Another elephant was chained up with his food just slightly out of reach and he was struggling so much to try to reach his food and be able to eat !! I felt sick walking around this park knowing I had paid and contributed to this park. If I knew the elephants would be so distressed and sad I; â€¦

Visited late afternoon to bath and feed, not ride. Paid over 1200k for two people for a ten min â€˜experienceâ€™ of washing. The washing was a drizzling hose pipe and two small hand brushes under a dark shelter covered in elephant poo. Didnâ€™t expect that. Didnâ€™t seem enjoyable for elephant or us, Not sure about this place at all but feeding them was nice. Elephants are chained around the park for what seems to be show for hotel guests

Visited the elephant park last week and loved it. The elephants seemed to be well looked after. We had a 30 minute elephant ride and our guide seemed to really love his elephant. The guide was really friendly and chatty throughout. The best part was feeding the elephants as you were so close to them.

Visited the elephant safari park last week with a gf for the first time. It was just awesome!!. We "scrubbed" the elephants, we sat on them in the pond (& got wet). Then had a lovely brunch, and finally got to ride them around the sanctuary. The Park is beautifully maintained and the staff that we spoke to are really passionate about their job. The elephants get a bit cheeky when you feed them the fruit & veggies. I did see a couple with leg chains on, but this was apparently for their safety as some get aggressive with other. A really awesome morning with these beautiful animals.
title: Elephant love

text: Visited the elephant sanctuary August 2018 after putting it off due to concerns over welfare to elephants but can honestly say itâ€™s an amazing place where the elephants are happy and well looked after. Each elephant has its own guide who they adore. Our only concerns were the riding of elephants (which we didnâ€™t do) & the chaining up of the elephants which you frequently read about but after speaking to one of the park staff and reading the signs there are benefits to these things happening in the volume of which they do. In brief, an amazing place which we would encourage everyone to visit during their stay in Bali! A 5 star rating from us!

Visited this park a few days ago, absolutely brilliant, nothing negative to say, staff friendly, elephants happy and well cared for, food lovely, definitely recommend, best trip i have done in Bali, i read lots of negative reviews on here before i went at it almost put me off,what a load of rubbish, people need to educate themselves on why things are done a certain way at the park, go and see for yourself, brilliant experience.
title: Amazing

text: Visited with friends as part of a day tour. We went along with an open mind, having been to similar venues in Thailand and Sri Lanka. As per several other reviews, the elephants are chained - albeit for 'safety issues'. They otherwise appear well cared for and happy. Our friends had not visited a sanctuary before and although we all chose not to ride the elephants, they wanted their photograph taken with an elephant, as a late relative had done here 20 years ago. This particular elephant was starting to look a little 'fed up' with the attention and indeed, rebelled a little when our friend sat on its leg, as instructed by the mahout....and consequently pushed her away! The elephant show lasted around 15 minutes and the animals seemed to be happy and enjoying showing off. Food; â€¦
title: Great

text: Visiting the elephant safari park was not on our original to do list of things to do in. Bali. But whilst staying in Ubud we were talked into it by our driver and as we have small Children we thought let's give it a try. I am so pleased we did. The safari park is world class, there were a lot of elephants and I did not see one of them chained. We had a ride on a gorgeous girl Ellie called Dena and had plenty of time for photo opportunities and feeding the elephants and see the babies. There was a wonderful energy to the placed and we walked away feeling uplifted by our experience there. My 4 year old daughter woke up the next day asking to go and see the elephants again.
title: Enjoyable experience

text: Was extremely shocked to see the way these elephants are cared for. Based on the reviews and the website information we thought this was a sanctuary where they would be cared for and happy. Many of the elephants rocked side to side which shows stress. They all have small concrete circles which they call â€˜padsâ€™ that they are chained to and also have to sleep in the chains all night. The staff said this is to stop them fighting with each other. The elephants were pulled round by their ears and shouted at by staff. The worst thing we witnessed was they had a very sharp tool in the shape of a hammer with a very sharp point on the end in which they used to poke the elephants in the head. When I questioned staff about this he said itâ€™s for tourist safety encase the elephant runs.; â€¦
title: Fascinated

text: Was great to be able to see elephants up close like this. Keepers obviously really care for the animals - as close to nature as you'll get (apart from a full safari). Facilities at the park are really good - the restaurant was top notch. Well worth a day out when in Bali
title: Bucket list ticked off with this visit..

date post: Jack B wrote a review Sep 2016
text: Was surprised to see that the majority of elephants are kept in chains with the seats on their backs, let alone that they are actually doing rides on them still. The place is not very big. I honestly did not feel very good with myself for giving them money after I saw the elephants.
title: Such well kept!

text: Was unsure of what to expect, we paid for elephant scrub and ride with lunch . Was pleasantly surprised at no point we were rushed, so had plenty of time to connect with the animals . Lunch was buffet balinese style , with fruit and dessert, drinks extra. Was great to connect with home while here on â€œ Earth cam â€œ so many great shots taken by friendly helpful staff. Special attraction one month old baby elephant great patting this little fella , free transfer from our hotel in ubud
title: Amazing Experience

text: We (me and my husband) took the option of "breakfast with elephants". We took 2 hours to make it to this place from Kuta, but all worth the effort. We got chance to bathe with elephant, and enjoy our breakfast watching them play around. There was an impressive elephant show as well. Most important of all "elephants were happy there, which made us happy too :)"

We all loved it, loved the elephant rides and thought it excellent value for money compared to what else is on offer....we are always wary of anything to do with animals in Bali as often we have found the animals (see Turtle Island review and then DONT GO THERE!!) but this, along with the bird park is clean and humane...
title: If you love elephants, come here!

text: We are a family of 4 - 2 adults and 2 small children. We arrived to a very efficent and fast check in and since we arrived early, the room was not ready. Staff quickly took our luggage to our room so we could wander around the park and get some lunch. Our baby was getting tired so i asked if we could get into our room earlier, the staff were lovely and got our room cleaned quickly (but still to an immaculate condition) so we could put the baby to sleep. It was very much appreciated. Our room was beautiful, overlooking the park so we woke up to see the elephants. The room had everything you needed, very clean marble loarge bathroom, comfortable bed and beautiful furnishings. Nice touches such as a welcome letter, elephant books to read and the DVD we wanted to watch on the owner; â€¦
title: Just perfect

date post: Mena B wrote a review Aug 2012
text: We arranged a pick-up from Nusa Dua via emailing the Elephant park. We were picked up at 12:15pm and made 2 more stops to pick up 2 other couples from near-by hotels. We arrived at the park at 2:30pm, the traffic makes it very slow-going. We paid $77.40 per person, which includes lunch. We were given vouchers for the lunch, which we were instructed to take first. It's a buffet lunch which was nothing special, but we weren't really hungry anyway. You have to pay for drinks at around 25,000rph for a soft drink. This was then followed by an elephant show, lasting around half an hour, where you see the elephants perform tricks, paint, play games etc. It was then another hour and a half wait until our ride on an elephant, which we spent feeding the elephants, watching the; â€¦
title: Incredible!

text: We arrived at the Elephant Safari Park by private car, we were warmly welcomed by the staff and walked around to the Elephant ride. This was on my bucket list and something I had wanted to do for a long time. We were at a height with the back of the Elephant so getting aboard was easier than I expected, a seat belt crosses the chair to keep us on board. To start with it was a very bumpy ride until we got into the swing of things. Our elephant was called Bibi she is the biggest female elephant and she and her trainer were great. We had a 45 minute ride around the jungle safari track, ending in the pool for a walk around in the cool water for Bibi. Her trainer answered all our questions and helped take photo's for us after the ride. It was an amazing experience for us and thanks; â€¦
title: Elephant Safari park Taro

date post: Tracy J wrote a review Jul 2017
text: We booked a Bathe and feed the Elephants/breakfast package. Had a great time with these magnificent animals. We started with scrubbing a 5 year old and also spraying water from a hose. The elephant is trained to "hug" you (wrap their trunk around your legs or waist. They were NOT chained down or had any tool used on them to comply. The trainers know their animals well and used words and what seemed like positive reinforcement the whole time. We then moved on to the water pool experience. I was veryyy nervous about getting on because they used a bit of a wobbly 2 step up ladder. (I think it's an accident waiting to happen. You are barefoot...I would suggest more of a short platform and not an aluminum step.) I did end up getting off NOT using it but instead just on the side of; â€¦
title: Amazing Elephants and more Elephants

text: We booked a day trip through Viator- through TripAdvisor, and booking went smooth and easy. We were scheduled for pick up in Seminyak between 7:30-8 am. The trip took 2+ hours there- so if you're travelling with children, make are you have some games or other distractions at hand, once the views become a bit less interesting. Also you're advised to bring some water and snacks along for the bus journey. Once you get there it is a beautifully planned park where there are many many elephants. The atmosphere is relaxed and the animals are well cared for. They all get rest days and they seem happy. They're not 'forced' to do anything, but they pose so well with you to take photos. They appreciate it if you buy a small fruit basket to feed them- but you can also feed them with bamboo; â€¦
title: Once in a Lifetime

text: We booked a one night stay in your garden villa which included time with the elephants breakfast, show, bathing and a swim- it was absolutely amazing. After travelling to many locations around the world the experience that you provide is second to none. The staff are knowledgable and eager to help, your passion for elephants is very clear throughout the park and what you have created is truly magnificent! Keep up the great work will certainly recommend to everyone back in Melbourne.
title: Awesome

text: We booked for the elephant lodge and it was really worth getting up at 5am for. The trip up there was quite long (from Kuta) but with all traffic here, itâ€™s a bit hairy, and can take awhile. Took us roughly 1hr 40 to get there, but once we did arrive, it was great. Crisp, cool, fresh air and the elephants chilling out on their own little allotments. We all got the chance to hose them down, scrub them and take lots of pics. All this was done in family blocks, so none of this barging in free for all. Next was actually climbing onto an elephant whilst it was in the water. There were quite a few lazing around having a good time in there and they seemed to enjoy the interaction. They wade around and dunk themselves under the water, all while you are on their back. That was a great; â€¦

We booked one night in one of the park view rooms so we could watch the elephants. This proved to be a very relaxing and interesting experience just watching different elephants â€˜dealâ€™ with their food. Whether it was what they chose to eat first, or whether they wanted to put the grass on their head before demolishing it! We really enjoyed our stay. Waiting for our elephant taxi to arrive to take us to dinner we thought was a lovely thing to do. Dinner was very good, we took advantage of buying it in advance, 3 courses, an amuse bouche plus tea and coffee, but we did feel it was rushed. No sooner was one empty plate taken away then the next course arrived. All staff were all helpful, amazingly cheerful and made the stay a good overall experience. The lady doing the breakfasts; â€¦
title: Horrific

text: We booked the breakfast with elephants through elephant trek and at very late notice too, they had no problem sorting us out and arranging it all for us. The experience is well worth every cent and the elephants are amazing, the breakfast buffet was very tasty. A great all round experience!
title: wonderfull experience

text: We booked the family adventure 2n/3d. I have mixed feelings about staying at the park. The visit started out on a sour note, but then got better. As check in was 2pm and we had to be out of our other hotel early, we asked for early pick up as transfers are included in this package. The car was right on time and we got to the park and were given a warm welcome just after 12, with enough time to wander round and have lunch at the park before checking into our room. I returned to reception to check in just after 2pm and was told that our room would not be ready until 2.45pm. I said no problem - could the children have an elephant ride whilst we wait (as supposedly unlimited elephant rides are included in the package deal). We were told yes and to see the guide in the park.; â€¦
title: Great Experience

text: We booked the hotel on-line and got a realy good deal. The hotel and the park was excellant and much better than I could have expected. We stayed in a paddy view room which was the most basic room the lodge does and it was fantastic and had a great view from the balcony. The park itself was a dream come true and being able to get so personal with the elephants was unbelievable especially bathing the elephants and the rides were great. I would deffinatley suggest staying at the lodge if you can afford to as you get to have the park to yourselves in the morning and the evening and the park is quite a long way from the hotel resorts. It took us 2 hours 30 mins to get to the park from Nusua Dua so if you are just visiting the park for the day it is along way to go. The elephants are; â€¦
title: SHEER MAGIC

text: We booked the safari park & lodge using a two night for the price of one coupon late last year. We had a fantastic time and is a must see for animal lovers. The elephants are beautiful. Our only gripe was the ridiculous taxi fares that the resort charges. Unfortunately due to the secluded nature there are no 20 balineese drivers waiting to give you cheap morning price cab fares so we were forced to just accept it. If you can arrange your own driver from a previous destination I would recommend doing so. Apart from that, the friendly service is what you come to expect from the balineese people, and the restaurant food is typically ordinary, but doesn't detract from the amazing theatre and experience of being there. Two nights is definitely enough. Boredom would certainly set; â€¦
title: Once in a lifetime experience - a must!!!!

date post: Olivia Grace S wrote a review Sep 2017
text: We came here as a part of our honeymoon and thoroughly enjoyed the elephant safari. We booked the activity directly as a package with a return taxi, elephant ride, show and lunch. Overall great natural experience with friendly staff.
title: Incredible Experience.. definitely worth a visit!

text: We came on a Taro Adventure package. Price was high but it was worth it for the experience. Good: Room was good and clean. However, my foot got cut by the bamboo floor mat. Definitely have to be careful on it. They tended first aid very quickly. Elephant experience. We feed, rode, played and bathed the elephant. The daughter (7 y.o) was over the moon for the experience. Elephant t-shirt painting: Paid for daughter to be painted by the elephant. US45 for about 3 mins but it was worth it. Staff: Excellent all around. Buffet dinner: Good but not spectacular. A-la-cart: Good to above average. Massage: Good but price is high compared to the rest of bali. Service: Excellent. Room cleaned twice a day. Breakfast: Good but choice is limited. Pool: Too small really, just a slightly bigger; â€¦
title: WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE

text: We came to the elephant safari park during our stay in Ubud. The park was beautiful, the staff was so friendly and welcoming. The elephants were truly amazing. I loved riding through the jungle on the back of our elephant Melanie. Our guide gave us a lot of insight into the elephant park and Balinese culture. We thoroughly enjoyed being able to be so close to the elephants, it was like no other place I have ever been. I loved watching the talent show where they painted, played basketball, soccer, etc., it was all pretty incredible. The safari ticket also included a wonderful buffet lunch overlooking the elephant park. I could have stayed there all day just watching the elephants, it was one of my favorite parts of our trip and a definite must see if you are anywhere near Ubud!
title: Rather disappointing

text: We chose bathe and breakfast with the elephants and it was absolutely wonderful! You get to ride and play with them in the big pool (watch out for the 'coconuts') the mahouts were fun and loved the elephants, just a great experience. Elephants all looked after exceptionally well, immaculate grounds and an interesting ride after breaky before the show. Truly if you like elephants then do it.

We chose to go to Elephant Safari Park and Lodge because it was advertised as being recommended by the late great wildlife lover Steve Irwin. The grounds and restaurant were just beautiful and the accommodation looked lovely also. However I was a little shocked to say the least over how the elephants were treated. Maybe things have changed over the years?? I know the elephants were all rescued from certain death and have a second chance now being at the park but why still make them do tricks, ferry tourists around on their backs? The worst was seeing the ones chained up when 'not in use' on individual "pods" scattered around the property. Elephants are social creatures, why put them in this solitary confinment? They would just stand there rocking back and forth trying to pull; â€¦
title: Well cared for elephants

text: We come at 10pm, the staff very helpful. They up grade my room, its woww for me. In the morning, i look arround, the view is awesome, they have many elephant. Garden & elephant cage is very clean. If you looking different situation, far from the city, fresh air, beautiful elephant, dont forget to choose this hotel. Love it. Love it.
title: a must visit !

text: We couldn't believe how available the elephants are. When we visited, there were about 40 of them, several very young. They are rescue animals from Sumatra and seem in great health. They are tethered at night, which is a little bothersome, but when you see them splashing in the water and playing with their mahouts, you almost forget about it. We washed them, fed them, swam with them (!) and fell completely in love. The staff is wonderful, the accommodations were fine (good, clean). The elephants come to pick you up for dinner each night. Close to Ubud, the must-see cultural center of Bali. We had a ball, both in town and at the Park. Next time I might devote several days just to the elephants.

We did a day trip to the elephant safari park and have mixed feelings about the place. The elephants are beautiful and it is lovely to get up close to them..although don't expect it to be a personal experience there's too many visitors also wanting that experience. We chose not to ride the elephants, as we don't agree with that, but were led to believe that the elephants when not being ridden have some freedom to roam. This is not the case and they are kept on a 1m leg chain. The younger elephants appeared distressed at this. The 'show' is 10 mins and other than that there is nothing much else to do. The grounds are beautiful, but can be walked around in half an hour. The food is nice and about twice the price of the same elsewhere in Ubud. The shop, pricey. We only did a day; â€¦

date post: Sandy C wrote a review Jun 2019
text: We did check out before visiting, it was approved by the late great Steve Irwin, abides by UK animal laws and has many reports from animal welfare organisations. It is explained that you will see chained elephants, which is always a sad sight. They say it is to a) prevent bullying, b) stop elephants stealing food and c) to comply with Indonesian law on unattended elephants. The gardens are nicely landscaped, you walk over the treetop walk and can see most parts of the park. You then wander past the "wash bay" and walk around the lake where you have the swimming experience. This lake is teeming with goldfish, all eating on the "parcels" left behind by the elephants as they walk around, before being scooped out for compost. There is an elephant feeding post where you can buy a; â€¦
title: An amazing place to stay

date post: Loretta J wrote a review Nov 2016
text: We did not stay in the hotel - we visited for the day to meet some elephants. Absolutely amazed to be able to interact with these phenomenal animals. You can feed them, touch them and play with them. I believe some people may be under a false impression of how the elephants are treated. When unsupervised the elephants are chained and have their own paddocks to freely roam. They are big, wild animals and because there are far more males in the group than is natural they do fight. If the elephant has his or her handler then they can roam freely. Each elephant has their own "hooman". This man (I didn't see any women, though there may be women hoomans) dedicates his life to his elephant. The elephants do not share hoomans, and they all have one. These men spend years of their life; â€¦
title: Amazing experience

text: We did the bathe and breakfast tour here. Our children loved it, especially climbing on the elephantsâ€™ backs and going in the water. It did feel a bit like a conveyor line - through scrubbing the elephants to then getting in with them. I also felt a little pressurised to tip all the elephant handlers. I did not like seeing all the elephants chained up and clearly bored - rocking back and forth. They are in the process of building a â€˜free-rangeâ€™ are which should hopefully help with this. I left with mixed feelings - these are elephants that have been rescued and they do have a successful breeding programme, but Iâ€™m not sure the elephants have a great life here :-(. My children absolutely loved it though!

date post: Jessica M wrote a review Apr 2019
text: We did the wash, swim and breakfast package. It was all amazing. The wash was cool as we got to get up close to the elephant (however if I was on a budget I would skip this bit) The swim was really cool. I had to pinch myself..... I was sitting on a elephant in a pool.... just amazing. They have showers for you to wash afterwards and towels to use. The breakfast was delicious and everyone including my fussy daughter found something to eat. Nice coffee too. Then we went back to the elephants and fed them. This was incredible. You can either buy food for 50,000 or there is heaps of free stuff. This was an absolute highlight of our trip.
title: Iâ€™m on the fence.

date post: Abby L wrote a review May 2018
text: We didn't stay in a Lodge at the park, but I have visited Elephant parks in SE Asia before, and this was by far the most professionally run and upmarket. It actually annoys me the comments on here about the Elephants being abused, and it not being a sanctuary, nada nada... Yes, it's a tourist attraction, well, that's why you came isn't it? You can see the money spent by said tourists is ploughed back into the business, the place is super clean, the elephants are well fed, well loved by their mahouts, and are in excellent health. We got up close and personal to Zoe a young elephant by giving her a good scrub and hose down lasting about 25 minutes. She was very content, there were no chafe marks from chains or harnesses on her body. Her keeper obviously adored her, and she; â€¦
title: Animal lover and activist

text: We didn't stay in the lodge but we had a one day visit. The locatiom is great and only half hour from Ubud. The elephant park is really beautifull and you can learn a lot of thinks about the elephants. You can also do some activities with the elephants. I thinks that every one who vistis Bali and special Ubud should visiti the place. Great for families also.

We enjoyed our stay at the elephant Safari lodge. The staff were happy to help whatever time of day, free shuttle in to Ubud town and the food was amazing. We enjoyed a few elephant rides, I just hope they aren't just used for shows and rides.
title: Thrilling and fun ride on the Sumatran Elephants!

text: We had 8 days there it was amazing,the elephants are so contented and happy,they swim every day, their handlers give them dust baths and then baths them everyday.We had the joy to do it everyday and swim with them as well.when it was hot they were taken to seperate cover and hosed down fed and rested,there is no cruelty ,they are fed and areas constantly cleaned.Rooms fantastic clean welcoming and nothing was spared in comfort,Dinner was either al-a-carte or boffet for both lunch or dinner,and food was perfect,many choices and plenty of it,requests were also taken with no problem.,staff from gardeners to even the owner Mr Nigel Mason ,who i met had time to chat and made us feel welcome,we saw weddings ,commitment ceremonies and watching all the elephants swim at lunch time as; â€¦
title: It's That Good, We Got Married Here

text: We had a brilliant time staying in a park room view. Because of where the room was we got to see the elephants and their carers (mahouts) up close and not under the spotlight. To say they are cruel and mistreat is just inaccurate. They are very caring towards the elephants. Living in captivity obviously has its limitations to what the elephants can do but they are so well looked after and fed, and the elephants seem very happy! It seems theyâ€™ve been saved from bad experiences, so whilst I donâ€™t 100% agree that captivity is best, they are well looked after here. We thought the experience was superb. No request is too much for the staff here. Food is good, staff are friendly, rooms are great. It was a very memorable time. Because there is not a lot in the surrounding area (this is; â€¦
title: Elephant Park

date post: Sridhar n wrote a review Sep 2017
text: We had a fabulous experience here. Each mahut care so much for their individual elephant as my ranger refers to his elephant as his second wife!! This place is wonderful all the elepha rd here are rescued and they have even bread 4 elephants. The experience is truly amazing the elephants are all well cared for.
title: Words cannot explain

text: We had a great afternoon at this 5 star venue, you might think it's expensive but you certainly get what you pay for at this very lovely venue. Facilities clean and modern and staff very friendly. Wonderful afternoon out.
title: Mary the elephant

text: We had a great day and the elephant ride was the highlight. A bit of caos waiting for your name to be called as our name got miss placed, but reasonably priced for a family. Would have been nicer not to see the elephant chained up and their ankles not so badly damaged.
title: Coolest place!

text: We had a great time at ESPL, very clean environment despite the 30 elephants right in front of the lodge. The park is very well maintained, very clean, and so are the elephants. It is so obvious that the elephants are contented and loved here at the park. The rides are great, being fetched by an elephant is a totally unique experience. The staff are friendly and very helpful, especially the reception staff. The room is nice and clean, LCD TV is great, the free wi-fi is great, the bathroom interior is nice, with a high class natural design . Breakfast was perfect, prepared with taste and class. Hotel location is rather secluded so the free shuttles to Ubud centre really helps. One more thing, I accidentally left my shopping bag in the car on a transfer to another hotel, I called; â€¦
title: If you want to interact with elephants, this is the place

text: We had a great time at the lodge. Everything perfectly organized, program was great. First hotel which surprised us for our honeymoon which was lovely. They nicely decorated the room for us, all romantic and when we came back from dinner we had some cakes and fruits. Really lovely. Elephant ride was great and cleaning the elephants was fab too. Not a big fan of talent shows in general so only went to one which was ok. Dinner under the stars was lovely and the buffet had a great selection of food. Just getting to the lodge and away was a bit of a pain. Would go back!
title: Great day

text: We had a great time with the elephants.The place looked well maintained. You have the options to ride the elephant or just take photos. The staffs were friendly & helpful. We had a great experience there.
title: Elephant Bath & Breakfast

text: We had a great time with the well cared for and friendly elephants at The Elephant Safari Park Lodge. It is truly amazing that you can get up so close to these enormous beasts here. We stayed at the lodge and the rooms, though not elegant, are well designed and comfortable with good TV, air con and internet access. The rides on the elephants were amusing and a treat to be taken to dinner on elephant back. No downsides to this little excursion and a good break from the beach and temples in Bali

We had a lovely time at the Elephant Safari Park! We stayed the evening at the Lodge and the staff and facilities are wonderful. It was a truly unique experience to have the opportunity to interact with elephants during our stay. However, we left the park feeling conflicted about the environment in which the elephants live. It was our impression the elephants would be roaming around (in controlled space) within the park. Unfortunately, that is not the case. When they are not giving rides, taking photos with visitors, or wading in a pool with their trainer, they are chained up on cement pads. It is very clear the animals are well taken care of, but it was unsettling to know they are chained up for most of the day. We only witnessed one adolescent elephant in some distress while; â€¦

We had a lovely time here. The room was very comfortable but of course the highlight was getting up close to these beautiful animals. We watched them being bathed and gently cared for by their mahouts who just spoke to them to get them to turn or lie down which the elephants did happily. Going to dinner on an elephant was definitely a highlight, picked up from your room and helped on at a special gate up the stairs.A bumpy ride but am glad to tick it off the bucket list. Hand feeding them was an absolute joy with their trunks reaching out to your hand. The staff were lovely and friendly and I recommend that if you love elephants you have a night here
title: Spending time with elephants

text: We had a wonderful few days at this resort. It is run superbly, with attention to detail and respect for staff, animals and visitors. The rooms are beautiful and the grounds spectacular, the staff are friendly and very helpful, and the surroundings peaceful and pleasant. But the real highlight - a HUGE one (in more ways than one) - was the elephants. It's possible to ride the elephants, feed the babies, swim with them, scrub them down, and constantly interact with these gentle beasts, which are all rescued animals from Sumatra. Each elephant has its own mahoot, and they are clearly passionate about their jobs. I can't praise this place enough - we loved it, right down to the heart-shaped decoration and honeymoon cake supplied free of charge when I mentioned we were on our; â€¦

We had a wonderful time here! The staff and facilities were great! We got up close with the elephants and have amazing photos and memories! The place was a little difficult to find but we hired our own car ( not at all recommended!!!) and Google doesn't show the correct location on the computer or phone. And there weren't a lot of signs posted but the locals helped us a lot! But once we found it we had a wonderful time and the staff graciously made us a map to get back! We will take away great memories!!!

We had an amazing time and experience.The elephants are truely a great animal. We decided to stay at the park for one night rather than the day trip and we are so pleased we spent the extra money and stayed over nignt. You get to do more with the elephants if you stay at no additional cost, night ride on the elephant through the bush, a morning ride and then wash the elephant and go for a swim with the elephants. Ever washed or gone for a swim with an elephant ?? we both found it a great experience. The baby elephants, there are 3 of them. My wife would have bought one home if she could! we had a great time feeding the baby elephants and every time i lost my wife i found her back down feeding them. The accommodation is very nice, it is as good as any 4 star hotel and better; â€¦

We had concerns about the ethics behind this place and if animal cruelty would be a problem here but as I left I felt reassured that we were supporting a good cause and that the elephants are there for the benefit of their own conservation. Loved petting and feeding them. The facilities are beautiful and well kept.

date post: Amanda G wrote a review Apr 2019
text: We had heard mixed reviews about Mason Elephant Lodge regarding the treatment of the elephants so visited not knowing what to expect. What we found was an extremely well kept place and well looked after elephants. As well as breeding elephants the majority are rescued from Sumatra. We took the elephant ride and was an extremely informative 30 minutes. The park wasnâ€™t too busy and plenty to do.
title: Amazing experience

date post: Sue J wrote a review Jun 2012
text: We had just one night here on a long weekend to Bali but felt we had enough time to do all we wanted to do. The lodge is well set up to provide a complete elephant experience, the only complaint would be they need to cut the bouganvillia off the Mammoth Bar so youcan enjoy looming at the elephants whilst enjoying a cocktail! We had the chauffer elephant, safari ride as well as bathing the elephants and riding him bareback into the water......now that was an experience! The elephants all look well looked after and despite what others have said I feel at least here in the park the elephants are safe and cared for. The buffet under the stars was reasonable value and all the food served was very nice. I would come and stay here again, my little daughter loved it. I would stay longer; â€¦
title: Unforgettable!

text: We had our driver drop us off and we purchased tickets at the front desk. We got entry and a 30 min elephant ride for $90 each. The park is clean the staff are very friendly and the elephants are well cared for. The memories created whilst feeding and riding these beautiful animals were priceless.
title: Fun day out

date post: Kevin C wrote a review Jan 2015
text: We had such a good time at the Elephant Safari, the staff were so friendly, the park and it's surroundings were beautifully manicured. We would recommend this as a not to be missed visit while in Bali. We didn't stay at the lodge but from the view we had I'm sure it would have been great.
title: Theme park hotel. Not Luxury Safari Lodge

date post: Amy W wrote a review Sep 2016
text: We had such a wonderful experience at the Elephant Safari Park & Lodge. Beautiful grounds, friendly staff and comfortable stay in the Garden Veiw room. This was a gift for my birthday and I would recommend going 'full board' as each experience was great! (Morning Washing and swimming with the elephants, safari walk, lunch and dinner) Full Buffet was delicious and plenty to choose from. It was nice we also had a lot of time interacting with the elephants who were not caged and mostly able to roam around the park during the day.
title: torn between amazing and sorry for the elephants

text: We had the time of our lives here. The tour guide we had with the elephant named Arum was amazing. He was very engaging and made sure to let us know Arum's story and ensured us we were not hurting her. The ride was so peaceful (we do NOT go as part of tours and just showed up on our own) and it was a lot of fun riding in the water too. The best part for sure though was getting to feed Arum and other elephants. They love to eat and love bananas, so if you can sneak some bananas in, you will be their hero! Have fun :)
title: Honeymoon

text: We had the very best time here from when we arrived to when we left.We were in a park view room which enabled us to see the elephants up close all night,I found I was soo excited I couldn't sleep I just sat on the balcony marveling at theses beautiful animals..yes their front legs are chained but we were told this is to stop them stealing each others food and fighting at night which seemed quite plausible.In the morning we went and washed the elephants and then rode them in the water ..hilarious fun! we then showered and had a jungle ride on one.It seems they need exercise daily as do we. I have read the negative reviews and pondered over them but they are very large animals and sometimes a little nudge may be needed to keep them in check.Thier carers love them and have mostly; â€¦

We had two nights at the Lodge/Park at the end of our 10 night Bali holiday....it was absolutely fantastic...I took my 14 year old son and my bestie took her 15 year old....they had a great time....they spent most of their time at the elephant nursery hanging with the 3 babies or requesting an elephant to take them for a ride.....We both decided to upgrade to a Park View room which was so worth the extra.....you could almost touch the elephants off the balcony....The food was 5 star ( I had the Australian steak two nights in a row). It was so relaxing to sit on your balcony and read while watching the elephants taking people for a ride or just chilling out....I really admire Nigel for his work in helping these elephants and creating such a beautiful park.....Thanks to Made who; â€¦

we have bin 30 days in indonesia we stay't for 1 nicht in the elephant park it has bin the best hotel we had in indonesia and the service was the best we had if somebody ask us we recommend this hotel olso the food is very nice and the beds are perfect nex time we stay longer and the staf are al very nice peopel

We have just been here today to visit the elephants and to wash & feed them, not to ride them as i donâ€™t support this cruelty, and there were a few things I noticed about the way they treat the elephants; 1. They seemed very drowsy like they had been given some kind of sedative - this is a guess and may not be true but something seemed a bit strange about the elephant that we washed, 2. We could see the other elephants on the safari being ridden by usually an adult and 2 children PLUS the adult who was the handler sitting ON TOP of the elephants head, 3. The handler who was sat on/steering the elephant had a metal rod which he hit on the elephants head to slow down/speed up - very wrong considering they say they are a â€˜sancturyâ€™ 4. You can feed them leaves of a coconut (which; â€¦
title: This is a really odd place

text: We have just left the Elephant Safari Park and Lodge following a 9 night stay there. It has been the best experience of our lives and certainly the best holiday we have had so far (we are now in Seminyak for the last 9 days of our Bali holiday and missing the park so much). We booked after a little hesitation after reading some reviews about the elephants being chained up and the show as we didn't want to be involved in some circus style organisation. However, from the moment we arrived, our minds were put at ease by what we saw, read and watched about the whole safari park and its history. We booked a park view room (room 203) with amazing views and had our very own elephant Ramona outside our room every day/night, we nicknamed him "one tusk" because he has one tusk. We were; â€¦
title: Awesome and Enjoyable.

text: We have just returned from our honeymoon in Bali. A very beautiful island! Our last stop of our stay, was a surprise that I had arranged for my new husband and I, 4 nights at the Elephant Safari Park. I had read the reviews and had seen the pictures, but when we got there, it blew us away. The elephants are so well loved and cared for. Each one is designated its own keeper, some had been with their elephant for many years. The park isn't huge but it is very well thought out. Our 'taxi' (an elephant) would arrive every morning, we'd step out from our room and on to the elephants back. My husband and I would keep looking at each other in disbelief as we just couldn't believe that we were having a nice, long elephant ride. It was brilliant! The keepers' tell you all; â€¦
title: A holiday with a difference

date post: Tony K wrote a review Jun 2011
text: We have just returned from the most wonderful experience, 2 nights & 3 days at this park. Everything about this place was 5 star. From the moment we checked in, the staff, rooms,views and most of all the elephants and their keepers. We did the tropical adventure package and my 60yo husband went white water rafting and had a ball, I opted for an extra 2nd spa treatment in the best Spa I've ever visited. My wish would be that everyone could experience this as we did.
title: FANTASTIC - what an experience

text: We have just returned home from our trip to Bali (July 2010) and just wanted to say that this was the best vacation that we have ever had. The hotel was just lovely from the elegant room to the beautifully landscaped grounds. The elephants at the lodge are such happy and gentle giants and the 3 babies kept us laughing throughout the stay. Everyone at the hotel was so helpful and always available for us whether it be to arrange transport to Ubud or a last minute elephant ride. The staff was always pleasant and did their best to make our trip stress free as well as very memorable. The restaurants were also one of the highlights as we love our morning coffee out on the terrace and the cafe had the most beautiful morning view of the elephants starting out their day. The food; â€¦

We have visited 2 elephant parks in the last 3 days. Hands down winner for best experience, expense, food, park grounds,animal health and welfare is Mason Elephant Park, Taro, Bali. We would go to this park every time whenever we visit Bali in the future and no other. A beautiful day with an amazing experience.
title: AMAZING

text: We have visited the park 2 times in the past 3 months and we absolutely love it! It was amazing to be able to see the elephant up close and interact with them. The Rooms are Also amazing. We could not fault our stay. Canâ€™t wait to visit again on our next trip!

We heard good things about the park ,and we are glad to report it was true , the elephants are loved and seem happy , I got trunk hugged by 2 different elephants, whilst we didn't ride ,we were content to wander about ,talk to the staff and observe . It is quite expensive ,with good reason 31 rescued elephants eat 250 kg each day , better than any zoo .

date post: Natalia B wrote a review May 2017
text: We just came back from a wedding renewal at this amazing place !!! It was the most amazing experience START TO FINISH !!! The wedding planner Dilla is just amazing in every aspect and especially on the DAY !!! The photographers were fabulous and so was the staff at the park . The wedding menu was Sensational!!!! If you have a wedding here you will not be disappointed our renewal went without a hitch the elephants are just gorgeous !!! I have high expectations and the whole wedding was amazing we HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PARK for food accommodation staff and if doing a wedding then Dilla is incredible THANKS SO MUCH EVERYONE at the park !!!
title: Memories for life!

date post: Tiffany R wrote a review Jan 2015
text: we just liked it!. it was realy nice afternoon with lodge friendly stuff and these great animals!. we had a ride with Roxy elephant through the nearby jungle.. on the end of evening there was elephant show, realy nice, and after that a dinner, very tasty.. if you are in Baly don't miss this attraction!.
title: Amazing experience.

date post: Vincent K wrote a review Apr 2015
text: We just returned home after a wonderful 3 days at Elephant Safari Park Lodge. We had a lovely and very relaxing time and we have already recommended it to friends and family. The facilities are to a very high standard, the staff were without exception very friendly and welcoming without ever being obtrusive â€“ everyone from reception to waitresses to grounds-staff to mahouts, everyone! If you are looking for a few days of chill out in a luxury location and close interaction with the parks elephants then you won't be disappointed - they'll pick you up for a ride everyday and they'll take you to dinner in the evening.
title: Great fun, but at what cost?

text: We just went there on June 26th 2017 on a holiday trip as one of our activity. After several times visit Bali, this place made us so amazed.. since we never thought this park was so beautiful. It's really out of our imagination as we had visited several similar park with animals before. This park were very well maintained. It's compact with the mini museum also shop to know more about how they transfered the elephants at the first time from Lampung which was far away from Bali and it's not that simple as we think before we seen the video. We had really wonderful time during spent time with the elephants there. They were so clean and warm. Really memorable...well maintained and very well trained. During the elephants rides we had also nice conversation with the staff who drove; â€¦

We love animals and are in awe of such special creatures as Elephants. Well, if you feel the same way, you must travel to this one of a kind elephant sanctuary. We started out by hand feeding a group of elephants who you can stand right next to. Then we took a 30 minute ride through a designated course on the property that ends by wading through a large man-made lagoon on the back of these beautiful, smart, gentle and awe inspiring animals.

We loved everything about this place! The grounds are quiet and peaceful. The staff is exemplary, always greeting us with a smile. Every evening the elephant chauffeur service picked us up to take us to dinner. The wait staff greeted us at each meal and always remembered where we were from and which dessert my son ate the night before.
title: Beautiful and an experience of a lifetime

date post: Karen A wrote a review Oct 2015
text: We loved it here! Myself and 25 yr old daughter and 13 yr old son. Elephant pick up at room for dinner and the lovely under the stars and huge Royal Palms, restaurant, where the food was beautiful. The elephants are so incredible! Riding bathing and swimming with them!! And the gardens themselves are a treat. The staff at reception, room maintenance and the wonderful people who take care of the elephants were all so friendly and so helpful. We did find the staff in the restaurants a bit standoffish and not really friendly or helpful. The buffet breakfast included in the overnight stay did not offer a lot of choice, and no gluten free bread and no soy or almond milk. Wish we had stayed another 2 days, and wish I had mentioned when booking my daughters food intolerance then maybe; â€¦
title: Amazing animals

text: We loved our experience at the Safari Park. You are able to get up close and personal with the elephants on a ride and feed them. All the elephants seem to be humanely treated and well looked after. The guides were very friendly and happy to answer your questions. The show was interactive and demonstrated what clever animals elephants are.
title: Close encounter

date post: Vicki S wrote a review Apr 2015
