text: We loved the baby elephant show and the ride around the park on one of the biggest males there. Great that we were picked up from our hotel and taken back at the end of the day. Buffet lunch was incredible, I could have eaten there every day. Look forward to visiting again
title: One night stay

text: We only did the safari ride. It was super fun, we got to ride the leader elephant and the guide was very happy to talk to us and answer questions. We got to feed some of the smaller elephants and take some really cool photos. And the show was pretty good too. A buffet lunch was included in the tour and the selection was very good. Plenty of vegetarian options for the boyfriend. The only trouble was at the end. The shuffle we had picked up us and another couple from another hotel. We ended up waiting around for half an hour before we could leave. I just recommend either going in a group or getting a private car.
title: "WHAT A WONDERFUL MAGICAL PLACE"

text: We only did the tour and saw the show. It was well prepared and the elephants are fun to be around with. They are well fed and it shows. We liked the tour in the forest. We also enjoyed playing with the elephants. These animals learned to play tricks on us. The elephants, the nature all around, the water and the many little attractions made a nice package. There is even a small museum.

We only had five nights to spend in Bali and wanted somewhere that would be interesting, clean and with good food. We came across a brochure brought back by some friends and decided that the Lodge would suit us perfectly and we would stay there for all five nights. This was the best decision we could have made. The lodge is spotless, the staff attentive and always cheerful, the grounds beautifully laid out and the food excellent. Because there are only 27 rooms you never felt overcrowded and even when day visitors arrived there is enough space to accommodate all. The special privilege of giving elephants their early morning scrub, watching them play especially the mums and babies, just being able to touch, feed, ride and bond with these magnificent animals is a thrill; â€¦

we really enjoyed the day we've spent in the safari park. there are many other options in bali to do an elephant ride, but this one is definately the best! you get great value for money. we booked the elphant ride and park visit and all transfers, an excellent buffet lunch with a great variety of food to choose from, the entrance in the park and a long ride on an elephant were included. Unlike in other parcs in bali, nothing costs extra! you can get real close to the elephants, take photos with and on them and even the food for the elephants is for free so you can feed them as much and as often as you want. the parc is clean and beautiful and what really appeald to us is that it is self-sufficient, they recycle the water, plant the food for the animals on fields around the park; â€¦
title: Fun But improvements should be made

text: We recently spent 3 nights in the Elephant Safari Park Lodge. Room - we stayed in room 219 The room doesn't look onto much just the pathway and the garden alongside it however why would you come here to spend time in your room. The Room was spacious, set out in a modest Balinese design. Bed was firm but comfortable and I got an amazing sleep here. TV had multiple channels. Bathroom was spacious with a large walk in shower. Steps down into the bathroom a little difficult after doing the Mt Batur climb as my Legs did not want to go down the stairs. Staff and Service The staff were amazing, they catered to our every want, organising the shuttle into ubud, making sure we had our complimentary Elephant Safari each day, and even ensuring we didn't sit next to the noisy Chinese; â€¦

We recently stayed 2 nights at the Elephant Safari Park & Lodge and what an experience! It was everything we dreamt of plus much more. Our 2 year old daughter had a great time, washing, riding and feeding the elephants. All the staff were friendly and courteous. The dayspa is expensive but so worth it! The Mahouts were friendly talkative and answered all questions asked. Both my husband and I swam with the elephants and this was a once in a life time experience. We had a garden view room which was nice and spacious - would have preferred a park view room, just to be able to sit on the balcony and watch the elephants. The only qualm we had was the price of the buffet and that dinner / lunch was not included in the price for hotel guests. I highly recommend staying there; â€¦

We recently visited Bali Adventure Tours Eelephant Safari park after doing the morning bike ride tour with the same company. The buffet lunch provided on arrival from the bike tour was the best spread of food we had in Bali. We then went for a 30 mins elephant ride which was great ,especially at the finish when they walk through a large pool. We expected this to be the end of our experience but after that we had the best time interacting with elephants. We got to feed them and pose for photos while holding their tusks. The elephants quite willing played games with everyone and even raised their trunk when you reqested them to. I was a bit reluctant about the elephants being chained up when we first arrived but after seeing how happy they were interecting with everyone and; â€¦

date post: Sandy H wrote a review Jun 2012
text: We spent 1 night to the Elephant lodge ! It was amazing ! Top notch client experience ! WOW ! It was really fun and we enjoyed it alot ! People are very kind and friendly . We LOVE it! Beautiful Park and the elephants are well taken care of.
title: Enjoyed our Day...A Good Choice

date post: Ross F wrote a review Nov 2016
text: We spent 2 fantastic nights here. Up close and personal with the elephants. Hands on washing them.... be prepared to get wet. The privilege of swimming with them is an opportunity not to be missed. Grounds amazing. Rooms clean comfortable and relaxing. Staff friendly and helpful. Excellent food...and cocktails. Highly recommend a stay here if you love elephants. Well done NigelðŸ‘ðŸ‘
title: Sleeping with the Elephants

text: We spent 2 nights 3 days at the park, The accomodation was first class, meals were fine. Getting picked up from your room and taken to dinner on Elephant back was pretty awesome. Then washing and swimming with them was absolutely fantastic. What an experience !!!!! If you like Elephants then this is a MUST !

We spent a couple of nights at the Elephant Safari Park and, whilst it was kinda cool and unique, ended up walking away a little underwhelmed. Given the cost of entry just for a day, staying overnight is pretty economical. One or two days is certainly enough. Kids will love it in a limited dose. Bear in mind it is a long way from anything (Ubud is 30-40 minutes away), so you are very isolated there - it's the elephants and nothing else (although, I guess that's the reason you go, right?) The rooms was fine, the food was good and the service was ok. Seeing the elephants right up close was definitely cool....but I guess none of it really had the jaw-dropping 'wow' factor that we were expecting. Two days was definitely enough. You'll do the elephant ride a couple of times (our; â€¦

We spent a night late June in the garden view room with 9yo and 12yo for $440 (one was free, one was $40 extra). The room was top quality. Best hotel room I have stayed in. The gardens are immaculate and lush and the elephants well cared for and well treated by their mahouts (I am a zookeeper so have ele experience). They have the same mahout for decades and they really love their elephants. Staying in the park we got picked up from our verandah for a day ride and a night jungle ride, got to go out early and scrub the elephants then have a bare back swim with them one on one behind the mahout. At one stage the elephant was under water swimming. We could go feed them and pat the babies and adults whenever we wanted and watch the show. Dinner was $100 for 4 but the outdoor tables; â€¦
title: Best elephant experience ever.

date post: Andrew Cook wrote a review Apr 2011
text: We spent four nights at the Elephant Safari Park and Lodge in late March 2011. We thought that may be a bit long, but it turned out to be a perfect time. We got to know the various elephants and mahouts much better than we could have if we were only there for a night or two. It's an amazing experience and nowhere in the world can you get so close to elephants in a safe environment. The elephants are well looked after and although it's not a perfect world the conditions would be the best in Asia for captive elephants, and certainly a better future for them than if they were not rescued by the park owner, Nigel Mason. The hotel rooms are comfortable and spacious. The food and service at the restaurant exceeded our expectations and every meal was memorable. Prices were reasonable; â€¦
title: Elephant adventure

text: We splashed out for a night here and didn't regret it. It was on the expensive side but well worth it. The package included meals and elephant experience. The animals were in the best condition and well looked after, maybe slightly over weight if anything. The staff and handlers were top notch and made our stay bliss. The room was 1st class. The dining experiences were excellent. being able to bath a young elephant was magic and swimming with them was too. The handlers speak quietly to the elephants and don't use anything but their voice to work with the elephants. the place is quiet and peaceful and a magical place to be well worth a visit
title: Wow wow wow

text: We staffed 5 nights - I would recommend staying a few nights as you get to enjoy the elephant park on a very personal level with the staff before the park is open to the tourists. The experience builds as you learn more about the characters of each elephant. It was a really fun experience and it was almost heart wrenching to leave the park at the end of the stay. All the staff are extremely friendly and helpful - I really can't emphasise this enough. They arranged a number of activities for us to do a number of things including trips to Ubud, cycling, cooking classes, hotel transfers etc and did so on a very personable level. I'd recommend the experience to anyone looking to recharge themselves.
title: Absolutely fantastic - the best expereince

text: We started our honeymoon at the Elephant Safari park and lodge before moving in to the Seminyak 'tourist area'. I spend about hundred nights a year in different hotels around the globe but never have I experienced anything similar to the Elephant Safari. No words can describe the feeling when you open your lodge's terrace doors and see elephants strolling around at almost a touching distance. Everything at the park was just perfect but might get a bit boring in a long run (unless of course you like to be far away from everything). For a few nights it certainly was an exquisite experience.
title: Great experience

text: We stay 2 nights, we love that you can bath & feed the elephant, specially the 3 baby, who are younger than my daughter ;-) I bring all the free fruit from the room & feed the baby elephant, they actually remember me the next day we feed them again before we leave, so sweet! My daughter keep telling me she want to bath the elephant even after we left. The elephant taxi (pick up from yr own room) is a nice touch. Room is not too big, I thought we will have a bath tube, because my daughter hate shower, but after I told them my concern, they bring me the kid's bath stuff right away, I am a happy mom then. The hotel is very far from Ubud centre (abt 30-45 mins ride) so we stay in hotel for dinner first night, over all food is pity good, breakfast is very good, since we paid high; â€¦

We stay at the lodge, me, husband and my little girl had one of the most relaxing week end. We enjoy all the activities, from watched the animal show, played with baby elephant, ride the elephant to washed the big creature, my little girl love it all. The 'Moment' for us is where the big beauty (elephant) pick us up right in front of our room and take us to lovely dinner, wonderful. Food was well present and taste nice. We did not swim as the pool water very cold, was rainy season. All around we had lovely get away, will came back.

We stayed 1 night in a garden view room and whilst the room was basic the inclusions of elephant picking you up and taking you to dinner, bathing them and swimming with them as well as a jungle ride made this a once in a lifetime amazing event for me and my family! I think if you just came for a day you would be disappointed it's well worth the $ to stay, we got a great deal on Expedia for 2A & 2C $550 if we had have done the day trip with elephant ride would have cost about $260 so it's worth the stay given the additional inclusions. The elephants are beautiful and they seem happy, they are chained by 1 leg for their own safety as they fight with others over food and could kill each other, they willingly lift their leg to be chained and they look healthy and have heaps of; â€¦
title: AMAZING - Will be back

text: We stayed 2 nights, I chose this place because my sister has always loved elephants and I was taking her to Bali for the first time (my 8th time). The price almost scared me off, we needed 2 rooms because I had my 2 teenagers with me as well, I'm glad it didnt. We dont have a bad thing to say about the place. The food was lovely, we did a la carte for dinner and it cost us less than AUD50 for 4 of us to have 2 courses. The professional photographer followed us around for the 3 days and the disk of all the photos cost around AUD3. I would definately consider going back - a welcome change from the kaos of Kuta. When we arrived they gave us a printed itinerary with our activities already booked for safaris etc. It made the stay stress free.
title: Great day out!!

date post: Pete L wrote a review Feb 2012
text: We stayed 3 nights 4 days and had the most amazing experience and would not hesitate to recommend it highly, especially for families, it's an absolute 10/10. We've traveled the world and taken safari's through Kenya, Tanzania, Botswana, South Africa, Zimbabwe, Mozambique, Swaziland, Egypt, Tanzania and Thailand and you will not find a better environment for elephants anywhere else in the world, other than roaming free in the wild. Unfortunately, WE have ruined their world and this wonderful place makes an enormous positive impact on regenerating this endangered species, as they have bred well in this park. I don't know what the Bambi brigade are complaining about....they paid money to ride an elephant, why, if you don't agree with this philosophy? The negative comments; â€¦
title: What an experience

text: We stayed 3 nights and loved it. The people were just great, the most amazing experience for us and kids to have with the elephants and to gain more of an understanding. The service was great and so personal. If you are visiting Bali make some time to stay, it is worth the extra costs.

We stayed at here for one night and what an experience it was. We took our ten year old daughter and she said it was the best experience of her life. The rooms were beautiful, clean and very comfortable. Being picked up for dinner by an elephant was amazing and the prices and the restaurant very reasonable and nice food. The park and the elephants were amazing and washing them and swimming with them in tghe morning was an unforgettable experience....everyone should do it it was an incredible place....One tip don't pay full price as it is very expensive look for cheaper deals on the net.

We stayed at Masons for 1 night as part of our honeymoon in Bali. It had been recommended by my friend who had just visited the park for the day. We upgraded to a room that overlooked where the elephants ate, it was a beautiful view to wake up to. The room itself is big and nicely decorated, the staff noted it was our honeymoon they made us a cake and had flowers in our room. It was very thoughtful. We were taken to dinner by an elephant which was a nice added touch. We fed them, washed them and swam with them all great experiences but for me seeing the little baby was a highlight, soooo adorable. I didnâ€™t see anyone mistreat the elephants and they are all well fed. Iâ€™d recommend staying here.
title: The Elephant sanctuary

text: We stayed at the Elephant Safari Park with our 20 month old son for one night in April 2012. It was well worth it (about $240.00 including breakfast) and I would recommend it to anyone over just a day trip (which costs about $19 each for admission and $49 each for an elephant ride - these are included in the overnight stay itinerary). The extra activities that you get to do by staying the night make it well and truly worth the money (getting picked up from your room by an elephant and taken to dinner, sitting under the stars and having dinner surrounded by the elephants and the absolute highlight of riding an elephant bare back while it takes a bath in a pool before breakfast). The atmosphere at the park is fantastic. The elephants are in great condition (check out the footage; â€¦

WE stayed at the Lodge for 2 nights and had a room overlooking the park which is an experience not to be missed. If you can afford the park rooms go for it as to wake up in the morning and see the elephants outside is just magical. You can stand for hours on your balcony watching the daily rituale of feeding, cleaning and elephant bathing. Being collected each evening and riding to the restaurant on the back of an elephant is just so good. One of the big draws with the park is the three baby elephants born last year. They are just so cute even at the size they are. Very cheeky and playful and to be able to feed and pat them is a rare experience. Taro is about 30 minutes drive from Ubud, but once at the hotel you can get out and about with Bali Adventure tours.
title: The best vacation ever

text: We stayed at the lodge for 2 nights and that was a great experience for the all family. Being pick up for the dinner by an elephant, feeding the elephants, doing a ride with the elephants and last but best experience for me bathing with the elephants is so wonderful and unusual experience. We were all back to childhood. We could see the elephants from our balcony and only that was fabulous. The room itself were large enough for the 4 of us, nicely decorated with all kind of elephant picture, towels which made it special. The staff is very nice and helpful. I also recommend getting out of the hotel for a short walk enjoying the rice fields just outside of the hotel, such a beautiful panorama. If you arrive for check in time and leave at check out time 1 night is enough to fully; â€¦
title: Awesome experience

text: WE stayed at the Lodge for 2 nights for our wedding anniversary and had a park room overlooking the elephants and the park. It is well worth the extra to pay for a park room and wake up in the morning and see the elephants outside. The balcony of each park room gives you a perfect view of all the elephants as they go about their daily routine. For an elephant lover like myself it is heaven being able to watch and interact with the elephants whenever you like. Taking the elephant chauffeur each evening to the restaurant is very unique. The 3 baby elephants born last year are so cute. To be able to feed and pat them is an unforgettable experience. Washing Mr Wong (one of the male elephants) was definitely the highlight of our trip. The elephants are VERY happy and well cared for; â€¦
title: Family with teenagers thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Elephant Safari Park Lodge

date post: Em P wrote a review Nov 2016
text: We stayed at the lodge overnight after spending the day in Ubud. Room was amazing with everything you would expect from a 5 star hotel. The balcony overlooks the elephant grounds which was an amazing experience. Waking up in the morning to all the elephants will be a memory i will never forget. That morning we did all the park activities; feeding the elephants, safari ride and watched the elephants show off their abilities. All the elephants look very healthy and are extremely friendly. Would definitely recommend this to any of my friends visiting Bali.
title: Great experience, nicely treated animals, and a great breakfast buffet ;)

text: We stayed at the Mason Elephant Lodge for 1 night. Service & food is impeccable & the rooms are good. But obviously the elephants are what people come for. There seems a lot of controversy involved with the treatment of the elephants. I would term this place not a zoo or park, but an elephant sanctuary, where someone can pay to stay at the lodge and help care for the animals. This aids their keep & contributes to education. Bathing & swimming with the elephants is a treat that all enjoy. The elephants are cared for individually - washed down, then taken for a swim, which is an obvious delight for them, & everyone else who joins in. They respond to interaction with people, & are respected & treated well by their trainers. An overall enjoyable place to stay. It is also; â€¦

We stayed at the Park for two fabulous nights. If you love elephants then this is the place for you! You will get so much more value staying in the Park rather than a day trip. As mentioned in a previous comment, it is a bit of a drive from the coastal tourist areas but the countryside is beautiful. If you stay at the Park you can have as much interraction as you like with the elephants. We had safari rides, we bathed elephants and rode them bareback in the water! We watched the shows, played with the babies and got picked up from our room by an elephant to go to dinner. The food at the restaurant was delicious at reasonable prices. If offered buffet compare with the Al a Carte menu as it may be cheaper to order what you really want to eat. Having said that the buffet was good; â€¦
title: Love the elephants!

text: We stayed at the park for two nights and loved it. The only downside was how expensive it was (we had to share a triple room to be able to afford it!). We loved the elephant taxi that came to pick us up for dinner. The rooms very very clean and nice. Staff were fabulous and spoke great English. Food was yummy although the buffet was quite deer ($30 per person). Loved watching the elephants swimming while we had coffee at the restaurant. Very glad we stayed here, but two days was enough. Any longer and I think we would have been bored - once you have seen the elephants and ridden them and seen the show, there's not much else to do.

We stayed at the park on our first night in Bali and it really started the holiday on a good note. The staff are super friendly and have good english. The linen on the beds is amazing, as well as the doona and pillows, made us feel like we were in our own bed. Swimming with the elephants was our biggest highlight and something we will never forget. Highly recommend a night at the park.

date post: Pam D wrote a review Jun 2019
text: We stayed for 2 nights and had the best time, this place is just amazing, so many activities to do with the elephants, the staff were so friendly and helpful, couldnt do enough for us and always with a smile. The elephants are well. Cared for and not stressed at all. Such a relaxing start to our holiday. The only thing that could be improved is the matresses and pillows but compared to the experience we had small price to pay. WE WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK!!!
title: Swim with the elephants

text: We stayed for 2 nights as a family of 4 and had an unforgettable time. Service was excellent, elephants chauffeured us to dinner. Must do white water rafting, also owned by company. Totally brilliant!
title: An Experience of a Lifetime!

date post: Lydia D wrote a review Feb 2020
text: We stayed for 2 nights in a park room view. As animal lovers we were a little unsettled at first and werenâ€™t sure if this felt more like a theme park rather than an elephant rescue centre. The elephants are rescued from Sumatran camps so undoubtedly they are living a happier life here, and the elephants do look very well cared for and appear to be treated respectfully. They do look happy and we never saw any signs of distress. The sad fact is that these elephants would be long dead if they were left in the camps or even in the wild, due to poachers and deforestation. At first we felt things like the riding and chaining up were unethical but the information at the park explains that the riding is beneficial for bone mineral density and strength, as they get less exercise here; â€¦
title: The best experience and a wonderful hotel!

text: We stayed for 2 nights in this wonderful place. The rooms where comfortable. The stars of the show are the elephants! They are cared for and have their own carer some who have been with their elephants longer than their wives! Each elephant has their own personality! We got to bathe and swim with the elephants and feed them! The staff are wonderful and the food was amazing! Highly recommend
title: Nice location and fully adventures but the service was very bad especially for local tourist

text: We stayed for 2 nights with our almost 3 year old as he's favourite animal is elephants. This was a great experience for us we loved the tranquility this place offers. The staff are very friendly and open and happy to talk to us about everything and anything we asked about the park and the elephants. To us the elephants seemed very happy and healthy and seemed to like the attention they got from the tourist. the only thing i was disapointented with was in the morning you can "bath" with the elephants I was going to take advantage of this wonderful experience but while watching others, I saw it was not about bathing with them but getting on the back of them in the water so they can pose for photos so I was happy to pass as its not the experience i wanted. The rooms are very; â€¦
title: What a place to propose!

date post: Kim J wrote a review Dec 2014
text: We stayed for 3 days at elephant safari park with the family and this vacation will rank in my top 10 list. Kids loved the royal elephant back ride for dinner(s) and giving showers to the baby elephant. When you wake up to the sound of chirping birds and elephant sounds and get to see a dozen or more elephants from your balcony, its awesome. The price for the stay may look somewhat expensive, but it is absolutely worth it. The service was great and staff were very friendly, and also facilitated our day tours very professionally. 6 stars experience.
title: Even Better than Expected

text: We stayed for a night at the Elephant Safari Park near the village Taro on a recent trip to Bali. It was the highlight of our stay in Bali. The opportunity to get up close and interact with the Sumatran elephants at this elephant sanctuary is something not to be missed. A pinch me I must be dreaming experience. We helped to bathe an elephant, patted and fed the three elephant babies, rode an elephant through the jungle in the day and at night with fireflies all around. There is simply no comparison to the glimpse we got of the elephant baby at the Melbourne Zoo recently. The lodge is a high quality venue and the food was very good. The overnight stay was great value and you practically have the park to yourselves in the morning before the day trippers arrive. Waking up to the; â€¦
title: Amazing and magical- A must see!

text: We stayed for just one night at the lodge as the prospect of interacting with Sumatran elephants was unmissable. It delivered in full as we were able to view, ride, and interact with the elephants. The park caters for a serious number of the animals (over 30 elephants) and appears to be doing a good job of looking after them. The room was comfortable and appropriate for the price, and the staff was friendly, helpful, and very accommodating. Would return.

We stayed for one night. I agree with other reviews in that we believed the elephants were free to roam.. the name of the place (and its website) suggests that the elephants live in a large area. We were surprised to see them chained up and in quite a small area. Despite this the elephants did not appear to be mistreated but this all depends on how you feel about the elephants being ridden for our enjoyment. If you are against this then I suspect you wouldn't go in the first place. The hotel was lovely. We stayed in one of the two paddy rooms inside the park and had a gorgeous view of the rice paddy fields behind the park. This is not a large safari park and as one reviewer also suggested there needs to be some changes. More room and less rides. The food was nice and; â€¦

We stayed for two nights at the Elephant Safari Park Lodge and loved our visit there. The Lake View room we had booked was very nice but too noisy for us, so we were upgraded to a Park View room. This is definitely the room to book, a bit pricy but worth the money. It was the most peaceful experience to sit on the balcony, just 10 metres away from an elephant and watch these gentle animals. When the day visitors had left and the park became very quiet it was even more pleasant. A Must for elephant lovers!
title: Morning trip as part of our honeymoon

text: We stayed here because the resort in Legian we were booked into for the rest of our holiday was full on our first night. According to our 7yo the Elephant Lodge was 'awesome!'. Because we came in straight from the airport, a 2hour drive in traffic, we arrived around 4:30pm. They had everything organized for us including a schedule to get the most out of the next 24hours. First up elephant feeding, then back to hotel to freshen up ready for the elephant ride to the elephant show and a very nice buffet dinner. Next morning elephant washing and swimming with the elephants and then a 'safari' ride through a 'jungle'. We caught the free lodge transport (not by elephant!) into Ubud but could have stayed for further elephant shows and feeding. This is not so much a resort for a; â€¦

We stayed here during our honeymoon on 26th September for one night and had an amazing time. Our room was fantastic and we enjoyed every single aspect of our stay including all our time on the elephant activities. It was incredibly well organised. The elephants all appear well cared for and the staff were all very nice. A special thank you to Sulawandi (I don't know if I have spelt that right) who took a lot of time out to take photos, answer questions and let me feed his elephant Gigi (again not sure on spelling) and the mahout who did our morning safari ride on the 27th. I would highly recommend this to anyone.

We stayed here for 1night as part of our honeymoon. What a remarkable place. The elephants are so well cared for and appear to be happy. We were fortunate enough to get to play with 3 baby elephants. We had an elephant chauffeur from our room to dinner and then swam with them the following morning along with feeding them. Yes the elephants are chained up and this was explained to us as I was concerned but we were told if they weren't they would just damage the resort. Although these are wild animals they would not have survived in the wild and have all been rescued. Please visit this wonderful place.

We stayed here for 2 night in April en route from Lovina to Jimbaran. To be honest, I'd booked it for the kids (well, the older two, aged 5 + 3; the baby was oblivious...) and was fully prepared for it to be a bit gimmicky BUT we were very pleasantly surprised! The room was not enormous but comfortably big enough for all 5 of us (double + single + mini extra bed made up when we arrived - as my daughter said it looked like it was waiting for the three bears! + great baby cot, with hanging toys, provided too). Nice fruit basket in room. The park area was very open and the elephants seemed to have plenty of space, and shaded areas. Predictably enough the kids loved their elephant rides (one down to dinner at night, one day 'safari' and one night 'safari'.... plus one extra ride; â€¦
title: Excellent place to stay, treat like royalty

text: we stayed here for 3 nights as part of our 25th wedding anniversary celebrations and were not disappointed. We had a garden view room which basically overlooked the park view lodges but this room enabled us to have the elephant taxi ride every evening which was a complete joy to see an elephant ambling round the corner to collect you for dinner! we enjoyed talking to the mahouts each day and hearing about their lives and experiences with the elephants. we found the rooms quite noisy as sound travelled very easily between rooms as did any outside noise. Breakfast was buffet style on the terrace overlooking the park, there was a good variety for all tastes. we really enjoyed getting up early to wash and swim with the elephants and this was the highlight of our stay. meals on; â€¦
title: Night safari!

text: We stayed here for 3 nights in April 2011 as part of our honeymoon. What a cool experience and stories we'll tell for years to come, about how elephants took us to dinner! The staff was exceptional (as everywhere in Bali!), just amazing customer service. Rose petals on the bed and in the shower of the bathroom, luxurious accomodations. The elephants are endearing, we loved the night and day safaris. Great restaurant on location. And the staff even gave us a painting by an elephant (paintbrush in the trunk) for our honeymoon! Great spa on site, looking over the elephants. My only complaint is that it is far from anything else, so when you are there, there is only the lodge to check out. I think 1-2 nights would have been sufficient... the third night was still lovely but we were; â€¦
title: A GREAT EXPERIENCE

date post: Leslie P wrote a review Nov 2014
text: We stayed here for one night and really enjoyed the experience. We rode elephants to dinner, around the park, fed them, bathed them, and went in the pond with them Its a wonderful opportunity to get up close to these magnificent creatures. The rooms are big and clean, the food is fine, and everyone working here is very friendly. It is more expensive than many Bali hotels but totally worth it because of the elephants. I highly recommend a one night stay for animal lovers in Bali.
title: Technical difficulties

text: We stayed here for two nights during a two and a half month travelling trip as a treat over Valentines Day and it certainly did not disappoint. We came early so we could spend the whole day in the park before check in, we got a cold towel and welcome drink on arrival along with an itinerary for our few days there along with free food bundles to give the elephants (two for each day) and vouchers for our washes, dinner and breakfast. Check in was quick and easy and they took our bags so we could enjoy the park whilst we waited for our room. The park itself is wonderful, thereâ€™s a museum and information centre about the elephants and the park which we found really interesting and which answered many of our questions about how the park started and how they look after the elephants.; â€¦

we stayed here on a room only, its a great place loved every minute of our stay, got to hear about how the park was started by Nigel Mason and family, met the elephants and just wondered around, the staff are amasing always very helpful but the main attraction has to be the elephants.
title: Amazing!!

text: We stayed here on our honey moon for 1 night, the place was amazing, rooms were very good and clean, and the views really nice.. The review is as of August 2014, I just can't choose dates before that March 2015 The Elephants were amazing and they were well looked after! The shows throughout the day was nice and very fun to watch, my wife got a Elephant to paint on a T-shirt and it was amazing art lool! You can bathe with the elephants in the morning too, which we did it was a nice experience but the water isn't THAT clean lool I mean you can imagine!!... The food however wasn't that great but not too bad either, all in all a very good experience and would recommend to anyone!

We stayed in kuta and traveled super far to this elephant park. The car ride was long, however once we got here, it was well worth it. It was like something I've never seen before and my husband and I had a blast having our first experience on an elephant together. At the end of our elephant ride, we also got to feed the elephants and take some pictures. Overall I would definitely recommend this place and I believe they have a place for lunch as well, very fun and definitely recommend it!

We stayed in the park for a half day, and really enjoyed it. Elephants seems happy to be here. People can touch the mammals and make cool pictures with them. We came by taxi and only bought the original entrance ticket (without lunch, ride and bathing), and I guess itâ€™s the best option, otherwise its pricey (transfer is way more expensive than go by Grab/Uber). Anyways we highly recommend it, this place is a little paradiseðŸ™‚

date post: Hazel C wrote a review Jan 2015
text: We stayed in two hotels on our trip to Bali. Elephant Safari Park Lodge (ESPL) and Alila Mangis. The cost of our accommodation at Elephant Safari Park was slightly more per night but the overall experience was significantly inferior in all aspects, from the standard of the rooms to service and food. ESPL is a solid theme park hotel that children would enjoy. It is cheerful, if not cheap. Our main complaint was that the marketing material, website and press coverage was very misleading in portraying the hotel as a luxury lodge, which it is not. For example, the hotel brochure features pictures of couples in evening-wear dining by candlelight. In fact people should be aware that the hotel grounds also welcome hundreds of visitors day to see the frequent elephant talent shows and; â€¦
title: A must to Visit

text: We stayed one night at the Elephant Safari Park and Lodge and loved it. We purchased the accommodation on the internet and drove ourselves to Taro which saved us quite a few dollars. Included in the cost of the room was a day or night time safari, washing the elephants in the morning and a night time elephant ride from our room to dinner. Because an elephant picks you up to take you to dinner, we chose the day time safari which takes about 35 minutes. The night time safari is about 25 minutes. Dinner was an additional cost but pretty reasonably priced. The park is very accommodating in allowing you loads of time to wash, feed and play with the elephants. There are plenty of photo opportunities too - especially with the 3 baby elephants. Highly recommended by us but if you; â€¦

We stayed one night here while visiting Bali, and it was my favorite night. You are hanging out at the lodge and elephants are all around you. You can feed and pet them anytime. I would highly recommend springing for a park view room... it is worth every penny. The park view rooms have big balconies that overlook the elephants, and it is amazing. It is really nice at night when the day visitors and tours are gone and just the guests are the hotel. The elephant ride to dinner was nice. The food at dinner was good. I wish they gave special access to hotel guests for the bathing and swimming. You are given a coupon and a time, but you are essentially waiting in line/ fighting for a spot among the day visitors. The talent show is cute. And you have to take home and elephant; â€¦
title: Bucket List!

text: We stayed only one night up at the safari park, but it was truly lovely. I took my mum there for a surprise for her, but i was truly pleasantly surprised as well. The room was spacious and very clean. Looking out over the park and seeing the elephants playing and walking was just wonderful. The food was great and my mum didn't want to leave the next day - she bathed the elephants and was so excited to be picked up by the elephants and chauffeur driven(ridden) to dinner. The only down size is the price, but i guess it does take a lot to look after the elephants
title: visit to park only, didnt stay at the hotel

text: We stayed overnight at the Mason Elephant Lodge, we had two rooms. Didnâ€™t have any reservations whatsoever before we booked, as i had read other peopleâ€™s views. I knew in my heart that it was most certainly a way of keeping these beautiful creatures safe and paying for their keep. Nigel Mason , owner, who had rescued these beautiful creatures from the Sumatra , had most definitely the Elephants welfare in mind when he chose the area to home them . It is well away from the hustle and bustle of Bali . Up in the country, cool relaxing for the Elephants to live out their lives . They are truly well looked after. Beautiful restaurant, lovely place to eat breakfast and of course a gift shop . No loud music, in fact non whatever. Its all centred around the Elephants their home their; â€¦

We stayed three days at the end of a family holiday in Bali. I thought it might be nice for the kids to experience these beautiful animals up close and I'm so glad we did. It was a relaxing, inspiring and perfect finish to a family holiday. The staff were so accommodating and the park activities very well organized. Coupled with a few trips into Ubud, I couldn't have planned a better finish to our holiday. A must visit in Bali. I can't believe I've waited so long to come here.

We stayed two night in the Elephant Safari Park and had the best time. I had a T'shirt painted by Debi which was an amazing experience. As a resident of the park we were able to get up close and personal with the Elephants. We bathed and swam with them. There were three babies which we just spent hours watching and playing with. The best room was a Park View room. I would wake up during the night and spend a few minuets just looking out from the balcony to see an elephant sleeping in front of our room.
title: Fantastic...

text: We stayed two nights at the Lodge and thoroughly recommend it. The staff were delightful and very friendly and we had the pleasure of talking to the manager, iKetut, a couple of times where she answered many questions and lovingly described the antics of the elephants and history of the park. We recommend the park view rooms as it really the spot to sit and watch the action from your balcony. The park is very clean and tidy and the elephants looked well taken care of. The room was clean and comfortable but perhaps a little spartan on the provisions such as water and teabags! An elephant will pick you up and take you to your dinner reservation. But the best thing for us was spending many hours playing with the two baby elephants - it was worth every cent to be able to have; â€¦
title: superb place to stay

text: We stopped just one night at the lodge. In reality, that is probably all you need anyway. We had an amazing time with the elephants and it was nice to experience the park when it was quiet (I.e. in between the tour buses). The room itself is very nice and the restaurant is surprisingly good (although more expensive than Ubud centre). However the highlight is obviously the elephants. By stopping over night you get to have an elephant ride to the restaurant (picking you up from your front door), a 20 min safari ride but best of all to wash and swim with the elephants. To sit on the elephant's back whilst it was swimming is an unforgettable experience. You then get to feed and stroke them after. All in all, if you like elephants and want a more hands on experience then stop the; â€¦
title: beautiful place

text: We took the "breakfast with the elephants" package. They picked us up from our hotel, and then stopped at another hotel to pick up a friendly Australian couple and we were on our way to the elephant park. We basically did all the offered activities. Swimming with the elephants, elephant safari, feeding the elephants (small extra charge per bowl of food/fruits), and washing the elephants. Got to see the baby (sleeping), and attended a small talk that they had on elephants (the need a better PA system as I could barely understand the lady). Everything we did was met with enthusiasm from my children. My wife is a bit more on the cautionate side but even she enjoyed it. Staff are curteous and professional. Happy to answer questions about the elephants or just hold a conversation; â€¦
title: Amazing!

text: We treated ourselves to one night here as on our honeymoon in Bali. Was a tremendous experience. The elephants are beautiful and well looked after. We had an elephant chauffeur in the evening who took us to a candle lit dinner... Very romantic! A magical experience and a must do when in Bali.
title: Just beautiful

date post: Terran N wrote a review Aug 2015
text: We truly enjoyed our time at the Elephant Safari Park. These elephants are rescued from Sumatra and have a good life (or so we would like to believe). There is a little "talent" show followed by an elephant ride through the jungle. This is a full 30 minute ride. The guides are delightful and were as curious about us as we were about them and the elephants. The park is clean and well kept. There is a gorgeous gift shop without a lot of pressure to buy. We took our 19 year old, 12 year old and my mom. Everyone had a great time,
title: Excellent hotel, unique experience

text: We visited during the day on a turn up and pay basis. We took the entry and elephant ride option. There was a 90 min wait for a ride but this gave us enough time to roam the park, feed the elephants and see the show. The kids absolutely loved the trip and the ride. The staff were very friendly and overall it was a very fun day.

We visited elephants in their park in Taro, Ubud on 10th of July 2015. It was really a magic experience. Roxy, the elephant lady from Sumatra, was very kind and she took as for a ride in the jungle-like park. We will never forget it. The stuff of the park really love these magnificent animals, they take very good care of them, so it feels that entrance fee money is well spent for making the best posible life for these rescued elephantes.

We visited for the bathing, swimming and feeding experience! We arrived before was park is open to everyone else and washed down and scrubbed the Elephants, we were then allowed in a pool with them and after we had breakfast and showered we could then feed them. The whole experience was amazing and one of the best things I have done. I personally feel that the Elephants were happy and seemed to enjoy the attention, the handlers explain that the animals were rescued from devastated camps and some handlers have been with their Elephant for 20 years plus. They have to be tethered when they are not with their handler however they are currently building a free roaming area for them which the park has been trying to do and buy the land for 12 years. Tip: Definitely recommend visiting; â€¦
title: Fantastic morning beautiful setting dreams came true

date post: Madam Penscake wrote a review Jul 2017
text: We visited here after being told how nice it was by a friend ,and it did not disappoint. The grounds were in immaculate condition and the facilities were all clean and well maintained. We saw the "elephant show"'which I was dubious about, but it was short and the elephants didn't seem to need any encouragement to participate. After the show an elephant ride around the park provided an opportunity to hear about the level of care provided to these wonderful animals. Our 9yo loved feeding the elephants and had to be dragged away. The elephant carers were all very friendly and welcoming of interaction with their elephants. We had lunch in the restaurant which offers a buffet and a la carte. We are off the menu and the food was good. We even got to see a wedding party ride; â€¦
title: Dissapointing Experience & Total Waste of Money!

text: We visited here as part of a package having done the white water rafting earlier on in the day (which I would highly recommend) and we're incredibly disappointed and sad. The whole park is tiny , which means that you end up sitting around doing nothing for long periods of time with little to do, in between the activities. You can feed the elephants- but only at an additional cost unless you want to feed them the scraps provided in a bin for free. The elephants are tethered on super short chains of around a metre in length and have nothing to do except eat. The ones that aren't tethered are used purely for amusement whether that be giving rides to tourists for an extortionate price or doing an "educational show". The ride on the elephants was ruined by the fact you feel so; â€¦
title: Fantastic

text: We visited here for our last night on honeymoon, it was a very lovely place to stay and there was the lovely company of the elephants. Hotel was lovely, the grounds were beautiful and the elephants were of course the highlight. We loved seeing them but we're a little saddened that they were chained up all night and for parts of the day.

We visited here unsure of what to expect but were very pleasantly surprised to find a superb well run facility perfectly set up to ensure the elephants are in a stress free environment - yes there is interaction with the visiting public but in all the time we spent there the elephants looked extremely comfortable with their handlers and the public too - well worth the visit

date post: John A wrote a review May 2017
text: We visited in early May and were quite disappointed with how to elephants were kept and treated during the 'bathing with elephants' experience. The elephants are chained throughout the park with not much room to roam. The bathing experience was quite nice as the elephants were standing freely are were able to walk around as they got a bath, but when we moved to the send part of the 'tour' when you were able to ride the elephants bareback in a pool you could tell the hooks were used to cause fear and make the elephants obey. The handlers would dig the hooks into the elephants to make them submerge in the water. Would not recommend this experience to people who value animal rights as it was quite upsetting to see. We opted out of this experience but could not leave until the; â€¦
title: Experience of a life time.

text: We visited Mason Elephant Park and Lodge whilst holidaying in Bali. The trip from Kuta took about an hour and a half. Boy was it worth it. The admission ticket for a family seemed very reasonable and we booked to take a ride on the elephants as well at reception to avoid queuing up again later. The park circuit itself isnâ€™t huge but it is spacious enough for the elephants. There is a pond area where they play and bathe and a place for a photo opportunity with the elephants. They call the elephants by name and their respective trainers/handlers donâ€™t force them to do anything they donâ€™t want to. This is nice to know. Having had a ride on them which lasts about 30mins or so you jump off and get a chance to feed them. Bowls of fruit and small bananas are available to buy. There is; â€¦

date post: Hoth Spots wrote a review Oct 2019
text: We visited Mason Elephant Park for one night as part of our honeymoon to Bali. I was very sceptical after reading all the mixed reviews, but wanted to see for myself bring an elephant lover. And if in honest.. I still have mixed reviews. The elephants were rescued from poaching etc in Sumatra so I do believe had they still been in the wild many of these elephants wouldn't be alive. They all look healthy, well fed and looked after. But look beyond this and the elephants are used as props for money. Our hotel room didn't look over the park, but a large pen at the back of the park which housed 5 elephants. At the time they were doing some construction in the pen (it looked like the were building shelter as these elephants had no shelter here) and instead of moving the elephants; â€¦
title: Wonderful Experience

text: We visited Mason Elephant Park, and we had a great time. We bought the full package that included elephant ride, swiming and washing, it was incredible. The best one, was the swiming, didnt expect that, as I was riding the elephant and suddenly it submerge in the water, was amazing.

We visited Taro elephant sanctuary for the night safari package they offer and we're not dissappointed. The hotel pick up and subsequent drive to the park was a good inclusion. On arrival we got to feed the elephants and have personal photos. The park is very clean and spacious with around 30 elephants but the your keeps the feeling unique and personal. There is a 'circus' style show which detracts from the natural feel of the park. They inform you these skills were acquired during their previous captivity but I am not so sure. The evening would have been just as good, if not better without the need to display such acts. There is then a night ride around the park which takes about 20 minutes before dinner in the park. My experience from such tour included food is often poor; â€¦
title: Truly Exquisite and Unique Experience, with Compassion

text: We visited the elephant park at Taro as part of a day trip to Ubud with Bali Made Tours. After doing a little research to make sure the park was above board, we opted to just enter the park and feed the elephants rather than ride them. The elephants appear well cared for and are very friendly. For approx $30AUD you can enter the park and feed the elephants - which was simply an amazing experience. There is a cafe and a place to watch the elephants play in the water, which was equally enjoyable. Other than that not a lot else to do in the park, so if you don't plan to ride the elephants you could allow an hour for your visit and you wouldn't feel rushed.

date post: Lauren K wrote a review Oct 2017
text: We visited the lodge and stayed overnight for one night as part of our 3 week Bali trip. I'll be honest, we had a blast! The hotel rooms are truly beautiful and some great finishing touches such as wonderful books to read in the room about elephants and Indonesia. The rooms are separate from the non guest areas and so even when the lodge is busy the rooms are peaceful. The breakfast included in the price is in a separate restaurant away from the main restaurant with the day visitors. My boyfriend recommends the banana French toast! The staff were super friendly and could not do enough for you. We also liked that the staff were from the local village, from the mahuts to the restaurant staff. As a hotel guest we had access to; Washing elephants Elephant safari ride Elephant; â€¦
title: A must do in Bali

text: We visited the Park as part of our honeymoon trip to Bali and we were beyond ourselves with excitement. The tour included hotel transfer, park admission, hand feeding, safari ride and buffet lunch all in one package. Some say that riding an elephant through the cool jungle of Taro is an experience you will never forget; well, that is what happened to us! It all started very nicely, the guide made us feel at ease while we were riding the elephant even though at the first impression the pachyderm seemed a bit nervous. The seat was very uncomfortable and nowhere near safe but what really worried us was the safety belt which was way to loose and literally slipping off our waist. It was when we got into the jungle that things got worse. The elephant suddenly stopped its ride,; â€¦

We visited the park in June 2017 just for a day trip to see the elephants. The experience was really cool and the elephants look very well kept and safely kept and looked after. The whole park was very clean and well maintained. We also had lunch there which was well priced and food was lovely. Admission price was very reasonable i thought and we stayed in Nusa Dua so got a driver to take us there with 2 other stop offs along the way to Ubud market and silver making place. All in all it was a great day and we certainly enjoyed it. as for the accomodation side of the lodge i can,t comment as we didn,t stay there we only did a day visit. Great for the kids as well and saw many young ones enjoying their elephant rides.
title: Elephant riding!

text: We visited the safari park yesterday and travelled from kuta. We didn't realise that the park was so far away and it took us nearly 3 hours of winding roads to get there and it didn't help I had travel sickness! But on the way back there was less traffic so took about 2 hours. The driver was very good and polite. It cost $109 which includes travel, entrance to walk around the park, feed the elephants and see them bathe, a talent show & dinner (this is the evening safari package). The talent Show is only for 5-10 minutes although interesting to see the elephants doing tricks it isn't long enough; but we were told it takes 1 elephant 6 months to learn 1 trick so I guess that's why. The staff are all very helpful and we had a nice man who was driving our elephant, he was very; â€¦
title: Had an Excellent Time - Staff Was Very Helpful And Experience Was Terriffic

text: We visited this park after much deliberation as we wanted to make sure that the elephants are treated humanely, not only during the day but also when the park closes. We asked around and were convinced that the family that owns the park have the interest of the animals at heart. This is a wonderful day out with kids to spend time with these beautiful creature. Our 8 year old son was over the moon that he could ride, feed them and sit up close with the adult and baby elephants. The food in the restaurant is more than decent and a quick walk around the area will show that there are some rare fish species being kept as well. Highly recommended!
title: Lovely

text: We visited this park as a group and were all horrified with what we saw. I tried to go with an open mind as the park is sold as a sanctuary on their website, but a sanctuary this place is not. The elephants have NO free range time at all and when they are not needed for tourist activities they are chained up on small concrete pads. Elephants were visibly distressed and the use of the hooks was excessive. The 2 girls we visited were almost in tears when we left. I genuinely feel embarrassed to have gone here and given them money, alarm bells should've rang, especially as elephants aren't native to Bali anyway! Also shame on trip advisor for awarding this place a certificate of excellence 2 years running. I
title: Perfect place with lot of elephant entertainment

text: We visited this park while on holiday in Bali, we stayed in a villa in ubud and got a driver to take us there (cost us 400k but he took us there as well as the coffee plantation and an awesome place for lunch - we had him most of the day). So we are two family's from Cumbria England - 4 adults and 4 kids age 5, 5, 3 and 8 Months) Anyway we were tempted to buy tickets beforehand from the street sellers but decided not to as we were not sure if the kids would actually want to ride an elephant. So we arrived and it's was 850k per family. Family is 2 adults and 3 kids (the books don't tell u this) plus we paid separate for the 2 adults as it was the cheapest way to do. The kids definitely wanted to wash the elephants so we paid for them to do that on entrance and it was around; â€¦

We visited this zoo (two adults!) with the main intention of having the experience of an Elephant ride that was recommended to us by friends who had experienced this before! Would recommend this although the zoo is great fun with lots of other wild animals including tigers. For a small price, you can feed them too! Lots of fun! We found and amazing Freelance Guide in Bali who is a local with very good English and knowledge of the area so we got to know so much about the Balinese people and the place. Wayan, (Tel: +62 819 99800469) our guide is very friendly, helpful, reliable and being freelance, a lot more reasonable and flexible with timings etc. No job/trip too small :)

We went for a morning visit to see the elephants. If you like elephants or have always wanted to ride an elephant then this is definitely a good a place as any to do it. The best part was actually just before we went for our ride where you can feed the elephants (50 IRP for a box of fruit) and the riders encourage them to do tricks such as wrap a hoop around you and place their trunk on your head which is pretty weird/surreal but also kind of cool. You can get some awesome photos. The ride itself is fun albeit not much to look at other than rainforest trees, the odd big spider and livestock. It was comfortable though and we were kept entertained by both the guide and the elephant. They also do a 15 minute show which is entertaining. The elephants all seemed very happy and are; â€¦
title: What a great place

date post: Dee B wrote a review Jul 2012
text: We went for two nights with our 7 yr old daughter. We will never forget it this is surely one of the great animal experiences on the planet. I was concerned that such a place could not combine a quality hotel and a decent safari feel. But my hat comes off the Mr Nigel Mason and his wife who rescued these elephants and brought them 3,000 by truck. What makes the experience so special is there are only 25 rooms so there are almost no other people around and no stress of lines. We bathed, rode, fed, stroked and got squirted with water by these amazing animals. There were three babies there and a pregnant mare due next June 2013. What was also wonderful was the buffet dinner. We normally run a mile when we hear buffet especially after some horrendous Club Med disasters, but this was; â€¦
title: World class

text: We went here on a tour and I have take a week to write this review so I can think my initial thoughts over. I love elephants but didnâ€™t want to go to a place where the elephants were mistreated, like places I saw in Thailand. The elephants do at time have to be restrained due to the law in Bali and have been coached so they respond to Signals but they also appear happy and do not appear to be mistreated. I loved feeding the elephants. They have a character thatâ€™s different from each other and are cheeky. Their trucks are amazing and wrap their trucks around the food and devour it. All I Can say is that I enjoyed the visit and think about the visit multiple times in the last week with fond memories. Your call but I loved it
title: a must if traveling with children

text: We went here on our 2nd day in Ubud and I would have to say it was one of the most beautiful experiences of our lives, to hear the elephants make their trumpeting and rumbling sounds, watching the babies with there mothers, going for a swim in the pond was just fantastic, it was one of the highlights of our 5 weeks in Bali. The park itself is a credit to the owners and carers, a little expensive for Bali but one of those once in a lifetime experiences you should not miss.
title: Intersting Day Trip

text: We went here recently, took 3 kids (4,6,8), did the works bathing, washing, riding, meet the new baby (couple of months old) really enjoyed, the park is immaculate, the staff were wonderful and we all loved it. What I thought was going to be a quick conversation with the usual answers was both reassuring and mind changing. It started with another guest concerned the elephants were sometimes shackled. We spoke with an employee/handler named Brad (an Aussie expat that has been there for 2 years) he explained that for there safety and for the safety of the park and guest this was required (this sounds like a simple push aside answer) however over the next 30 minutes he explained the history of the park, the animals and the owner with such passion and emotion and love for the; â€¦
title: Beautiful

text: We went on a day tour to this place. Get there early (9.30am) to avoid the line up when the crowds roll in from 10am. The elephants are beautiful and the guides are excellent and very good with the English language. The gardens are well looked after and so too are the elephants from what we could see. The park is very well organised. Staff were constantly cleaning up, raking and hosing to keep the park looking great. Would highly recommend this tour (we went with Bali Adventure Tours).

We went on a day trip to the Elephant Safari and had an absolute ball. Would highly recommend doing Elephant Safari and Monkey Forest (cheap and in Ubud also). The Elephant safari was great, we rode an elephant (Rhonda) around a small jungle track and then through a pool at the end. You could easily do white water rafting (morning), monkey forest and then elephant safari in one day if you left early from Seminyak, although we decided to stay in Ubud for one night and do Elephant/White Water rafting on day 1 and monkeys quickly on day 2 before being picked up by a (free) shuttle back to Sanur for a boat ride across to Nusa Lembongan for 3 nights (highly recommend this place too).

We went separate ways today I did a bike ride and my wife did a guided walk both ending at the Safari Park. Both experiments where very good. The bike ride started near the volcano and went more or less down hill, great scenery through the first and rice paddies. Elephant show was good and the animals appeared to be in good health and wellbeing.

date post: Kate E wrote a review Aug 2018
text: We went to the elephant lodge for a day trip and everything was really nice. The staff is professional and service minded, itâ€™s clean and they treat their elephants good. We also did their helicopter trip which was well worth the money. They are all so sweet and nice, I highly recommend this company (Mason travels).
title: Children enjoyed it

date post: Aidan C wrote a review Jun 2017
text: We went to this elephant park as we thought it was a rescue for them. The elephants are all chained up and can barely move. A lot of the elephants were pacing on their chains. The chains were so short. When I asked why they were chained they said it was because they fight and for their safety. I don't believe this to be true. Also if they did fight they could just put them in separate pens rather then chain every elephant to a tiny circle. They also use hammers to control the elephants which wasn't very nice. I think the elephants are treated better here then in other elephant parks in Asia but it wasn't nice to see them pacing with extremely short chains :(
title: Amazing!

text: We went to this park (not hotel) as part of a day package with another company. I would not have been happy to pay the entry fee otherwise - what a rip off!! I felt so uneasy the whole time, felt like I was about to fall out of the carriage on top. The handler was constantly kicking the elephant to make him move and when he went to eat some leaves he was hurt with a big metal hook near his eye. I told the handler it was ok for him to eat which was just brushed off. We witnessed a baby elephant chained up and he was obviously distressed rocking side to side and making strange sounds. What a life!! I couldn't wait to leave there and will not return. Don't go there, yes it's a novelty riding an elephant, but at what cost?!
title: Good experience

text: We were a little hinky about the elephant preserve going into it, and while many have belabored the point of the ethics of such a place, I'll leave it at this - Mason's grounds are spacious, safe and beautiful. The handlers are gentle and knowledgeable. The elephants are ravenous for sweet potatoes, carrots and fruit. Having an elephant adeptly and gently take a piece of a carrot out of your hand is pretty amazing. Being able to brush and run your hands along the flank of a 3 ton elephant who is unchained is magical. Riding an elephant wasn't our thing, and "bathing" with an elephant wasn't either (too much poo in the water), but the experience was extremely memorable for all the right reasons.
title: Impressed

text: We were greeted and accompanied by wonderful people and even made some friends. The hotel service exceeded our expectations. One thing that I did not enjoy was the elephant rides. Though the lodge rescue these animals and take great care of them I would rather not do this activity. We spoke to many of the elephant keepers and we were around the elephants enough to see that they are really well taken care off. The food!!!! we have traveled to many places and it's not always easy to find food that is truly delicious. You do not have to look to far, this is it. Overall I would rate this as a 5star experience and we will be returning to let our family enjoy this experience with us.. Thank you Mason Elephant Lodge and staff.
title: Great care for Elephants

text: We were guests at this delightful Resort from 3/6/2010 to 6/6/2010. It was a "life changing experience". We were so impressed with the attention to detail, the care given to the elephants ,the quality of the facilities, the comfort of our room and the wonderful service given by the friendly staff. The thrill to get to know these beautiful creatures, both big and small. Where else can one be collected at 7pm by your own mahout and elephant and transported to "silver service dining", under the stars, in the Palm Grove? Our only regret is that we didnt stay longer. Do your self a favour and visit.
title: A Unique Experience

text: We were picked up around 0630am and taken to the lodge from our hotel in Ubud. The park was clean and the operators very professional. We had a good time scrubbing our elephant before being amazed by our swim with the elephants. ( make sure you change into swimming gear first as you get wet abd will shower immediately after ) the breakfast after was delicious. We then got to go on a small ride on the Elephant around the park before watching a short talent show where the elephants do some painting and basketball etc. You could purchase little fruit bowels for 50000 IDR to feed the elephants with also which was a neat experience in its self. You can tell the operators care about the elephants and don't over work them. One of the highlights from our holiday and would highly; â€¦
title: Loved the experience!

text: We were so excited to visit the elephant safari after being recommended to go by a few people in our hotel. Entrance to the park was expensive even without paying to ride them as we said we would decide once we were in there if we wanted to or not (thank god we didn't). As soon as we walked in after paying nearly 600 IDR we were told by a staff member to go into the merchandise store and use the restaurant (not very welcoming). The park seemed nice until we got closer to the elephants who all seemed extremely sad and chained up with stupid saddles on their backs. You then had to pay more to feed them which to be fair we happily did as we felt like at least we were giving them something by feeding them. The staff that worked their were brutal. Forcing the elephants to pose for; â€¦
title: Elephant Safari Lodge

text: We were so pleased we went to this elephant park in Bali. The staff are so friendly and are so happy to take pictures of you with the elephants and to show you how to feed them etc... feeding the elephants was such a highlight and learning about these amazing animals was just fantastic. We paid for the elephant safari but looking back we wouldn't do it again and were quite happy just feeding and watching the elephants. The safari is ok to say you have rode an elephant but you literally just go around a circle of trees and it isn't much of a sight and I spent most of the journey flicking giant ants off of me after the trainer told me they bite!

date post: Melissa T wrote a review Dec 2017
text: We were there with children. Elephants either chained with minimal movement options or rigged to take tourists for a ride. We asked about the chaining and were told that if unchained they would fight..... but that begs the question how zoos around the World have unchanined elefants. Tjat area was tiny. I got the impression from the web that this place puts the elefants welfare first and choose it because of that - but it honestly in My personal oppinion seems more like a marketing gimmick. I would NOT reccomend this place!
title: Conditions for elephants should be improved

text: We were under the impression that this was an elephant sanctuary... we were happy to pay for an expensive night as we thought that the money would be going to the care of the elephants... but it is a luxury resort, elephants are chained up and have people riding them most if the time... when we looked up reviews we were under the impression that there was not riding of the elephants and that you got to spend your time feeding, washing and looking after them, this is not the case. You have to pay to feed them and bath them on top of the already expensive nights stay. Ultimately this is a place for rich people to ride elephants and stay in there rooms watching them chained to a small area swaying and looking pretty miserable....
title: DO NOT VISIT !!!!!!

text: We were unsure about visiting an Elephant sanctuary but after doing our homework we decided the Sanctuary at Ubud was the best option. The elephants are well cared for and clearly loved by the staff. Every elephant has their own keeper who stay with that elephant. Our beautiful female Elephant called Pusbar was 42 and had the same keeper for 15 years. The Sanctuary is well kept and clean and has a nice restaurant . The Elephant trek lasted about 30 minutes and was worth every penny. Downsides The elephants do have a single chain around their hind leg when not participating in the treks, and there was a show which we didn't watch.
title: Bathe and breakfast with the elephants

date post: Ken L wrote a review Feb 2017
text: We when here with our 5 year old and it was great we got to feed the elephants and to see the show. We did not ride one as we felt bad as it seems that they are doing that all day. Poor things.... the park is good and clean. We had lunch there and it was ok. I was feeling quite sick afterwards. The food for the elephants cost around $5. Overall good experience...
title: Elephants

date post: Kerrie M wrote a review Sep 2017
text: We will never forget our visit here. The Elephant ride was a first for us and one off our bucket list. Especially going through the water. My advice wear sensible shoes, I wore flip flops and felt I might lose them at any time. Our guide was amazing and answered all our questions. The Elephants are rescued and look well looked after and content. Feeding the Elephants was our favourite part of our visit and the elephant trainer took some wonderful photos with my phone and camera for us. If you like Elephants you will love a visit here no matter what age you are.
title: What a beautiful place.

text: We won't ever forget the two nights we spent here. We stayed in the Padi view rooms - lovely views - really tranquil in elegant surroundings. Being amongst the elephants was a wonderful experience. All the staff were focussed on making our stay memorable and enjoyable. Their love for the elephants was obvious. The experiences we had with the elephants were beyond what we expected. Prior to the visit we had read of concerns people had regarding the elephants' welfare, so we were concerned about this when we arrived. However, after staying here, we have absolutely no doubts that the care and welfare of the elephants is of the highest priority and we will never forget our experiences here. Two major highlights were swimming with the elephants (twice) and being picked up by the; â€¦
title: Bleeding elephants! Do not go here!

text: We would recomend this hotel to anyone. We stayed here as part of our honeymoon and it could not have been any more perfect. We felt like we were celebrities, nothing was too much trouble. The elephant safari was excellent and as guests we could go at the time that suited us and being picked up from our own balcony. Our favourite hotel ever.

We, a 3-generation family of 6 stayed two nights in park view rooms. Any misgivings we may have had about zoos, elephants in captivity, limited options â€“ were quickly dispelled. This is a beautifully landscaped park with gentle elephants that are clearly well cared for and are not over-worked. Watching a family of three elephants playing together in the pool in front of the restaurant will remain for us an enduring memory. Captivity is never better than the wild, but many of these elephants have been rescued from far worse conditions. The mahouts are friendly and knowledgeable, have been with their elephants for many years and are obviously very caring. The staff generally are very attentive and efficient. Food in the restaurant is good, the museum and gallery interesting and; â€¦

Weâ€™ve been to natural Elephant sanctuary in Thailand. The Mason Lodge treats their elephants with extraordinary care, LOVE and kindness. I was skeptical at first, but they won me over. These are Happy Elephants . Highly recommend this for at least one nights stay to commiserate with these gentle giants!! Blessings to Nigel! Thanks

Well cared for elephants, rescued from Sumatra. Very well organised park. Tickets can be purchased to visit, or visit and ride an elephant, adding lunch in the restaurant or drinks and snacks sold in the cafe. Lots of outside seating, sit in the comfortable huts and watch an information video in English if the park and founder. Watch a live 15 min show performed by the elephants. Excellent for couples and families alike, staff are willing to take photographs of your experience or you can purchase a disc of your trip.
title: I feel bad for the Elephants :(

date post: Yelena M wrote a review Apr 2015
text: Well this place is just fantastic. All of the comments below are true. Swimming with the elephants was magical. The buffet, although pricey by indonesia standards was submime. Grilled fresh tuna, fish curry, rare beef salad, mmmmm. My advice is to arrive exactly at check in as they create a full itinerary for you from the moment you arrive. Absolutely top quality rooms, great service and as has already been mentioned lots, the animals truly look happy and well cared for.
title: Above and beyond!

date post: zane p wrote a review May 2017
text: Well this was well worth the money the views the elephant safari feeding the elephants and their daily shows was so exciting and enjoyable in Bali the fee included a fantastic lunch time meal we did t need anything for the rest of the day apart from a snack but there are botanical gardens elephant ride was the highlight of the tour as well as feeding them
title: Best trip in Bali

text: Went here first thing of my birthday day. A bit choked when I saw the elephants separated and in chains. Then one by one they take the chains off. They initially took one chilled elephant called Eva for us to wash. I was trying to hold back tears, it was a very moving, humbling experience! To see them eye to eye, see them staring back at you.... almost spiritual! Then we were then taken to a pool. Another group of super chillax elephants, this is where they get really wet and they submerge themselves. I promise you you will get wet so bring a spare set of clothes. We didn't want the bfast and the animal show so we had just wander around the park. Heartbreaking to see the elephants still carrying humans on their back! Then one by one all the elephants are loose, following around; â€¦

Went to check out the Sumatran elephants. What magnificant creatures they are. Did'nt do an elephant ride because I think it's not the best way to safe them. Nice parc, Well maintained. Entry fee is high, considering you only walk around the parc. But you can have interaction with the elephants if you want to
title: Great work!
