text: Went to the park today for a wash and lunch. When we got there it is full of pictures of celebrities who are having a great time. Once you go into the park it is full of animal abuse, every handler has something sharp to pinch the elephants with if the don't listen and the animals are forced to do as the handler say. Elephants that are not being used to entertain tourists are just chained in a small sand circle with only about 2 meter chains. THIS IS NOT A SANCTUARY!!!!

Went with my husband and 15 year old daughter. We all loved it. My husband said it was a highlight for him getting to touch feed and ride an elephant. Very clean well run place. I normally feel funny going to places like this because the animals are not in their natural environment. These elephants have been rescued and are Sumatra elephants and yes you get that funny feeling should I be doing this but the place is so well run and the elephants seem happy you leave feeling blessed to have experienced it ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ Totally recommend.
title: Elephant-sized fun!

text: What a awesome experience. Have two teenagers with me and it's so good to see there faces light up and laughs when experiencing the 30min ride on the elephants. The staff are friendly and encourage you to Pat and get photos next to the elephants. Be aware though if you get to close they start flapping there ears and your face/head is right next to it! Harmless but can give you a fright. If you want to ride the elephants remember to take your ticket as they call your name out first before you line up. So do not get in line unless called. Souvenir shop awesome and reasonable plus already priced. We all enjoyed our day a must to see and do in Ubud.
title: Elephants Don't Have Great Lives!

text: What a fantastic place, if you are thinking of coming here book it now and make sure you book a park view room...after all you are going here to look at elephants not a garden or paddy field! We stayed for 2 nights and could have probably done 3. Although pricey I feel the honeymoon package was worth the money, and all facilities including the river rafting really were top notch. This is well planned and designed resort with 5 star finishing throughout. On arrival my wife was extremely ill and the lady at the front of house was very helpful...she arranged for a driver to collect medicine from Ubud and fortunately by the evening she had recovered to enjoy a fabulous buffet dinner. We are not big fans of buffet style eating, but this one was amazing. The food included a range of; â€¦
title: Looks good, feels fake

text: What a fun amazing day very peaceful and relaxing! Riding the elephants is just incredible. You just couldn't complain about the day! The buffet lunch was great and gift shop was really well priced with cool lil bits and pieces you can't find elsewhere. Elephant shows were really cool and they seem really happy and well treated!!
title: Heart breaking

text: What a fun day! When you sign up for breakfast and bathing the elephants you get more than you bargain for. I totally wasnâ€™t expecting the breakfast to be more than a continental one, however it was filled with flaky, soft croissants and pastries, to bacon, eggs and fresh juices. After eating you get to scrub these gentle giants down, while snapping pictures. Over in the pond you get to mount one and ride it into the water with them. Hold on or squeeze your legs tightly against them because you will be submerged into the water unexpectedly. Donâ€™t worry, your head will not get wet. I didnâ€™t chose the option to ride the elephants because having breakfast, bathing and playing with them was good enough for me. Enjoy yourself!

date post: Fatima R wrote a review Oct 2017
text: What a great place to stay. Stayed 2 nights .The rooms are beautiful with a great clean bathroom. Air conditioning is a great welcome. Each evening the elephant picks you up at your lodge to take you to evening meal. You can wash the baby elephant in the morning. It's a great place all the elephant are well looked after. I would recommend going to get the experience. We loved it. There was nothing bad about this place. The staff are do caring and friendly. We will be hoping again.
title: Elephant ride

text: What a great way to spend a few days! The room was lovely but we weren't in a position to catch a ride on an elephant to take us to dinner as we had a Paddy room. Not a disappointment though as we had plenty of opportunity to view, hand feed, wash and interact with the elephants. Fantastic for kids and adults alike, thoroughly recommend.
title: Unique experience but not cheap

text: What a wonderful caring park for the rescued elephants. I was a little I sure at first however after seeing for myself and chatting to the keepers you realise there is a lot of care and attention in this particular elephant park. Itâ€™s a rescue centre, and itâ€™s clear theyâ€™re all passionate about the elephants here. Itâ€™s a wonderful community. Also if you have the option to eat there, do! Food is great, fresh, tasty and caters very well for all dietary needs inc gluten free. Will certainly revisit again next year. Thank you for taking such wonderful gentle care of my toddler who was a little unsure at first due to the size of the wonderful creatures, however by the end was happy to feed the elephants all the fruits and veg we could get our hands on.

date post: Heinrich U wrote a review Aug 2020
text: What a wonderful experience my girlfriend and I had this past weekend. The park and facilities are outstanding, the staff are wonderful and very helpful. The restaurant items were superb and delicious, far superior to many other restaurants in Bali. The elephants are incredible, gentle, happy, playful, healthy, and majestic intelligent creatures. The complimentary elephant ride from our room to the restaurant was so delightful. Bathing the elephants, swimming with them, feeding them was such a dream come true. I am truly humbled by their presence and gentle nature. The baby elephants are so cute and playful. It felt like we were staying at Jurassic Park with Elephants, the park layout is so well planned and beautiful. The rooms are excellent with incredible views of the; park. Please note that this park treat the elephants humanely with integrity and caring. Disregard the negative reviews from uneducated guests, any questions you have the staff are there to help you understand the terrible circumstances from which these animals came from. Please support this fantastic sanctuary as CoVid has affected their ability to expand and grow. A special thanks to Brad, Ketut and Lenny for their extra special care and hospitality, it was an absolute pleasure being under your care!!; â€¦
title: Song of the giants.

date post: Heinrich U wrote a review Aug 2020
text: What a wonderful experience my girlfriend and I had this past weekend. The park and facilities are outstanding, the staff are wonderful and very helpful. The restaurant items were superb and delicious, far superior to many other restaurants in Bali. The elephants are incredible, gentle, happy, playful, healthy, and majestic intelligent creatures. The complimentary elephant ride from our room to the restaurant was so delightful. Bathing the elephants, swimming with them, feeding them was such a dream come true. I am truly humbled by their presence and gentle nature. The baby elephants are so cute and playful. It felt like we were staying at Jurassic Park with Elephants, the park layout is so well planned and beautiful. The rooms are excellent with incredible views of the; park. Please note that this park treat the elephants humanely with integrity and caring. Disregard the negative reviews from uneducated guests, any questions you have the staff are there to help you understand the terrible circumstances from which these animals came from. Please support this fantastic sanctuary as CoVid has affected their ability to expand and grow. A special thanks to Brad, Ketut and Lenny for their extra special care and hospitality, it was an absolute pleasure being under your care!!; â€¦
title: Song of the giants.

date post: Ric S wrote a review Aug 2016
text: What a wonderful experience to see a Sun Bear who actually sat on my knee..he weighted 65 kilos. It was the most magical moment and the elephants were amazing. I had heard about the bear but to actually see and feel them was the best.Would recommend to anyone to make the effort to see them
title: Anniversary Holiday

text: What a wonderful experience, the best was swimming with the elephants. We got a deal through one web site only to have another website do a better deal for $400 less. Without a deal this place would be too expensive to stay at. The food can be expensive, buffet lunch is 200,000IDR for adults and 100,000IDR for kids but dinner buffet is $30 USD and kids $20USD â€“ so some things are USD and some rupiah, not sure why. Cocktails are about $14 AUD so not cheap for Bali we stayed two nights which is plenty

date post: GÃ¡bor S wrote a review Sep 2016
text: What a wonderful place to visit. Started with a beautiful buffet lunch, then photos with the elephants. The trainers are so welcoming and take the time to let you feed and take photos with all the elephants big and small. Our ride was unforgettable, it poured with rain half way through but they were organized with umbrellas on board. After our ride on our elephant we got to watch the show. The are incredibly intelligent. Would definitely go again..
title: interaction with elephants was amazing!!!

date post: Karina W wrote a review Mar 2016
text: What a wonderful place! Elephants rescued from a nearby island where elephants are still not safe from ivory hunters, the animals at the park are paired with a human for their lifetimes. They are well cared for and seem to be really loved and treated as buddies rather than beasts. We rode [the elephants do only two trips per day then play] and loved going through forest trails this way. Then we played a bit [under supervision of course] with 'baby elephants' who were gigantic and adorable and gentle. What a charming experience. And hopeful! that animals can be well treated by humans. A buffet lunch is included in the ticket price.
title: Incredible experience

text: What an absolutely amazing and awesome experience to swim and wash these gorgeous gentle animals. These elephants are treated so well and it was my pleasure to be able to do this. I will certainly do it again when I go back. Loved it so much

What an amazing experience, so after visiting the elephants in Thailand we were shocked an thrightened to visit a place with elephants again, they were beaten, under fed, and we was subject to a small stompeed which scared me to absolute death, so being cautious to the negative reviews we had read about the Mason Lodge I can honestly say the treatment and care here is outstanding after seeing how they were treated in thailand compared to here... just wow, the elephants are constantly fed a variety of vegetation and fruit. They are pampered throughout the day getting bathed, cleaned and fed, in which we could take part in, the elephants are exercised regularly ether walking ether themselves or with there personal trainers some of which have been with the elephants for over 20; â€¦
title: A Stunning Safari Experience

date post: Dasha M wrote a review Oct 2012
text: What an amazing hotel. I recently travelled to the Elephant safari lodge with my husband and two children 4 and 2. We only stayed one night and that was fine for our age children From the moment we arrived we felt welcome including a personal escort to our room by a friendly staff member. That night it was so exciting because we got picked up from our room and taken to dinner by elephant. The look on my daughters face was priceless. We then woke in the morning to a lovely breakfast plus more elephant interaction including cleaning the elephants and my husband even swam with them. We then were picked up from our room by elephant again to go for another ride.It is so funny when the phone rings to tell you your elephant will be soon arriving. It was AMAZiNG. My daughter has shown; â€¦
title: ANIMAL CRUELTY!!

date post: Will H wrote a review Apr 2018
text: What an amazing place! After seeing Nigel Masonâ€™s doco on how he rescued the elephants, all I can say is â€˜I am totally impressedâ€™. The elephants are happy, not mistreated and their handlers have been with them for years. The lodge, dinner and all the facilities are first class and couldnâ€™t recommend this highly enough. It was the highlight of our trip. We canâ€™t wait to return. Well done to all the staff.
title: Best experience

text: What an amazing way to finish a trip to Bali. We stayed just two nights prior to departing Bali. It is about 30 min from the main shopping area to Ubud. They have a shuttle that runs twice a day into town otherwise it is $27 USD round trip. The place is amazingly clean with all the wonderfully kept elephants. We had an amazing time with the gently giants. I do recommend the morning bath and feeding time as this is for hotel guest only. At time is can be busy with tour groups. I did the swimming with Elephants. The water is gross but who could resist a once in a lifetime chance to swim with an elephant. I figured the elephants eat organically so what could happen. The staff like most of Bali were wonderful. The AC was just adequate. The room was large and comfortable.

date post: Malcolm C wrote a review Nov 2015
text: What an excellent day photos with a lion elephants a good family day out . Food reasonable priced . The safari drive around the park was enjoyed by all the staff very friendly and helpful . This is a great place to bring your family or on your own
title: Family holiday highlight

text: What can be better than sitting at breakfast watching elephants as they have their breakfast (though it seems they are always eating!) and their handlers prepare for the day? The park is incredibly beautiful filled with lush foliage, flowers, koi ponds and statues of the Hindu Diety Ganesha. The food is delicious, accommodations uniquely wonderful and the service impeccable. Of course the stars are the elephants Bathing them, while feeding them orchid flowers and riding them as they bathed in the pond was a bucket list experience that everyone should experience at least once in their lifetime. We plan to one day return.
title: Great day out

text: What can i say what a great place to go and spent time with awesome animals and the staff. They put on a show with the elephants then we went on a ride so relaxing just walking in the bush . If you come to bali its a must see

When we arrived, we were sad to seethe elephants chained. However it was evening, the next day the elephants were being bathedby guests and swimming with them. We just loved it, the elephants were obviously very well cared for and the relationship between the mahouts and the elephants was heart warming. We saw the elephants walking round all day yes at times carrying guests but lets face it, these elephants were rescued from logging etcand the weight of two guests is nothing to them. We watched 4 elephants play in thewater alone with mahouts nearby, they looked so relaxed and well cared for. It truly was a magical place that does its best for the elephants. I acknowledge somethings arent perfect, but this is real life not Disney and this place provides a safe home where they are; â€¦

When you have been in Bali as long as I have for 19 years and lived in my 1,200 m2 Â© Bali Luxury Villa plus travelled the world staying at some the finest hotels I am frankly hard to impress. Yesterday I experienced the Bali Elephant Safari Park run by the very successful Bali Adventure Tours owned and operated by long time Bali expatriate Nigel Mason and his lovely wife Yanie. Years ago I had experienced their elephant walk which was enjoyable. This time I was invited by Yanie to enjoy the elephant walk and to stay overnight at the Lodge built in recent years. Frankly at first I turned down the offer for the Lodge because after all I live in a huge modern 6 bedroom mansion only an hour and a half away on the beach and would miss my private Jacuzzi and pool. Out of curiosity; â€¦

Where to begin - the safari lodge exceeded all expectation. It is incredibly well put together, the park itself is beautiful (if a bit remote - although they do run free shuttles to and from ubud a few times a day). Everything is elephant-centric down to the smallest detail (elephant legs for the bed frame, historical paintings depicting the treatment of elephants in the breakfast room, elephant museum) and everything is very well thought out and put together. Elephant tourism, and animal tourism in general, has become somewhat contentious, but I felt the elephants were well cared for and had a far nicer life at the lodge than they would in most other instances. They seemed playful and happy, squirting water over tourists and bathing multiple times a day. Bathing with the; â€¦

date post: Mary S wrote a review Oct 2019
text: While its not particularly nice to see the elephants chained in their respective circles to eat, it is incredible that there is a haven like this for guests and rescued Sumatran elephants. The owner Nigel Mason is the first to admit very openly that in a perfect world, these animals would be in the wild. Seeing the museum photos of the horrible Sumatran containment camps where these animals were chained and living before coming here is heartbreaking. Kudos to all those involved for making it a reality and I wish there were more places like this as options for these gentle giants. Its like walking into a movie set from jurasic park- big wooden doors, lush tropical landscape and friendly staff to care for your every wish. I give them 5 stars for the printed itinerary, the; â€¦
title: Gorgeous Elephants

date post: Sarah A wrote a review Mar 2019
text: While on vacation with our group of 9 we came across this tour offered by TripAdvisor. I will say this was one of the best tours we had booked in the 14 days we were there . The elephants were so well taken care of and you could tell they were so happy . Our tour included Bath the elephants Feed the elephants.. including the young ones. Ride in the swimming lake as well the safari ride . This also included the Buffett breakfast The entire park was so impressive from start to finish We even got to have a short chat with the founders Do not miss this when you travel to Bali !!!
title: Mixed Feelings

text: While staying in Ubud for a recent family holiday we decided to visit the Elephant Park, some 45 minutes away. Our hotel suggested the morning feed, wash and bath with the Elephants was a unique experience worth trying. An early hotel pickup found us at the Elephant park at around 7.30am. After helping scrub the elephants we had the pleasure of riding on their backs while they had their morning swim...what a thrill. Bathers definitely the order of the day. Watch out for the floating coconuts! This was followed by a quick shower, then breakfast. While the breakfast was relatively basic, it was more than adequate. After watching the morning elephant show we had a elephant ride around the park, before the bus ride back to the home. While the whole morning was relatively; â€¦

While visiting Bali all my 4 year old wanted to do was ride and elephant. So I looked into it and found Elephant Safari Park and Lodge in Taro. We had our driver take us out there after stopping in Ubud. Driving to Taro you truly get to see the quiet Balinese villages and their way of life out of the hustle and bustle. The park was cheap for entry but riding an elephant is around $100US per adult. Kids 4 and under are classed as infants so it's pretty cheap. I highly recommend booking online as I think it's a bit cheaper. The park was quite in the afternoon when we arrived. We needed lunch so headed to the restaurant where they have a great menu and the food is really nice. I'm not sure what I was expecting to be honest. I thought being a sanctuary the elephants where able to; â€¦

While zoos are fun this one is just way too expensive and I feel like they mickle and dime you to death. It's not the same without the tram - you really just can't see enough animals to make it worth the price.
title: Amazing!

text: Wish we could have stayed longer here, because it is such a unique experience. The lodge is situated in magnificent gardens and parkland, and as Taro is in the highland part of Bali, the climate here made a welcome change from the humidity on the coast. We were greeted with friendly smiles at check in, which was done in no time at all, and then escorted to our room. There are a approximately six steps up to the rooms (this is so there is ease of access onto the elephant when you are collected), so I think anybody with disabilities would find it challenging. Rooms are "elephant themed", everything has elephants on them, be it lamps, bed covers, cushions, even the bed legs are carved as an elephants foot. High quality furnishings throughout. It was a nice touch to have paintings; â€¦

With a rich heritage of celebrities attending the safari you are certain this trip will be unforgettable. With excellent friendly staff that will protect and give you an exclusive tour round a enclosed forrest you will never want to get off the elephant. Elephants that are named after the football players it was a great display that they can paint like Picasso with their own paint brush and canvas. Be sure to get wet and be sure the elephant will drop a few dungs of leftover, you will have your son who would not want to leave the safari park after a great photo shot of this journey.
title: Great Trip!

text: Wonderful time, education about the Sumatra Elephants their long time caretakers Have 1 elephant. The caretakers we met had been with the same elephant many years. They are chained for their safety between themselves and damage to surrounding village farms. They work the elephants ( like walking your dog) by taking guest to dinner and walks around the jungle. Guest have the opportunity to brush and bathe them. As well as take them for a dip in the pond. Riders only get wet up to mid chest and Showers and changing availability. Grounds of the elephant lodge and park beautiful.Food was excellent. Rooms are elevated (stairs) so the elephants come to get you for dinner and walks. Rooms spacious and Comfy. Spa had great couple massages Staff was excellent!; â€¦
title: Amazing!

text: Words cannot describe this place. This is the second time I have stayed and it will not be the last. If you have a love for animals and in particular Elephants then you simply have to go to this place the food, rooms and gardens are magnificent and the elephants are all in great condition and their mahouts obvious love for them is clear to see. This time we stayed in a park view room and to wake up surround by 30 elephant is an experience not to be missed. My advice is that you must stay at this place overnight to experience that entire place. The bathing the elephants in the morning is the highlight and the chance to spend time one on one with these most noble of creatures is an experience I will never forget. I cannot express what special place this is. I was generally sad; â€¦
title: Everyone should visit once!

text: Wow what a wonderful day...Elephant rides, shows, great food and all round great experience.. I rode and fed the Elephants the handlers were fantastic assisting with selfies..definately worth tipping. The eatery was a great place to sit relax with a coldie and have a meal. It was very fairly priced offering maximum entertainment value...great for families the kids will love it!!!!
title: A wonderful experience to remember dearly.

text: Wow! First tip: spend the extra money and stay here! You get a complete itinerary of activities including elephant chauffeur for room pick up to bathing and swimming with these (very well looked after) beasts. The up close interaction is breathtaking... you won't be disappointed... I felt completely safe the entire time I was there but beware of floating coconuts in the water!! :-)
title: Highly recommend

text: Wow!!! What an amazing experience to get up close and personal with these amazing animals. The elephants looked so happy and content in this purpose built haven..., such great care taken by all the staff and trainers, it was good to see how well they are treated. One of my highlights for Bali 2019. I will be back again to see my favourite baby elephant, so, so cute. Thanks again Mason for providing the experience.
title: Elephant Lodge Stay and Park

text: WOW. My friend and I as well as her parents ventured here as part of our vacation to Bali and it was very much worth it! We got to have a 30 minute elephant ride during which we chatted with our elephant's trainer and got some great photos. Our elephant (Arum) was a sweetheart and gave us a great ride. After our ride we got to feed the adult and baby elephants and get more great photos! We were able to pet them and hug them, too, which as an animal lover was my favorite part! There was also a brief 10 minute show where the elephants did a few tricks that was fun to watch. Lunch buffet at the park was good; after we ate the trainers and caretakers let us take more up close photos and give more hugs and pets. The elephants were so sweet and seemed to have great lives in the; â€¦

Wow... where do I start? Me and my boyfriend stayed in a park view room for 1 night at the end of our stay in Bali and we were amazed from the moment we arrived to the moment we left with how exceptional the experience and staff were. Upon arrival, we were greeted by friendly faces & a welcome drink - our room wasn't quite ready as we did arrive early although there is luggage storage on site so we were able to leave our suitcases and roam the park. The elephants are SO fascinating, they appear happy and well looked after. Yes they are chained up over night because they can be very destructive animals, after watching the elephants get chained/unchained they didn't seem stressed or in any discomfort. This is my opinion from what I saw from our 24+ hours at the park. The; â€¦
title: Elephant bathing, washing

text: Writing this halfway through our 2 night stay here! From the friendly greeting with cold towels and drinks after a 2 hour drive! We were shown to our room for the next 2 nights No227. Is this a 5 star resort? You bet your life it is! The room is superb! Very very clean, well appointed, comfortable bed, spacious bathroom, definitely 5 star accommodation. The restaurant is where we took our evening meal last night and the A La Carte menu is very reasonable and the food superbly presented and delicious. As guests all the activities are included in your room price! The breakfast is plentiful and very nice indeed. Eating meals whilst watching the gentle giants is amazing! Now the nitty gritty! The elephants themselves! They are very well looked after! The staff love them and care; â€¦

Yes, very enjoyable experience. Pleasant atmosphere, nice to have the 'transfer' to the restaurant on Elephant back, nice to have breakfast overlooking a field with Elephants, definitely recommend this place. Bear in mind though that Elephants will leave a certain 'aroma' behind, as they collect guests from the hotel rooms - and this smell stays around. We did not mind, you get used to it - and it's more than made up for by the overall experience - but it may put some people off.

You are really paying for access to the Elephants when you book here and in terms of our overall expectations, the lodge delivered. We had a Park-view room for my husband, myself and master 5 and a garden view room for our 20 and 23 year old. The garden view rooms are good value as you still experience everything that those in a Park-view room do, minus the additional $320.00 USD per night. I booked a Paddy room through Wotif.com for the two older kids with an automatic upgrade, factor in breakfast (buffet and a la carte) and it's a very reasonable deal. I wanted a balcony and view but I'm not sure the extra cost was really worth those features along with the larger room and bathroom (no bath in the Parkview rooms either). You don't actually spend that much time in your room; â€¦
title: Peaceful resort & perfect weather!

date post: Jennifer D wrote a review Jun 2019
text: You can only compliment the owner and his dedication to this sanctuary over the past decades. What he has also created to the community is extra ordinary. Whilst the animals cant talk they indicate all signs of happiness and well being. The stars are obviously these big Asian Elephants but the real gems are the people behind. Each one of them from gardener to driver to the elephant care taker are extremely professional, speak great english and truly love their job. Make sure you stay at the rooms overlooking the feeding ponds (#1-4) Such an amazing experience, keep up this special tribute to mother nature
title: Sad experience

text: You must come here while you're in Bali! This place is incredible! We were greeted on arrival with a cold towel and a refreshing drink and from there things just got better and better. We were shown to our room, with our bags following shortly afterwards. The room was fantastic. It was spacious, very comfortable, and well appointed. The bed was great, and we had towels made into an elephant waiting for us. Cute. No sooner had we arrived in our room, then there was a knock on our door. An elephant was standing outside waiting to take us to the last elephant show of the evening, and a stunning outdoor buffet. The outdoor restaurant was a very romantic setting, white tablecloths, under illuminated palm trees beside the pool. The food was amazing, a huge variety, lots; â€¦
title: Wonderful and excellent vacation!

text: You wouldn't think elephants could be romantic but they were at the Elephant Safari Lodge in Ubud, Bali. Thanks to the great conservation work of Nigel Morris it is possible to see these wonderful creatures up close whilst at the same time having a 5 str luxury stay in your own mod con villa.the highlight of the trip is 'booking' yoru own elephant to come and take you to dinner and then after a fantastic meal, plod home through the trees....a must for all romantic couples and families with small kids everywhere...

45 minute driving from Ubud Central. The area far from crowds. The new hotel (soft opening). View was awesome specially morning sunrise. Very spacious room, equip with capsule coffee machine, DVD player (with no dvd disc hahaha). Bathroom also spacious. The infinity pool with warm water is the great spot for relax. Need improvement on room service food (availability and quality).
title: Stunning View

date post: Jacky Y wrote a review Jul 2016
text: A beautiful resort built with Balinese way. The room is clean, the pool is fantastic, every staffs are very friendly. We book a premium deluxe room and had a late check in to the resort, we been upgraded to a premium club room with a beautiful pool view! Thank you Padma Ubud, you surprised us. The pool water is warm and nice, we soaked ourselves in the pool everyday. The food in the restaurant are good, Chef Ketut is friendly and he really care for every guest satisfaction by visiting every table to talk to the guest. Spa staffs are very friendly equiped with professional skill, we booked total 3 spa session and we really enjoy it so much. The resort activities are good but we missed all that activities because we had our planned program with a local tour agent, that's why
title: Wonderful Stay at Padma Ubud

date post: Kerry C wrote a review Oct 2015
text: A few days ago, I got a chance to stay at Padma Resort Ubud with my friends. As someone who had stayed at their sister hotel, Padma Legian, I have high expectations. This is because I had experience first hand the quality of hotels, staff, service there. And after two nights of staying in Padma Ubud, I must say they did not disappoint. We did not expect that the resort will be further - down in Payangan - area. We can see that there's some construction going on because it was not 100% finished yet. And even though the pathway that leads to the hotel was beautiful - we could only imagine how amazing it will be once the trees are big and lush throughout the entire hotel. Yes, we can see some construction. But the friendliness of the staff makes up for it. They were very polite.
title: Pre 'soft opening' at Padma Resort Puhu Ubud

date post: Christine O wrote a review Oct 2016
text: A gem in Ubud. Like everything you could think of (except the temperature of the pool) is perfect! The hotel is new, we were told they opened in February 2016. It's beautifully made. From the reception to the gym. My son was happily feeding the fish with one of the staff :) Everyone was so helpful and friendly to our two kids. Helped with the luggage or anything else you could struggle with. The room we had (I believe every room looks the same, has a perfect layout, spacious bathroom, kingsize bed, modern and earthy furniture and a balcony with a great view. The only restaurant for breakfast and dining has great views too. A huge selection of asian and western dishes. Every single dish we had was delicious! One thing the could improve though is to leave the guests eat and be
title: Best hotel experience

date post: Silvia H wrote a review Jan 10
text: A lot of activities here from yoga, archery, golf, cycling, a tons of kids activity that will you had a maximum leisure time. Aerial yoga & morning cycling conducted by Mr. Made was amazing experience, worth for woke up early. The heated pool is stunning.
title: A very nice hospitality

text: A must for lovers of the movie Avatar as the resort unknowingly reflects this movie. Needless to say staff food pool room views all absolutely amazing. Did not want to leave after 3 glorious nights. If you want to get away in total relaxation in a beautiful jungle setting this is the place. We made one trip into Ubud (40 mins) but could not wait to return to the resort for a great dinner near the pool and a magnificent night swim in the absolutely incredible infinity pool. My wife had 3 treatments in the spa she says it was great to go to a Resort spa and not have to take out a bank loan. The value was fantastic. Overall we can't rate it higher enough. We now move on to Padma Legian rested to take on a couple of adventures there.
title: 10/10 luxury

date post: Cassandra C wrote a review Jan 2017
text: A must stay! The infinity pool is amazing, so much so that it won a worldwide competition "pool nation" The staff go over and beyond! Nicko in the restaurant is wonderful. Highly recommended. Even just a few relaxing nights!! Plus there are activties you can do at the resort. Like bicycle tour, learn balinese conversations,make balinese offerings etc ALL INCLUDED IN YOUR STAY.
title: Breathtaking

date post: Chad M wrote a review Jun 2016
text: A must to do while in Bali. The resort is about 45 minutes from Ubud but you won't want to leave. The resort is beautiful. There are great walk trails down to the river and the hotel has lots of activities. Must do is the cycling, you get to see rice fields small villages and some amazing views. This hotel is new and the rooms are incredible, luxury bathrooms, beautiful balcony etc. breakfast buffet for a king. The staff are incredible, so kind and accommodating. We will be back for our 3rd visit real soon. Thank you Padma Ubud for a great visit
title: Retreat from reality

text: A Very nice resort in Ubud, The room, Views from the room , and infinity pool are really incredible for us. love to come back here for my next holiday. Breakfast and dinner also very nice. The staffs are very friendly.
title: Fantastic Stay

date post: Karen E wrote a review Apr 2016
text: Absolutely beautiful place to stay. Amazing attention to detail in every way. The pool is fantastic overlooking the Jungle as is the dinning area. The day spa is under ground in a cave like area.The rooms are very generous with a huge bathroom and bath over looking the view.Staff were very helpful The only draw back is it is about 40 min north of Ubud and absolutely nothing around the hotel.The hotel offer free shuttle bus into Ubud and activities throughout the day. My Husband did the Bike ride and said it was fantastic "A must Do" If you want to relax this is the place but only for a few days.
title: Amazing

text: Absolutely loved our stay here. One of the highlights were the yoga classes held by Budi. I even managed to get my teenage boys to participate . The pool, the location, service etc were fantastic. The only issue we had were the water bottles in both resorts are very hard to open . The design could be improved
title: M&B package

date post: Hendry G wrote a review Jul 2016
text: Absolutely stunning resort. I came here with my mum and we both agreed that it looks like the type of hotel you have your honeymoon at. Gorgeous rooms - so new and modern and fancy! Buffet breakfast and afternoon tea included. Lovely staff! Amazing pool - which is heated to suit the outside temperature. So if it's cold outside, the pool is warm but not too hot. Great swim up bar. There is a number of included activities that are accessible to you in your pay package. Including sunrise and sunset yoga, bicycle riding, scavenger hunt for the kids, there's a bamboo bridge walk, 2.5km walking track, village visit, kite activities, muscle toning activities, planting and more!! Didn't get a chance to do it all as we only stayed a few days but the sunrise yoga was great, bridge and
title: Detox

date post: Belina M wrote a review May 2016
text: Absolutely the Most Fabulous Resort we have ever stayed at. We were greeted with a wonderful warm welcome by Ari at the front gate, to all the staff in the resort a big thank you to you all. The rooms were beautifully presented. The Infinity Pool with swim up bar and surrounding gardens and scenery were Breathtaking! The Restaurant at night produced a wonderful atmosphere and the Food 5 star. Afternoon Tea in the afternoon was a Lovely Touch also.( many thanks to Marzella for keeping my husband entertained with the soccer competition.) All in all a Fabulous Stay.
title: Heaven

date post: Jess L wrote a review Jan 2017
text: After booking 8 nights accom at the Padma in Legian, we wanted to spend a day in Ubud. The concierge offered us a night at this hotel as a free exchange. We weren't sure at first however so glad we did as we could not have been more impressed with this hotel. Suited for a peaceful relaxing retreat. The rooms, faculties and staff were amazing. Nothing was too difficult for the staff, they always had a smile on their face and endeavoured to get to know us during our short stay. I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else now.
title: Couldn't be happier

text: After spending 7 nights at PADMA LEGION,we stayed 2 nights here.WOW! Absolutely stunning in everyway.The staff were excellent and so helpful at all times.The Pool,grounds and rooms were faultless.Stayed here as a family of four with 2 girls aged 7 and 6.They were treated so well by the staff and as well by the kids club also. Try the daily bike ride on offer if you're up for it.The guide,Lenor,takes you to a temple,off road through rice fields and past local houses and gives a great insight into Balinese life. All in all......can't wait to return.
title: OUTSTANDING.

text: After spending several days in Seminyak it was nice to go up into the rain forest to this quiet secluded resort. Our highlights there included the huge heated swimming pool with the swim up bar and the relaxing spa. All of the staff were warm, welcoming and helpful. The breakfast buffet was huge with Balinese, Chinese, European and American selections. The only downside was that it was so far away from Ubud town where all of the shops and restaurants were located. Everything was 40 minutes away no matter where you went. This is a comfortable resort where you can relax and get away from it all!
title: Breathtaking view & amazing infinity pool

text: After staying at Padma Legian 3yrs ago we jumped at Ubud for our 10yr Wedding Anniversary. 5 nights in the secluded resort was amazing, the facilities, pool, location, privacy and that top Padma standard made it a holiday to remember. The resort is approx. 35min from the markets, Monkey Forrest and restaurants / shops but well worth the daily shuttle service to break up resort time and soak in the local less hectic feel of Ubud. Special mention to a few staff that made our stay memorable Gus Oka at the pool bar and the crew of Eko, Slamet, Joni and Wahyu. The restaurant team with Nico greeting you every morning with a big smile and Deasy checking in regularly to ensure your experience is first class. Thanks again Padma we will be back! Highly recommended for honeymoon
title: TRANQUILLITY AND LUXURY

text: All of instrument in Padma ubud resort so AMAZING the room was sweet & so comfortable , the foods delicious & the drinks so fresh , especially "Reza power" is my favorite !! Hehe the employees so kind and helpful , and the best from all is the View & the infinity pool that was so beautiful.. the best place i've ever visit on vacation. Thank u Padma Ubud and Mr Reza.. Jazakallah khairan katsiran.

Amazing hotel with really good facilities. I was really surprised at how many activities they have available such as sunrise yoga, jungle trekking, archery, etc. The staff were great and very helpful. We stayed during the pandemic and the hygiene protocols were very strict without being intrusive. There's hand sanitiser in every corner, also in the room, and temperature checking on arrival and at the restaurant. Everything at check in is "contactless". The room was spacious and cleaned well. We ate at the pool restaurant and normal restaurant and both meals were really good, decent portion sizes and delicious. The infinity pool was insane. 89m with amazing views and it felt like we had your own pool since we were the only one's there most of the time! Definitely going to stay
title: The 89m infinity pool is awesome!

text: AMAZING HOTEL! 100% recommend, everything is perfect. Great staff great rooms great view. What more could you want. It is abit out of Ubud but you don't need to leave the hotel ever. 100% recommend to everyone. Can't say anymore, just great!
title: Heaven on Earth

text: Amazing hotel, I have travelled all around the world, from four seasons Louis XIV Paris to Hyatt Shanghai to ... For my standards I could say that this is one of the best options for hotel you could be accommodated in Ubud for a very reasonable price. Don't book too many days (5-6) tops there distance to any event is quite far (minimum 40minutes to 1,5hr) continue your travel to the south for better weather afterwards. Tip: ask for Suadyana the taxi driver of golden bird taxi company. You Will be helped very Well, there he is An excellent guide with suggestions. Tip: start your day early!!! Even when jetlagged start your day early at the pool from 8 till 10 and then have breakfast. The weather switches at 11am to very cloudy since you are on a mountain with a lot of
title: Perfect to start relaxing and adapting away from stress

text: Amazing resort! Padma Resort Ubud is my best choice to spend my wedding anniversary. I always curious about the heated infinity pool and my curiosity answered here in Padma Resort Ubud. Wifi everywhere, even in the jungle track for jogging, Great. Room was excellent. Breakfast was also satisfying. Definitely will come back again for next trip to Bali. Thank you for the hospitality during my stay in Padma Resort Ubud, I really appreciate the resort' staffs service and warm welcome.
title: Exceptional !!

text: Amazing rooms and luxurious setting. Stayed here at Christmas for 5 nights. It was so relaxing! Staff were so lovely and helpful. Thanks to sekar for looking after our daughter. Can highly recommend this hotel for a quiet, relaxing time.

Amazing scenery and beautiful resort the staff were ever so friendly and the infinity pool amazing , food was absolutely delicious and will definitely come back in the future perfect way to relax away from the hustle and bustle of Kuta etc

Amazing view, amazing pool. staff was highly trained and friendly. this resort has all facilities that you need. i drop my 16 months old baby to the play room and they took care good of my kid perfectly for a couple hour. surely will comeback.
title: Perfect

text: Amazing!!!! Only one place to stay when visiting Bali. The service,hotel, food, heated pool floor less... I would recommend this hotel/resort to anyone for the perfect get away. No crowd no dirt just peaceful and relaxing.
title: a little bit disappointing

date post: Galalima Glamping wrote a review Nov 2020
text: An excellent hospitality, clean and cozy place. Very recommended for family. The animal zone really good and so fun for kids. The Spa treatment was excellent and so relaxing. The pool is amazing and so beautiful
title: Beautiful place

text: Arrived this morning and completely amazed by this resort. The surrounding is super, the room is beautiful, and all the staff is very nice and accommodating. Food is excellent as well. Highly recommend this place for a relaxing get away.
title: A slice of paradise

text: Awesome resort, highly recommend the mixology session with Dedy. Excellent experience, you go through their garden to collect your fresh ingredients and then off to the bar. Dedy is a pro at slinging drinks and will show you the ropes. Can't beat the price either for this fun way to spend some time at the resort

Awesome resort. All The Staff Were so friendly and it was so peaceful this was way more than I expected. From the moment we arrived we was impressed with our choice. Plenty of resort activities to keep you amused fit and relaxed. The food was top class and breakfast had plenty of variety. The pool was a dream with its infinity edge fringing the valley with a great swim up bar with some nice cocktails all at reasonable prices. keep an eye out for happy hour. Two areas to eat one casual and relaxing as its surrounds the other a little more top class with views to impress both producing tasty quality food I would not hesitate to come back again. Thanks Padma Ubud for a memorable stay.
title: Padma Ubud

text: Awesome views, awesome group, awesome tour guide.. this tour is definitely worth it!!!! We love jungle trekking on padma ubud!!! The trip is about 3 hours and we passed jungle, river.. the air was also very fresh

date post: Tomas J wrote a review Jan 2017
text: Beautiful and newly built hotel. Had a great stay there in December 2016. The pool is amazing and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Very relaxing atmosphere with the forest around the hotel and there were not many families during our stay. A bit far from central Ubud but the hotel is perfect if you plan on spending most of the time at the hotel/resort.
title: Very pleasant stay

text: Beautiful hotel, amazing pool, amazing food and best staff. Our family has traveled a lot, this is a true 5 star resort. We have a 4 year old son, kids club is a plus here. It's located in a middle of a forest, the view is very nice
title: Amazing!!!!

date post: Riny W wrote a review Dec 2020
text: Beautiful place and very heplfull staff. Very hygienic ðŸ¤—ðŸ˜˜â¤ hello if u like to running, this hotel have jogging track ðŸ˜â¤â¤â¤ or you can rent for bicycle too N my kiddios have a new experience at garden n mini farm ðŸ¤—ðŸ™ðŸ™ Love it this hotel ðŸ˜â¤â¤â¤ðŸ¤—ðŸ¤—
title: "Will be visit here again"

date post: Elaine A wrote a review Nov 2016
text: Beautiful resort in the middle of the jungle !! Awesome infinity pool. We really recommend the spa, which will offer you a fantastic relaxing balinese spa experience. However service at the front desk can be HIGHLY improved.
title: Fabulous place to unwind

text: Beautiful resort. However there are a couple things I wish I knew prior to booking the hotel. Let's start with the good things. The resort is beautiful. The grounds are amazing and the staff are even better!!! The hotel grounds are very clean and the staff are constantly cleaning it. The breakfast was some of the best meal we had. There was so many choices. It was amazing. Now on to the others. The hotel is very far from ubud central. It's about 45 minutes. There are only 4 shuttles running in a day!! (Should be constantly running) the shuttles only run in the times that the city is crowded, which means you can't beat the crowds and arrive to ubud central in the morning. To get a hotel shuttle at your own time was 250 k rupiah (not sure if it's per person or per car). Taxi
title: Beautiful resort

text: Beautiful, quiet and peaceful resort. Ideal for relaxation and escaping the hustle of the main tourist district. Fair way out of Ubud, but with a free shuttle bus, getting into town is easy. Wouldn't expect anything less from a Padma resort.

date post: Prasti Prabandari wrote a review Jan 27
text: Been trying several 5 stars hotels in ubud but padma the best. Staffs are very warm and welcome, the pool is ah-ma-zing, activitynya banyak dan terutama yang paling bikin menyenangkan di temenin guide bli Dade selama main sepeda ke rumah penduduk sekitaran hotel dan diajarin golf, he is funny, helpful dan terutama pinter ngambil foto dan video (penting!)ðŸ‘ðŸ¼ definitely will comeback to padma ubudðŸ¥°
title: The best experience in ubud

date post: Prasti Prabandari wrote a review Jan 27
text: Been trying several 5 stars hotels in ubud but padma the best. Staffs are very warm and welcome, the pool is ah-ma-zing, activitynya banyak dan terutama yang paling bikin menyenangkan di temenin guide bli Dade selama main sepeda ke rumah penduduk sekitaran hotel dan diajarin golf, he is funny, helpful dan terutama pinter ngambil foto dan video (penting!)ðŸ‘ðŸ¼ definitely will comeback to padma ubudðŸ¥°
title: The best experience in ubud

date post: Jeremy J wrote a review Sep 2016
text: Before we got to Padma Resort Ubud, we received an email requesting pillow preferences and food allergy information. That was the beginning of our amazing stay. The rooms and resort facilities are first class. The staff a very attentive & go above and beyond for their guests. It was all about unwinding and taking in the beautiful atmosphere. So if you want some "me time" or "couple time", put this place on top of your list.
title: Amazing place

text: Best hotel i has visit for my family holiday,all staf are very kind ,all is here amazing,room, foods, service, and also the facillity ,big thanks to mr.klinsman and mr.owen receptionist,they are very amazing and helpfull and very kind ,sure we will be back in the next holiday!
title: Very good hotel

text: Best hotel in Ubud, infinity pool with best nature view, nice club lounge and cozy spent time with my husband. Also we enjoy our food at Puhu Restaurant and dining room service. Will stay at Padma again for our next trip.
title: Cozy and Relax at Padma

date post: Aadu A wrote a review Apr 2017
text: Bit pricey? Yes. Bit far from everything? Yes. Then again - if you want to escape crowds and have some quality time in peace and quiet - this is the place. Heated infinity pool overlooking the jungle beats even 'unbeatable' Padma Legian pool. Rooms are even better than those in Legian, breakfast on the other hand is better in Legian. Bicycle trip to neighboring village was very nice. Moral of the story - probably the best hotel I have ever stayed at. And yes - I have been to MANY hotels :)
title: Best hotel I have ever stayed at. Period.

date post: cindy o wrote a review Jul 2016
text: Came with wife and 2 kids for a family vacay to Ubud: 1. Chose Padma Ubud because I wanted to try this fairly new hotel. 2. For you looking accomodation in Ubud, please beware that their name is MISLEADING. This is nowhere close to Ubud (center), perhaps 35-40min. 3. The compound is absolutely breathtaking, with up til 9pm heated infinity main pool & swim up bar, jacuzzi, bonfire spot. Plus find the hidden pool for couples. Definitely the highlight of our trip. They also have Kids club with own pool, and jogging track leading to small river some 2KM down to the valley (explained during checkin, but didn't do it). 4. Booked the basic Premier Room, but it was huge, big bathroom with separate tub and rainshower, King Bed, and balcony with daybed. Gorgeous and luxurious with
title: Beautiful!

text: Comfortable and well designed rooms, with a good view. Breakfast spread was great and the view at the restaurant is divine. The pool is one of the best in Ubud - water is comfortable for a swim and the view from the infinity pool is awesome. The duty managers, Clement and Ari, provided good service and ensured that all our needs were met. Kudos to the team, and we look forward to staying at Padma Ubud again!

date post: Explore Shaw wrote a review Jul 2016
text: Coming to this resort and the Ubud area was an impromptu change due to the overwhelming business of Seminyak. In short, we loved it here! And it was the relaxing, quality end to a holiday that our family needed. The rooms and facilities were great. The only recommendation I would make is that it could do with one more high end dining option. But in saying this there are plenty of good restaurants in Ubud that can be accessed and with babysitting and drivers being available, this was an option we ran with in the end. And I'd happily do this again! The staff went above and beyond to ensure our stay was of a high standard and were very attentive to our needs. We don't often visit resorts more than once as we generally like to mix things up a bit, but I can assure you that in
title: Absolutely Beautiful

date post: Kylie L wrote a review Apr 2016
text: Definitely worth booking. Staff amazing, always ready to assist you & extremely friendly. Room was beautiful from the private balcony to the massive bathroom. Not close to anything so if you are looking at just relaxing then this is the place for you. Shuttle buses to & from Ubud makes it easy to explore the area but it's a 40 min drive. Infinity pool is just beautiful as is the serenity. Time to relax then book here.
title: Heaven in Ubud

text: Delighted at the wonderful huge pool and hot jacuzzi with powerful bubbling. Food was great quality and bonus to have inclusive afternoon tea every day and also a free set dinner and lunch with our package. Good variety of western and eastern dishes, all to high standard. The gardens and walkway around the hillside and gorge were also great additions. The resort is very well maintained and a tranquil haven in the hills. Perfect place to relax.
title: Fantastic pool and all round hotel

text: Don't be dissuaded from staying here because it's in bucolic Payangan rather than in the middle of traffic-clogged Ubud. For those who require their fix of Ubud's charms, it's only 35-40 minutes' away by the resort's complimentary shuttle. The resort itself is beautiful. A perfect opportunity to (5 star) commune with nature. There's genuine, warm hospitality from staff and attention to detail prevailed from first online inquiry to throughout the stay. Great value and good for the soul.

Driving to Padma Resort, in the dark, was a bit scary at first. We saw so many "hotels" on the drive up that were exactly what we WERE NOT looking for. It was extremely far from the airport (2 hours kinda far) which was unexpected as the hotel calls itself Padma Ubud. PSA - this resort is not in Ubud, it is in Payangan (approx an 1 from Ubud). I mean, we are all for the Balinese "experience" but when you book a place online and see pictures, you have expectations and we wanted them met. Welp. All our prejudgments were immediately knocked to the floor. The resort is gated, and the drive in (after the gates) is luxurious. We loved every... single... bit of our stay and couldn't stop going on about it. Being avid travellers, we said over and over again that this is one of (if not

date post: Marlene D wrote a review Nov 2016
text: During our recent stay in Bali, we stayed at the Padma Resort in Ubud. What can I say, this was paradise! A 5 star resort with large luxurious rooms overlooking the rainforest. No noise except the sound of birds and insects. Friendly, caring, supportive staff who treat you like royalty. The staff's attention to detail is incredible. I highly recommend this resort. Matthew & Dianne.
title: Sensational

date post: Letâ€™s Go wrote a review Mar 2016
text: Emailed to inquire about different room rates and inclusions. Received no response. Called the resort and was asked to call their Legian property. The reservations officer in the Legian property were oblivious to the rate inclusions of Ubud property and was not at all helpful. She was also complaining that their office was under renovation hence it was difficult to hear me. Rather frustrating repeating myself three to four times and yet not getting clarity. Although I was ready to book and confirm, I was concerned by the lack of comprehension and non-accommodating nature of the reservations agent. Particularly on the matter related to the airport transfer. I'm opting for another resort until they're truly ready.
title: Reservations NOT responsive

text: Every single thing about this 5 star resort was just wonderful. From the warm and friendly greeting at arrival to the fantastic hotel room, amazing breakfast, lunch and dinner. Breathtaking views and heated pool and jacuzzi which we enjoyed whilst indulging in our cocktails. One experience not to be missed was the lovely walk down to the little river. Can't recommend this resort highly enough and my only regret was that we didn't stay longer!

date post: Gina D wrote a review Dec 2016
text: Everything about the Padma Resort Ubud is fantastic. Staff were extra friendly and fast with check-in. Butler service for our room was very thorough explaining the hotel in detail. Pool view & ambience is so relaxing & tranquil. Although the location is removed from the main part of Ubud, it's the type of hotel that you don't want to leave. We have actually readjusted our schedule to have more pool time & do some of the free activities organised by the hotel. Shuttle bus service into Ubud was easy & organised by the hotel.
title: Amazing Hotel

text: everything was just perfect..i love the bed, breakfast, and infinity pool with heated water, my husband and my kids can not stop swimming, there is shuttle to go to ubud central with fix schedule. the staffs are friendly as well either to local or non local guest. other suggestion from me is please give bell outside the room, since the room is so big, i have to knock the door hardly to call my husband inside, and please give the qiblat direction in the room for muslim knowing the direction for prayer :) for service and other things i cant complaint for more :)
title: i love the longest infinity pool

date post: Fathul K wrote a review Sep 2016
text: Everything was just wonderful. Highly trained team, great room with top of the class amenities and fixture, great bedding, fluffy pillows, heavenly weather, as food to die for. Stayed here recently for a quick getaway, and the experience was superb. Love all the public area, starting from the unique caved like Spa, great restaurant with amazing view and of course excellent dinner we had here accompanied with great wine selections, and last but not least is the highlight of the resort was the heated pool makes a remarkable experience for us. Being situated on a high ground, the heated pool allowed us to enjoy swimming even at night. Definitely a must retreat when you are in Bali. Keep up the great work
title: Bali Trip 2 - 6 Sep

date post: Adila C wrote a review Aug 2016
text: everything was wonderful. the location was beautiful.the staff was polite and friendly, and place has a good energy. the food was excellent. we saw the chef, such a nice guy. the room was comfy and clean and they designed it with honeymoon decoration that we love. we spend four day of our honeymoon trip in heaven. we love our indonesian massage in hotel. we highly recommended padma resort ubud and certainly we will come back there soon.
title: A nice place to stay

text: Excellent accommodation, friendly staff, large beautifully decorated rooms.... Pool was just amazing.... Food & service was exceptional... About 25 minutes from Ubud in a beautiful tranquil location... Would highly recommend this accommodation! Enjoyed our few days stay immensely!
title: Belinda Jenkin

text: Excellent hotel in the very nice area Payangan, everything in the hotel was fantastic swimming pool,fitness room,very good breakfast/ restaurants and the Balinese massage Very nice staf ( we meet Fariz very nice guy from Java) Sampai jumpai dan terima kasih / matur suksma
title: Great stay!

text: Excellent hotel, Spacious and clean room Refreshing environment with lots of greeneries Love the swimming pool Excellent facilities for the whole family Enjoyed the morning yoga class The kids enjoyed the animal feeding session assisted by Pak Dharma Yoga Friendly staff
title: Padma Resort Ubud

date post: Nurkholis Ady wrote a review Dec 2020
text: Excellent service from check in to check out, everything was efficient and personalized. Room was huge, bathroom as well. the balcony is a good space for you to unwind. Lots of activities that you can try, unfortunately, the bamboo bridge was under maintenance during my stay. but there are other activities. Last, don't forget to stop by the Spa. to end your stay with a very memorable experience.
title: Energize Yourself

text: family vacation, quiet place surrounded by forest, friendly service, yoga, great breakfast / dine & great view, mini zoo, warm swimming pool with forest view. suitable for refreshing after work routines. And great price. worth the price
title: Hideout in the forest

date post: Maria Sabova wrote a review Jan 2017
text: Fantastic experience at Padma Ubud! The staffs were very friendly and attentive.Special thanks to ITA at Puhu Restaurant. Breakfast was good with good variety. Lunch and dinner good too but the thai coconut soup was salty and the braised beef was quite tough and chewy. After we feedback about the food, the executive chef came to our table explained to us and apologize. I can feel the staffs at Padma take feedback very seriously. Excellent service. The pool was amazing and was most definitely the highlight of our stay.
title: Amazing Stay!

date post: Julie R wrote a review Sep 2016
text: Far away from the beach and far away from the crowded this hotel is perfect place for honeymoon or escaping during hectic moment. Wonderful pool surronding by forest and hills,jogging track along the forest hotel and bambus trees ,we can't say much about the room hotel while we never been staying in this hotel but I can imagine to stay here for a couple nights but we had a nice visit and impressions for this hotel.
title: Quite and nice hotel in Ubud

date post: Samuel T wrote a review Sep 2016
text: Faultless. My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights and enjoyed every moment. It's an island of peace and tranquility close to otherwise chaotic Ubud. The service and amenities more than justified the price - The huge heated infinity pool and massive very well kept grounds are the highlight. We also took advantage of some of the provided guided bike tours with Sudana who was very knowledgeable and gave us a great insight into local culture.
title: The highlight of our trip

date post: Jakob R wrote a review Jan 2017
text: First I thought this place is suitable for honeymooners and after arrived there I still believe that, though you can also bring your family here as the pool is great for relax and enjoy with your family. The kids club activities also nice for children. The infinity view towards the mountain and greenery is great. Just remember to apply sunblock though. The water in the pool is warm. They also provided some floating devices like that colourful long flexible pipe so children don't need to bring their own. The view from room is also relaxing with the 2 seater couch in the balcony. You can even charge your electronic devices as they provide an electrical socket. There's a bath tub in my room separated from the toilet and the shower. Good thing too they provide toilet shower. The
title: Amazing place run by an amazing team

date post: Richard A wrote a review Dec 2016
text: First thing that hits your mind, is not to leave a good reply - so this place can stay 'your own little secret' :) But that's an impossible act regarding our experiences at this resort. We have never stayed at a more beautiful and relaxing place as this resort, we have never experienced such nice and service-minded staff. The owner of this place must be very satisfied with all his floor personnel :) We didn't believed that the extremely nice treatment we got when arriving would last our entire stay - but it only got even better :) We would like to leave a special remark for 3 in particular persons, who took the experience a bit further. First one is Clements: He was always very thoughtful, polite and a 'problem-solver' out of normal league. Thanks you for making our stay
title: Still one of the best resort in Ubud

text: First time at the Padma Ubud, and it's not near Ubud Central. While free shuttle was offered, only till 6pm and about 40 mins away. The infinity pool is an absolute gem and the only highlight of the hotel. The room is spacious and pillow menu is definitely a winner. We received a free 1hr Balinese massage at the spa and definitely the best massage we had in Bali. We wished the food menu in Puhu restaurant had more options, and room service menu was quite limited. Being far away from town, we wished the food options was a bit better.

For my family, every year coming back to Padma Ubud is like coming back to our second home. Our last visit was the first week they had just reopened. They followed all Covid health protocols and all guests was required to get their temparature taken before entering the premises. All of our luggages were sanitized, all of the staff wore a proper face mask, a hand sanitizer was stationed all over the hotel, and they even satinized small things like our pens. Our room was cleaned and sanitized then sealed properly afterwards. The staff is like family to us, from the amazing Bu Eti, our lovely Deasy, Pak Charda, Pak Sukarya, Pak Pong, Pak Gary, Pak Fatchu, Pak Ari, Debby, Desak Missing you like crazy Padma Ubud ... We will be back soon
title: Missing you like crazy Padma Ubud ...

date post: Brian Hendrata wrote a review Mar 2017
text: From Lombok to Bali, I would say that Lombok still sits back about 10 years. It's good to be back in Ubud. What can I say, my wife loved a quiet and serene spot, been searching around where to stay in Ubud and we came across Padma. I forgot exactly where, but the moment I saw the pictures, I know we would fall in love with the place! Fast forward, 12th of February, 2 days before Valentine and the moment when we got there, we knew exactly that we made the right choice. Upon arrival, yes we were greeted and served well by the crews. The front desk was exceptional and we knew that we were up for a great time with this kind of service. One of the hotel crews guided us through the hotel to our room and explained thoroughly what we would get during our stay! Impressive...yes but we
title: Amazing 2nd Honeymoon Spot

text: From the incredible smiles when we entered this fabulous resort, it just kept getting better. We upgraded to a club room which was well worth it. We enjoyed afternoon tea and cocktails served with delicious finger food from the fabulous chef and staff. Nothing was a problem and every wish was our command. The room upgrade was fantastic. A very special thank you to May, who welcomed us with open arms and escorted us to this magical view from the top floor with welcome drinks on arrival. The view was of rain forest, mountains and rice fields. Also, special thanks to Wahan whose smiles just brightened our days, not that they needed any. Another special thanks to our bike tour guide. We chose the "easy" ride and the guide took us into his village and gave us so much insight

From the moment my sister and I arrived we were made to feel like we were home. All the staff were friendly, warm, caring and helpful. Our room was a delight with beautiful views across the mountains. Cheff Kututs food was five star, he is a true culinary artist. With a fantastic activity list there is something gor everyone . We did the cooking class with Chef Kutut, which was one of the highlights of our stay. Getting into Ubud central for some shopping, which was about 45 mins away was easy with the resorts shuttle service., though we found we were happiest when at the resort swimming in the amazing infinity pool, or relaxing on the resturant balcony during the daily afternoon tea taking in the amazing views, which is included in ypur stay. The place itself is

From the moment we arrived at the hotel we were treated like special family guests. We arrived at 1130pm as our flight was delayed and hour and it took 1hr30 min to get from the airport to the hotel. We were greeted by a bright and cheery sales agent who gave us a hot up of ginger and lemongrass tea. Be warned it is a lot cooler up in the mountains we were so unprepared a light shawl would be perfect. Our room was beautiful, lashed out and booked the Premier Club room so view over pool and valley. Breakfast was in the club where you could access the buffet or choose from the menu and those meals were divine. Club access also gives you afternoon tea where you have nibbles, tea & coffee, then back at 430pm for cocktails and canapÃ©s all the time served to you like you are
title: Luxury hotel

text: From the moment we arrived at this absolutely magnificent complex, we were blown away by the 5* service, the hotel and its facilities available to us . The staff made us feel so welcome - there was nothing they could not do for us! Our Club room, on the third level opened up to beautiful views over the jungle to Mt Agung, which we did manage to see twice!! ðŸ˜Š The cocktail hours & afternoon teas were superb in the Club room & the food in the Puhu Restaurant (thank you Ketut) was second to none. Special thank you's to Wahyu, Debby & Meitria. It may be a 40 minute drive up from Ubud, but a superb place to come to unwind after the hustle & bustle of Southern Bali. A big Thank you to you all - can't rate this highly enough. A Hotel so new with superb old school hospitality we will

from the moment we arrived the staff were absolutely great. the resort is luxury beyond compare.the pool is amazing .the view from our room was great . would have loved to stay longer.The walkways and amenities were fantastic.

date post: Carley R wrote a review Mar 2017
text: From the moment we arrived to Padma Ubud, we were in constant awe of the incredible jungle surroundings and beautifully designed resort. You enter the property through a magnificent gate and the grounds are in immaculate condition. From the outdoor lobby to the spacious rooms to the enormous infinity pool, Padma delights at every turn. The 5 star staff was top notch. The breakfast buffet is amazing and the jungle trail is a nice way to walk off those few extra pancakes. We spent our afternoons making friends at the swim-up pool bar and floating in the magnificent infinity pool. Nicest pool I've ever been in. The shuttle service to Ubud center was very convenient and super easy. We also did a private BBQ one night on the lawn and would highly recommend it. If you're in the
title: Little Slice of Paradise in Ubud

text: From the moment we arrived we loved it. Our room was spacious, clean everything you need there. The view was superb of the tropical forest. The pool was to die for!! One of the most peaceful places on earth. Would highly recommend if your after some serenity. I wish we had more time to stay longer.

date post: Christopher H wrote a review Sep 2016
text: From the moment you walk into the lobby of this hotel you know you are going to have a great experience. Elegant, luxurious absolutely gorgeous. Staff were absolutely amazing.Whn we arrived there, the staff welcomed us very friendly.Specially the small young lovely lady in the restaurant, name is Amelia.She is so nice to us and we really like the way she explained everything about the facilities in the hotel.Our room was so luxurious with amazing views! Restaurant staff were fantastic. We went to the Puhu restaurant which was great. This hotel was on my bucket list and didn't disappoint. Would highly recommend it.
title: Personalized and genuine

text: From what we'd read on internet and in guidebooks, Ubud was supposed to be a 'serene' spot to get away from the more hectic tourist towns in the south, but we found it almost equally crowded and chaotic. So we were really glad we'd booked this hotel. It's an oasis of calm surrounded by green jungle, well laid-out and spacious and also refreshingly cool, at least in the evenings, due to its altitude. Admittedly, it's a trek out of Ubud, but that was an advantage as far as we were concerned and we only went in once during our stay. There is plenty to do at the hotel itself - with its amazing, huge infinity pool and the views out over the jungle as you sip on cocktails at the pool bar. The gym is decent (could do with another running machine) and they have a picturesque jogging
title: excellent hotel all around

text: Good place for relaxing, detox, and clear your mind. The room, the air, and everything else was perfect..only one thing they should try to make it better, the food and the service at the restaurant. It was just okay, not fantastic. The scenery was just great, perfect if the food was great. I visited this in july, it is windy, drizzle dan cold. So should bring your jacket and long pants. It's perfect for family and couples. Cheers!

Great hotel with great family activities.. yoga, archery, golf, animal feeding, kids club, cycling, trekking.. especially archery.. i love it â¤ï¸ Friendly staff.. very clean.. pool with good view â¤ï¸ Will be back soon ðŸ˜
title: Great place for family holiday

text: Great services with strict social distancing and satisfactory cleaning procedure. Delicious breakfast. Kids enjoyed animal farm and heated swimming poolðŸ‘. Booked archery and beginner mountain bike tour but it was cancelled due to rain.

date post: adiwena n wrote a review Sep 2015
text: Green bali.. Feel the real village of Bali.. Finding so much beauty hidden in this tropical wilderness.. Enjoying the village by moving around with bike.. Great pool with the view of natural forrest of puhu village.. The First thing to visit in bali before Karangasem / Bedugul village.. And great food also!
title: Cast away, Hide away, Authentic Bali!

text: Had a blast amazing resort. Amazing heated pool. Amazing food. Amazing staff. Amazing views. Can not wait to return. Everything was perfect. Even the daily activities were good. Bar in the pool was a bonus.
title: Padma Ubud

date post: Putu Hidemi wrote a review Nov 2020
text: Had a night stay at this resort and i can say all of the staff really fulfill my expectation. This resort also followed by a good safety and hygiene protocol. The heated infinity pool and the jacuzzi are so insane we love it. Special thanks and love to Bli Dade for the relaxing and warm morning yoga class, Mbo Kandri who done my massage and Bu Rasmi who being so helpful at SPA. Also Pande and Debby xx
title: wonderful staycation experience

date post: renny h wrote a review Dec 2020
text: Had such an amusinnngggg stay! Great jobb padma ubud resort. Its a one night stayed, but with million experiences! My first swing and bogey golf, and Archerryyy ðŸ¥°ðŸ¥° will definitely back! Bli Agus as the expert of Archery helped me, another thing to tell, he is super friendly!
title: Wonderful stay

text: Have just enjoyed 3 nights at this beautiful resort. While this was my first visit, my wife had stayed here in December 2015 and assured me that it was well worth the hour and a half drive from the airport. As usual, she was right.The resort is sensational, and did not disappoint in any way. The surroundings are amazing and all staff as we have experienced from the Padma Legion are extremely friendly and accommodating. Despite the fact that we arrived close to midnight, our check in was quick and painless. We found the dining options within the hotel to be more than satisfactory and as we had already visited Ubud on previous occasions, we were happy to relax and enjoy the stunning surroundings. The pool is amazing and while all staff were fantastic, we would like to pass our
title: Padma mixology

text: Having been a Padma Bali regular holiday maker not venturing past The Legian resort decided to try the Padma special - mountain and beach package, starting with 3 nights in the new Ubud resort followed by 4 in Legian with all transfers taken care of. Padma Ubud is 2 hrs from the airport located in a timt village called Puhu which is 45 minutes from the Ubud town centre. Padma ubud is approx. 1 year old now and is a beautiful well designed resort over looking the bamboo and rainforest. When we stayed here is was very quiet, this we enjoyed with only 30 or so rooms occupied. The rooms are beautiful and slightly larger than you will find else where, with all room shaving a nice balcony with a view. The infinity swimming pool is lovely, heated and comes with a stunning also over
title: A Beautiful, secluded rainforest retreat

text: Having stayed many times at the older and acclaimed sister hotel in Legian we thought this worth a try. Sure, it's still early days, but effusive niceness can be irritating if overdone. Our first dinner was very disappointing. Great location and view, but indifferent service. 10 minute delay with first glass of barely drinkable house wine - with red wine served from the refrigerator! We ordered a second round as they rushed to take our entree plates. They arrived after our mains and were miserable 5 oz max. And despite being quiet it seemed that they were in a selective rush. I had barely placed my cutlery down when my plate was swept away - despite my wife still eating. Just poorly trained wait staff. The place is screaming out for a highly experienced front of house manager

Hi everybody, We have visited Padma resort Ubud in july 2016. It was a deal from Padma ,3 nights in Ubud and 4 nights in Legian. We have to say Padma resort Ubud was one of the best we ever been. And we travel quite a lot. Rooms are very clean, staff is very polite and smiling all the time they see you. In the room we had a coffee machine which for us was verry handy,as we love our coffee... a lot..ðŸ˜€ðŸ˜€ðŸ˜€ When we arrived , we asked the butler for a softer pillow,and in couple of minutes they supplied one.The swimming pool is heated with an amaizing view over the forest. They have even a small pool underneath the big one with waterfall which we loved it ...verry verry nice.So if anybody wants a relaxing time in Bali ,to forget about KIdsðŸ˜€ðŸ˜€ðŸ˜€ , problems...etc we verry
title: Excellent hotel

date post: Kerry C wrote a review May 2016
text: Highly recommend a visit to Padma Ubud/Puhu. Amazing resort, beautiful rooms, stunning views, serenity, wonderful staff. Just go and see for yourselves !!!
