Will be heading back during my next trip to Bali. Mountain/Beach package is the perfect way to experience this fantastic resort. Thanks for a great few days everyone !!! ðŸ˜
title: Most beautiful peaceful resort.

text: Highly recommend this amazing hotel. The staff were friendly and compensating. They organized transport for us back to the airport at a discounted price. They also have incredible activities like biking and nature hikes. On top of it all, it is the best pool i have ever been to. highly recommended

I absolutely love this resort. From the beautiful scenery, comprehensive facilities, good service, spacious room, amazing pool, and very nice breakfast buffet. If you love nature then you don't have to look elsewhere as you get an abundant of it here. I encourage to either walk or go for a bike ride through the local village. If you prefer to stay within the resort compound, you can make great use of their jogging track. It's terrific for family as well as they have daily activities to keep your kids busy. Keep in mind this resort is far from Ubud so if you're looking to go out and about into town, it's best to pick somewhere closer. However, if you are looking to relax and really take in nature then this is it.

date post: Bev D wrote a review Dec 2015
text: I agree with all other reviews, the placement of the resort is just breathtaking. I would love to return to see the finished hotel, that's not to say that it was inconvenient in anyway while we were there, The staff are so attentive and genuinely willing to help in anyway that they can. Katut is an amazing chef and lovely person who's finished products are better than anything I have seen on master chef, the presentation, taste etc is fantastic. The resort is set near a local village that is untouched by tourism as yet. You can ride a bike on a guided tour by the activities staff and see how the villages operate, how the farming is attended to and hear how the resort has assisted children in the village with scholarships and work. I could praise the resort all day, however I
title: Fantastic

text: I always came back to Padma Ubud for our anniversary and my birthday. Im so in love with this place and its people. For me Padma Ubud is my second home in Bali. The resort manager, the kind and beautiful Miss Deasy Sagita always made me feel so special! From flower lei greeting, her warm hug and smile, and birthday cake in my room. She is very meticulous about detail, she knows about my acute asthma and very carefully making sure no bug spray and air freshener in my room. Breakfast and tea time always amazing! The whole staff are amazing, Miss Deasy, Mr Klemmens, Mr Gary they all very profesional doing what they do best. I will be back soon .... I miss Padma Ubud already

date post: erik b wrote a review Dec 2016
text: I always like staying at Padma chains. It's unpretentious, generous and friendly. If you are looking for a 'designer' hotel then Padma is not for you, but if you are looking for a comfortable stay with affordable rate then this is a great stay. The rooms are well appointed, proximity between pool and rooms is perfect. For those bringing kids, you can practically leave your kids at the play club for free where they have different programs everyday. The only minus for this hotel is the location which is around 40 mins from Ubud Center where foods are located.
title: Very nice hotel and area

date post: Sarah N wrote a review Sep 2016
text: I am a frequent traveller and visit Asia regularly. I must say this hotel was everything I had hoped for. The service, resort environment, activities offered and decor throughout the resort was fantastic a true 5 star luxury hotel. The staff and service : Absolutely fantastic faultless nothing too much trouble. All staff were friendly helpful and attentive. A credit to the management at the resort. Room: Beautiful interiors and the view was breathtaking. The room was spacious and had a lovely balcony area. Cleaned immaculately everyday. Activities : If you can pull yourself away from the am amazing infinity pool I would recommend doing the bike ride and jogging track. The gym was nice with a good selection of equipment. Food : Breakfast was a delight everyday and we dined
title: Amazing stunningly beautiful resort with outstanding customer service

text: I and my friend visited Padma Resort for spa. We had aloe pack massage for sunburned skin. Wish its duration was longer! While aloe was covered on our body, masseuses gave us head massage. The head massage made me straight to fall asleep. We took such a long time to change up though, they patiently waited for us. ^^ After massage, we had so much fun talking with Ms. Okta. I already miss her. :D She is very welcoming and cool. (She should really try and go to Batu mountain! Haha) I would like to stay here next time visiting Bali. :)
title: Peaceful time at Spa!

text: I can be really short about my stay in Padma Resort, because everything was just amazing. Room, views, infinity pool, service, drinks, everything! If you're looking for a beautiful experience in the middle of the jungle, go to Padma. It's around 20 minutes up north from Ubud centre (by motorbike).
title: Incredible!

text: I cannot begin to explain how amazing this resort is. It is by far heaven on earth. From the stunning rooms to the amazing pool and dining area it's perfect in every way. We started our first morning with sunrise yoga, walking down to one of the lower levels below the pool we were greeted by mats, towels and water bottles as well as the most beautiful setting for morning yoga. Breakfast consists of a buffet with many different choices from fruit to cooked and traditional Balinese, there is something for everyone. The Infinity pool is situated on the edge of the resort overlooking the iconic forest of Ubud. Itâ€™s the first heated pool in Bali and because of this it creates
title: Heaven on Earth

text: I cannot express how wonderful this resort is: from the moment we arrived we felt thoroughly welcome, the rooms are spacious, brand new and very comfortable. The outdoor areas are spectacular - the enormous heated infinity pool overlooks the surrounding countryside, and the staff are always on hand to provide towels or to take food and drink orders. Here I have to give special thanks to Jery Araiwan from the pool bar for taking such good care of me and my friends! I had a small fall during my stay (through sheer clumsiness!), within seconds I was whisked to the nurses station and delivered safely to a nearby doctor for an evaluation - all was fine, but still I felt very secure that should something happen, the team would be watching out for me: so if you have any concerns
title: Blown away by this place

text: I couldn't imagine a more beautiful place to stay. The staff were amazingly friendly. Could not fault the facilities and service. We didn't want to leave! We will be back for sure and won't stay anywhere else!
title: Amazing pool

text: I had a lovely stay. Though the hotel wasn't fully finished yet, nothing bothered me through out my stay because it was all covered with great service, hospitality, room, view, food, pool and activities from the hotel. I'll be sure to come and visit again soon.
title: Cozy

date post: Denish G wrote a review Dec 2020
text: I had good times staying here in Padma Ubud. The view is very nice. The room is clean. So many activities you can do here especially during this pandemic. Thank you very much for all of the staffs and the teachers (Bli Fiska (Aerial Yoga & Biking) , Bli Wayan Budi (Vinyasa Yoga & Golf) , Bli Lenu (Vinyasa Yoga) Bli Agus (Archery).
title: Best staycation

text: I have visit to padma resort ubud, I can say if Padma Resort .... Great resort. the staff friendly and helpful. the view was amazing, great pool, great jogging track and great rooms. also very beautiful landscape.

I love this hotel. Very nice place to relaxing and tranquil for any occasion. Beautiful View with manicured landscape and garden at pool area while enjoying Hi-Tea. Warm hospitality can be felt from the moment you step in at the lobby until in the restaurant with genuien service from the staff with Bali hospitality. I very recommend hotel in Ubud, Bali.
title: Very nice place

date post: Yunkyung Cho wrote a review Nov 2020
text: I spent 3 nights here. In here there are a lot of activities to do. Such as Yoga, golf, archery, kids club and so on. My favorite activity was animal garden. In the animal garden we can feed many animals. I liked catching fish and giving it to otters. The staff member Geday was very kind and he he helped us to catch a lot of fishes. Everysingle staffs were kind in here. Breakfast, afternoon tea, dinner buffet was delicious. The room condition was very good with nice view.
title: Padma ubud resort

text: I spent my christmas holiday here, the food was good, I love the bread, it's really fresh, the fried rice taste good, The pool and the view was really beautiful, there are jogging track and they has a sunset yoga. The room was nice, we was happy stay at Padma hotel, they have a really friendly staff. Recommended
title: Excellence

date post: Shandy Reinata wrote a review Nov 2020
text: I stayed 3 nights in Padma. They just recently opened a month ago after several months closed due to pandemic.. They followed all health protocol and it was super safe to stay here. The swimming pool indeed the best in Ubud. The river track, jogging track, the animal farm all were satisfying. Should've stayed longer! Lol. Thank you Padma. Will definitely come again I enjoyed archery and bike tour with LENU. And the morning Yoga with instructor MADE was SUPER AMAZING..
title: A great experience

date post: Nur Rukiati wrote a review Nov 2016
text: I stayed at Padma Resort Ubud with my friends for Goal Praying event of Emotional Healing Indonesia on 18-20 Nov'16. My room was perfect, beautiful view from restaurant during breakfast and dinner, food was delicious, largest swimming pool I've ever tried with water heater, the staffs was friendly and very helpful. Thank you Padma Resort, very recommended place to stay in Ubud.
title: Great place to stay for business & leisure

text: I stayed at Padma Ubud for 2 nights. Me and my husband love everything about this hotel, friendly staff, excellent butler service, nice room and view, delicious breakfast, amazing jogging track, and so many free activities that you can do at the hotel. We did archery, mini golf, morning yoga, and it was very enjoyable! The staffs are ready to help you about whatever you need, and this is what I like most about this hotel! It makes me want to come back again someday to Padma Ubud when I visit Bali. The access is good, it's 30mins drive from Ubud Center. This hotel is very suitable for family who have kids.
title: everything is excellent!

text: I stayed at Padma Ubud resort for 6 days. I have to say it was an amazing stay there and I would definitely stay again! Definitely paradise. Activities they provide activities ranging from yoga, to Balinese classes, to visit villages, planting to name a few. We were only able to do the village visit and Balinese lessons which was very fun and interesting. Arya was a great tour guide on the village visit and I learnt a lot about Bali from him. Only if I had more time there, I would do all the activities. Breakfast loved every bit of it! There were so many varieties that I never got bored. My friend and I looked forward to our breakfast buffet every morning. Afternoon tea was also provided. Smaller range but it was still amazing. Food there is definitely great quality

I stayed at the Padma for three nights from December 27th. While my friend and I arrived past 1am and didn't have the chance to see the property, we were extremely pleased with the rooms, which are super spacious, well-lit and had excellent amenities and toiletries. They provide free bottled water daily, coffee and tea. Upon waking up early the next day, I had a chance to see the surroundings, which are lush trees from the forest surrounding the property. I took advantage of the spacious balcony to read and relax and wasn't bothered at all by any bugs that I had been forewarned about. Breakfast was at the fourth floor restaurant with an amazing view of the fabulous infinity pool overlooking the forest. The breakfast was quite busy with many guests and though their was something
title: And exhale...

date post: Tara P wrote a review Jul 2016
text: I stayed at the Padma Ubud Resort for a relaxing vacation and that is exactly what I got and more.... I must say the breathtaking view from the Wine Lounge was absolutely my favorite attribute of the resort besides the staff :) Hotel was impeccable, new and filled with a very gracious staff that made me feel welcomed when being so very far from home. All meals were of excellent caliber with an extensive selection for all palates. During my stay there were specifically 3 staff members that stood out to me. Elsy (not sure if I am spelling her name correctly) who works in the Puhu Restaurant went out of her way to welcome me on my first day at the resort and made sure my lunch was prepared for me and brought to the Wine Lounge where I was sitting. This was very much appreciated.
title: Blissful

text: I stayed at this hotel twice. One night in August and 2 nights earlier this week for business purposes and I have to say that Padma Ubud is so great. The architecture is so Bali, the view it gives to each room is breathtaking, the pool! OMG the pool is so nice, it is so pretty and the water is warm making it even greater. The foods are yummy with its wide range of choices, the staffs are very very nice and helpful, the room quality is so good starting from its big TV screen, its comfy huge king sized bed, its amenities, its complimentary fruits and drinks (various of teas!), i loved the room especially for the bathroom setting. Everything is perfect. I have no complain at all and I'm planning to visit it again this year. Thank you Padma Ubud for the pleasent experiences^^

date post: Jaspreet S wrote a review Apr 2017
text: I stayed here during my honeymoon for four nights. The hotel is fairly isolated and as such guests have to rely upon the resort itself for entertainment, meals and spa services. It is these areas that real improvement could be made. The hotel itself is set in incredibly beautiful surroundings. The setting is lush jungle, the hotel also has 3 hectares of cultivated land in which almost every tropical fruit and spice is grown. However the quality of the food does not reflect the outstanding service, the exceptional setting, or the beautifully appointed rooms. Breakfast is varied and delicious, however the choices for lunch and dinner are not up to the standards I would expect from such a wonderful hotel. The afternoon tea is particularly poor. There are no sandwiches on offer
title: Almost great

date post: Yohan Y wrote a review Jan 2017
text: I stayed in Padma Ubud with my wife to celebrate our first Honeymoon. In this special occasion, we reserved a one bedroom suite with a privilidge membership that came along with the package. On our first night arriving in the hotel, we met a wonderful assistant manager by the name of Mr Clement Suseno. He was and is an extremely nice gentleman and staff. He helped us to get to know our room and the hotel's facilities. Our room was facing two mountains: Gunung Batul and Gunung Agung. And, it, appatently, has the best view for sunrise. We could see the majesctic sunrise and the mountains and the paddy's field at the same time in the morning while we were enjoying our morning warm jacuzzi. We highly recommend that others who would stay in this room to bring a DSLR camera to
title: The Best Hotel in Ubud Bali

date post: Reshma D wrote a review Oct 2016
text: I stayed in the 2 bedroom suite with some friends for 4 nights, and the whole experience was amazing. The beds were so comfortable, we could choose which pillow type we wanted, the rooms & bathrooms were very spacious & nice, the breakfasts & food in general was delicious and high quality, the pool area and grounds around the hotel were beautiful & immaculate, the gym is good & has a great view, the day spa was so nice, they offer extra free activities like sunrise yoga & bike riding, and I could go on and on... We had access to the club lounge as part of our package, and I'd definitely recommend it to add to an even more fantastic experience, with lots of extras included. The best thing about the hotel were the staff. Everyone that we encountered was so friendly, helpful &
title: The best place to be

text: I stayed there for 2 nights and I don't think I would come again. The resort was extremely far and it wasn't offer much. The pool was average, the spa place looked average too. The room was spacey and beautiful tho. But unfortunately the view was not as good. The breakfast wasn't tasty. We had pool party with the LG mobile group and the food was average too. Even the gelato doesn't pleased me at all. The staff were friendly and helpful.

date post: farnaz z wrote a review Oct 2016
text: I think everybody stayed here would be impressed how they express the two words: "elegant" and "legendary". They exactly set the top standard of hospitality.this our honey moon trip and lovely stuff suprise us . U can go throw the jungle and river
title: The best one

text: I think the major area for improvement is the food. It was awful and too salty etc. It became an issue for me since i went there to really spend quiet leisure time at the hotel and didnt wanna travel to the city centre. So i was depending so much on the hotel food. Also this hotel is quite far from Ubud city (45 mins with only 5 schedules to and from there) makes dining in even more preferred. I hope they'll fix it because the food is quite expensive too. Other than that, was awesome. Situated in a quiet rather isolated area make this hotel perfect for honeymooners or just family looking for some quiet time together. The pool is a must to try, jogging track down to the river and bridge is also a nice activity. Wifi deserves compliments as well as the spacious beautiful room and
title: It could've been even better

text: I think this is the best hotel I've ever stayed at. It feels brand new, the staff are really nice and friendly, and that infinity pool is simply amazing. Whoever designed this place knew what they were doing. We barely left the resort! Happy hour was fun ;) and we had great massages and yoga classes. The food is great and that breakfast buffet... wow. The kids had chocolate donuts and fruit salad every morning! The kids club was good quality too - lovely staff (thanks Tina!). One of our daughters spent more time there than she did with us!
title: Absolute paradise. You really wont be disappointed.

text: I unreservedly recommend this resort if you are looking for a remote, relaxed getaway in a STUNNING setting with the most amazing pool and service. If you want to be in walking distance of anywhere, this place is not for you.....a trip into Ubud can be enjoyed easily but be aware it took us an hour on the shuttle bus (each way). The spa is fantastic, beautiful setting and excellent massage.....our 10 year old daughter was also treated like a princess there, enjoying their young persons massage and facial offering. My only criticism (and this is small and maybe a personal thing) the traditional music played at breakfast was the opposite of relaxing, the plinky plunk sound drilled into me and detracted from the incredible tranquility of the setting. A huge thank you to the

I very rarely return to the same destination/ hotel twice as i feel that it is a big world out there, so i am reluctant to visit somewhere more than once... however Padma Ubud is a hotel i will return to again and again. If you are looking for somewhere to escape from real life, relax, sleep better than you have ever slept in your life and unwind, then this is the place for you. The photos online speak for themselves. This resort is well worth the 1 + 1/2 hour car journey from the airport. From the minute you get out of your taxi, the atmosphere is just so relaxing. You don't hear any noise from traffic, mopeds, tourists etc. that you can hear in other areas of Bali such as Seminyak, Nusa Dua and such like. This results in the best night's sleep you will ever have. The
title: Beyond words...Amazing!!!

date post: Theodorus E wrote a review Jan 5
text: I visited Padma Resort with my wife and we had an absolutely delightful experience there. So many activities to enjoy there esp the cycling experience with Bli Fiska. Had my best breakfast ever at Padma, their guava jam was out of the world. They use their own cultivated fruits and vegetables so no question for the freshness. All crews were so helpful and friendly. I believe I had my best resort experience at Padma Ubud.
title: Visiting Padma Resort Ubud

text: I visited this beautiful resort just over a week ago. The resort was magical, the staff were incredible and warm and their new Club Room was amazing. The service in this room was beyond all expectations. Everything about this hotel was beyond fault. I applaud the owner of this hotel. Thank you for my amazing experience ðŸ˜Š. Just a couple of photos below of parts of this place.
title: If you're looking for peace, tranquility and luxury...

text: I was amazed by the personal care, friendliness, the rooms and infinite pool at the Padma Ubud. Most of all we were impressed by the the way we were treated, like royalties. On our arrival we were escorted to the club room where we were greeted with a necklace of flowers and smily, kind faces. We all sat down looking into the most amazing tropical views of the surroundings and the views of the infinite pool just below. At the club lounge the table was soon filled with complimentary afternoon tea and refreshments. At this point My 3 girls were feeling very special and my husband and I knew this was going to be an amazing 3 days. The staff were always so helpful, friendly and genuine in their approach to make our stay a very incredible experience especially with the

date post: Luhputu Setiawati wrote a review Nov 2020
text: I was stay at Padma Resort Ubud on 2nd - 3rd November 2020 with my family. I really loved over all of the resort! From the first step of my booking, i just amazed with the reservation staff and the GM as well. They taking care of my reservation well. The GM sent me the preference letter as well. I'd loved how they treated their guest. After i check in, i amazed with their health protocol. Really really apreciate it. For me thats the important things while we have a staycation in this Pandemi situation. All the staff really nice, until i noticed 1 name "Bli Nisca". And i think he was from activity team. He was noticed my family from my first day stay when my family enjoy the pool in the afternoon. He noticed my nephew due to she don't want to stop swimming and the day after
title: Birthday Staycation at Padma Resort Ubud

date post: Carnaby W wrote a review Dec 2016
text: I was staying with my dear mother at the Padma resort Ubud....the receptionist who checked us in couldn't speak English...and the bit he spoke , I didn't understand...finally after discussing to get a room with 2beds(the last time I slept with my mother in a double bed was a long time ago)...the told us us about the shuttle bus...the last one is at 9pm...and we better should be at the meeting point 10minutes b fore...because otherwise...they would drive away....and that would be real bad....because don't get fooled with the name UBUD IN THE NAME OF THE RESORT.,the place is 40minutes away behind never-never-land. Every night we took the last shuttle from the city toothed hotel...guess what we were.on time...but the drivers always 30-40 minutes late....even the car was there
title: Excellent

text: I will start my review by saying THANK YOU, to all the staff in the Padma Resort for making our stay an INCREDIBLE experience. Especially to EKO, I will explain later why. It all started with the pickup, we were staying at The Mulia in Nusa Dua and the butler there contacted Padma staff and the sent for us, for free. The driver was really punctual and friendly he took us yo a Batik store and to a coffee shop. You would like to know that is a 2 hours drive up hill, but it is all worth it when you reach the resort! They welcomed us with drinks and quick check in, showed us our room (4th floor) and invited us to go and get to know the facilities. We were dying to see the pool and the wait was worth it, amazing views of the jungle and perfect temp to dip in. We spent Christmas

I work in customer service and never have I ever experienced such devoted service to customers. From the bell boy to the gardeners to the wait staff to reception, all staff wanted to serve you and upon making requests genuine responses such as "my pleasure" was music to my ears. The grounds and facilities themselves are gorgeous and Ubud is absolutely stunning. Best hotel I have stayed in, nothing could be faulted. Also we had Koka as our "butler" (driver) and his English was wonderful and he was always helpful and a great communicator. Very charming and entertaining and a great member of the Padma Ubud team!

date post: Tim B wrote a review Dec 2015
text: I would like to commend Hima (F&B Manager) and his team for an excellent service and support that he and his team lend to me! I planned a surprise for my Girlfriend's bday at Padma Puhu and everything went well with the help of Hima's team. We checked in and you will be welcomed by relaxing tea, wet towels and warm welcome by every staffs in padma. Thanks to mr budi for the orientation of the property and trekking the huge property of the hotel. Hima helped me to prepare the room with balloons and flowers. as well as a romantic table setup dinner that i my self didn't expect to happen. also the whole waiters and chefs available went out and sing birthday song for my Girlfriend. I am in awe and very thankful with the extramile legendary service and unforgettable experience.
title: Wonderful!

text: If bright lights and jingle bells are your thing, then this isnt the one of you. But if you are looking for an oasis in the mountains, this is it. The hotel location is fabulous, tucked into a valley with the most gorgeous views from the heated infinity pool. Mist rising, sun setting..it was breath taking, more than words can describe. Ok, so thats the pool. How about the room? This was beautiful, we loved it from the moment we entered and it just made us feel so..."I'm glad we booked here". Staff were wonderful, however, on returning to our room later, had a small cause for complaint and believe me, the team were amazing. Special mention to Ms Daesy who co-ordinated with me and really made me feel like even the smallest complaint is an important one. We honestly couldnt thank
title: One of the most tranquil, beautiful hotels we have ever stayed at

text: I'm not sure where to start. This was one of our most opulent and luxurious getaways. We booked for 2 nights and stayed at one of the club rooms. We were courteously taken to provate check in at club lounge. And then came the surprise. The view. Totally OMG moment! The pool was just beautiful and so was the view of the mountains. Check out the pics. The room was super spacious and the toilet was grand. I told the hotel we were in our honeymoon - beautifully decorated bed with flower petals, delicious cake and a romantic bath ready to be drawn with bath salts and an essential oil. My wife loved it. Customer service was impeccable. Always smiling. Breakfast was just fantastic - always had the chef's signature special. Plus we had access to the buffet, which was delicious. Fresh
title: Should be 10 star hotel

text: I'm writing this review from the verandah of the Puhu Restaurant at Padma Ubud after a sumptuous, delicious breakfast with a myriad of choices. Overlooking the phenomenal 250m long infinity pool and beautiful jungle my husband and I do not want to leave but alas have non refundable hotel in Canggu from today. We've been here 7 nights and this place is magical, serene, healing, beautiful and our top 2 favourite Hotels we have ever stayed at and we have travelled the globe and filled several passports between us. This resort is less than 18 months old and we found a deal on scoopon for Premier deluxe Room. The rooms are decorated in the fashion of modern Balinese and understated luxury. A humungous shower with excellent water flow and fixed rainhead and adjustable shower head with
title: You'll never want to leave...

date post: Alin K wrote a review Nov 2016
text: Imagine, the sun has set and the steam is rising off the pool, you have a frosty cocktail in your hand while you look out into the lush spectacular rainforest. A perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of the usual tourist destinations. Padma Ubud is about 40 minutes (more in traffic) from Ubud itself. If you're looking for shopping, massages, cheap eats and drinks... I wouldnt stay here. If you're looking for peace, tranquility, relaxation and luxury, then this place will be your very own heaven. The bike riding activity is strongly recommended, see how the locals are living and explore the village. If you don't want to pay Australian prices for drinks then please bring your own! We love to have a few beers but it becomes too expensive every night (even with the happy hour).
title: Perfect!

text: In June 2016 my husband and I stayed at The Padma Resort in Ubud for 3 nights, halfway through a trip to Bali. We have previously stayed at The Padma Resort in Legian on numerous occasions. We love The Padma Resort in Legian so we had high expectations for the new Ubud resort. It had only been open for 3 or 4 months at the time however The Padma Resort in Ubud was everything we had imagined and more. We had initially booked a Premier room (standard King Room) however when we arrived, we were told that as the resort was not fully booked yet, we would be upgraded to a Premier Club room for no extra cost. The room overlooked the jungle (the same view from the pool) and it was amazing! Just like The Padma Resort in Legian the room was decorated beautifully, spacious and super
title: Amazing place â¤ï¸

text: In reality the hotel is more beautiful. If you visited Bali, this hotel is a MUST. The staff is the most friendly that I ever meet. Thanks to everyone, especialy to ARDANA, because you made our stay to be memorable.

In short: - the staff are friendly and very accommodating - the surrounds are devine - the facilities e.g. gym etc. are great - included activities e.g. bicycling, yoga etc. are a fun addition to each day - the food is great - the rooms are large and very clean - the spa is devine... Tina was fantastic - the pool is just stunnng It is in a fairly remote location so if you're looking for some real downtime in the lush, green jungle... this will be perfect for you. I really enjoyed my time here!

In the normal mornings, you can see both Mount Batur and Mount Agung standing side by side behind the forests. The water is cool during the day to provide an invigorating oasis on warm afternoons, allowing you to spend countless hours of relaxing moment looking at the enchanting bamboo forests of Payangan.
title: Paradise

text: It is a wonderful hotel combined with its friendly hosoitality staff. Thanks to jerry the waittress. I enjoyed alot visiting there and it is such a paradise in jungle. The nice pool with cheap offer does worth to be appreciated
title: Amazing visit

text: It is a wonderful resort in ubud bali, I loved the amazing service we received, the beautiful location away from everything else. It was the perfect place to refresh the mind and stay relax, the infinity pool so beautiful with an amazing view overlooking the jungle and valley of payangan, just like a real paradise, thanks for Jerry and Guna for amazing service. see you next year
title: Luxury combined with the beauty

text: It is simply the most luxurious and amazing resort I have ever stayed in. Rooms were exquisite, the infinity pool was voted the best pool in Indonesia (completely agree) and the swim up bar is an extremely wonderful asset to the pool and resort itself. The Restaurants provided high quality food and all this was made 100 times better by the staff. Bartenders Eko and Agus took it to the next level and added a lot to the already amazing experience. They both make extremely nice and visually appealing cocktails.The mixology class with Agus is highly recommended as he takes you to the luxurous herb and fruit garden to then come back to the bar and create your very own cocktails! Overall by far the most amazing experience I've ever had at a hotel/resort and you will not regret it one

date post: Jeny F wrote a review Apr 2016
text: It takes approximately 2 hours to reach here in the middle of Payangan, Ubud, Bali from the city (Denpasar) by car, but it was all paid off when I stepped in to this gorgeous resort. The freshly air to breathe and the blend of nature surroundings around this traditional yet modern touch resort so amazing. The staff are all great and attentive to details and served me well upon checking in and out. They're always smiling and taking care of their duty kindly. The room itself is really big, I chose the room with breathtaking view of their infinity pool and jungle from the balcony. Bed is really comfortable with a choice of pillows for convenient, bathroom is large with bathtub, shower room, and great amenities plus the hot hanger to dry towels just in case towels didnt dry enough
title: Hotel stat

date post: V S wrote a review Dec 2020
text: It was nice to do the Archery for the first time. And the trainer Pak Kayan (Mr.K) was very funny helpful and patient with all of us. Padma Ubud is one of the best hotel I've stayed ever. The location is amazing in the middle of the forest but totally clean and cured in any detail.
title: Archery at Padma hotel ubud

text: It was really nice staying 3 night at Padma Resort Ubud. Excellent services starting from airport transfer (at Pak Surya) receptionist services (at Laras) , room services, house keeping (at Sewarta), and for sure all foods at Puhu (at Pak Solo, Mba Wiwin, Juliarti, Desak, Eva, and others) & Pool Restaurant (pak Kayan & others) Excellent services for all staff hospitality. Best place for relax Nice atmosphere Room is spacious Definitely we will be back again for sure. Thank you
title: Vacation at Padma Resort Ubud

text: It was very fun to cyling and saw paddy field. Animal park is clean and has many animals variety. Our children having fun in Padma Ubud. Pak Kayan was very Nice & helpful guide. The hotel staff and manager also very friendly. Recomended for this hotel
title: Awesome biking experience!

text: It's a fabulous hotel. The one that you want to have for a great excape. The room is very nice and comfy. My son and I like it so much. The lobby is incredible especially at night, and the pool is a breathtaking. I surely will recomend this hotel to my family and friend.

It's just a wow...when we were entering the room. The room was huge. View from the balcony was incredible. So peaceful, surrounded by nature.The butler showed us everything in details. My daughter was so happy playing at Kid's Cub. Wanna stay longer in our next visit.. Thank u Padma Ubud...

date post: Peter O wrote a review Oct 2016
text: I've been to many hotels and resorts globally and must compliment Padma Ubud for the above and beyond level of staff helpfulness. Never have I met such a dedicated group. The rooms were well designed and maintained. The butler service was always a dial away to deal with any questions or make bookings or give suggestions on our behalf. The resort itself is about 30-40mins drive from Ubud but a free shuttle is is provided and you can always take a taxi. Being that it's not central, the resort provides a lot of activities on site such as cycling, yoga, and many more. The views from the infinity pool were a personal highlight of mine. I would highly recommend this and look forward to coming back.
title: A perfect slice of tranquility

date post: Sidonia C wrote a review Oct 2015
text: Just arrived back from a 2 night trail stay at Padma Resort Ubud, beautiful place , stunning scenery and the Resort itself is beautiful, comfortable rooms, great views and the staff are exceptional, would highly recommend it Will go back in March
title: Excellent

text: Just came back from Bali and decided to spend 3 nights in Ubud. Our travel agent said that the Padma had just opened and is rated good. This was more than good it was fantastic. The hotel it self is spectacular but the staff were exceptional and the food fabulous. I can not recommend this hotel highly enough, the staff really bent over backwards to help us in every way. Thank you Padma Ubud.
title: Fantastic Hotel

text: Just like you have died and gone to heaven. Beautiful scenery, beautiful staff and beautiful modern facilities. The best breakfast buffet we have ever seen. We highly recommend this place to all who love a bit of luxury.
title: Heavenly

date post: Melissa H wrote a review Mar 2016
text: Just spent three nights at Padma ubud, it's a wonderful resort. Yes its a little further away but it's perfect for relaxation and nature. The shuttle service is more than enough to get you out and about. The spa is a must try and the food is fantastic. One of the best breakfasts buffets you can find. The big thumbs up from me is for the staff. They are simply fantastic!! Keep up the great work!
title: Padma you've done it again!

text: Large, clean, comfortable and impressive, built on a hilltop with great views out to the surrounding jungle bushland. Views wide, spectacular, in Asian jungle, swaying palm trees and heavy foliage. Very enjoyable. Dining The views are wide and spectacular, taking in the Asian jungle bushland and large swaying palm trees and heavy foliage. This makes for a tranquil setting in which to enjoy the ample breakfast (mostly western in nature and style). The Indonesian coffee is a high-ranking highlight of any holiday in Bali and there is plenty of the bean service to you during breakfast in an unfailingly friendly, hospitable manner by the staff. Staff Unfailingly, the staff at Padma Resort Ubud are very approachable, friendly and readily willing to assist you in queries
title: The resort is very large, comfortable and impressive, built on a hilltop with great views out to the surrounding jungle

text: Let me start by saying that we have stayed in many 5 star hotels all over the world, but this hotel blew us away with their excellent service and attention to detail.Although this is a big hotel it feels like you are staying in a boutique hotel. They even make a point of remembering your name. This hotel has so many positives: very clean, beautiful rooms, comfortable beds, stunning location, AMAZING pool overlooking the forest, delicious breakfast etc. We are already looking forward to returning to the Padma Ubud. What a fantastic hotel!

date post: Craig L wrote a review Aug 2016
text: Located very far away from the central part of Denpasar makes Padma Resort Ubud a good choice for those of you who wants to have a relaxation, nice and quiet holiday. It is more preferable for people who did not really want to go out a lot and just stay at the resort. Frankly, i don't really like to stay here, not because of the resort cause the resort is amazing however, its because of the distance and the location. So, i would like to recoomened you, if you are interested in staying in the hotel, it is preferable only to stay for couple days and then you move again to the more crowded area. Enjoy! :)
title: Surpassed all expectations!

text: location is Ok, not far away from ubud. breakfast food is really tasty and when they're preparing food for us makes me wonder how good they treat us while the occupancy rate still lower than normal season. and for the rest facilities are excellent. their hotel services are top notch, needless to say. so many offerings for their guest including yoga, bike, zoo, jogging track, spa, archery, golf, etc We only spent 1 night there, and we really missed this cozy resort. we recommend this hotel for those who seek leisure or new activities in this covid era. special thanks to mr lee and mr tama for guiding and teaching us basic yoga and archery.

Location: so far away LOL. 1.5 hours from Ngurah Rai International Airport. When I walked in their front office, I felt so cold. Yup, it's not like the other area in Bali. It's cold and freezing. And the room was amazingly beautiful. The bathroom was big too. The pool is far away from the room, but it's infinity pool. Gorgeous. I love the breakfast. All delicious. Definitely will be back again.
title: Amazing !

text: LOVE all things.. 1.i'm local, n they treat all the costumer w/ same standart.. whle some other resort don't. 2. We're on honeymoon n they give us beautifull set up w/ flowers on bed, bath tub, n also a very delicious cake.. 3. Their staff are all friendly n helpfull.. The guest officer (laura) give welcome drink, cold towel, she's really nice, friendly, w/ good explnation about the resort, and all activity.. the butler (joshua) really helpfull, very concern for our needed, and gv detail explntion abt the room and d view.. 4. The room is very clean, neat, comfy, d best we ever had. The interior is classy n hv BEST QUALITY stuff.. they hv 5 pillows selection (YES, FIVE) and we can ask for all 5. They hv a VERY BEAUTIFUL SCENERY, jogging track,pools..a view tht make us

Love this place sooo much! The staff is awesome, kind, helpful and friendly.. the food was great, service is incredible.. I did a yoga in the early morning with the beautiful view then a spa day, it was probably good! The view from my suite room was amazing with open-air Jacuzzi bathtub! Oh God! I highly recommend! Thank u and see you very soon Padma Ubud!

date post: Cinvy A wrote a review Jan 25
text: Love this place! It was a really great stay! The service, rooms and amenities are all above my expectation. Even did a yoga class in the morning & our yoga instructor, Tama, helped us to explore the hotel and gave us insights on Ubud area!
title: Yoga with Coach Tama & Animal Feeding experience was awesome!

date post: Cinvy A wrote a review Jan 25
text: Love this place! It was a really great stay! The service, rooms and amenities are all above my expectation. Even did a yoga class in the morning & our yoga instructor, Tama, helped us to explore the hotel and gave us insights on Ubud area!
title: Yoga with Coach Tama & Animal Feeding experience was awesome!

date post: Oriana T wrote a review Oct 2015
text: Loved everything about our stay at this new resort. The staff are so accommodating and it was especially nice to see the friendly faces of Arie, Yoga and Yogi who had worked for many years at the Padma Legian. They will become role models for the new staff members. The rooms are wonderful - generous in both size, facilities and amenities and the setting for the resort is so tranquil. We enjoyed the morning of our second day relaxing beside the infinity pool which overlooks the surrounding 'jungle '. This area will be even more beautiful once the newly planted gardens become established. The meals that we had - breakfast & dinner - were delicious and the executive chef, Ketut, and his staff present each meal with such attention to detail. We were given a tour of the
title: The Peak of our Ubud Trip

text: Lovely new room with stunning views of lush vegetation and rice paddies. Gorgeous pool, friendly staff,and delicious breakfast. An unexpected highlight was the exciting "long" bike ride through the farms and fields with Lenu as our guide. Single track and loose rock climbs and descents, a challenging and fun hourlong ride. The medium ride was also pleasant and on small tracks and roads largely. Very nice new mountain bikes with front suspension and disk brakes.
title: Fantastic

text: Lovely staffs, delicious foods during breakfast - afternoon tea - and our dinner at The Puhu Restaurants & Lounge, very wonderful experience staying in Padma Ubud Resort. Would love to come back in our next visit in Bali!
title: Nice hotel & good staff ðŸ˜ðŸ˜˜

text: Luxury hotel with a good service,I love the room, I love the restaurant and I love every,i got best experience in my first time visit bali island,but for next I hope this hotel provides for more Chinese speaker little bit difficult for want to order some food when I have dinner at the puhunya restaurant,and special big thanks to owen the Chinese speaker, because only him can understand and help us for order something! I hope when I back to this hotel will have more Chinese speaker! Because we just thinking when Mr.owen not working we are the Chinese guest will be stuck and can't do any activities also order some food,one more time I would like to say thank you to padma hotel ubud management and to owen the Chinese speaker â¤

M husband and I booked in for a one night 5 star retreat and decided to stay an extra night because we were so impressed with Padma. The infinity pool is most definitely the feature, but the rooms are elegant and luxurious, all with modern fittings but with a beautiful Balinese feel. The staff are clearly trained to be polite and friendly. The food was delicious. We also did a wonderful yoga class with experienced teacher, Made. We will be back!

Many activities for kids,All the staff are kind,the hotel is recomended for us. Kids are fun with the animal story from Mr Yoga at the Farm animal.Thank you Mr Yoga for explain about the animals for Rey and KenðŸ‘ðŸ‘ðŸ˜ðŸ˜
title: Kids felt happy at Padma Ubud Bali ðŸ‘ðŸ‘ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ðŸ˜

date post: Berni G wrote a review Dec 2020
text: many activities that can be done while staying at Padma Ubud. feeding animals, riding bicycles and most recently archery. For archery we have never done it before so it is the most enjoyable experience, guided by Mr. Agus, very friendly and very good at guiding archery.
title: Good Activity at Padma Ubud Resort

text: Many hotels in Bali are great, but Padma's service is second to none. When we first arrive, we were greeted by every staff. Saputro, who helped us with our luggage, informed us of all the resort facilities and gave his business card telling us not to hesitate to call if we need assistance of any kind. The room was perfectly set up with swan towels and roses. Bathtub was a very modern freestanding one, with himalayan salt and rose oil provided. The infinity pool stretch far from one end of the forest to the other, and the pool is heated. You would think that this is unnecessary for Bali, but with Ubud unpredictable weather, you'd be thankful. Lunch by the pool was also great, i had durum kebab and sangria. Price is closer to restaurant price, not a normal hotel price so more
title: Awesome 2 nights stay experience in the middle of a forest

text: Me & my friend stayed there for 2-nite (March 31st - Apr 2nd), and we love the place. The location is actually in Payangan, roughly about 40 minutes ride from Ubud Centre. It's quite easy to find in, from Kedewatan you just drive straight towards Payangan, on the way you'll pass Ubud Hanging Garden on the right side, Samadhi on the left side, drive slowly in few hundred meters you'll find Padma side on the right side, just follow the track and you'll find Padma on the left side. You'll love the peaceful ambience of Padma, good for the soul. Room is spacious & modern, with separate bathtub & shower...very spacious bathroom...love it. However, Padma needs to pay more attention to their Pillow, they kinda smelly, not a very good first impression...but they immediately changed them
title: Peaceful Padma

date post: Marko K wrote a review Jun 2016
text: Me and my wife decided to reserve this hotel just about a week before our wedding on 11th of June. I once had a good experience staying at one of most recommended resort in Central Ubud, and was thinking to stay there again. But the reason why we ended up choosing Padma because we wanted to stay at a quiet place for an escape after the > 1 year wedding preparation. Despite the misleading name (it is actually located 45 mins from central Ubud to the north), we found that we made a correct decision to spend our honeymoon here. Let me summarize all the pluses and minuses also idea how this hotel could be better: Plus: + warm welcoming and helpful staffs + large, nice and comfortable room, + heated pool, + many options for activities: yoga, trekking, cycling (free), + scheduled
title: Pleasant escape

text: Me and my wife stay here for 2days After tide schedule in nusadua and jimbaran, we want to spent our last two days at ubud. I never been to ubud. But i heard alot of nice places in Ubud. So we make the decision to stay at Padma ubud At 1st we tought this will be normal standart hotel. Since its far from ubud center. When we reach there, we were welcome by Deasy , front liner. She's very informative to tell us all about the hotel , facility and benefit. She show some care to all the hotel guests We were assign to Ari, our butter service to look at our room and hotel facility. Afternoon tea was great. Cocktails also good. Budi, poolguard. He's telling me for the water temprature and when is the best time to swim. 9.30am start to swim. Since they start to heat the water at
title: LOVE IT!! Will be back for sure!!!

text: Most incredible resort! I have not one bad thing to say about it! The room was large and luxurious, the pool was just amazing! being able to look out onto the forest whilst enjoying a cocktail in an infinity pool was a dream! The food was lovely at the restaurants and the room service was definitely 5 star! lovely quite location which was perfect for a romantic getaway!
title: 5 star!!!!

text: My boyfriend and I spent a few days at the ubud resort back in July and had a fantastic time. The staff at the pool bar "the hulk" were so friendly and helpful! The food at the restaurants was fantastic and the spa was very tranquil
title: Unbelievable stay

text: My boyfriend and I stayed 4 nights at Padma Ubud during our stay in Indonesia, and I can only say it is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. Everything from the airport shuttle, to the kind staff, cleanliness of the hotel, huge rooms, great heated infinity pool and not to forget the incredible views overlooking the forest, exceeded our expectations by far. The food was absolutely amazing (and there was a lot of variety as well). The hotel is 30 min. away from Ubud centre, which was exactly what we were looking for in order to escape from the busy town (and the hotel offers 5 free shuttles to Ubud per day). We also had a massage at the hotel which felt very relaxing. Great wifi throughout the whole resort (something we have lacked at other hotels of similar standards

date post: Ben S wrote a review Feb 2017
text: My brother and I were in Indonesia recently for a 2 week holiday. Spent a week in Bali and for our last 2 nights in Bali, we stayed in the stunning Padma Ubud Resort. It was everything I hoped and wished for. Upon arrival we received a complimentary drink and cold facecloth to freshen us up after a long journey (traffic is bad in Bali). The staff were genuinely kind, warm, welcoming, helpful, genial, and very friendly towards the guests. Our room was beautiful. Had a wee cake as it's my birthday week which was lovely. Room was big and bed was comfy and the pillows were brilliant. Absolutely loved the view from our room. I've managed to book 3 yoga classes which were just basic but the view was to die for. Very relaxing and serene. Another favourite is the infinity pool
title: Had to leave with a heavy heart.

date post: Ian C wrote a review Dec 2015
text: My family (me, my wife, my 2 children, my parents, my brother and sister) come to Padma Resort Ubud on 13-15 Dec 2015, despite the hotel is still in construction with progress almost 95% we are very pleased with the hotel facilities such as the longest infinite pool in Bali with a gorgeous view of Ubud forest and paddy field, trekking path with a river view and lots of other 5 star standard facilities. Location of this hotel is around 25 minute from Ubud central, its located in Puhu village. Its quite far if you want to find public facilities such as minimarket, shop or restaurant. However with its location and the view of hotel surrounded by forest view and paddy field it will give you a way to enjoying tranquility in the edge of Ubud. I recommend this hotel for couple who
title: Legendary Service and Unforgettable Experience!

text: My family and I visited Padma Hotel in December 2020. We had the best time and experience there. There were a lot of activities that we can sign up for. Together with my family I joined the archery class held. Our facilitator was Mr. Agus. He explained briefly what to and what not to do when holding a bow. In the beginning we had several difficulties in controlling the direction of the arrow, but with him guiding and supporting us we were finally able to hit the target. He also applied all the health protocol properly. We were really satisfied with the trip.
title: Recomended hotel ðŸ‘ðŸ‘

text: My Favorite in Bali I have stayed 3 times in this resort since they opened, and i always stay in One-bedroom Suite which having Club Benefits. My last stay i was impressed with the improvement service at Club Lounge. The service become more personalized and soon i will definitely come back! Thanks to Deasy and her team who always assist me and makes me feels home everytime i step my feet in this resort. Great job!
title: Beautiful & Luxurious

date post: Siti N wrote a review Jan 2017
text: My fiancÃ© and I were celebrating New Year's Eve at Padma Resort Ubud. The hotel is stunning!! The staff is very professional, helpful and friendly. Big thanks to Deasy who was always there for us. She helped us with many thinks from the first hour until we left. We will miss her big smile. Thanks also to Gerry who helped us to get the table for breakfast (which was busy on new years morning). Because of the great butler and its superb room orientation upon checking in we knew there was heated hanger for our towels (very fancy facilities in the room which we loved). Last but not the least we were amazed by the General Manager Mr. Reza who led the team in a humble and very friendly style which reflected to all the staff who looked like they really enjoy their work. The bartender
title: More than a resort

text: My first time going to this resort was in February. I planned a quick romantic getaway with my husband. We are fans of the hotel chain, so when we saw that Padma just opened in Ubud, we were sure to book. The hotel has just done their soft launching, so there was still work being done here in there. But nothing to make our stay uncomfortable. The rooms were spacious, the bathroom was clean and spacious (so spacious it was like a room in a room), the bed was super cozy too. Our highlight was the activities. If you stay here, you definitely have to try their in house activities. The cycling tour was fun and challanging, the tour guide (Anton, if I'm not mistaken) was the best! I also had balinese dancing lesson, and did morning yoga facing a forest scenery, wonderful! And their
title: Beautiful!

text: My husband and I always stay at Padma Legian when we come to Bali, and we love it. After staying at Padma Ubud we also love it. We had the most wonderful, luxurious experience,every thing is perfect. The weather is a lovely change from the intense heat in Legian but still warm enough to swim and get a tan. The best part about this resort is the staff, they are beautiful and the food is absolutely AMAZING! We went on an escorted bike ride around the surrounding village, which the hotel offers as a free activity, and saw rice paddies and many beautiful children smiling and saying "hello" , everywhere we went. Definitely a place we will come back to and recommend to our friends.

My husband and I had lunch at this resort in May after doing a day trip out of Padma Legian where we usually stay. We enjoyed the peace and quiet and the amazing view so much that we decided to stay and try the resort this trip. We are so happy we did. Free shuttle from the airport was the start of a wonderful holiday. After a comfortable and interesting drive from the airport we arrived at the Padma. The gardens like the Padma Legian are magnificent. A nice start. We were greeted by one of the staff given a beautiful tuberose lye and after being shown to one of the check in desks we were given a icy cool cloth and a welcome drink. Check in was very efficient. The staff are so warm and friendly. The management are friendly too. It makes you feel relaxed. Big
title: Peace and quiet

text: My husband and I have just spent 3 nights at this amazing resort. It is absolutely beautiful. We stayed in a premier deluxe room which was wonderful. It has a massive walk in shower and a beautiful tub with special salts, bubble bath and rose petals. The room also comes with a fridge, water and a coffee making machine. The bed is super comfy and the best bit of course is the view from the balcony. The resort is set within the incredible rain forest and waking up to the blazing sunshine and the view was unforgettable. The pool is one of a kind. A massive 250m infinitely pool overlooking the rain forest. The was simply incredible and so so peaceful. The food was delicious throughout. The choice at breakfast was vast, they had everything I could have imagined. The highlight was

My husband and I recently stayed at Padma Ubud with our two children (5 yrs and 2 yrs). From the moment we arrived, the experience was phenomenal. We stayed in a super spacious suite so that we had a bedroom for the kids, a lounge area and two bathrooms. There was a lovely view from the balcony over the lush surroundings. The swimming pool is absolutely breathtaking... huge and looking out over the beautiful tropical landscape. The swim-up bar was a hit with the kids who had mocktails whilst we went for the real stuff. The kids begged to spend time in the kids' club which is right near the pool so you can hang out nearby while they have fun inside with the lovely staff. Throughout our 4 day stay, we found all the staff to be very attentive, cheerful, highly professional and so

date post: Bee I wrote a review Mar 2016
text: My husband and I spent 4 nights here at the hotel. We had a great experience. At times we felt like we were the only ones there. It was nice and peaceful. The pool is amazing. Everything is brand new and clean and the staff are just beautiful. They had free daily activities we did the cycling which was an amazing experience and we learnt loads about the local culture & visited a local families village. The food was great including the buffet breakfast, everything fresh and tasty. A lovely stay
title: Great infinity pool, but not convenient spot.

text: My husband and i stayed at Padma ubud from feb 28- march 1, 2016. We absolutely loved it here. We found the resort to be extremely clean and the staff were one of the best we've come across our travels in southeast asia. On the day of arrival, my husband was surprised with a birthday cake from the lovely staff. The staff helped us with booking a trip to mount batur. We found that the price was a fraction of what the going rate was outside of the resort. We were treated like royalty at this resort. The breakfast was delicious and had a large variety. Even on the morning we were leaving to bali, one of the staff members packed us breakfast during our 2 hour drive to Bali. I would definitely go back to Padma resort ubud, if we ever come back to Indonesia. This resort is a
title: Highlight of our honeymoon

text: My husband and I were lucky to spend one night at the new Padma Resort Ubud courtesy of the Padma Legian where we had spent 4 wonderful days/nights. The resort is actually about 45 minutes out of Ubud set amongst the jungle - it is quiet, romantic, intimate and the perfect escape for a couple. The rooms are all suites with large bathrooms including a free standing bath tub, large shower and double hand basins. The bed is huge and extremely comfortable. The facility even include an espresso coffee making machine. All rooms have a balcony looking out over the jungle. The Resort boasts the largest infinity pool in Ubud and is quite spectacular. The top floor restaurant looks out over the jungle and pool area and provides some of the best food available in Ubud. The spa is

My mum and I stayed here for 3 nights as a part of a package offered by Padma, I think it was 3 nights in Ubud and 3 at the Padma in Legian. I have stayed at Padma Legian once before and loved it, however, it fails to compare to Padma Ubud. Having never been to Ubud I was curious to see how the Padma presented it. My breath was taken away when I walked into the breakfast area. We were seated right at the balcony edge in the middle and the view is 360 degrees of the jungle and hotel pool area. It was beautiful and I looked forward to seeing it every morning. The rooms at the hotel were beautiful and very big! The bathroom was huge and so were the twin beds, it was almost as if they were double bed and the pillows were perfect. Did you know that they have a pillow menu??? How
title: Breathtaking view for breakfast

date post: A K wrote a review Apr 2016
text: My partner and I chose Padma Ubud for the beginning of our one-week long holiday in Bali. The Room: modern, spacious, beautiful decor, Balinese furniture, comfortable bed (with pillow menu), outdoor chairs + outdoor couch and gorgeous free standing bath. Entertainment: live band during dinner, breathtaking walking/running tracks around the property and down to the river. The highlight is the bamboo bridge ; if I had scenery like this at home, I would be very fit. The infinity pool was another huge highlight, good temperature, more panoramic breath taking views while cooling off for a dip. We partook in bike riding and yoga which was brilliant, our guide was lovely, the second day we attended the village visit which was excellent to see the real locals way of life and
title: Great honeymoon spot

date post: Peter K wrote a review Feb 2016
text: My partner and I spent 3 nights at the Padma Resort in Ubud and absolutely adored it. The official opening of this resort was on the 1st of February and we started our holiday on the 2nd. Though it is a 30 minute drive from the township of Ubud, there are regular, complimentary shuttle buses that will take you to and from the resort throughout the day. The infinity pool certainly lives up to all expectations with a spectacular view overlooking the rainforest. Nothing is too much for the friendly, obliging staff who are always willing to help. The service standard is incredibly high. The view from each of the bars and restaurants is to die for and the food is delicious. (Would really recommend the complimentary afternoon tea, do not skip this, you'll regret it.) The rooms
title: Relax and comfortable place

date post: Nathan G wrote a review Mar 2017
text: My partner and I stayed at Padma Ubud for four nights and were very impressed with the quality but most notably the staff. The staff were so attentive, friendly and respectful and many remembered our names! The facilities are 5 star and the location, was far enough away from the busy streets of Kuta. The rainforest walking trails were a highlight and so was the infinity pool. I would highly recommend this resort for anyone looking for an enjoyable holiday.
title: Ten out of ten

text: My partner Ben and I visited Padma Resort Ubud in February. It was so beautiful from the pool to the room. We also were very happy with the customer service we recieved at the resort. They were all so welcoming and friendly. Whilst staying at the Padma, we did the Mixology Class with Dede. Dede was a fantastic teacher and made the class lots of fun. He's an excellent bartender! Highly recommend the class!
title: Mixology Class

text: My sister and I purchased a Scoopon deal to stay for 7 nights as we wanted some rest and relaxation before returning to work. And that we got! Breakfast was plentiful and our Club Lounge access afforded us with additional menu items, afternoon tea and cocktail hour everyday. The service was superb in every aspect of the hotel and we give thanks especially to food & beverage, Club Lounge, Spa, and activities staff including but not limited to Indah, Rudita, Koka, Chef Ketut, Nisca, Yanti, Eva, Sukri, Chef Kiwang. Special thanks to Executive Chef Ketut who went out of his way to make us feel special with a surprise dinner and added extras with other meals. His food talent would be appreciated in Melbourne! The room was large and most comfortable and the grounds are immaculate,
title: Sublime!!!

text: My stay at the Padma Ubud was amazing and above all my expectations! Myself and my boyfriend booked the 3 night deal, including a 3 course dinner and 60 minute massage for two. Before we arrived we were sent an email with a pillow menu and asking if you were travelling for any special occasion. We selected the sweedish memory pillows (amazing!!) and as it was our anniversary we were left a slice of cake in our room upon arrival and departure! As it is a new hotel, everything is still in perfect condition. The pool was heated to the perfect temperature and looks even better then the photos. The room and bathroom were also amazing. Comfy bed and huge bathtub and shower. The buffet breakfast had a HUGE selection. We were very impressed. They also provided free afternoon tea at
title: Absolutely amazing!!

text: My wife and I booked the mountain and beach package which included a stay at the Padma Resort Ubud and the Legian resort. We had a great stay, this is an ideal place to stay on honeymoon or if you are looking for something a bit quieter than the beach resorts. The staff were friendly and professional and the food was great. The location is stunning and the resort offers free transfers into Ubud. It's worth doing the bicycle tour offered at the resort. The heated infinity pool is a nice place to spend an afternoon drinking cocktails. The bar staff were all great. We didn't see the other rooms but the one we stayed in was big and nicely decorated with all the amenities you could need.
title: Amazing hotel

text: My wife and I had 3 days here as part of the mountain and beach package with sister hotel in Legian. There was a slight hitch with the transfer as the driver hired for us could not even find Ubud never mind the hotel 40 minutes north. We doubled back a few times then went through Ubud twice. That meant it took 3 not 2 hours for the transfer but at least that meant we had the lay of the land the next day. The hotel rooms are huge with all the facilities you could need and more. The infinity pool has stunning views over the rainforest. The jogging track is really a steep climb so best take a guide and walk it. Wifi was fast and worked absolutely everywhere - never known that before. The restaurant and bar are a bit pricey but the food was amazing. We got a free set meal with the
title: Simply excellent

text: My wife and I spent 3 fantastic days at this amazing resort. Only 2 years old , this resort has everything. No need to venture out although there are heaps of day trips from the resort on offer and free shuttle to Ubud central. The large infinity pool wraps around the resort and is nestled on the side of the hill overlooking the beautiful rain forest. A 'swim up' bar caps off the amazing views There are numerous walking tracks around the resort to explore which can be backed up with a trip to the stunning 'water cave' themed spa treatment rooms. The food is exquisite, from pool snacks to the fine dining experience in the Puhu Restaurant and lounge. The degustation menu (with wines) was fantastic and reasonably priced at $150 AUD for 2 persons. Staff at the resort , and

never been in an aerial yoga class before but it's great having a private aerial yoga class with Pak Made, Pak Made it easy even for beginner like me. he taught some great positions to release back pain.

New open hotel in Dec. and had a great visit there. The night is spacious and clean. I like the balcany a lot. Each room has its own balcany if your room is located at first floor you could access to the trail or garden directly which is cool. The room is super clean and brand new ( of course). You have to check out their scenery swimming pool which has outstanding view. We travelled with infant and feel easy and comfortable in the hotel room and they could provide enough service when we request. The masage is the best I had this time in Bali. But they only have 6 spots for masages and remember to make a reservation even before you check in. They have their own trail in the hotel which is cool and amazing. The food here is relatively good compared to the averaged local
title: New hotel with good service and scenery

date post: Wandy Margo wrote a review Nov 2020
text: Nice experience... The hospitality is great... the hotel followed health protocols..Cycling and Aerial Yoga are recommended activity. Thanks for bli Agus and bli Made (i forgot his name, teacher at Aerial Yoga) very kind.
title: Experience and Activity

text: Nice staff, nice food, good ambience & view..mr Kayan the staff that bring us to do swing & bogey activity & bicycle activity was very nice ðŸ¥³ðŸ¤© would back again to here next time..see u next time guys ðŸ˜ðŸ˜˜
title: Amazing service, great food and activities!

text: Nice trip in this huge resort which don't miss anything except a resturant as good as the crew, the quality of rooms and services offered... Expensive prices at the restaurant are not justified. But, there is a fitness room with saunA, hammam, jogging track and all the main facilities. But a little too far from the first town Ubud
title: Great welcoming but such a bad resto !

text: No where near ubud as the name would have you fooled, but we wanted a paradise Pinterest worthy hotel and that's just what we had! A dream location, brilliant staff! Staff leave you to your own devises unless you pop your flag up (this is how all resorts should run!) room awesome, views breathtaking, heated pool lush, evening fire pit awesome!
title: Paradise

date post: Mark L wrote a review Jul 2016
text: Okay, so I'm just a tad over-excited at the moment in that we only just arrived today for a 6 day stay at this amazing new resort and I couldn't contain myself and had to jot this down while it is fresh in the grey matter. I will amend this once our stay is over for additional critique. The Good Stuff. I will clarify and outline why some of the " Not so Goog Stuff " aspects are negated by the outweighing Good Stuff. The Rooms, or should I say Studio Style Apartments are extremely well appointed and spacious, the en-suite bathroom is awesome. This is the first resort we have stayed at that supplies an expresso " Pod " Coffee Maker which is a must for all you Caffeine Addicts.. :) Not happy with your pillow, well then just check out the Pillow Menu for something that suits you
title: OMG, Mountain Paradise Resort/Retreat
