I seriously cannot recommend this resort highly enough and if you are after somewhere to stay which is relaxing with beautiful views of surrounding forest this is definitely the place for you!
title: Amazing resort!!!! Highly recommend!!!

text: This resort is 40mins drive from Ubud Center, but I think this worth the drive. The room is huge and clean & the view are stunning. I enjoy the view from Puhu Restaurant where we had our afternoon tea & breakfast. So in love with the heated pool, perfect for relaxing and long enough for exercise. This hotel also have kids club & activity and free shuttle bus to ubud center. I will definitely come back to this resort.
title: Great gem with a catch

date post: Pritha Razad wrote a review Oct 2016
text: This resort is about 20mins from Ubud city center. But for this gem, i wouldnt go anywhere rather stay in the resort as they have everything. Heated largest infinity pool in the region, swim up pool bar, pool side restaurant, all day dining restaurant with beautiful and spacious room. Beautiful !
title: A tranquil !

date post: Manisha J wrote a review May 2016
text: This resort is away from the city and beaches. It is a long drive though almost an hour and a half from the airport. Its set admist beautiful scenery and lush greenery. When we visited it was still very new. The rooms are nice, large and comfortable. The jogging track and jungle walk are good to get ur muscles going as the gym is quite small. The pool has warm water and is quite relaxing while one can spend the whole day enjoying the cool breeze and warm waters of the pool. All staff are very polite and friendly. The hotel also does provide a shuttle service to the Ubud City Centre which is about a 45min to an hour drive. The only thing the hotel does need to improve on is theur quality and hygine of food as its quite far, one has no option but to eat at the hotel. Hence,
title: Back to Nature

text: This resort is located a 30 minute drive from Ubud, in the remote area of Payangan. If you want to enjoy a relaxing holiday, without the hustle and bustle of areas closer to the airport, then this place is for you. The 89 metre infinity pool is meticulously maintained, and includes a swim up bar. The resort facilities include a gym, a kids club, day spa and more. A free shuttle bus service operates from the resort to Ubud every day, at different times to suit. Also offered are a range of daily activities, including yoga and cycling. We went on a bike ride through the villages, and experienced the most beautiful scenery. We have been on paid bike tours in Bali before, and this ride was even better, and all included. The staff at this resort are outstanding, and nothing is ever
title: Sensational place if you require serenity

text: This resort is magnificent. Beautifully landscaped, huge infinity pool with swim-up poolbar, nice spa, very good breakfast buffet. Rooms are big and really well designed. Every day there are free activities like village-visits, bicycling tours, Balinese dancing etc. Staff is super friendly and attentive. I would recommend this place to anyone.

This resort is really special! Set in the middle of the jungle, you are completely away from all the hustle and the bustle which my husband and I loved. Waking up to all the majestic views overlooking the jungle was breathtaking and felt so relaxing. Being so deep in the jungle meant the air is super clean... both of us were at the tail end of a cold and I'm convinced the air completely flushed us out! So good! There are no words to truly describe the swimming pool at this resort... just know you will be blown away and will easily spend most of your time by the poo, enjoying the everything the space has to offer... pool bar, pool heating, magical views, and more swimming room than I have experienced (outside the ocean of course). The food at this place also 10/10. Very fresh and

date post: Scott P wrote a review Oct 2016
text: This Resort is the best resort that myself and girlfriend have ever stayed at and our 3 night stay felt way too short. The first impression upon arrival of the resort is 'paradise in the mountains'. We stayed on the 4th floor which had a spectacular view of jungle and gardens. The rooms are outstanding, clean (practically new), spacious and well set out. (We loved the towel swan that was on the bed on arrival). The resorts food was impeccable we ate every meal of our stay at the resort. The food quality is of a high end restaurant but what we enjoyed the most was the atmosphere and the friendly and attentive staff. We spent a large amount of our time in the infinity pool where we were well looked after by every staff at the "sunken bar". After sampling various of the
title: Amazing and Friendly

text: This resort nestled in the terraced hills about 30 mins North of Ubud was for next level relax mode. The room was huge, clean and well appointed. It's the little things like plenty of room for luggage and bench space in the bathroom plus a shelf in the shower. Huge twin beds, huge fluffy bath towels huge free standing bath and huge shower. The pool is an infinity lagoon and heated so you can enjoy it longer in the 'cooler' breezes of the hills. The shuttle bus was great to get into Ubud to shop and get a cheap massage. The in house spa looked amazing but priced out of practical use. Room service was great and despite the reviews I read we loved the restaurant. Complimentary afternoon tea was pointless but the chef has talent he uses well in the degustation dinner menu. The
title: Beautiful location, stunning resort

date post: Vicki S wrote a review Feb 2017
text: This trip to Bali involved a 2night swap stay from Padma legian to Padma Ubud. The resort is set in stunning lush green grounds complete with beautiful views of rain forests and rice paddies. The resort is about 20 minutes from the town of Ubud but the resort provides shuttle buses to get you there and back. It has the biggest infinity pool in Bali. 93 metres of water with a breathtaking view to wile away the time. All rooms have a view and are spacious and decorated in traditional yet modern style. And to our delight an afternoon tea was provided for all guests and catered for allergies. There are an assortment of daily activities including bike riding and yoga. This is a great place to recharge and relax.
title: Serene picturesque

text: This was my first time to Bali and grateful to choose Padma Ubud as our place to stay. Even though we were only staying for one night but we had an amazing experience. Since we arrived, we were greeted by a friendly staff, offered a welcome drink, and the staff also explained all the facilities in our room with friendly manner. In the late afternoon, I ordered their classic tiramisu and found that it was so good! One of the best facilities in Padma Ubud you must try is their Infinity Pool. It has direct view of the forest. Makes me feel calm and refreshed. So amazing and mesmerized! But unfortunately we could not enjoy their spa because it was fully booked on the day of our arrival and the next day we had to move to Kuta in the morning. We also enjoyed breakfast in Puhu
title: Experience Heaven in Bali

text: This was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in, from the beautiful fish in the gorgeous water gardens to the immaculate spacious rooms and one of the best pools I have ever swum in, overlooking the teeming jungle. I loved the frogs and crickets chirping in the gardens at night and the bats and wild life of the jungle. My ony wish is that this wonderful resort takes good care of the wild life around and inside the gardens as it so wonderful to feel part of the jungle and yet pampered like royalty.

This was one of the best hotels I've stayed at. Hidden in the mountains is this beautiful place. So serene and relaxing is what I needed and this place had everything I could ask for. The staff at this resort was AMAZING!!!! They were so attentive and so sweet. I would definitely be back here again.

date post: Phil c wrote a review Dec 2016
text: This was our first holiday in Bali. This review is based on stays in other hotels in different parts of the world, and at home in Australia. This package included airport transfers and from the moment you are met at the airport, you know this experience is going to be something different. The little laneway to the resort belies what is ahead. On arrival at the resort you are greeted by extremely friendly, polite and attentive staff. After a detailed check-in, you are shown to your room. If you haven't been impressed by the resort thus far, walking into your room will surely amaze you. The size and and substantial quality of the furnishings demonstrate the thought that has gone into providing a wonderfully relaxing and peaceful atmosphere for the guests. You will soon become
title: Wow. Wow. Wow

date post: Kym J wrote a review Dec 2016
text: This was our first trip to Bali and we decided to start with the rainforest rather than a beach holiday..... WOW. This resort is just AMAZING. While the drive from the airport takes about 2 hours, the resort picks you up and makes you feel at ease. This was also a great chance to look out the window and see the real Bali. When you finally reach the resort it is gorgeous. We had a family suite which consisted of 2 inter connecting rooms. The rooms were very spacious and the bathrooms.... to die for!! The staff were friendly and always had a welcoming smile. The main feature of this resort is the infinity pool and it didn't disappoint. With the swim up bar, one could stay in there for hours. The meals were a good size and the breakfast buffet in the main restaurant overlooking
title: P.A.R.A.D.I.S.E.

text: This was the most magical of experiences for us! The scenery is stunning the staff are just gorgeous and the chefs amazing! The resort is pristine and so so beautiful! Big shout out to the head chef Ketut and our breakfast chef who looked after us and cooked us some of the BEST meals we have eaten! Highly recommend the cooking class and spa! Wish we had longer than 3 nights here! Could easily do a week or more! So much to do in the hotel no need to leave. Why would you when you have everything you need right here and the scenery is second to none! The pool is just amazing no wonder it won pool of the year for all of Indonesia in 2016! We will definitely be back!! Thank you Padma Ubud for making our honeymoon so memorable! â¤â¤

Today, we went on a 5k biking trip to the forest. It was really cool and i'd like to give a big shoutout to our tour guide Agus. He was ver nice, very polite, and very helpful. By far the best staff member in the hotel.

Usually it's not a good sign when something goes wrong in the beginning. We waited for my pick-up from Padma at the lobby of a hotel in Nusa Dua for 15 minutes and there was no one approach me so I called Padma. Long story short, Padma has given an incorrect name to the driver. The problem was finally sort out and we left Nusa Dua half an hour behind the schedule. I was a bit upset but shortly after we arrived at Padma, I forgot about the late pick-up. The staffs are very friendly. The rooms are excellent. We managed to get our request for connecting rooms. It's very spacious although the connecting doors are somewhat designed incorrectly. It blocks the doorway when its opened. The room includes breakfast and afternoon tea with various foods selections. The infinity pool and
title: Sanctuary in Ubud

date post: Octaviani W wrote a review Dec 2020
text: Very happy to stay here...so many activity during our staycation...i try the aerial yoga (you have to try this and they have certified yogis to help you with the move) and also cycling , the guide take me to see the village around the hotel...beautiful... for the kids, they can play around in animal graden (we love the duck...very cute), my son go fishing then fed the otter, chika & chiko...the kids garden club also interesting...the kids love it! Nice and clean room...very comfy to stay...the hotel staf also helpful...and the food so yummy (we try chicken karage, gurame asam manis also some pasta...and all made our tummy happy ) I'm sure will be back again next time. Thank you Padma Ubud.
title: Padma ubud

date post: Nany Ismail wrote a review Dec 2020
text: Very nice and lovely. The pool is sublime. Kayan, our guide for biking is so nive and kind, recommended. The view is so nice , you don't want to leave the hotel. We will come back next year with my good friends.
title: Biking and swimming

date post: Shonda H wrote a review Apr 2016
text: Very nice service by the staf especially the manager pak Ary. The view is amazing, the swimming pool water is not cold, so my son can swim without getting cold. It is great place if u need to relax. It is 45 minutes to Ubud central. Will come back again
title: Relaxation!

date post: C R wrote a review Nov 2020
text: very recommended resort when you stay in Ubud. Everything you need is here... Perfect Jungle view, Breakfast were AWESOME!!! Afternoon tea was beyond our expectation!!! We also joined sport activities such as Mountain bike, Golf and Archery. Mr. Kayan trained us like a PRO athlete, really enjoyed the time being here. the next day we also went to animal garden, fed some rabbits, ducks, chickens, cows, goats, andddd they have two cute otters that always HUNGRY. Defenitely one of best resort in Bali... Will come back for SURE!!!
title: BEST UBUD RESORT WITH FIVE STARS FACILITES AND SERVICE

text: Visiting Ubud and looking for New Resort to relax...I got it! Padma Resort Ubud offers the best experiences with all activities and facilities. Located in the most beautiful hill overlooking the forest and river. The resort complex is huge... the room is big and has balcony with green forest view.ðŸ˜ I love the experience from the lounge...very pleasant hospitality speacially when the Resort acivity manager offered what I could do during my stay here. The best part when I do nothing.... just enjoy the super breathtaking view where I can view the best infinity swimming pool in the island and two beautiful mountains. Amazing! Never miss the Spa offer to relax, experience Fantastic F&B with the best mediterenian food and high tea selections. Next time I will bring my family

We absolutely adored our stay at Padma Ubud. It is the only resort in the Payangan area so it is very quiet and tranquil. One of the highlights of our stay was undertaking the mixology class with Reznu! We went to the botanical garden first to pick out our fresh ingredients and were served with a welcome drink and canapes before class began. Reznu has a great sense of humour and he made the class very fun and interactive. All the cocktails we created were classics with a twist. We were also presented with a certificate when the class concluded. The resort itself is about 40mins away from the Ubud centre, however, the complimentary shuttle bus provides free wifi, which means you definitely won't be bored. We were very fortunate to have been upgraded to a Premier Deluxe room

We are here for another honeymoon. Before we arrived... 2 hour before arrival time,they check every single thing about us.,butler service are out of expectation, room are big,perfectly cozy ,great view ,beautiful swimming pool...from the f&b ,food are superrb,good choice's,.cant wait for another visit with family. Thank you
title: Fantastic

text: We are mid way through our stay here and I couldn't wait to write a review about this gorgeous hidden paradise. We still have 5 days here and loving every bit of it. The service is exceptional to say the least. They take the time to cater to your every need and it is never a drama. The food is beautiful and the cocktails are divine. The best is the infinity pool over looking the breath taking forest. The pool is heated so night swims are a must. It is a little far away but that's exactly what we needed. Free shuttles throughout the day to ubud town and free wifi which is strong throughout the resort. We really do love it here and will come back anytime. Special shout out to Deasey the resort experience manager who has made sure our stay here has been amazing. 5

We booked the Club Lounge room for two nights, stayed over the Silent Day as it's known as remote area. Located in Puhu, 25Km from Ubud City, the resort offers you everything you need. Very friendly staffs, from the time we checked-in until we checked-out. They really taking care of the guest personally. The hotel was fully occupied that day but still, they could keep remember your preferences. Indah and Debby at the Club Lounge are very friendly and lovely. On the Silent Day night, when all the lights were turned off, I walked out to the parking area to capture the milky way. The security guy Kadek ushered me to the pool area which was totally dark, for better milky way view, and back to the room Pak Reza, the General Manager, congratulations for your great team work for
title: The Silent Day experience

text: We booked the Mountain and Beach package at the Padma Resorts Bali and now wish we had stayed the full holiday at the Padma Resort Ubud. From check in to check out, three nights later, it was peaceful and relaxing. The room was modern and comfortable, the pool was beautiful and the view of the valley was the best part. The staff were lovely and the food each day was excellent. Probably helped that the drinks menu was just as good :) Even though there was a daily shuttle to Ubud, (it only took about 35 minutes to get there) it was enough for us to hang around the hotel and enjoy the peace and quiet, with daily activities provided by the hotel. I know it's only a soft opening but hopefully this hotel will just improve. It's just lovely for couples or families that like to
title: Just beautiful!

text: We booked this hotel for 4 nights and we are thinking to stay one more night. This is such a peaceful place with a huge swimming pool on the jungle view. There is nothing to say about the service. All the staff is smiling, greeting you all the time and they are doing their best to make your stay as nice as possible. The restaurant is a mix between Indonesian and western food. They use high quality ingredient and refined dished. We booked the cooking course and we recommend it. We spent the day with the chef who brought us to the market, to his own house and then to the hotel kitchen. He comes from this village but he has a huge experience as he travelled all over the world. It was really an amazing experience and we have learnt a lot with him. Rooms are very comfortable, bed

We booked this hotel on the suggestion of a friend who had come across the hotel on the internet. We reserved the amazing two bedroom apartment which has two huge bedrooms with massive ensuites both with freestanding baths and walk in showers. There is also a large lounge room separating the two rooms and a generous balcony which overlooks the bamboo rainforest. As part of our package we were also able to access the guest lounge and WOW what a treat! From the special breakfasts to the afternoon tea and on to cocktails which are serviced with delicious canapÃ©s for two hours. The lounge is located on the top floor overlooking the infinity pool and the rainforest. The infinity pool is the largest in Bali. The hotel also has a fantastic kids club which our kids visited

date post: Dewa Ayu W wrote a review Aug 2016
text: we came and stayed at padma resort ubud for our anniversary celebration and everything was fantastic!!! Over all we enjoyed our stay. The room, the staff, the food, the pool, the atmosphere make us want to come back. special thanks to koka who was really friendly and to debby at front desk who arranged our room to be so romantic for our celebration. we will definitely come back.
title: great stay, great moments

text: We came here as a family of 6 with 2 young kids. We love ubud however we noticed that there isn't many kids friendly hotel around ubud. However, since I know that padma just recently opened in feb 2016, and knew that it had some kids facilities/kids friendly, we thought to give it a try. This hotel provides free shuttle taxi to and from airport if you book direct. I think it's awesome! Since not that many hotels in ubud would do this. Room is so spacious! Very lovely and Nicky decorated. Hotel area is just amazing! You don't need to go outside the hotel at all. Plenty of activities to do. Jogging tracks, river walk, yoga, village walk etc. Kids had a great time. Mbak rini from the kids club just so lovely. My boys spent a lot of time with her doing arts and crafts. Spa for

date post: Yan Y wrote a review Mar 2017
text: We came here for two nights during our stay in Padma Legian. The rooms were really clean and spacious and the afternoin tea was very nice incorportainga mixture of world cuisine. The infinity pool was heated and had a spectacular view and there was a walk that goes through the jungle. There is a kids room and small unheated childrens pool. The main area of ubud was a fair distance from the hotel. I would recommend this hotel for adults.
title: Stunning hotel in the middle of the jungle!

text: We came with our two daughters as soon as we arrived we were greeted by the wonderful and warm staff of the Padma. This warmth and friendliness continued throughout our stay with every staff member we encountered. Especially Deasy. She was amazing and everywhere doing numerous tasks from greeting people to getting her hands in and cleaning tables during a very busy buffet dinner. Always with a beautiful smile and time for a quick chat. As for the hotel itself amazing. The grounds were breathtaking the jogging track through the tropical raiforest is an amazing walk and and an engineering and architectural masterpiece. And the pool warm beautiful and my favourite so far in Bali and we have been going twice a year for many years. The room we had was huge comfortable. The only

date post: Iain M wrote a review Feb 2017
text: We chose Padma Resort because I was astonished by the pool photo on the website. And it was as beautiful as in photos. Of all the hotel features, I love the infinity pool the most. They said their pool is the longest infinity pool in Ubud. It was located between hills and all is green. Really a place for escape from your routine. Especially if you lived in a city like Jakarta. We only stay 1 night so we didn't get the chance to use the spa. They have open air barbecue, but you need to reserve one-day before. Their poolside pizza was great. Parma ham pizza we ordered. Room service also delicious, we had tiramisu and meringue for dessert in room. They also have various activities like cycling, yoga, gardening, etc. A piece of advice is Stay Longer. At least 2/3 nights.
title: Company offsite in Bali

text: We didn't stay there but went to have a look and had lunch as friends of ours were raving about it . The service was very good and food excellent. My husband left his sunglasses and it so happened we were staying near Padma resort Legian. Our reception phoned them and was told they have daily shuttle between the two padma resorts. They even delivered the sunglasses to our hotel! What a service! I would definitely split my stay between the two Padma resorts- one for peace and tranquil and the other for shopping and night life on our next trip to Bali
title: Service at its best

date post: Lee S wrote a review Apr 2016
text: We enjoyed the peace and quiet of the Padma Resort Ubud rooms were wonderful you could not ask for better service from all the staff. Infinity pool and forest view are amazing would not have any trouble recommending this Amazing Resort to anyone. 5 star +++
title: Peace & Quiet

text: We got welcomed really friendly by all of the staff. A welcome drink and a cold towel got served after seconds being there. The check-in went smooth and the atmosphere is lovely. During our stay the staff was super helpful and nice. Our room was located on the ground floor and had access to the big garden area which is actually on the roof of other buildings. Itâ€™s really cool to walk there and take a look at the pool and the surrounding nature. The room is so spacious and lovely decorated. I really liked the bed and had a perfect sleep every night. Not only the room was in top conditions, also the bathroom was a big plus. Now to the pool, which is totally amazing and the longest infinity pool in Bali. And guess what, it is also heated! First I was confused about a heated pool
title: Bali longest infinity pool

date post: Ahmed Rahman wrote a review Apr 2017
text: We had 3 nights in this amazing hotel at the end of March. It is like no other place I have been to before. The infinity pool is massive and so relaxing. Spa treatments were good. All staff very friendly. Breakfast with wonderful views. The list could go on and on! Only downside is the time -40 mins to get to Ubud. Hope to get back there.
title: A piece of heaven on earth!

date post: Henrik Wigermo wrote a review Oct 2016
text: We had a wonderful 5 nights at the Padma Resort in Ubud. The hotel is stunning and the pool is the out doubt the best I have ever seen. The hotel is beautifully manicured and the rooms and very comfortable. The spa was excellent and very well priced as were the restaurants. We were there over Aus school hols and there weren't many kids so if your looking for a place that very kid oriented this may not be the place for you. My 10 years old loved it tho! We look forward to visiting again next year!
title: Wonderful, quiet and beautiful reaort

text: We had an amazing stay at the Padma Ubud. We stayed in the Premier Deluxe room which was lovely. Very spacious, luxurious and comfortable. We were skeptical about being bored staying in a resort for 5 nights, however it was easy at the Padma. The pool was exceptional and the daily activities were a great inclusion. We did yoga and a daily balinese language lesson with Arya, who was a skilled and attentive instructor. We had a fantastic time chatting with him and learning about Balinese culture. We also did an Agroforestry tour with Kayan, who was so friendly and knowledgeable about the resort's gardens. All of the resort's staff were exceptionally attentive and welcoming. We would love to return and recommend to anyone.
title: Great escape in paradise!

text: We had an incredible stay at the padma. We would get up early each morning to do yoga with their instructor Lee. A very friendly and professional instructor with good English. The restaurants were great, the rooms and grounds are stunning. I cant wait to go back to that little slice of paradise

date post: nisya n wrote a review Dec 2020
text: We had superfun family holiday in Padma Resort Ubud. I wouldn't mention any name of staff because all of them are AMAZING! they're really care with our kids since our arrival. The facilities are so great for children. The pool temperature was warm, so our kids had so much fun! The animal garden, the agrofarm, the view was so stunning..not to mention the SPA was soo good! Me and my husband really enjoy the balinese massages so much. We also enjoyed our breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Our favourite ever is Banana Milkshake..love it sooo much! Padma resort Ubud the best resort ever! We sure will come back..thanks Padma!
title: Excellent Services Ever

text: We had the fantastic stay at Padma Ubud. Yes it's far from the airport (1.5-2 hours) and yes it's not in Ubud (30-40 min shuttle ride) but the staff, the facilities, the service and the location were amazing. So believe me it's worth the trip! Every member of staff was great but the ones we remember in particular are Komang, Ari, Dewi, Sudana, Catur and the nurse. We suffered food poisoning after a lunch we had outside of the resort but the services of the nurse plus the clean up services of housekeeping was excellent. The rooms were huge and well kitted out, the food fantastic and the spa services great. The buffet breakfast has a huge choice and the complimentary tea is a nice touch - my only comment would be to label what the meats are in the dishes for those who don't eat
title: The most beautiful way to start Bali

date post: Rodrigo M wrote a review Jan 2017
text: We have just returned from a fabulous 3 nights honeymoon at Padma Resort. The pool is absolutely incredible!!! It's warm and so inviting, you can literally spend hours in there. There's a great pool bar with happy hour in the afternoon. The food at the restaurant is delicious and very reasonably priced. Would recommend the degustation for something special. Morning yoga overlooking the jungle is simply beautiful and relaxing. All the staff at Padma are very friendly and really make you feel at home. A special thanks to the Chef, Deasy & I Wayan for making it so memorable. We would highly recommend everyone to spend a few nights, especially if you feel like relaxing surrounded by beautiful greenery. Just a note, it is around a 30-minute drive to Ubud but this is what we loved
title: Amazing Hotel, Oasis in the Jungle.

date post: Andy T wrote a review Dec 2016
text: We have just returned from an 11 day stay at the Padma Ubud and we are already planning our next trip with family for next year. The resort itself is absolutely stunning the gardens are beautifully planned, walking track is a must!! The pool is gorgeous and we were told that it had just won number 1 pool in Asia, the pics don't do it justice. The view are amazing, you will not get sick of waking up to the sounds and sights. Breaky is substantial with a huge amount of choice, not to mention delicious, you can order a coffee of your choice, and the views from the 4th floor are sensational at any time of the day or night. We ate at each place in the Padma and the food is fabulous and very resonably priced, we ate some fabulous meals. We did do the 3 course degustation and it was
title: Absolutely amazing, a 'must do' on your Bali holiday

date post: Michelle W wrote a review Mar 2016
text: We have stayed at Padma Legian many times so we were eager to try their new resort in Ubud. It is a 2 hour drive from the airport and the resort is located 40 minutes away from Ubud central. Once here, you are committed to the hotel unless you are prepared to catch the hotel shuttle to Ubud. The shuttle has limited space, so plan and book your seats in advance especially on the last shuttle back to the resort which is very popular. The last shuttle heads back to the resort at 9pm sharp. We had booked a Premier King Room during our stay which overlooked the lush rainforest surrounds. The room and amenities were first class. The room was very spacious and comfortable. We had a king size bed and a rollaway bed for our 14 year old. The rollaway was very comfortable - like a real
title: Different to Padma Legian

text: We have stayed in bali for 4 days in Grand hyatt and 2 days in Ubud in Padma resort. I really wish that i had a longer stay in Padma resort. Everything was more than amazing. All Staff were very friendly and hotel design was unbelievably cute! Balcony door was opening to a small cute garden. The pool had a view of Jangle and we had a lovely jangle dinner with a very beautiful view . Also the restaurant that they were serving breakfast was on the 4th floor in front of Jangle.. Everything was like a dream.. They have various free tours and entertainments and also the internet speed is very good. Our room was very clean with new equipments and nice design. Thank you very much Padma Resort

date post: Felicia L wrote a review Dec 2016
text: We have travelled extensively and I must say that this is a top resort. The setting is beautiful the whole resort was spotless and the staff were very attentive and nothing seemed too much trouble for them. The food was very good and the Indonesian buffet was great. I cannot fault this resort I would recommend this to anyone who wants to get away from the hustle and bustle of life for a bit. It is a bit of a trek from the airport if you hit the traffic at the wrong time we had a two hour transfer but it was well worth it.
title: Perfect resort in Ubud!

text: We invaded the hotel and took over 100 rooms, the hotel coped splendidly. Food was excellent and service was professional with a personal touch. Rooms are modern and well equipped. Location stunning - well worth the 2 hour trip from Denpasar. Strongly recommend.
title: Heaven on Earth!!!

text: We just comeback from our yearly holiday, this time indonezia was chosen as a destination. We took a deal from padma resort and spend 3 nights at legian and 4 nights at padma ubud. First I would like to say that the employees are amazing, always kind, nice and ready to help with every questions that u have, they made our vacation perfect so - THANK YOU ! We love all the activities that the hotel is offering, the pool, and the hiking routs we spend an amazing time over there! The combination of the two hotels was nice but for me personally ubud did a way better impression, is a must to stay hotel! Very valuable for the money. We will come back next year!

We just had a wonderful 2 nights stay at Padma Resort Ubud!! We wanted a place that is relaxing and close to nature, and this is the best of both worlds you can get in Ubud! AIRPORT TRANSFER The airport transfer was included in our hotel booking which was very thoughtful and the driver waited for us patiently as it took a long time to retrieve our luggage at the airport. This also saved us the trouble of getting our own transport there. The journey to the hotel was about 2.5hrs from the airport but itâ€™s worth it as the inviting ambience started to unfold in front of us with a â€˜WOWâ€™ factor as we approached. WELCOME We were warmly greeted by the receptions staffs once we had arrived at the lobby which made us feels at home. Checking in was speedy and we were immediately ushered
title: The Perfect Cooling Jungle In Heaven With Healing Power!

date post: Nathan T wrote a review Apr 2017
text: We only stayed for 2 nights but wish we stayed the whole time while in Bali. The staff, service, rooms, amenities and food are all amazing. Deasy, Owen and the rest of the staff at Padma Resort Ubud were so fantastic. I think we may have found our anniversary spot. We will definitely be coming back.
title: Outstanding!!!

date post: Paul K wrote a review Oct 2016
text: We only stayed here for 2 nights at the end of our trip (a regret now- wishing we had spent more time here). The atmosphere, the staff, the food, service - we couldn't fault anything. We went down to the spa and enjoyed the 180 minute massage, the girls were absolutely amazing at what they did, feeling so relaxed afterward - a definite recommended activity! We were a part of the club lounge members and what an added bonus, drinks and snacks provided throughout the day with cocktails and canapes from 4:30pm and the wonderful service of our favourite Debby! - who also helped us book (and got us a discount) for the river rafting. Awesome stay, would definitely recommend to friends and will be coming back here next time we are in Bali!
title: Perfect!

text: We planned to spend 5 days here and changed our plans to stay for our whole trip. It is a beautiful relaxing destination and the infinity pool is so gorgeous. With views of the forest from the pool and room it truly is a spectacular destination hotel

We really enjoyed our holiday here. The location is amazing looking out over the jungle to the volcano in the distance. The staff were all very helpful, friendly and polite. They really made us feel as if we were royalty! The pool is a great feature and the children loved swimming up to the pool bar for milkshakes. The room was clean and spacious. The free activities of cycling around the villages and having a tour of the kitchen garden was interesting and enjoyable - definitely worth doing. We enjoyed walking down into the jungle and the running track looked popular -although we didn't use it. Couldn't fault the club lounge if it's possible I think this really enhances the stay. A very relaxing stay. We had a two bedroom suite which was amazing for the family, a central main

date post: Dimas T wrote a review Jan 11
text: We really enjoyed our stay at Padma Ubud. Ubud was't in our travel itinerary at first, but due to sudden gov't announcement regarding PCR swab for those visiting Bali, we decided to re-schedule our itinerary 1 day earlier, because we already tested non-reactive for covid19 (serology method) and did't want to take another test just within days. Consequently we would need accomodation for 1 night. Based on friend recommendation and acknowledgment of Padma group big name and good reviews (in Bandung area), we chose to stay at Padma Ubud just night before our arrival in Bali. For this we want to compliment ms Deasy for giving information and assisting our booking via phonecall. The place is serene - refreshing cool breeze and so relaxing walking around the hotel at night, the
title: Great experience at Padma Resort Ubud

date post: Mel H wrote a review Jun 2016
text: We recently stayed at the Padma Resort Ubud and had the best stay ever! They provided a shuttle to pick us up from the airport to the resort, that was such a relief because we have been traveling all day. Right when we arrived to the hotel we were welcomed with warm smiles and such kind service from all the staff. They were so excited just as much as we were to be in Bali at this magical hotel. We were greeted with Bali tea, that I absolutely loved and had almost every day. They service was outstanding they walked us to our room and gave us a grand tour that was so so gorgeous overlooking the forest. I love infinity pools, we were so excited to see the pool at the Padam resort! It was huge and also heated so don't worry about being cold, just jump in and go for it!:) We had
title: Heavenly

date post: Nick Selleck wrote a review Jan 2017
text: We recently stayed at the Padma Resort Ubud for 7 nights and thought we might need more to do around Ubud but we ended spending most of our time at this beautiful resort. We made the most of the amazing pool and spa and really enjoyed all the activities that the resort offered. The grounds were so beautiful just to walk around and enjoy the scenery. The restaurants had so many different options on the menus that we ate something different every night. The staff were exceptional and always helpful and friendly. We really couldn't fault the Padma and just didn't want to leave. We returned home relaxed and very happy :) We can't wait to one day return to the Padma Resort Ubud.
title: Brilliant Resort and exceptional service

date post: Sharleen B wrote a review Jan 2017
text: We recently stayed at the resort with our 2 small children. The rooms were fantastic with a great view. The pool was large with swim up pool bar, we loved that the pool was heated given it is cooler in Ubud. Good gym although a little small so arrive early. The food was was probably the main down side . Given the resort is 40 mins from Ubud you need to eat in the resort and I found the choices limiting and not great. Staff are still also learning the ropes and struggled with English and understanding what we were ordering or asking for. On one occasion when I requested salt for my table the staff spoke to each other and started laughing. Quite unprofessional really.
title: Beautiful resort

date post: Phil L wrote a review Mar 2017
text: We spent 3 days relaxing and chilling by the pool. The highlight of our stay was a Mixology class. our teacher/bartender Dede invited us to tour the Resort Garden and choose fresh ingredients that might inspire us in our Mixology class. Our class was fabulous! Whilst we learnt so much, we had a wonderful time. Many laughs and many drinks. Thanks to Dede (Big Daddy) for a great afternoon!
title: Fabulous Pool and AMAZING Mixology Class

date post: Ouafi S wrote a review Oct 2016
text: We spent 3 nights in Padma resort and we wished we could stay longer. This was basically the best hotel we have been to in all Indonesia. It is new and has everything you would want in a resort. The rooms were very comfortable and the pool is amazing. Food in the restaurant is also delicious. The view from the restaurant and the pool is breathtaking. There is nothing you couldn't like in Padma resort
title: Best hotel in Bali

date post: Jade F wrote a review Oct 2016
text: We spent 6 nights at this resort. They offer free airport pick & transfer and even though we were staying in Kuta for our first 3 nights, they were happy to pick us up from that location at no charge. The resort is simply beautiful, truly the best place we have ever stayed at. We had never stayed in Ubud before & made the assumption (wrong) that it was close to Ubud centre. The resort is 45min out of central Ubud and there is nothing else around. It is perfect if you are happy to stay within the confines of the resort for your trip but probably not if you like to have a lot happening around you. Having said that, the resort offers free shuttle transport to & from Ubud a number of times a day so you always have the option. The grounds are divine and the infinity pool is something
title: Just amazing!

text: We spent 8 nights at the Padma Ubud and had an amazing time. We made use of the activities enjoying bike riding, village visits and yoga. The swimming pool here would have to rate as one of the best in Bali, it is simply sensational. We were never bored and only ventured into Ubud twice on the shuttle bus. Our room had an amazing view of Mount Agung and the jungle which we found very peaceful. The staff at the resort are sensational. Special thanks to Deasy who turned a great holiday into an amazing holiday. Also thanks to Parwita for his bike riding and village tour, Nico and Ita in the restaurant and Junarta who kept our room spotless and delighted us with his towel animals. It would be lovely to see another restaurant at the resort for those of us who stay a week, as there
title: Phenomenal

text: We spent Christmas and New Year here with our family and took 3 premier rooms. The Padma Ubud is beautifully laid out with wonderfully kept gardens, a magnificent pool, swim-up bar and spa. The views are heavenly and we never tired of them. The service is friendly but very patchy -- much of this is to do with language problems. There is one main restaurant and a pool-side restaurant. The breakfast is wonderful, very varied and something for everyone. We particularly liked to try food from the Asian Corner. The Club Lounge also has a special breakfast menu which is a good alternative. The staff are extremely friendly and do their best. Often the service was quite poor in the restaurant and the cleanliness of the rooms needs some attention. I think as the hotel was so

We spent five nights here after a glorious week in central Ubud and I have to say - Padma was perfect. Obviously the pool is sensational, but the whole resort is that standard. The staff are amazing, the rooms are beautiful, the food is good and reasonably priced for such a fantastic resort (especially brilliant breakfast). The organic in-house garden is just getting started, but in a year or so it will be providing a huge amount of the hotel's food, which is a big bonus. It's a bit of a trek into Ubud from here, but we didn't need to as we'd just come from there. We got to just sit back and relax and enjoy the pool and views. I know we'll be back.
title: Holy Smokes - amazing. Absolutely amazing.

text: We spent three nights here and wish we had of stayed for longer! The hotel is spectacular. The most amazing swimming pool and views to die for. The Staff were amazing and couldn't do enough for you. Reading other reviews, It is true that the hotel is quite far away from Ubud (30-45mins) but that is quite obvious when you look at a map. The hotel provides a free shuttle bus to ubud 5 times which was ideal for us. We wanted to spend some relaxing time at the hotel and go to Ubud in the evening/afternoon. The food at the hotel was amazing, we don't normally stay and eat in at hotels but the food was very good (we tried more of the traditional Balinese dishes) All facilities were immaculate... swimming pool, spa, gym, sauna, rooms everything was perfect. We are definitely coming
title: Amazing!! The best hotel we have ever stayed in!

text: We spent three nights in this very beautiful resort where the surrounds are something to see. The staff were so friendly and helpful in every way. If rest and relaxation is what you are looking for this is ideal, however if you want the hustle and bustle of Bali then Padma is not for you as it is situated 20ks from the town which is an hour in the shuttle bus. Three nights was perfect and then we had four nights at the Parma in Legian. This completed a fantastic week.

date post: Bagus A wrote a review Mar 2017
text: We spent time here for special event that they have it called Cascade trio The ticket was include cocktail and canapÃ¨ and it all was perfect. Great taste of wine including delicious canapÃ© On top of that, the view is stunning. For non residents guest and if you wish to visit Padma, i really recommend to come during afternoon time.
title: Stunning view.

text: We spoiled ourselves with a single day at the Padma. Wow!!! We were blown away with the serenity and luxury all rolled into one. Just jump on the website to see all the attractions for the reaort. We enjoyed afternoon tea on arrival, a memorable swim in the infinity pool and beautiful elevated dinner. The next day we had a couples massage, another swim and walk in the forest. Nico and Owen bent over backwards for us, and nothing was too hard for any staff. An affordable luxury and one we'll recommend to our friends and family :))))))

We stay here for 2 days. We arrive late night. The staff at lobby was so friendly and helpful. The hotel is so good for family. During my stay we find some good things and some list need to improve ; The good things are ; Staff upon arrival is professionally friendly and helpful. The room is spacious and beautiful The pool is fabulous and good for day relax The bad things are; The first day we have our breakfast, the restaurant was so busy. One of the kitchen staff at the egg corned said because they have group. The female lady at the entrance escort us to our table and didn't us for to have some coffee or tea. So I decide to order coffee, but no one come back to ask my wife and my aunt coffee or tea. The worst thing, I should wait for25 minutes for a cappuccino and when the
title: Dissapointed

text: We stay here for 2 nights and the service was really excellent. The room is spacious and I love the scenery from our room (directly to the jungle). They have lots of options for breakfast (american and asian). Dinner was really awesome too! I try tuna steak and my husband had Balinese fried rice. They served in big portions and I think its better to have dinner in the hotel rather travel to Ubud center just for dinner. And also their infinity swimming pool was amazing! Keep up the good work Padma Ubud! Will surely come back :)
title: The worst "so called" 5star HOTEL !!

date post: Mars B wrote a review Apr 2017
text: We stayed 1 night in this lovely resort. The staff were amazing, kind and welcoming and the resort is clean! the pool has amazing views over the jungle + the gym also has great useful equipment! If you are looking to have a quiet getaway for yourself and your partner this is great.
title: Amazing relaxing place.

text: We stayed 3 nights at Padma resort Ubud and it was absolutely lovely from A to Z. From the check in to the check out,the staff was friendly and smiling. Variety of choices for the breakfast from asian to western with an amazing view facing the pool and the forest with balinese musicians playing. Their main restaurant was delicious and the afternoon tea was ok. We have tried their activities such as cardio training, yoga, cycling around the village and rice fields. The highlight of our stay was the fantastic spa!!! I totally recommend it. The swimming pool was absolutely stunning. The resort has a great track down the jungle all the way to a small river. About the rooms, it was spacious with nice balcony only the mini bar was empty but there is a 24 hours room service :)
title: "Suksma Padma!"

text: We stayed 3 nights with friends and loved this place. The heated infinity pool with swim up bar was a favourite spot and the spa was great. Would definitely recommend for relaxation. The staff were amazing and very attentive. Was a 30 minute drive out of Ubud .

We stayed 4 nights here and fell in love to this hotel!! The location of the hotel was in the middle of jungle, so every time you looked around was only trees! So green and peaceful! I personally love this hotel very much!! Yes, Padma was far from Ubud Center, but the facilities they had were excellent! They had amazingly pool, nicely restaurant, lounge, gym, also they had different programs every day such as yoga, bycicling, etc! Then why do you have to go outside while they gave you excellent facilities? :) The staffs were amazing, they remembered your name! They weren't only smile but also greeted you and called your name when they met you! They had very nice spa as well. So we tried Balinese massage and it was amazing! If you want to go to Ubud Center, they have shuttle bus

We stayed 4 nights, it was a relaxing and fun stay. The rooms are large, fun hotel activities and the pool is so pretty. The bath is romantic and the walking track is challenging which makes for good exercise. The breakfast and afternoon tea offered are yummy and the staff were attentive and polite. We made use of the shuttles to ubud, they are easy to book and in town there is plenty to do. Staff are happy to make bookings for you. There were a few issues, the spa is overpriced. I booked in for a massage and the lady was not friendly and the service was ordinary. She scratched my foot with her nails during the massage! I had a better massage for a third of the price in town. Also the housekeeping was not the best, the amenities (cotton buds, mouth wash, shower gel,
title: Wonderful resort, few issues

date post: Wawan Harimawan wrote a review Dec 2020
text: We stayed at Padma during Pandemic for our honeymoon because the location is remote and its the best resort in Ubud. We are really satisfied with the service, the staffs are definitely well trained and every activities is very well prepared and adhere to health protocol. We had a mishap but the Manager on Duty was quick to handle the problem and provide us with great solution (changing our room in the middle of the night and personally clean our luggages, thank you Pak Budi). The spa was fully booked but the service is great! (thank you Bu Sri and Bu Eva), the restaurant staffs are also friendly and always checking up on us (Bu Elta, Mbak Wiwin, Chef Dora), and we can safely do activities because of strict protocol (thank you Bli Sudana and Bli Fiska). Even the drivers are
title: Amazing stay at Padma for Honeymoon!

text: We stayed at Padma for my 30th birthday at it blew us away! The complex itself is brand new with great amenities and truly gracious staff. Our room was large, well appointed with a breathtaking view of the forest that the hotel is set in. Our booking included a complimentary meal and massage - both were perfect. The quality of the food is top class and the spa staff were perfect. Two employees stood out in making out stay perfect, Nico & Eva. Although Ubud is 18 hours from us we will 100% return to Padma!
title: Simply incredible!!

text: We stayed at Padma Puhu Ubud pre "soft opening". From the moment we checked in our expectations were far exceeded! We were greeted by the most welcoming friendly staff. Deasy, the Assistant Front Desk Manager is an asset to the Padma team, always there to make sure your stay is everything it should be. After settling into our room (which was extremely spacious and comfortable) we made our way to the pool to enjoy our afternoon tea. The 89 metre infinity pool is amazing, It overlooks the jungle and is just so peaceful and relaxing. The food by Executive Chef Ketut is 5 star, just outstanding! The best food we have had in Bali and we have travelled to Bali 17 times. (Thank you for spoiling us CK) I wish the Padma Pahu Ubud all the very best for their opening. I can't wait

date post: Saira A wrote a review Mar 2017
text: We stayed at Padma Resort Ubud for 2 nights with our 21 month old. The room was luxurious, spacious and quiet. A portacot was already set up in our room and the room was situated closer to the reception to save us from walking too far with our toddler. The resort was quiet most of the time and was only busy during breakfast hours. The facilities were amazing, beautifully landscapped and next to new. The visit to the spa was delightful. The massage was very relaxing and staff were accomodating. There were probably 5 kids in total and they seemed to remember my daughter's name. We visited the kids club every day and my daughter had the whole area for herself. There was a vast range of toys and even beds for the kids to nap in. Gym had a lot of equipment. The inifinity pool was
title: Excellent hotel

text: We stayed at Padma Resort Ubud for 3 nights. It was luxurious with a great breakfast buffet, friendly staff and 24hr butler service (yes, this includes 24hr room service!). If you are looking to get away from it all, this is the place. And bear in mind it's about a half hour (an hr if there's traffic) from Ubud Central. We really enjoyed the secludedness. This place is surreal - Perched high on top of the hills covered by jungle. Whilst having our breakfast or lazying about the infinity pool, there's tiny little birds flying and swooping, butterflies and dragonflies flying around - it really felt like paradise. Photos don't do this place justice. Service is impeccable and we are sure to come back!
title: Amazing place, very nice staff and manager

date post: Ronni S wrote a review Dec 2016
text: We stayed at Padma Resort Ubud for five days, and it was our best hotel stay ever. The hotel itself has an unbelieveable placement, with a scenary that is incredible. The food is fantastic, the staff is loveable, and the services are great. Even the massage provided in the spa was the best we've ever had. It is a fantastic place!
title: Incredible

date post: Budiyantik T wrote a review Dec 2020
text: We stayed at Padma Ubud for 3 nights with our 2 kids. The hotel has great facilities especially for kids. We joined their bike program and achercy which host by Agus he is very friendly and fun. We hope to come back again.
title: Fun Staycation at Padma

date post: Carolyn W wrote a review Jan 2017
text: We stayed at this beautiful resort for five days/four nights. Cannot rate it high enough! Service was A1 from check in (and upgrade offer, well worth it!). Our room on the top floor amazing. More than enough room to accommodate a rollaway bed for our 7 year old. Outlook from the Jacuzzi on the balcony was breathtakingly beautiful - mountains, forest, temple, so peaceful! The Club Lounge itself was worth the upgrade. All of the staff made us feel so special, especially Debby who developed a great friendship with our young one. The restaurant can get quite busy, but the food reasonably priced, and we enjoyed each meal. I suffered an injury whilst out of the resort on a day trip, and ALL of the staff when I returned fussed over me and made sure I was comfortable and still able to
title: Stunning!

date post: Lucas S wrote a review Nov 2020
text: We stayed for 2 nights in Padma Ubud and was overwhelmed with the service. All staff were very friendly and thoughtful. Special call out to Kayan, for treating us well during mountain bike tour and archery. Kayan was very helpful and care to guest. Also Viska (Yoga instructor) during Aerial Yoga class, was very consistent to follow standard hygiene protocol and inform us before the session start whether we are convenient for him to do adjustment for us and keep using hand sanitizer after handling guest. To all butler team, Debby and her team, a big thank you for the fast response to fix our coffee machine in room and explain us how to do it properly. Bravo!! I canâ€™t say more but the staff in Padma Ubud is very consistent on how handling the guest, from greeting the guest,
title: Wonderful hotel with amazing staff

text: We stayed for 3 nights at this beautiful resort. We wanted to experience some time in the mountains for a different side of Bali as compared to the busier beachside locations. The resort is breathtakingly beautiful with gorgeous architecture and water ponds/features everywhere. The staff were extremely well trained and so professional and friendly. The infinity pool looks over into the jungle which is just beautiful. The food was delicious and the rooms were luxurious. The only negative was that the resort is actually 30 minutes drive from Ubud whereas the name suggests otherwise. There is a free hotel shuttle to take you in and bring you back but you have to book at least 2 hours ahead and must commit to your return time which is quite difficult to do when you don't really know

We stayed for 3 nights, its excellent hotel for family. The hotel offers few range of activities that are suitable for kids and adults. Aerial yoga class conduct by Mr. Fiska is very recommended, he has strong passion of yoga, kind and patient. It is my first time to join aerial yoga, surprisingly its very enjoyable and fun.
title: Aerial yoga

text: We stayed for 4 nights in this hotel, and we loooove it! The hotel surrounding is so peaceful with amazing scenery. Room is big & cozy. Very attentive staff, special thanks to Mr. Reza (GM). It takes 45 mins to ubud centre but hotel provide a shuttle bus. My parents, kids (7, 5 and 1 yrs old) enjoyed the infinity pool and the jogging track which goes down to a nice river banks. Above all of that, this is a new hotel, still need improvement with the facilities and more maintenance.
title: Great place to relax

text: We stayed for 4nights with kids, kids so happy with the animal feeding activity, exploring the garden, and for me, took aerial yoga as my morning exercise, its so memorable, thanks to Mr. Lenu to guide me. Will back again soon.
title: Family holiday resort & Aerial Yoga in frame activity

text: We stayed for 7 nights from the 25th Dec 2016 - 1st Jan 2017 and most thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. My partner and I spent our "babymoon" here and couldn't have asked for more. I've stayed at the Padma in Legian before and the Padma in Ubud lived up to (or possibly exceeds) the excellent customer service of this hotel. From the time you arrive to the time you leave people always greet you with a smile and are happy to accommodate any requests. What truly makes this resort amazing tho would have to be the scenery. Set on acres of jungle with walking and jogging tracks around the premises you really feel like you're away on a deserted island. Also being a newish hotel the rooms were immaculate, perfectly clean, functional, spacious and really gives you that island resort feel. The
title: Paradise...

text: We stayed for 8 nights in Padma Ubud from1-9 september. It was the best hotel i have ever seen in Bali. The staf is fantastic. Everybody soo friendly and kind. We felt like we was all a big family. Special thanks to front desk (Oven and Anita). They did a great job and was very helpful for us during all our staying there.
title: Heaven

text: We stayed here for 2 nights as part of a longer Bali honeymoon. It is very new and has all of the little things you expect in a 5 star hotel: very clean, bathtub and amazing bathrooms, quality toiletries, ironing board, even a set of scales which is rare these days. As it was our honeymoon they very kindly upgraded us and when we got to our room had a beautiful cake, fresh fruit and a personal note congratulating us. Nothing was overlooked. From the moment we arrived the service was impeccable, everyone very attentive and keen to make sure everything was good. I have to say every single one of the staff were amazing and Selmat especially looked after us while we were there. The grounds are stunning, it was quiet when we went there and we felt like we were in our own private
title: Wonderful stay

text: We stayed here for 2 nights it was a wonderful experience the accommodation was 5 star the pool heated and staff so helpful would recommend this to anyone looking for a relax and unwind. Next year we will stay 4 nights!! We didn't go into Ubud as it was so great to stay in the resort !
title: Wonderful experience

text: We stayed here for 3 night. It's a superb resort. Everything here is fantastic! They pool is the kind that you would never want to get out off. They keep the water temp so nice and warm, feels like you in a huge hot bathtub with an incredible view, in the middle of such lush and beautiful jungle. Breakfast is one of the best. Moreover, they offer so many different fun activities everyday. From yoga, cycling and agro-tourism. It's the place to be if you value nature. Fantastic scenery to walk or to jog.

We stayed here for 3 nights in late November . Being aware of how remote it was made us think that 3 nights was enough....well it wasn't. The resort is spectacular.....there was nothing to worry about because you don't need to go anywhere. A gorgeous 86 metre infinity pool( with swim up bar) the dining room on the top floor has beautiful views wherever you look...the breakfast was as good as we have ever, had the staff were fantastic...nothing was too much trouble. An in house health spa...morning yoga...what's not to like!! Next time we will do a week for sure!!! The only downside is the trip there...a bone jarring 90 minutes in a car...anyone who has been to Bali knowshow busy and manic the roads are and this place is in Ubud so it is a fair step!!! Not sure there is

We stayed here for a 3 day break and really enjoyed it. The focus of the hotel is the wonderful heated infinity swimming pool with bar, overlooking the jungle. The restaurants serves good food and the service is excellent. On one occasion there was a problem with one of our main courses, this was dealt with really well. Apologies were offered by almost all the staff we encountered and without even asking the dish was removed from the bill. If you have a room that entitles you to use the club area do make use of the cocktail bar especially at happy hour - overlooking the pool. The Spa is also wonderful. The only thing to be aware of is the fact that it is some 30mins from Ubud but a free shuttle is available several times a day. In summary this is a fantastic hotel that is

date post: Alan W wrote a review Dec 2016
text: We stayed here from dec 10-13 as part of the Padma mountain and beach resort. The rooms are spacious and well equipped. Staff are always attentive and responsive to requests. The infinity is a natural attraction to even my son who enjoyed the swim in the heated pool in the midst of the rainforest. We brought our 73 year father in law went for the trail at the bamboo bridge. On the way back up, he was panting for breadth as he is not used to walking up the gradient of the slope. My wife and i decided to call the hotel staff for assistance. The staff response was immediate and we have 2 of the staff assistance him with a shoulder carry back to the hotel. Arrangement was made to the hotel clinic nurse to monitor and administer his vital signs. The duty manager - Clements was
title: Outstanding service that you can rely on in emergency

date post: Donna Mochino wrote a review May 2016
text: We stayed here Sep 2015, it was still in pre-opening then. Aside from some small work here and there and the poolside restaurant not opened yet, the hotel was already functioning quite properly considering and it has shown to become a great hotel later. It is not quite near the wellknown & busy part of Ubud, so this is the place to stay if you crave tranquility & relaxation. Guests can arrange outdoors activity (including Yoga by the pool) a day or two in advance. The room was spacious, modern with ethnic & artsy touch. The bathroom was spacious too with great amenities, including a towel warmer.
title: Great Hotel

text: We stayed in the Padma Ubud Resort for 4 nights as part of the first section of our 8-day honeymoon holiday so we were able to spend the whole last day relaxing in the pool before our connecting lift (provided by Padma) whisked us away down the mountain to the Padma Resort in Legian for the remainder of our trip. We stayed in a Premier Suite which was VERY nice and spotlessly clean. The hotel grounds are absolutely amazing and one could argue that Padma could be one of the most tropical jungle paradise places in the Bali mountains. All the grounds and gardens are very well maintained. The â€˜infinity poolâ€™ area is absolutely amazing and is 85M long. This is great for both children as well as adults (with a very nice swim-up bar area) as the pool is not too deep for younger kids.

date post: Vendula M wrote a review May 2016
text: We stayed in this hotel for 4 days and if we have not booked our flight tickets back home we would def. stayed for longer! When i walked in the room i was so impressed,i think we had the best view of our balcony!!!!Breakfast and their free day activities where just perfect!I had a private yoga in sunrise light with Budi -really recommend it!!!!!!!Also the staff were so helpful all the time!They provide free transport too!And the bed was just superb!
title: Not wanting to leave!!!!

text: We stayed when still in construction but it will be a lovely hotel. the highlights are the food - amazing chefs - the infinity pool - on edge of forest, and the rooms were very comfortable. The location is not really Ubud, but 40 minutes further up the mountain but when you get there its idyllic. its design is traditional Bali, but being new the rooms and facilities are modern and well designed. Outstanding food. its a place to go to relax and laze by the pool, has gym and spa (yet to be opened when we were there). Staff were delightful.
title: Newly Opened and its gong to be lovely

text: We stayed with our 3 year old and were probably given one of the worst rooms in the hotel: ground floor with no view and bare grass outside littered with the plastic domes of the Spa's skylights on the lower level. You'd think it would be OK for the kid to run around but we didn't feel safe letting him to that because there was a steep drop in the landscaping down a hill. Apart from that we were happy with the interiors of the room which were lovely and spacious with high ceilings and nice bedding. Can't commend the staff enough for their enthusiasm and good nature. A few of them are still learning the ropes though. Food wise it was very inconsistent. The buffet breakfast was disappointing as the hot food was all luke warm. The fried eggs were not cooked to order but just
title: We'll be back!

text: We took advantage of the Padma Mountain and Beach package but I'll write 2 reviews as the hotels are very different. With the mountain part you are at Padma Ubub (also called Padma Puhu). It is quite a way outside of Ubud but there are daily shuttles in if you want to go to the markets etc. I've been to Bali a few times but never up to Ubud as the 4-5hr return trip seemed like a long way to go. However by staying there for 3 nights the drive was worth it. The hotel is smaller than Padma Legian at around half as many rooms and is in the middle of a beautiful river valley. The sounds you hear are nature not scooters, yelling and wild nightlife of Kuta etc. I thought my two kids (8 and 10) wouldn't enjoy it as much as Padma Legian but in fact they preferred it. Sure there was no
title: Something for everyone

text: We ve just had a very relaxing ,very comfortable 4 days at this beautiful hotel. The staff are so friendly and helpful. We made the most of the great facilities especially the gym. The setting is perfect. Thank you
title: A beautiful Resort

date post: Faroze S wrote a review Apr 2017
text: We visited Padma to have dinner with my wife old friend, maybe about 15 minutes away from Alila. Drove through the villages before reaching the hotel and was amazed with the view upon arrival. Was greeted by a wonderful staff name Clement, who showed us around and explaining about the hotel. There was a nice koi pond surrounding the main reception area. Next stop was the spa...suddenly we were in the cave...was quite and interesting organic design and there was also a waiting area in the spa that looks like the hobbit room. And they have kids spa also. Next stop was the Mediterranean theme restaurant. Apparently the Executive Chef CK was based in Turkey with another International Hotel Chain before coming back to Ubud, and we got to know later that he was born and raised in the
title: Simply Amazing, for couples and families.

text: We went there for a romantic getaway and found the place was really worth the money. The view from our room is breath taking with the pool below and the verdant valley. The room is so spacious with a nice terrace. You can soak in the tub while enjoying the view outside. The main pool is heated so you can swim in cooler nights and stay warm. There is a jacuzzi at one side of the pool. Another smaller pool is secluded but not heated; a perfect place to run from the heat of the sun. Kids have their own pool. Breakfast was nice, and if you join the executive club like we did, you can order more hot food from the club, plus free flow of drinks for the whole day, and alcohol at certain hour in the evening. The high tea was great as well. There was a glitch with the service but

date post: Mala L wrote a review Jan 2017
text: We went to Padma Resort with quite and expectation and they really delivered. We upgraded our room to the club and it was well worth it. The room was new and the view especially in the morning was amazing. Such calmness and tranquility, the beauty of Ubud right in front of your room. The only negative things we could think of were the floor board in the room that was creaky and the road access to the place was quite bad. The high tea food selection and the additional menus for the club lounge were awesome. The staff are great, Clements, Indah and team pampered us well. Our 7yo son had a really good time in the pool and kids club. On the last day he fell sick and was having a fever, probably from exhaustion and climate change from cold Melbourne. We called in the house nurse
title: Bali Babymoon

date post: kathy n wrote a review Feb 2016
text: We went to Padma Ubud for 2 nights after we had stayed at Padma Legian for the first 3 nights. Wow what an amazing experience . The resort is absolutely beautiful . The infinity pool is amazing and the rooms have beautiful views of the gorgeous countryside . The staff are so friendly and helpful. The food is the best food I have ever eaten in Bali. Ketut the chef is so friendly and will cook up something different if you don't like what's exactly on the menu. They put on the most beautiful afternoon tea every day which is included in the price . We went on a bicycle tour of the village which was included and it was fantastic . Anton our guide was so great and took us to one of the local families home. So interesting learning about their culture. Definitely a highlight of our
title: Heaven

date post: Grace S wrote a review Dec 2020
text: We went to the resort with a lot of reservation, because the resort is located in a secluded area, far away from the Ubud Center. However, after 3 days of an amazing stay, I can only say that the whole experience was focused on making us, the customers, felt comfortable and happy beyond expectation. The rooms were spacious, and the layout of the hotel was very well thought of. There were a lot of activities to enjoy, my kids were happy, my elderly parents enjoyed sitting at the restaurant looking at the view, while all the friendly staff kept offering them food / drinks / snack. I tried the morning aerial yoga, jungle trekking, and archery. I also swam at the heated infinity pool overlooking a spectacular view. At dinner, the only restaurant that opened during this pandemic
title: An amazing resort with amazing crew.

text: We were absolutely pampered in every way possible. The staff were great to talk to, friendly and extremely professional. The resort was breathtaking with priceless views, heated infinity pool/spa and inclusive activities. Also only 30-40mins out of Ubud central. This place is a holiday within itself.
title: Very luxurious and beautiful

text: We were invited to stay at the new Padma Hotel in Puhu. We were greeted on arrival by the most lovely, friendly staff, including Arie who previously worked at Padma in Legian. Was great to see a familiar smiling face ! We were taken to our room which was perfect in every detail and with lovely view across the 'jungle'. After settling into our room, we went for afternoon tea which, was fabulous and even more so when the staff appeared to sing a belated Happy Birthday to me !!! Very special. The food was amazing, lovingly prepared by 'CK', some special treats along the way. And, then there was Deasey........a most delightful, helpful Assistant Front Desk Manager, nothing too much trouble for our Miss Deasey !!! All in all, our short stay was lovely and, can only imagine how

We were lucky enough for the Legian Padma to offer us and accompanying family a two night stay. Wow, what an amazing place. Brand new and every staff member out to ensure a full five star stay. Best pool we have ever had a swin in. Large very well appointed rooms. Highly highly recommend a stay if you are thinking of Ubud.

We were offered an exchange to the Ubud Padma from Legian. The hotel is a 5 star brand new experience in elegance,and hospitality. Although only opened several months ago, the service is outstanding. The lack of Legian's humidity is a welcome change, and all rooms have stunning jungle,valley views. The rooms are sumptuous, huge and appointed beautifully. The pool is fabulous, 89M of infinity lovlieness! There is a children's pool and kids club, well appointed with caring staff. Meals are amazing and reasonably priced as nowhere else nearby to eat. Shuttles to Ubud and activities offered free.
title: Stunning hospitality surrounded by nature

text: We were offered to transfer here for 2 nights from the Padma Legian and we loved our stay! Firstly thanks to Satria for his help with a late check out, transfers to the airport and use of the hotel facilities after our 2pm check out until 6pm including the high tea. Also a big thanks to Ari, or "Bali Ari Gold" as he called himself. We met Ari at Legian and he looked after our three kids 13,11 and 8 in his newly established teen/tween club. Ari is hoping to establish something similar at Ubud for kids over 8. Ari is wonderful with the kids, he took ours boogie boarding at Legian, swimming, snorkelling, and played tennis and soccer with them they also had lunch together and did some fun videos on the beach which ended up on the Facebook page. If the Ubud property offered this too

date post: Jovita Pranata wrote a review Nov 2020
text: We were stayed at Padma Resort Ubud in November 2020, and it was a truly enjoyable stay. I rarely review a hotel accomodation, because, I think, it is very proper if we stayed in a 5 stars hotel, and accept a 5 stars facility and service. Worth the price. But I have to say that my experience with Padma Resort Ubud was totally more than just a common 5 stars service and truly beyond our expectation. We booked 2 connecting rooms for 4 of us. Rooms were very spacious, warm ambience, with large beds, wooden Balinese interior with balcony. The staffs were very helpful, friendly and warm. When our electric kettle was mulfunctioned, they replace it immediately, along with compliment of 2 plates of cake, and the next day, the resort manager herself see me to apology for the
title: Padma Resort Ubud, exceptional stay experience

text: We were thinking of not writing a review because this would mean a lot more people would come to this hotel, but it was so amazing that we just to had to write. First, the grounds are spectacular with gardens, flowers, forests and running tracks to appease even the most discerning sports person. The rooms are clean and also great, the pool is exactly as pictures show, stunning. The staff service is first rate, the food and breakfast area overlooking the jungle are spectacular with food items such as smoked duck and smoked marlin on offer every morning. The place never felt crowded, and the staff make an effort to make you feel special. The Yoga offered in the morning overlooking the jungle is right out of a novel. They also offer free bike tours and other activities, if you

Well, just back from another fantastic stay at Padma Ubud/Puhu. From the moment we arrived the staff were there to help us in any way possible. Our one bedroom suite with jacuzzi on the balcony was so beautiful..luxurious !!! This is my third visit to Padma Ubud and each visit there are more exciting additions, this time was the very elegant Club Lounge, filled with beautiful furniture, the place you can have coffee, tea, cocktails, snacks and just sit and gaze at the amazing views out through the jungle. Also, this time we were able to explore the great Agroforestry Garden. A leisurely walk around this very well designed garden area, filled with fruits and flowers, all for the picking and to be used in the hotel. We were invited to pick a pawpaw which we took back to the
title: Magique !!!

text: Well, this my first time stay here with my parents. Check in handle by Ibam, He's suggest us for upgrade from premier king to premier club with a really nice view at pool view and we've so many benefit. Wow, a really excellent service.
title: Family Holiday

date post: Famelia L wrote a review Sep 2016
text: Went here with my husband for our honeymoon, they gave us pool view room, view is so amazing, hotel staff are very friendly, breakfast and in-room dining was good,the only bad thing is I wish I thinkstay longer, We definetly will return to padma ubud.
title: Love it love it love it

text: Went to Padma Resort to enjoy pool access with 250k minimum purchasing, it very good to get what i expected from social media photo. Very kind staff, nice view, beautiful infinity pool and it's very worth for what we spend. Thank you!

Went to Padma resort Ubud with my wife and we were truly amazed with this amazing resort. Set in a beautiful location with privately maintained forest, river and infinity pool has to be best in Bali. The infinity pool has a wonderful scenery, wherein you can look over the beautiful forest. The poolside bar is fantastic. Special mention goes to Spa services and also butler. But kindly checkout free shuttle service as it tends to fill up fast. Truly amazing and trust me, you will love it more than any other resort in Payangan or Ubud.
title: Truly amazing and perfect

text: Went to the new Padma Resort Ubud as part of a Beach and Mountains Package. Highly recommended! This resort is brand new and about 30 minutes drive past the Ubud town. It was so refreshing to get away from all the hustle and bustle that goes along with being in Bali on holidays. It was our wedding anniversary and they really looked after us, including a special anniversary cake on our arrival. The rooms at the hotel are spacious and well-equiped.
